But because ads placed alongside content that doesn't correspond to the brand's positioning hurts the brand

column79: which updates the changes automatically to Drive for access from any of your devices later); and Quick Access with Team Drives (that uses artificial intelligence based on an analysis of activity

column81: and workday patterns to serve the most relevant Google Drive files at any given time.And that's not all: Hangouts also got an enterprise version calledHangouts Chatthat could help with corporate communications.As far as acquisitions are concerned
column82: the company announced a couple: AppBridge
column83: which has a tool of the same name to facilitate migration of data (along with file permissions) from other storage solutions whether it's on-premise devices
column84: cloud services
column85: or hybrid solutions to Google Drive. The second was Kaggle
column86: which hosts data and facilitates machine learning contests.Google-Uber Lawsuit DevelopmentsAlphabet's Waymo added a fourth patent that it says was infringed upon by Uber and furnished further details including the statement of an eye-witness in a fresh filing. The statement is from Pierre-Yves Droz
column87: a former colleague and close confidant of Levandowski's (the ex-Googler who has allegedly run off with Waymo self-driving technology and trade secrets to form self-driving trucking company Otto
column88: which was subsequently bought by Uber for $680 million). The lawsuit specifies the time at which Levandowski met Uber executives in Jan 2016
column89: registering the company that would become Otto the following day. Waymo is seeking an injunction to prevent Uber from using the technology in its self-driving vehicles and seeking damages for any proven infringements.Uber says that since Google has in October
column90: filed for private arbitration against Levandowski for violating confidentiality obligations in his contract to improperly recruit his Waymo colleagues to Otto and Uber
column91: it should also move the allegations of trade-secret theft and unfair competition against Uber into arbitration. The logic is that since both these are related to Levandowski they should be handled similarly. Arbitration proceedings are private and also have different rules related to evidence
column92: which could safeguard Uber's reputation. The company is willing to continue the patent infringement aspect of the case in court.Gender Inequality at GoogleThe U.S. Department of Labor (DoL) has made a sweeping statement that it had ""found systemic compensation disparities against women pretty much across the entire workforce"" and DOL Regional Director Janette Wipper said the agency had received ""compelling evidence of very significant discrimination against women in the most common positions at Google headquarters.In a detailed response to the allegation
column93: Google's VP of people operations
column94: Eileen Naughton said that the claims had been made ""without any supporting data or methodology."" She also explained the salary analysis system Google currently employs:""Each year
column95: we suggest an amount for every employee's new compensation (consisting of base salary
column96: bonus and equity) based on role
column97: job level
column98: job location as well as current and recent performance ratingsâ€¦The analysts who calculate the suggested amounts do not have access to employees' gender data. An employee's manager has limited discretion to adjust the suggested amount
column99: providing they cite a legitimate adjustment rationale."" The model then measures individual salary calculations against those received by their peers
column100: which is done to eliminate ""statistically significant differences between men's and women's compensation"". Naughton also said that Google's methodology is available to other businesses if they want to test their own compensation practices for equal pay.This has been going on since Sep 2016
column101: after which a case was filed in January
column102: asking for Google's compensation data. Things came to a head after Google failed to comply with a routine audit.Google Wants to Invest In LGSouth Korea's Electronic Times reported that Google has offered to pay LG Display up to $880 million (one trillion KRW) as its contribution toward a production line for flexible OLED panels for use in second-generation Pixel phones. LG is considering the offer. Google's Pixel
column103: which has the appearance and features of a premium device and has been marketed as such
column104: will fall back in the race with Samsung and Apple on features if it doesn't get some OLED screens of its own. So Google's needs are clear. Google would also rather not get into a deal with Samsung
column105: which uses OLED in its own phones and is also in an agreement to supply to Apple. So it's trying to find another supplier.Other NewsGoogle Building Ad Blocker for Chrome: Google could be putting up some real competition to ad blocking companies. It now intends to build an ad blocker into Chrome that would help users shut down pop up
column106: auto play and such other annoying advertisements. What constitutes unacceptable adverts will then be decided by the Coalition for Better Ads (an independent group set up by a consortium of major advertisers and agencies in March to develop standards after ""comprehensive research"" involving more than 25
column107: 000 participants).While Google does derive the bulk of its revenue from ads
column108: it has over the years framed guidelines and policies to ensure that ads weren't too intrusive. So if it does go ahead with the ad blocker
column109: it wouldn't be opposed to its own policies. On the other hand
column110: Google would be able to save the money it often has to dish out to ad blocking companies to whitelist ads (nice way of saying unblock). The news was reported by WSJ and is yet to be announced by the company.PayPal
column111: Google Partner on Payments: The partnership allows Android Pay users to make payments using PayPal's app. This extends Android Pay's reach and makes Android Pay more useful. Since PayPal is growing closer to Google (it already uses the Google Cloud)
column112: this partnership renewed speculation that Google might acquire PayPal some time in the future.Payments Through Gmail: Google is extending the peer-to-peer payments service for Gmail users to the Gmail app for Android. Clicking on the attachments tab will now also throw up options to send or receive money with the funds then being transferred from one bank account to the other. The service will be directly pitted against PayPal's Venmo (although without its social aspect) and SquareCash.Smart Jackets with Levis: Google's Project Jaquard
column114: metallic alloys with natural and synthetic yarns to create touch-sensitive interactive fabrics is finally inside smart jackets from Levi's. The jackets
column115: which will allow you to skip songs
column116: use Google maps and make phone calls by the brush of your sleeve
column117: will sell for $350 from this fall.Data Highway with Facebook: The highest-capacity Internet link between Asia and the U.S. is about to be constructed by Chinese real estate magnate Wei Junkang's Pacific Light Data Communication Co (60% share)
column118: Facebook (20%) and Google (20%). American contractor TE SubCom will lay the 17-millimeter wide
column121: which will in all probability be operational by late 2018.Google Fake News Fix: Similar to Facebook's ""disputed"" tag
column122: Google has also decided to create groups called review teams to flag content they deem ""upsetting-offensive"". Some of the criteria Google's using to flag content would make you smile: ""high-quality"" pages could be the home page of a newspaper that has ""won seven Pulitzer Prize awards
column123: and ""low-quality"" pages could be articles that include ""many grammar and punctuation errors."" Thankfully
column124: the results will still show up

column128: respectively. Google's overall share of digital ad spending will be 40.7% this year while Facebook's will be over 19%. Facebook is expected to continue growing much faster than Google off a smaller base.Google will dominate in search with a 78% share and Facebook in display with a 39% share. Twitter

column6: Alphabet(NASDAQ: GOOGL) (NASDAQ: GOOG) andStarbucks(NASDAQ: SBUX) attracted heavy investor interest following their   respective quarterly earnings reports.Image source: Getty Images.Alphabet posts broad growthShares of Google parent Alphabet jumped almost 4% after the   search giant announced surprisingly strong earnings. Sales jumped   22% to $24.75 billion and outpaced consensus estimates that were   targeting $24.2 billion. Profits blew past expectations as   earnings soared 28% to $7.73 per share. Wall Street would have   been happy with $7.40 per share of profit.The Google business continues to shine
column7: with operating income   up 22% to $7.6 billion on surging advertising revenue. The   segment benefited from stellar results in a young hardware   segment that now includes the Google Home speaker and the Pixel   smartphone. These newer revenue streams joined the booming growth   in established areas like mobile search and YouTube to send   overall operating margin up a full percentage point to 27% of   sales.The company's Other Bets unit expanded its loss to $855   million from $774 million while boosting revenue by nearly 50% to   $244 million.Executives were happy with the operating trends and   telegraphed more aggressive spending on improving its search   platform while pushing deeper into the hardware business. ""Our   excellent results represent a terrific start to 2017

column9: Porat continued.Starbucks sees an end to its traffic strugglesStarbucks shares dipped 2% despite the coffee titan posting   record fiscal second-quarter sales and earnings figures. Revenue   rose 6% as a 3% boost in comparable-store sales combined with a   quickly growing store base. The company also managed an uptick in   profitability
column10: with operating margin rising to 17.7% of sales   from 17.3%. As a result
column11: earnings rose at a healthy 15% clip to   $0.45 per share.But Starbucks wasn't immune to the broader retailing slowdown   that's hurting peers across the industry. Customer traffic was   flat in the key U.S. market during what new CEO Kevin Johnson   described as ""a very difficult period for many brick-and-mortar   retailers.""Image source: Getty Images.On the bright side

column13: the company is   ""seeing further acceleration into April
column14: Chief Financial Officer   Scott Maw explained in a press release.Those recent trends are giving executives confidence that   growth will speed up over the next two quarters to allow the   beverage giant to meet its long-term annual growth goals despite   industry challenges. column6: Amazon.com

column1: Twilio Inc (TWLO) Stock Has More Upside to come;4/28/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsTwilio Inc(NYSE:TWLO) took quite the roller coaster ride after its IPO almost ten months ago. TWLO stock
column3: priced at $15
column4: opened at $24
column5: and closed its first day of trading at $29. By the end of September - barely three months after Twilio stock hit the public markets - TWLO traded above $70. The decline was swift
column6: however. Within six weeks
column7: TWLO stock hit $30
column8: nearly completing a round-trip to its first-day closing price.makeArticleAd();Source:Web Summit Via FlickrSince then
column9: TWLO stock has calmed significantly
column10: and traded in a reasonable range. An upgrade from JPMorgan earlier this month has sparked a small rally in Twilio. But the stock still trades below half the highs reached last year.I don't expect TWLO to retake $70 any time soon - but I do see plenty of reason for near-term upside in the stock. With Twilio earnings due in early May
column11: there's a potential upside catalyst ahead. And from a broader perspective
column12: there are other drivers of what remains a strong growth story.Twilio's Performance Is Just FineThe mini-bubble in TWLO in late 2016 colors the perception of the stock. Somehow
column13: because Twilio stock is about 55% off its highs
column14: it seems disappointing.The 10 Best Stocks for the Next 1
column15: 361 Days of President Donald TrumpThat's not really the case
column16: however. It's not Twilio's fault that investors bid up a low-float
column17: high-growth issue soon after its IPO. A secondary offering announced in October certainly didn't help - but most of the proceeds went to shareholders
column18: not the company itself. And it's not as if other companies haven't done the same thing: bothAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column19: NASDAQ:GOOGL) andFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB)
column20: among many others
column21: executed secondaries soon after their public offerings.If TWLO stock had priced at $15
column22: closed its first day at $23
column23: then risen to $35-$40 before a more modest retreat
column24: TWLO would be considered just another growth stock
column25: not damaged goods. And it's not as if Twilio's performance has driven the decline. The company beat estimates in both Q3 and Q4; and Twilio stock gained as a result.The fact that Twilio stock traded above $70 in October doesn't impact where Twilio stock is headed going forward. That rise and fall aside
column26: Twilio has performed well - and that performance should continue.Twilio's Growth Will ContinueTWLO stock gets almost universal rave reviews from analysts. And it's not just the analysts involved in the IPO. Smaller shops without investment banking services - and thus the incentive to goose Twilio stock higher - have been positive as well. Those are the same type of firms who have expressed steady skepticism about theSnap Inc(NYSE:SNAP) IPO
column27: largely on valuation concerns.Analysts aren't always right
column28: of course. But the backing of the analyst community should help near-term trading
column29: particularly out of earnings reports. Sympathetic analysts get the post-earnings story out the market. And the fact that the Street sees upside for Twilio does matter from a long-term standpoint as well. The average target price for TWLO stock is over $39
column30: representing 20%-plus upside. That's a major gap for such a well-followed stock.Meanwhile
column31: Twilio is growing - and should continue to grow. Revenue increased 60% in Q4
column32: and 66% for the full year. The midpoint of 2017 guidance suggests another 33% increase in 2017. The company's integration withAmazon.com
column33: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) and its Amazon Web Services unit provides a powerful growth driver going forward as well.Twilio isn't profitable
column34: admittedly. The issuance of Twilio stock to employees and executives - some $24 million in 2016 alone - needs to be considered as well. But in 2017
column35: the company should near non-GAAP profitability. And the nature of the SaaS model is that upfront near-term losses are booked in order to create high-margin recurring revenue down the line. As long as Twilio can continue its impressive top-line growth
column36: the numbers will work. And with Amazon as a partner
column37: and real need for the company's CPaaS offerings
column38: that growth should continue.TWLO Stock Isn't Cheap - But It's Not Expensive
column39: EitherEven at half price
column40: Twilio stock is priced dearly
column41: trading at over 6x the midpoint of 2017 revenue guidance on an enterprise basis.Why Starbucks Corporation (SBUX) Stock Is Running Out of AirBut that's not terribly out of place in the current software environment.Veeva Systems Inc(NYSE:VEEV) is at almost 10x forward revenue - despite lower current growth and an eventual limit driven by its focus on the life sciences industry.Splunk Inc(NASDAQ:SPLK) trades at a similar revenue multiple to Twilio stock
column42: despite lower growth.Twilio stock has room to gain even at that high multiple - if revenue growth continues. And
column43: again
column44: there's little reason to see otherwise at the moment. TWLO stock isn't cheap - but investors generally have to pay up for quality. And post-IPO trading aside
column45: this looks like a quality stock.As of this writing

column15: proved a point. A couple of days ago Iwrote herethat while there were signs of problems with some delayed IPOs in the tech sector
column16: the fact that the Nasdaq is above 6k should not be a cause for worry.â€œThis timeâ€ I wrote â€œis different...â€ and if you had any doubts about that
column17: yesterday afternoon should have removed them completely. What is different now as opposed to the year 2000 is that the record highs are not being driven by speculation or unbounded optimism
column18: but by rapidly increasing profits from companies listed on the exchange.makeArticleAd();In part that change is simply down to maturity. Nasdaq started life as an exchange in 1971 and in 2000 was still the young upstart where the companies of the future
column19: rather than the established firms
column20: listed their stock. A booming Nasdaq index at that time indicated unbounded optimism about the future and a belief that at some point in the future tech would be big business.As we know all too well that was an accurate

column22: and now those same companies have become money making machines. The record highs in the index simply reflect record profits
column23: with multiples of future earnings that are actually quite conservative given current growth rates.Probably the most impressive report yesterday was from Alphabet

column1: Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Hits All-Time Highs on All-Star Q1;4/28/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsInvestors don't need to worry aboutAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL). Yet again
column3: Google's parent put out a strong quarterly earnings report rife with growth
column4: and GOOGL is popping Friday morning to extend its double-digit 2017 run.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockIt's simple: The core search engine business is driving user activity
column5: which in turn is attracting online advertisers. We'll get into the details
column6: but right now
column7: that premise alone is driving Alphabet shares ever closer to the $1
column8: 000 mark.Alphabet Earnings By the NumbersAlphabet reported first-quarter revenues that shot 22% higher year-over-year to $24.75 billion. Net income climbed 28% to $7.73 per share. Both figures smashed estimates of $24.22 billion and $7.39 per share
column9: respectively.GOOGL generated a 27% operating margin despite jacking up its headcount from 64
column11: 992.Google segment
column12: advertising and properties were the three top contributors to revenue
column13: and they more than offset the loss of $855 million in the ""Other Bets"" division. Investors may excuse Alphabet's weakest division by revenue
column14: though - Alphabet's advancements in artificial intelligence
column15: mobile and its internet search moat should ensure continued profit growth.Amazon.com
column16: Inc. (AMZN) Stock Is a ""Stay Away!"" on Q1 Earnings BeatOnline ad revenues improved thanks to two developments: It succeeded by refining the way it tabulated paid clicks and cost-per-click. The combination of testing trial ad formats and adding more TrueView engagement ad categories lifted paid clicks. It also lowered cost-per-click.GOOGL Stock Still Is a Reasonable ValueDespite the YouTube ad customer exodus over the quarter
column17: Alphabet's revenues managed to exceed the consensus easily. And looking forward
column18: analysts expect 30% earnings growth
column19: implying a forward P/E of roughly 23.Growth investors should have no problems justifying a buy in GOOGL stock at that kind of P/E. Google is the dominant search engine on desktop and mobile
column20: and advertisers have no choice but to spread budget between it andFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB).While the YouTube division might be hurting right now
column21: a fix to its systems that allows more targeted advertising - away from the hate speech and other questionable content that sent advertisers packing in the first place - will set things right.Business Beyond AdvertisingAlphabet knows that the company faces significant risks if it relies solely on advertising revenue for growth. It is even keeping the online advertising business clean bycutting out poor-quality advertisers.Building an ad-blocker and enabling it by default may hurt Google's business. Yet by weeding out advertisers who push poorly designed ads
column22: everyone benefits. Auto-playing videos consume bandwidth and slows down web page load times. Pop-ups hurt the user-experience.Still
column23: Chrome browser users should not assume Alphabet is completely altruistic. The company may still track user behavior
column24: selling that data to the highest bidder.Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Slumps After Merely OK Q3 EarningsGoogle's inclusion of the ad blocker also will hurt third-party providers of the same service. This eliminates them from the competition
column25: leaving only Google as the provider of ad-blocking services.Takeaway on AlphabetAlphabet recorded a solid quarter that justifies the 12%-plus gains in GOOGL stock
column26: and apparently a little more
column27: if today's pop is any indication.Investments in its own business and innovating on the advertising algorithm
column28: search and Android
column29: the mobile operating system
column30: are all paying off. If Alphabet continues growing the business at this pace
column31: the stock could easily reach $1
column32: 000 per share by the end of this year.Maybe some profit-taking ofApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) shares will help GOOGL reach that landmark first.As of this writing

column1: Amazon.com
column2: Inc. (AMZN) Wants to Dress You With Echo Look;4/27/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsYou can count onAmazon.com
column4: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) to come up with â€¦ interesting â€¦ ideas. Likedrone-delivered packages
column5: Dash buttons for pushbutton ordering of products and the idea it came up with in 2015 to stuff its Alexa digital assistant in a wireless speaker - the Amazon Echo.makeArticleAd();Source: AmazonThat Echo smart speaker hastaken off in a way that no one predictedand spawned competitors likeAlphabet Inc's(NASDAQ:GOOGL)Google Home.Now Amazon is cranking up the creative with the Echo Look
column6: a device the company describes as ""a hands free camera and style assistant."" And once again
column7: Alexa is inside.What Is Echo Look?Amazon has built a wireless camera with a built-in microphone array
column8: a speaker and Alexa integration. Like the Amazon Echo
column9: you can ask Alexa to play music
column10: order toilet paper or control you smart home devices using Skills. Oh
column11: it's also a camera.Amazon is positioning it as something that works with your smartphone as a kind of virtual mirror. The command ""Alexa
column12: take a picture"" snaps a full length photo with background blurred. Amazon says this makes your ""outfit pop"" and blurring the background makes your photos more shareable (presumably by hiding all your dirty laundry and unmade bed).5 Tech Stocks to Buy for Growth AND DividendsYou can get a live look at yourself from different angles using the Echo Look app. You can ask Alexa to shoot a video so you can see yourself from every angle. And you can submit photos of yourself to Amazon for AI advice based on input from ""fashion specialists."" You can also create a personal ""lookbook"" in the app
column13: which appears to be a catalog (remember those?) of you modelling all your outfits.Why Would Anyone Want This?People who want to be dressed according to the whims of artificial intelligence? People who haven't figured out mirrors? If you live alone
column14: or don't trust the fashion sense of the people you do live with
column15: Echo Look promises a second opinion on your outfit choices. Albeit
column16: an option from an AI owned by a company that wants to sell you new clothes.With the ongoing addition of Skills that integrate it with other services and devices
column17: it's possible that the the Echo Look could also expand into functionality like a fitness camera (capturing progress photos) or a security camera.So What Could Go Wrong?It goes without saying that Echo Look is going to be used in ways that AMZN had not intended. That's human nature. Put a camera in bedroom that snaps photos or shoots video on voice command
column18: with LED lighting and lenses that blur the background
column19: and it seems inevitable that content shot with Amazon Echo is going to start showing up online.Of course the elephant in the room is the ongoing privacy concerns about smart speakers. People have been freaked out about Alexa always listening. What if Alexa is also always watching? Amazon toldArsTechnica UKthereisa button tophysically disable the camera and microphone.It's a single button
column20: however
column21: so if you turn off the camera
column22: you also shut down Alexa voice command. So people are going to be tempting to simply leave it on so they can continue to ask Alexa the weather forecast.Unless you do get in the habit of physically shutting it down after each use
column23: the potential is there for things to go sideways
column24: Already this year
column25: we've seen Amazon Echo speakers fooled by a TV broadcast withAlexa ordering dollhouses for viewersin the San Diego area. Then there was the commercial that infamously ""hacked"" Google Home tostart reciting hamburger info from Wikipedia.With Echo Look
column26: you have the same basic vulnerabilities at play
column27: but this time there's not just a microphone and a direct connection to your amazon.com account; there's also an internet-connected
column28: voice-controlled camera pointed at you.How to Get an Amazon Echo LookDespite the potential risks involved
column29: there are going to be people who want to buy an Amazon Echo. So how do you get your hands on one? If you have your $199.99 you have torequest an invitation from Amazon.Intel Corporation (INTC) Stock Is a No-Brainer Buy Ahead of EarningsIf selected
column30: AMZN says you'll receive a notification e-mail. Everyone else will have to wait until Amazon decides whether or not to launch the Echo Look to the public before they can say ""Alexa
column31: take a picture.""As of this writing
column32: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace3 ETF Options to Hedge Against the Next Market CrashThe 7 Top-Paying Dividend Stocks You Need To KnowForget Bank of America Corp (BAC) Stock: Buy These Stocks InsteadThe postAmazon.com

column1: Is Amazon.com
column2: Inc. (AMZN) More Beneficial to Customers Than Investors?;4/27/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsI have to tell you
column4: I want to like retail juggernautAmazon.com
column5: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) as an investment. I really do. I am a committed fan of Amazon as a consumer and happily pay up for its Prime service every year. Like most customers
column6: I find the $99 annual fee a small price to pay for free two-day shipping for the year
column7: access to Prime entertainment (though I rely more heavily onNetflix
column8: Inc.(NASDAQ:NFLX) and other perks I am sure I do not use like I should.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockThe success of AMZN stock has been so resounding that it is frequently mentioned as THE reason that bricks-and-mortar retailing is in crisis mode.Arecent retail surveyin the Atlantic details that nine retail bankruptcies have already occurred in 2017
column9: and a multitude of store closures across the current operators. Meanwhile
column10: Amazon's retail sales have grown firm $16 billion to $80 billion since 2010.It's difficult to think of a traditional retailer who is thriving these days. I gave up on investing inRalph Lauren Corp(NYSE:RL) andUrban Outfitters
column11: Inc.(NASDAQ:URBN) some time ago.Sears Holdings Corp(NASDAQ:SHLD) is thought to be close to bankruptcy
column12: Macy's Inc(NYSE:M) is closing stores andStaples
column13: Inc.(NASDAQ:SPLS) may eventually sell office supplies online and through its mail-order services that its business customers prefer.Why Amazon Stock Is KingAMZN stock is benefiting from the convergence of the internet
column14: communicating via mobile devices and cloud computing. Amazon customers shop the internet via mobile phones
column15: and do so while at competing stores. I just did it while at aBarnes & Noble
column16: Inc.(NYSE:BKS) store - a book I purchased was nearly 40% cheaper on Amazon
column17: and I got it shipped to my house the next day.7 Blue-Chip Stocks Every Investor Should OwnAmazon also happens to be one of the biggest operators in the cloud. Its Amazon Web Services reported $3.5 billion in sales during the most recent quarter and operating income that is approaching $1 billion quarterly. That was a high percentage (71%) of total company operating income of $1.3 billion.As you might have guessed
column18: AMZN stock is growing rapidly
column19: and it is expected to continue to do so.  Sales growth is projected just above 20% in each of the next two years and should hit $200 billion by the end of next year. Profits are expected to jump from $7.24 per share to $12.44 per share over this same period.Given the current share price of $918 per share
column20: that is still a pretty rich earnings multiple (187 and 73
column21: respectively).Alphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column22: NASDAQ:GOOGL)
column23: parent of Google
column24: is growing nearly as fast
column25: and trades below 30 times earnings projections.This is where the wheels come off for me in terms of investment appeal. I just can't get comfortable with where the current valuation is for AMZN stock. At a 30 times multiple
column26: the share price should be closer to a ballpark between $21 and $36 per share. In my mind
column27: a $100 share price seems a stretch given the current reported earnings levels - even considering hyper growth for the foreseeable future. Nine times that level just seems silly.The cash flow picture calms my nerves only slightly. I was excited to read Amazon's financial slides covering its fourth-quarter 2016 financial results. Page 3 states the following: Long-term goal - optimize free cash flows. The same slide details full year free cash flow (operating cash flow less capital expenditure) jumped 32% year-over-year to $9.6 billion
column28: or close to $20 per share.A 30x multiple off of that cash flow figure (which is also growing briskly) gets me to $600 per share.  However
column29: free cash flow less principal repayments of both capital and finance lease obligations was only $5.7 billion
column30: or less than $12 per share. Now
column31: I'm back to $360 per share - max.These capital lease obligations essentially account for the massive warehouse space Amazon is having to secure to support its growing empire. It is reasonable to include them as an annual cost of doing business
column32: and therefore subtract them from free cash flow. It will likely slow in the future -Wal-Mart Stores Inc's(NYSE:WMT) lease obligations are under $1 billion per year.Don't Be Fooled. Twitter Inc (TWTR) Earnings Sucked.This brings us to one of the key arguments for investing in Amazon stock - it is ambitiously investing for its future. This future should have ample free cash flows for investors that care about an eventual return on their capital. But
column33: at what price?Bottom Line on AMZN StockMy conclusion is that there is too much uncertainty to get comfortable investing in Amazon stock at the current share price. Revenue growth is easily as good as you'll find with such a large company
column34: and the profits are starting to really come in. But much of the profitability is from AWS
column35: which is another fantastic growth avenue
column36: but also fiercely competitive.This means
column37: as it stands currently
column38: Amazon doesn't make much money from its core retail operations.  It also has to spend heavily to expand warehouse space. It's also building out its own fleet of jets to ship goods. Plus
column39: it wants to spend heavily to develop its own entertainment content. Its ambitions are enviable
column40: but also potentially reckless.And the trading multiples for AMZN stock (both based on earnings and free cash flow) are just too high based off of current profit trends. At this price
column41: I would be inclined to gamble on the recovery of a traditional retailer that trades closer to 10 times earnings. Or invest in Alphabet
column42: which is a comparative steal at closer to 30 times earnings (and cash flow). It may turn out that Amazon benefits its customers most
column43: which I am just fine with.As of this writing
column44: Ryan Fuhrmann was long shares of Alphabet.More From InvestorPlaceThe 10 Best Cheap Stocks to Buy for $10 or LessThe 7 Top-Paying Dividend Stocks You Need To Know10 Stocks That Won't Exist in a DecadeThe postIs Amazon.com
column45: Inc. (AMZN) More Beneficial to Customers Than Investors?appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Interesting GOOGL Put And Call Options For July 21st;4/27/2017;"Investors in Alphabet Inc (Symbol: GOOGL) saw new options become available this week
column2: for the July 21st expiration. One of the key inputs that goes into the price an option buyer is willing to pay
column3: is the time value
column4: so with 85 days until expiration the newly available contracts represent a potential opportunity for sellers of puts or calls to achieve a higher premium than would be available for the contracts with a closer expiration. AtStock Options Channel
column5: our YieldBoost formula has looked up and down the GOOGL options chain for the new July 21st contracts and identified one put and one call contract of particular interest.The put contract at the $885.00 strike price has a current bid of $25.90. If an investor was to sell-to-open that put contract
column6: they are committing to purchase the stock at $885.00
column7: but will also collect the premium
column8: putting the cost basis of the shares at $859.10 (before broker commissions). To an investor already interested in purchasing shares of GOOGL
column9: that could represent an attractive alternative to paying $890.44/share today.Because the $885.00 strike represents an approximate 1% discount to the current trading price of the stock (in other words it is out-of-the-money by that percentage)
column10: there is also the possibility that the put contract would expire worthless. The current analytical data (including greeks and implied greeks) suggest the current odds of that happening are 55%. Stock Options Channel will track those odds over time to see how they change
column11: publishing a chart of those numbers on our website under thecontract detail page for this contract. Should the contract expire worthless
column12: the premium would represent a 2.93% return on the cash commitment
column13: or 12.57% annualized - at Stock Options Channel we call this theYieldBoost.makeArticleAd();Below is a chart showing the trailing twelve month trading history for Alphabet Inc
column14: and highlighting in green where the $885.00 strike is located relative to that history:Turning to the calls side of the option chain
column15: the call contract at the $895.00 strike price has a current bid of $28.50. If an investor was to purchase shares of GOOGL stock at the current price level of $890.44/share
column16: and then sell-to-open that call contract as a ""covered call
column17: they are committing to sell the stock at $895.00. Considering the call seller will also collect the premium
column18: that would drive a total return (excluding dividends
column19: if any) of 3.71% if the stock gets called away at the July 21st expiration (before broker commissions). Of course
column20: a lot of upside could potentially be left on the table if GOOGL shares really soar
column21: which is why looking at the trailing twelve month trading history for Alphabet Inc
column22: as well as studying the business fundamentals becomes important. Below is a chart showing GOOGL's trailing twelve month trading history
column23: with the $895.00 strike highlighted in red:Considering the fact that the $895.00 strike represents an approximate 1% premium to the current trading price of the stock (in other words it is out-of-the-money by that percentage)
column24: there is also the possibility that the covered call contract would expire worthless
column25: in which case the investor would keep both their shares of stock and the premium collected. The current analytical data (including greeks and implied greeks) suggest the current odds of that happening are 50%. On our website under thecontract detail page for this contract
column26: Stock Options Channel will track those odds over time to see how they change and publish a chart of those numbers (the trading history of the option contract will also be charted). Should the covered call contract expire worthless
column27: the premium would represent a 3.20% boost of extra return to the investor
column28: or 13.74% annualized
column29: which we refer to as theYieldBoost.The implied volatility in the put contract example
column30: as well as the call contract example
column31: are both approximately 18%. Meanwhile
column32: we calculate the actual trailing twelve month volatility (considering the last 252 trading day closing values as well as today's price of $890.44) to be 15%. For more put and call options contract ideas worth looking at
column33: visit StockOptionsChannel.com.Top YieldBoost Calls of the Nasdaq 100 Â»"

column5: if a flop
column6: could spell doom for MSFT stock.makeArticleAd();Source:Johannes Marliem Via FlickrWhat a difference a year makes.Not only was Windows 10 well received
column7: Microsoft is just crushing it in the cloud on the back of its Azure product.Still
column8: while Nadella seems to be getting all the company's ducks in a row
column9: Microsoft stock holders have yet to see a particularly decisive quarter that suggests the company is back to its former greatness.Will Thursday's fiscal Q3 report do the job?Microsoft Earnings PreviewAs of the latest look
column10: analysts collectively expect the software giant to turn $23.4 billion worth of revenue into a profit of 69 cents per share for the recently completed quarter. MSFT earned 62 cents per share of on $22.1 billion in sales in the same quarter a year earlier.The outlook
column11: if met
column12: would mark the best revenue growth Microsoft has mustered in two years.The past couple of years haven't been easy ones. Sales continued to grow in 2015
column13: but income took a big hit as then-relatively new CEO Nadella wasn't able to get the organization entirely ready for the rapid rise of cloud computing. Income rebounded but sales fell in 2016
column14: leaving investors unsure as to the sort of growth the company was capable of producing.The 10 Best Cheap Stocks to Buy for $10 or LessSlowly but surely
column15: though
column16: Microsoft has unveiled new initiatives that make its existing services more marketable. The final quarter of last year (June) saw respectable growth
column17: but not convincing growth. Thursday's post-close report of third-quarter results has the potential to prove the company is on the right track.What to WatchThough the top and bottom lines will be the most looked-at measure of the company's third quarter report
column18: there's a select group of details that will ultimately push MSFT stock higher or lower. Three matters stand out above the rest. In no certain order
column19: keep an eye (and ear) onâ€¦LinkedIn Impact:The acquisition of LinkedIn wasn't completed until December 8
column20: so Microsoft hasn't yet reported a full quarter with its sales and earnings contribution factored in. That will change on Thursday.We do have a pretty good idea of what to expect
column21: though. Before the buyout was consummated
column22: LinkedIn was doing nearly a billion dollars worth of business a quarter
column23: and had just turned profitable. Microsoft may have stepped in right at the company's inflection point.That being said
column24: MSFT stock owners have only begun to see what the company intends to do with the professional networking site. Only in the past few days has Microsoft explained it wants tointegrate LinkedIn's data with its Dynamics 365 platform. That still only scratches the surface of how LinkedIn could be leveraged
column25: though.CloudBook:While Windows 10 may still be the king of all laptop operating systems
column26: Microsoft doesn't really have much of a presence in the low-end and small form-factor netbook space. That's whereAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL) is really starting to gain traction with its Chromebook lines.That may be about to change
column27: however.Microsoft is prepping a launch of a so-called CloudBook
column28: which will not only be price- and performance-competitive with Chromebooks
column29: but will offer a very familiar and very flexible Windows operating system.Cloud/Azure:For the unfamiliar
column30: Azure is an efficient way for users tointerface with a variety of cloud services. It matters just because Microsoft wouldn't be making any revenue headway in the cloud without it.Last quarter's server and cloud services revenue was up 12% on a year-over-year basis
column31: thanks to Azure's 93% top-line improvement. The company has been adding to Azure's menu in the meantime.Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Is All Grown Up. That's a Problem.Bottom Line for MSFT StockWhile its fiscal third quarter is an important one
column32: don't let a lack of a big earnings beat paint an unnecessarily pessimistic picture of what's to come. Although it's taking a while
column33: Nadella really does seem to have all the parts of the engine synced up quite nicely.As our Chris Lau said on Monday:""Microsoft continues to produce strong revenue growth and profits. Its cloud-computing platform is expanding
column34: and the costs to build it are falling. As more companies migrate apps to cloud services
column35: Microsoft's sales will keep going up. Meanwhile
column36: MSFT stock still has the support of Microsoft's legacy businesses and strong cash return to shareholders via dividends and buybacks.""It's tough to disagree with that assessment. The only concern a newcomer might feel is stepping into MSFT stock after the 35% run-up its dished out following its year-ago earnings report. Meanwhile
column37: shares continue to touching new highs in 2017.As of this writing
column38: James Brumley did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace7 Blue-Chip Stocks Every Investor Should Own10 Dividend Stocks That Will Deliver Double-Digit Returns Every YearThe 10 Best Stocks to Buy for the Next DecadeThe postNadella Has Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Purring Like a Kittenappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThe growth story atFord Motor Company(NYSE:F) suffered a setback during the first quarter as the costs of recalls bit into profits.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockThe company said it had income of $1.6 billion
column3: 40 cents per share
column4: on revenue of $39.1 billion
column5: compared with net income of $2.4 billion
column6: 61 cents per share
column7: and revenue of $37.7 billion a year ago.Despite this
column8: the shares rose nearly 2% in premarket trading because the company hadwarned about the number last month
column9: predicting profits would come in at 30 cents to 35 cents per share.The biggest contributor to the shortfall was the cost of repairing cars under warranty
column10: which rose $467 million.The company also spent $253 million more on product launches than a year ago
column11: and $176 million more on commodities.The company issued an optimistic set of estimates for the full year
column12: saying costs should not increase for the rest of the 2017 and the company should earn $9 billion.Ford Car Sales PeakedU.S. car sales peaked in December at 18.7 million units
column13: coming in at just 16.9 million for the month of March.5 Stocks to Sell in MayThe peak came in well short of peaks achieved in previous recoveries
column14: but until March had been within a range of 17 million-18.7 million for two years. The average car on U.S. roads is now11.6 years old
column15: a full year older than it was in 2010
column16: as U.S. automakers have worked to match the quality of foreign cars.Unlike rivalGeneral Motors Company(NYSE:GM)
column17: Ford isnot making up for U.S. weakness with strength in China. The company's sales there last month came in at 90
column18: 457 units
column19: down 21% from a year earlier
column20: and were down 19% year over year.Changing Chinese tax laws on new auto purchases were blamed. A tax of 10% dropped to 5%
column21: and then rose this year back to 7.5%. Sales of cars not subject to the tax
column22: those with larger engines
column23: were up 21% against a year ago.Our Tom Taulli was recently down on Ford
column24: saying the stock is cheap but""cheap is not enough.""He wrote that Ford has become a niche player
column25: and its niche is light trucks like the F-150. Its vaunted entry into new markets like electric cars and self-driving cars are thus hampered by lack of scale.F Stock a Bargain?Auto stocks have been cheaper than the market throughout this decade. Despite not having taken a bailout in 2009
column26: Ford has languished with the rest
column27: losing one-third of its value since a 2014 peak of nearly $18 per share. It will open for trading on Apr 27 at under $12.This has left it with a price-to-earnings multiple of barely 10
column28: and a dividend rate of 5.2% that has become the best reason to own the stock. The company usually covers this dividend with earnings
column29: and the most recent quarter is no exception. An extraordinary 2016 led to a 20-cent-per-share dividend paid in January
column30: but the rate fell back this month to its regular 15-cent-per-share level.Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) to Battle Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) for Class CrownF stock's balance sheet shows the total debt-to-assets ratio being kept level at about 60%
column31: but half of that consists of current liabilities endemic to the auto business
column32: things like short-term debt and accounts payable. Long-term debt comes in at a little over $90 billion on nearly $240 billion in assets.The bottom line remains what it was before the report. Ford is a great stock to buy for income
column33: but a lousy stock to buy for capital gains. Since it re-launched its dividend in 2012
column34: it has tripled the payout
column35: while the shares have gone nowhere
column36: and it would be wrong to expect that to change.Dana Blankenhornis a financial and technology journalist. He is the author of the political polemicSaving Trumpistan

column1: Starbucks Corporation (SBUX) Should Dip After Earnings
column2: And Thatâ€™s OK;4/27/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsUntil its latest rally
column4: Starbucks Corporation(NASDAQ:SBUX) was flat for about a year. However
column5: a 7% push since April 13 has given SBUX stock a breath of fresh air
column6: and put it on the path to overtaking its 2015 highs.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockStarbucks is currently one of the few fast-casual diners (which it's typically grouped into) that are doing well in the U.S. Same-store sales are sub-5%
column7: but at least they're growing.And the progress that the company is making in China is unbelievable. China eventually will be a larger market than the U.S. for the coffee titan
column8: so the progress it makes there over the next decade is critical.Arising dividendis another argument for the bulls.The question heading into Thursday afternoon's fiscal second-quarter earnings report
column9: though
column10: is what path will SBUX stock take from here? Will it rocket to all-time highs
column11: head back from whence it came
column12: or something in between?Expectations for StarbucksSBUX stock hit a new 52-week high on Wednesday
column13: bringing expectations higher as well. Often
column14: when a stock rallies like this into earnings
column15: it turns into a ""sell the news"" event.10 Dividend Stocks That Will Deliver Double-Digit Returns Every YearI think Starbucks earnings could be setting up for a similar reaction. Perhaps it's not an outright sell. But the reaction to earnings could result in a small pullback for SBUX stock or a muted reaction after-hours.There's one thing that makes gauging Starbucks a little trickier
column16: though: U.S. same-store sales.For the past two quarters
column17: Starbucks has turned in a subpar report card
column18: with 4% U.S. comps. For almost any other company
column19: those are great numbers. But for SBUX
column20: it broke a long string of quarterly comps north of 5%.Then-CEO Howard Schultz - who stepped down and is now executive chairman - was unhappy with the results. Traffic had turned stores into a frenzy near peak hours
column21: according to management
column22: and Starbucks is trying to implement solutions to get people through more efficiently.Thus
column23: American comps could be underwhelming again this quarter. But (and this is a big but) if management tells us they've found a solution and second-half same-store sales will accelerate
column24: investors likely will use that as their buy/sell trigger over other results.How to Trade SBUX StockThis latest breakout is quite refreshing. For long-term investors who are truly thinking long-term
column25: stay the course. There's no reason to veer away from a terrific company.For short-term investors
column26: though
column27: Starbucks is trickier to navigate.We believe the stock has gone too far
column28: too fast. As a result
column29: a muted reaction higher or pullback is the most likely outcome.SBUX stock is overbought in the short-term
column30: as seen by its Relative Strength Index reading on the chart (top purple circle). This doesn't mean a correction is due
column31: but it does increase the odds that Starbucks is exhausting itself.Clearing through the $58 to $59.50 region of resistance was a big move. Barring a terrible quarter
column32: this region should act as support. Given that the stock's 10-day moving average is at $59.50
column33: I would expect it to act as support too.Under Armour Inc (UAA) Stock Races Higher on a Critical Q1 BeatA pullback of 2% to 4% would be really healthy on the back of a strong quarter. It will allow the stock to digest some of its gains and rebuild momentum for a push higher.Those who are already long can stay for the ride
column34: or consider selling some upside calls. This gives Starbucks stock a bit more room to rally
column35: but adds some income in the event of a pullback.Bret Kenwell is the manager and author ofFuture Blue Chips. He can be contacted on Twitter via@BretKenwell. As of this writing

column1: Multimedia Weekly Digest: Tech Talk And Arconic CEO Ouster;4/27/2017;"BySA Multimedia:Welcome to the seventh instalment of SA Multimedia's Digest

Paid per click is the amount of times that someone clicks on an advertisement. Cost per click is the amount of money Google revenues from an advertisement view. The recent trend in earnings releases has been a decline in cost per click and an uptick in paid per click. In Ben's personal research

column1: Amazon Q1 Earnings Preview: How Much Will AWS Grow?;4/26/2017;"In what promises to be one of the busiest days of season

column4: are set to post their latest reports on Thursday. Nevertheless
column5: investors can expect internet behemoth AmazonAMZNto hog the attention when it releases its first-quarter resultsafter the market closes.Over the past several years
column6: Amazon has transformed from an e-commerce innovator into a bonafide powerhouse in every corner of the tech world. The company now boasts a portfolio that includes a burgeoning media department
column7: millions of premium members
column8: and the fast-growing Amazon Web Services (AWS) unit.Amazon Web Services is a collection of enterprise-level platforms designed for websites and companies that can't afford the time or money it takes to develop their own server farms. In short
column9: AWS provides cloud-based storage and templates for companies to quickly boost their computing capabilities.The cloud computing industry is thriving
column10: and AWS is booming. What's more
column11: the segment offers Amazon some reliable profitability
column12: allowing the company some leeway to burn cash on other projects. All one needs to understand about AWS can be found when looking at its growth rates and margins.Amazon Web Services revenues came in at $3.536 billion for the fourth quarter
column13: marking year-over-year growth of 47%. These results brought the segment's full-year total to $12.219 billion
column14: up more than 55% from its prior-year total of $7.880 billion.And at the same time that Amazon has been able to grow the AWS division
column15: it has also been able to make it more profitable.Keeping the unit's 2015 and 2016 revenue totals in mind
column16: note that its operating income in 2016 was up to $3.108 billion from $1.507 billion in 2015. This means that the Web Services unit operated with an EBITDA margin of 25.4% in 2016
column17: which was a nice improvement from the EBITDA margin of 19.1% it posted in 2015.So this is why everyone will be looking at AWS when Amazon reports tomorrow
column18: but how will it perform? Well

These estimates are updated daily and are based on the independent research of expert stock analysts.Learn more here>>>Our latest consensus estimate calls for AWS revenues to hit $3.7 billion this quarter-an increase of 42% from the year-ago quarter. This would also represent a roughly 5.7% increase from last quarter's totals.While this growth rate is certainly still impressive

column21: AWS revenues grew by 55%

column23: AWS is quite a long way from its plateau
column24: but it could be on the horizon eventually. Nevertheless
column25: investors should look to see if Amazon can continue making the business more profitable.Make sure to check back here for our analysis once Amazon reports on Thursday!Want more stock market analysis from this author? column1: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) to Battle Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) for Class Crown;4/26/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsNext week

column4: as well as unveil the Windows 10 Cloud edition of the company's iconic operating system.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockThe interesting part
column5: though
column6: is not anticipation of a new device or expectancy of some revolutionary program rollout.Rather
column7: the focus is expected to heavily surround the Windows 10 Cloud OS and management'sintentions to shift significant attention to the education market.CEO Satya Nadella will
column8: apparently
column9: be allocating a larger portion of the company's resources to wage war against tech behemothAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column10: NASDAQ:GOOGL) in the classroom arena. BothMicrosoft and Google each sport their own classroom servicesthat offer teachers and students alike the opportunity to learn
column11: work and collaborate using a variety of tools designed to increase efficiency and cultivate a productive environment.However
column12: despite having equally robust and functional Classroom products
column13: MSFT has struggled to gain ground against GOOGL since the official release of Microsoft Classroom in April 2016. Comparatively
column14: Google Classroom has been around since August 2014 and
column15: for the most part
column16: it has been very well-received across the country by professors and teachers as well as students ranging from elementary school-age up through universities and grad schools.Why Google Has an Advantage in ClassroomsMany investors have wondered why MSFT would be willing to spend such time
column17: money and resources to get its software in front of elementary school-age children. Well
column18: last year
column19: shortly after the debut of Microsoft Classroom
column20: Fortune's Barb Darrow answered that question
column21: explaining:Tech titans know that if they want to expand their customer bases
column22: they've got to get 'em while they're young. That's why Google and Microsoft have targeted teachers and younger students with special editions of their bread-and-butter software packages.The idea is if you learn to type on Microsoft Word or Google Docs
column23: you'll keep typing and working on one of those options for life. That's the rationale behind the companies' respective Google Classroom and Microsoft Classroom franchises.5 Tech Stocks to Buy for Growth AND DividendsWith this in mind
column24: the battle for dominance in classrooms across the country makes a lot more sense.Apple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL)
column25: which has been battling Microsoft in classrooms across America since the release of its Apple IIe desktop computer in the 1980's
column26: was in a solid position to maintain top market share with the iPad release in 2010. Almost immediately
column27: the iPad became a nationwide hit with teachers and students alike
column28: and by 2013
column29: Apple devices accounted for nearly half of all shipments to classrooms
column30: while MSFT devices only accounted for 29%.And so the war waged on
column31: as it had for more than three decades prior
column32: with AAPL and Microsoft vying for the attention of America's pupils in hopes of establishing a lifelong brand loyalty by putting their devices in classrooms across the country. Meanwhile
column33: all along GOOGL had been laying the groundwork for making further inroads into educational institutions by marketing Google Apps for Education
column34: which integrated with Google Drive and Gmail.GOOGL rather quickly disrupted what had traditionally been a solid duopoly - like it had done (and continues to do) with a number of other services - and rose to become the top dog
column35: rocketing past the competition thanks to a few key elements that
column36: together
column37: were much more desirable for both students and educators.While Apple and Microsoft focused on marketing their hardware
column38: Google had realized that students and teachers were still using its cloud platform to create
column39: share and collaborate
column40: regardless of the device they used to access its cloud services
column41: hence the introduction of Google Classroom.With development of the functional
column42: yet extremely inexpensive
column43: Chromebook device
column44: which provided for extremely easy access to the web-based applications that the bulk of students and teachers already used
column45: it was no surprise when GOOGL amassed a 58% market share in early 2016.Source: FutureSourceSo
column46: asFast Companyput it
column47: ""Caught on their heels in the U.S.
column48: and anxious that Google's Chromebooks will soon repeat their success overseas
column49: Apple and Microsoft are fighting to regain momentum. First
column50: they need to convince educators that in a world of rapidly changing technology they can give both students and teachers a competitive edge.""Microsoft Has a Plan to Compete Against GoogleWhile it's no secret that many consumers
column51: investors and analysts alike frequently tend to view MSFT as ""old school"" and GOOGL as the better
column52: more modern technology company. However
column53: not everybody feels this way
column54: and there's no denying that Microsoft has the experience and resources to remain a major player in the tech industry. The question
column55: though
column56: involves finding the most potentially profitable areas for future development and growth of MSFT stock.According toWindows Central
column57: the timing is right for Windows 10 Cloud.""Apparently
column58: management has learned from the Windows RT debacle and has a new strategy in place to properly and successfully market Windows 10 Cloud as a viable alternative to Google and its line of Chromebooks.If the company can gain traction and start chipping away at Google's market share
column59: that could translate into solid long-term support for MSFT stock. Unfortunately
column60: it will be many months before anything concrete is available
column61: and even those figures will just be preliminary. It could take at least a year before any meaningful earnings and revenue figures are released
column62: which is what will ultimately be the driving force behind a change for Microsoft stock.The 10 Best Stocks to Buy for the Next DecadeOf course

column64: either. The company is no stranger to competition

column66: though

column14: hardware   like Chromecast and the Pixel smartphone
column15: and Google's cloud   computing and hosting platforms.""G"" is for GoogleIn keeping with Alphabet's reorganization and shift towardsegment-based reportingjust over a year ago
column16: expect to see a breakdown of the company's   two primary operating segments: Google and ""Other Bets.""The former is the financial core of Alphabet's business
column17: encompassing Search
column18: Android
column19: Maps
column20: Chrome
column21: Google Play
column22: Gmail
column23: and YouTube
column24: as well as Commerce
column25: Apps
column26: Cloud
column27: and hardware.   Together
column28: these services represented nearly 99% of Alphabet's   total $26 billion in revenue and all operating income last   quarter. Within that
column29: advertising revenue comprised almost 86% of   total revenue last quarter. But don't be surprised if   advertising's influence falls as contributions from   non-advertising businesses increase.Alphabet will also break those results down to help investors   better understand its ad revenue
column30: including the growth and   percentage that came from its own properties versus network   member sites. We'll also see the latest growth in aggregate paid   clicks (up 36% year over year last quarter)
column31: as well as aggregate   cost per click
column32: the latter of which measures how much Google   makes per ad. Note
column33: however
column34: that aggregate cost per click has   steadily declined in recent quarters -- the metric fell 15% in Q4   -- thanks to enviable growth at YouTube
column35: where the TrueView ad   format monetizes at lower rates as a byproduct of reaching   consumers earlier in the purchase funnel.What to watch in Other BetsMeanwhile
column36: the Other Bets segment is made up of promising   pre-revenue businesses operating in a wide variety of industries
column37: including Google Fiber (high-speed internet)
column38: Calico (human   longevity)
column39: Verily (life-sciences products)
column40: Google Capital   (capital investments)
column41: Nest (connected home)
column42: and X (""moonshot""   initiatives).But while Other Bets' top line is growing nicely through sales   of Nest
column43: Fiber
column44: and Verily products
column45: this segment will almost   certainly continue to generate large operating losses. Last   quarter
column46: for example
column47: Other Bets revenue climbed nearly 75% year   over year
column48: to $262 million
column49: and generated an operating loss of   $1.088 billion -- albeit narrowed from an operating loss of   $1.213 billion in the same year-ago period.Of course
column50: those losses are more than recouped through   Alphabet's immensely profitable Google operations. And Alphabet   management will likely reiterate that investors would do best to   view Other Bets through a long-term lens
column51: noting that their   eventual success could hold the key to unlocking several   multibillion-dollar industries.In any case

column1: Why Chipotle (CMG) Stock is Still Awful for Growth Investors;4/26/2017;"Following the earnings report for Chipotle (CMG) last night

column13: 089 million. So

column17: Inc. QuotePretty terrible if you ask me.Chipotle hasn't grown revenues at all since Q1 2015

column53: as their 'innovation' now.To me

column1: Better Buy: Apple Inc. vs. Google;4/26/2017;"Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL) andAlphabet(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) -- the holding company formerly   known as Google -- are
column2: in all likelihood
column3: the two most powerful   technology companies in the world today. To avoid burying the   lede
column4: both companies have outstanding economics and deserve a   place as core technology holdings in many investors'   portfolios.However
column5: that isn't to say one company doesn't present a more   compelling option for investors right now. As such
column6: this article   will analyze Alphabet andApple stocks through three important dimensions to see which company is more   deserving of investors' attention in the here and now.Financial fortitudeBoth Apple and Alphabet are two absurdly profitable companies.   With cash positions dwarfing the annual economic output of some   pretty large countries
column7: these two companies are financial   fortresses in every sense of the word. Here's a quick breakdown   of a few of the most commonly used solvency and liquidity metrics   for both companies.makeArticleAd();CompanyCash & InvestmentsDebtCash From OperationsCurrent RatioApple$246.1 billion$87.5 billion$65.4 billion1.2Alphabet$86.3 billion$3.9 billion$36.0 billion6.3Data sources: Apple investor relations
column8: Alphabet investor   relations
column9: Yahoo! Finance. Cash from operations reflects most   recent 12 months.Most importantly
column10: Alphabet and Apple carry effectively no   financial risk. Their respective net-cash positions of $82.4   billion and $158.6 billion alone are larger than most successful   companies' total market capitalizations
column11: and this totally   overlooks the tens of billions in operating cash flow Apple and   Alphabet generate annually.Sure
column12: Alphabet's current ratio trounces that of Apple.   However
column13: taken in the context of Apple's broader business.   Neither company is at any risk of falling short of its financial   commitments. And given that Apple edges Alphabet out in terms of   net cash and cash-flow generation
column14: the Mac maker deserves a win   in the first category of this analysis.Winner: AppleImage source: Apple.Durable competitive advantageAs alluded to in the introduction
column15: both Apple and Alphabet   enjoy considerable durable competitive advantages.For Apple
column16: the company's unique ability to combine beautifully   designed hardware with its internal software and app ecosystems   allows the consumer electronics giant to command prices far   higher than those of its peers. Last year
column17: Apple recorded a $645   average selling price (ASP) for the iPhone
column18: compared to $217 for   the average Android handset. This device premium has allowed   Apple to consistently capture the overwhelming majority of   smartphone industry profits in recent years; one sell-side   analyst estimated that Apple earned 92% of all smartphone market   profits in Q4 2016. This pricing power is the heart and soul of   Apple's competitive advantages
column19: and it seems likely to endure   into the company's coming device cycle as Apple launches a   totally redesigned iPhone 8 this fall.Alphabet dominates its core internet search business in much   the same way that Apple controls the smartphone market. The   search giant typically controls two-thirds of the global   search market
column20: a feat made all the more impressive by the fact   that the Google search engine is blocked and effectively   inaccessible in China. According to recent data
column21: Google receives   over 30 billion search queries each month across its various   platforms. This breadth of exposure and the intent-based nature   of Google's searches enabled the Internet giant to command   31% of global online advertising spending last year
column22: and evidence   suggests Facebook and Alphabet will continue to capture greater   percentages of online ad-spend in the future.This platform gives Alphabet a massive profit stream that the   tech giant has aggressively funneled back into a series of   futuristic business ideas it collects in its Other Bets reporting   segment. Though they garner significant media attention
column23: Google's   only real profit center -- and the source of its massive   competitive advantages -- is its search business.Winner: TieImage source: Google.ValuationTurning to the third area of this investigation
column24: here's a   quick overview of three of the most commonly used valuation   metrics as a starting point to frame our discussion.CompanyP/EForward P/EEV/EBITDAApple16.813.711.0Alphabet30.021.316.6Data source: Yahoo! Finance.Obviously
column25: Apple is cheaper on an absolute basis. However
column26: the   key to finding attractive stocks to buy lies in finding relative   mispricings between a company's current valuation and its   expected future performance.We can do this through a number of ways. One popular metric   that tries to capture this is the PEG ratio
column27: which compares   companies' growth estimates against their valuations
column28: Alphabet trades at a PEG ratio of 1.3
column29: while Apple is
column30: in   theory
column31: slightly more expensive with a PEG ratio of 1.7; a PEG   ratio of 1 is
column32: in theory
column33: correctly valued.However
column34: with the average analyst estimating it will grow   sales 6% this year
column35: I see Apple's elevated PEG ratio more as a   reflection that Wall Street is underestimating Apple's growth   potential in the year ahead. Furthermore
column36: Apple's dividend   yield and the likelihood that it will increase its capital   return program in the coming quarterly report further enhances   the company's return profile. This one is tough
column37: but I see Apple   as more attractively valued than Alphabet based on my thesis that   the market is underestimating the iPhone 8's potential   impact.Winner: Apple (by a nose)And the winner is...AppleHopefully
column38: you sensed that both companies are indeed worthy   investments. However
column39: Apple holds a slight edge in today's   analysis because of its cheaper relative valuation and its more   easily identifiable near-term growth catalyst in the form of the   iPhone 8. Still
column40: you can't go wrong holding either tech giant as   a part of the core technology stocks in your portfolio for the   long term.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column41: it can pay to listen. After all
column42: the newsletter they have run for   over a decade
column43: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column44: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now...and Apple wasn't one of them!   That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even better   buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of April 3

column46: an executive at Alphabet
column47: is a member of The     Motley Fool's board of directors.Andrew Tonnerowns shares of Apple. The Motley Fool owns shares of and     recommends Alphabet (A and C shares) and Apple. The Motley Fool     has adisclosure policy."

column1: Nasdaq 6000: What It Reveals About Tech Stocks And Venture Capital;4/26/2017;"As Nasdaq hits 6
column3: for investors of a certain age
column4: any sign of strength in tech stocks brings back worrying memories
column5: and prompts the question
column6: â€œAre we headed for another tech wreck?â€ The answer to that is quite simply no. This time is different.There is
column7: however
column8: a bubble in the tech sector that investors should be watching closely; it just isnâ€™t in the stock market.To some extent
column9: the current stock market situation is
column10: like back in 2000
column11: the result of excessive optimism
column12: or what Alan Greenspan famously called â€œirrational exuberance.â€ The difference is that in most cases today
column13: that optimism is about increasing already substantial profits
column14: whereas in the dotcom boom it was about simply achieving profitability. What we have now is an issue with valuation. What we had then was rampant speculation. They are not the same thing.makeArticleAd();Corporate profitability will inevitably catch up to the market at some point when it is based on expectation
column15: even though those expectations may have gotten a little out of hand in the short term. Assuming no unforeseen â€œblack swanâ€ event or major economic crisis
column16: natural economic growth dictates that the question now is one of how long it will take corporations to achieve the kind of results that the market is pricing in.That is why even though I am bearish in the short term I think it would be foolish to sell stock in mature but still growing tech companies like Apple (AAPL)
column17: Facebook (FB)
column18: or Amazon (AMZN). Some short term hedging of a portfolio may be in order
column19: but this is no time to panic.In 2000
column20: the question with regard to many of the high flying stocks was not about how fast they could grow. It was about whether the corporations concerned would survive long enough to ever make a profit. Now
column21: even those that have struggled to fulfill their potential such as Twitter (TWTR) are seen as underperforming
column22: not because they are losing money but rather because they are not making enough. In fact
column23: based on this morningâ€™s spectacular beat
column24: even that assertion could be seen as questionable.When it comes to the tech sector as a whole
column25: however
column26: not everything in the garden is rosy. The fact that Snapchat (SNAP)
column27: for example
column28: is down over 25% from its post IPO high demonstrates one problem in the sector. If there is a bubble in tech right
column29: now it is not in the stock market
column30: but rather in venture capital. Funds are falling over themselves to invest in startups and as a result IPOs have changed in nature.The purpose of going public has always been to raise capital; historically it has been the cheapest and most efficient way for rapidly expanding businesses to finance continued growth. After nearly a decade of ultra low interest rates
column31: however
column32: and with a huge amount of venture capital funds looking for the next Google (GOOG:GOOGL)
column33: many early stage tech companies now find themselves with a wealth of financing options
column34: even for massive sums of money
column35: that are simple and inexpensive.As a result
column36: many companies - think Uber and Airbnb - are staying private even as they achieve virtual ubiquity. The only reason for companies like that to go public now
column37: it seems
column38: is so that early investors can cash out. That is great for them
column39: but not so good for the average investor seeking growth from a â€œyoungâ€ tech company.If anything
column40: that trend towards successful tech companies delaying IPOs results in less worry about stocks in the sector. Once the shares are on the market those companies have worked out the kinks
column41: grown to a formidable size and
column42: in many cases reached the point of being profitable. That may make some IPOs questionable from a growth perspective
column43: but it does result in greater long term stability.Nasdaq 6K is not
column44: then
column45: a cause for worry. There is no unsustainable bubble in the stock market. Venture capital
column46: on the other hand
column47: is showing the kind of irrational exuberance for the tech sector that got us into trouble before. That doesnâ€™t pose a danger to most retail investors
column48: but those in that market will one day have to pay the price."
