column1: Texas Instruments (TXN) Beats on Earnings and Revenues in Q1;4/26/2017;"Texas InstrumentsTXNor TI's first-quarter 2017 earnings and revenues came ahead of expectations.Earnings of 89 cents per share (excluding 8 cents discrete tax benefit) surpassed the Zacks Consensus Estimate by 6 cents. Revenues of $3.4 billion beat the consensus mark by nearly a billion.Shares were up 1.59% at the end of Tuesday's trading in response to the better-than expected results. Year to date
column2: the stock has outperformed the ZacksSemiconductor - Generalindustry. It gained 12.4% compared with the industry's gain of 3.6%.The strong results were driven by strengthening auto and industrial markets. The communications market grew slightly year over year. The personal electronics market was stronger compared to the year-ago quarter. Enterprise systems declined.Internally
column3: the company has always executed rather well. It
column4: along with chipmaker IntelINTC
column5: remains one of the few semiconductor companies that depend on internal capacity for manufacturing the bulk of its devices. Since the company usually builds out capacity well ahead of demand
column6: it is able to make opportunistic purchases. As a result
column7: it is able to contain capex at up to 4% of sales even while on an expansion plan.Texas Instruments continues to prudently invest its R&D dollars into several high-margin
column8: high-growth areas of the analog and embedded processing markets. This is gradually increasing its exposure to the industrial and automotive markets and increasing dollar content at customers
column9: while reducing exposure to volatile consumer/computing markets.At the call
column10: management stated that the company will remain focused on increasing free cash flow per share and strengthening competitive advantages. Overall
column11: we remain optimistic about TI's compelling product line
column12: the differentiation in its business and lower-cost 300mm Analog output. We note that channel inventories remain very low
column13: meaning that demand is likely to remain strong.Let's see what the numbers say.RevenueRevenues of $3.41 billion were slightly down sequentially but up 13.1% year over year (within the guidance range of $3.17 billion and $3.43 billion) and beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate by 3%.The automotive market continued to be strong. The company also saw broad-based improvement in the industrial market.Growth of analog and embedded processing applications business was strong. The Other segment declined. The company continues to return cash to investors in the form of share repurchases and dividends.Segment RevenuesThe Analog
column14: Embedded Processing and Other Segments generated 66%
column15: 24% and 10% of quarterly revenues
column16: respectively.TheAnalogbusiness was down 1.5% sequentially but up 20.1% from the year-ago quarter. The year-over-year growth was driven by strong performance in all three product lines - power
column17: signal chain and high volume.TheEmbedded Processingsegment
column18: which includes processor
column19: microcontroller and connectivity product lines
column20: was up 7.9% sequentially and 10.2% year over year. The year-over-year growth was driven by stronger sales across all product lines - processors and connected microcontrollers.TheOthersegment
column21: which includes DLPs
column22: custom ASICs
column23: calculators
column24: royalties and some legacy wireless products was down 10.8% sequentially and 16.6% year over year. The decline was mainly due to royalties moving to other income and expenses.Net product orders were $3.5 billion in the quarter
column25: up 14% year over year.MarginsTexas Instruments' gross margin of 63% was up 54 basis points (bps) sequentially and 222 bps from the year-ago quarter. The company's gross margin has been improving consistently as more production shifts to its 300mm line. Reducing depreciation on its fixed assets is also a contributing factor. Fab utilization remains steady and mix relatively consistent at these levels. Therefore
column26: these factors aren't likely to remain gross margin drivers in the future.Operating expenses of $892 million were up 9.6% sequentially and 5.6% from the last year. Operating margin was 36.8%
column27: down 183 bps sequentially but up 409 bps from the year-ago quarter. All expenses increased sequentially as a percentage of sales.The Analog
column28: Embedded Processing and Other segments generated operating margin of 41.4%
column30: respectively. Analog and Other segment margin contracted 140 bps and 1130 bps
column31: respectively on a sequential basis while that of Embedded Processing expanded 170 bps. Analog and Embedded segment margins expanded 482 bps and 424 bps
column32: respectively year over year by while Other contracted 481 bps.Net IncomePro forma net income was $1 billion
column33: or a 29.3% net income margin compared with $1.05 billion
column34: or 30.7% in the previous quarter and $711 million
column35: or 23.6% in the year-ago quarter.On a GAAP basis
column36: the company reported net profit of 97 cents a share compared with a net profit of $1.02 per share in the previous quarter and 69 cents per share in the comparable prior-year quarter.Balance Sheet and Cash FlowCash and short-term investments balance was $3.05 billion
column37: up $44 million during the quarter.The company generated $795 million in cash from operations

column40: although the amount spent on share repurchases dropped 24%.At quarter-end
column41: TI had $3 billion in long-term debt and $378 million in short-term debt. As of Mar 31

The mid-point of the guidance is higher than the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $3.49 billion.The annual effective tax rate and the rate to be applied for the second quarter is around 28%.Earnings for the quarter are expected to be 89 cents to $1.01 per share. The Zacks Consensus Estimate is pegged at 91 cents.The capex target remains at 4% of revenues.Texas Instruments Incorporated Price

column1: The 3 Best Dividend Stocks of the 2020s;4/26/2017;"Investing in soliddividend   stocksis arguably the most effective way to generate market-beating   returns over the long term. But those returns can be even more   lucrative for investors with the foresight to buy not just   dividend stocks that have outperformed in the past but also   companies that are positioned to deliver years of outsized gains   going forward.To help point you in that direction
column2: we asked three top Motley   Fool contributors to each discuss what they believe will be one   of thebest dividend   stocksin the 2020s. Read on to learn why they choseUniversal Display(NASDAQ: OLED)
column3: Qualcomm(NASDAQ: QCOM)
column4: and Google parentAlphabet(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) .IMAGE SOURCE: GETTY IMAGES.makeArticleAd();""A good place to start""Steve Symington(Universal Display):When Universal Display deliveredstrong fourth-quarter 2016 resultsin February
column5: the OLED technologist also raised eyebrows all   around Wall Street by announcing its first-ever quarterly cash   dividend -- albeit at just $0.03 per share
column6: which equates to   a minuscule 0.14% annual yield at today's prices.During the subsequent earnings conference call
column7: however
column8: Universal Display CFO Sidney Rosenblatt offered some context on   the new dividend
column9: by saying
column10: ""Today's announcement reflects the   Board of Directors' confidence in Universal Display's robust   future growth opportunities
column11: expected continued positive cash   flow generation
column12: and commitment to return capital to our   shareholders.""When asked to clarify the company's stance during the Q&A   section of the call
column13: Rosenblatt elaborated that the   $0.03-per-share payout is ""a good place to start
column14: and further   insisted they ""intend to continue to pay regular dividends   quarterly going forward.""And why not? I'veargued beforethat Universal Display is still in the early stages of   its long-term growth story as its flagship OLED technology   becomes more ubiquitous. Not only is its OLED material and   intellectual property used in millions of smartphones fromSamsungand televisions fromLG-- which represent Universal Display's largest and second-largest   customers
column15: respectively -- but it's also poised to become a   bigger part ofApple's repertoire (Apple Watch already uses OLED displays) with the   widely anticipated launch of the first OLED iPhone later this   year.In fact
column16: shares of Universal Display climbed more than 5% on   Thursday to flirt with a fresh all-time high afterGoldman Sachsanalyst Brian Lee cited both the Apple developments and his   expectation that Samsung will convert to a more lucrative running   royalty agreement with UDC starting in 2019. In the end
column17: as   Universal Display's business continues to take off into the   2020s
column18: I suspect its dividend payout will inevitably follow   suit.Tech tailwinds and a chunky yieldKeith Noonan(Qualcomm):Research firm IDC estimates that the number of connected   devices will have increased from roughly 11 billion in 2016 to 80   billion in 2025
column19: and semiconductor company Qualcomm is going to   play a big role in driving that growth. Between its dominance in   the mobile chip market
column20: its recent push into the automotive   segment by way of acquiringNXP Semiconductors
column21: and its development of low-power Wi-Fi chips for Internet of   Things devices
column22: the company is on track to be a major beneficiary   of the connectivity boom. A study from LexInnova found that   Qualcomm has more high-value IoT patents than any other company
column23: so both its licensing and its hardware businesses are looking at   meaningful tailwinds as IoT ramps up.On the returned income side of things
column24: Qualcomm already boasts   an attractive profile with its yield sitting at 4.3%
column25: and its   14-year history of dividend growth suggests that investors can   count on payout increases down the line. Trading at roughly 11.5   times forward earnings estimates
column26: the stock is also a potential   value play. A slew of legal challenges are depressing the   company's valuation
column27: and while these issues do suggest real   downside risk
column28: they also present the opportunity for investors to   buy into a stock that could be a huge winner over the next decade   and beyond at bargain prices.Qualcomm stock is something of a rarity in that it combines a   sizable dividend component
column29: a cheap valuation
column30: and ample growth   potential. With these characteristics in mind
column31: I think it stands   out as one of the top dividend stocks to hold through the   2020s.Tech's future dividend kingTravis Hoium(Alphabet):Alphabet isn't a dividend stock today
column32: but by the 2020s
column33: I think   it is going to be one of the best dividend stocks on the market.   The company has a massive lead in search
column34: which is incredibly   profitable and has adapted well in the shift from desktop to   mobile devices. It's this core business that's driven the   incredible cash flow machine you can see in the chart below.GOOG Free Cash Flow (TTM)data byYCharts.If free cash flow grows anywhere near the level you see above
column35: Alphabet could easily pay a 5% dividend yield by 2020. And that's   just from cash flow and doesn't include the cash pile it's   already sitting on.What makes Alphabet a potentially great dividend stock for the   2020s is the company's constant innovation. Whether it's   artificial intelligence
column36: self-driving cars
column37: or virtual reality
column38: it is constantly on the forefront. And with a cash flow machine   at the core of the business and multiple growth opportunities in   the lab
column39: Alphabet will be generating enough money to pay a   dividend for a long time to come.10 stocks we like better than QualcommWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column40: it can pay to listen. After all
column41: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade
column42: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column43: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Qualcomm wasn't one of     them! That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even     better buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of April 3

column1: Why Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Is a Likely Short After Earnings;4/26/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) will report its quarterly earnings on Thursday
column3: April 27
column4: so today we'll be looking at the setup in MSFT stock.makeArticleAd();But I should point out that Thursday is a major day for large-cap tech earnings
column5: and arguably for the near- to intermediate-term direction of theNasdaq-100. In addition to Microsoft
column6: Alphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL)
column7: Amazon.com
column8: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN)
column9: Baidu Inc (ADR)(NASDAQ:BIDU)
column10: Expedia Inc(NASDAQ:EXPE) andIntel Corporation(NASDAQ:INTC) are among the many big-tech firms dropping quarterly results after Thursday's bell.But I want to focus on Microsoft
column11: because given the most recent multiday rally in MSFT stock to the top end of its trading channel
column12: the Q3 earnings report and outlook could turn out to be an important ""show and tell"" event - and provide ample opportunities for traders to pounce on.Before looking at the trading opportunity
column13: let's get some perspective. Microsoft shares make up about 8% of the Nasdaq-100
column14: which frequently is represented by thePowerShares QQQ Trust
column15: Series 1(ETF)(NASDAQ:QQQ). Amazon
column16: Alphabet
column17: Intel and Microsoft together make up about a quarter of the index.While it is entirely possible that given these companies' different businesses
column18: their respective stock reactions to earnings could cancel each other out and thus lead to little movement for the Nasdaq-100
column19: we at least have to consider what will happen if they trade in sync come Friday morning. Such a scenario could lead to a chart-altering move
column20: and also likely jostle the broader U.S. stock market.MSFT Stock ChartsWhen I last discussed Microsoft on Jan. 24 - two days before its last earnings repor t- O offered that should the stock be able to overcome the $63.50 area
column21: this could open upside toward $65-$66. Sure enough
column22: MSFT popped after the Jan. 26 earnings report
column23: and the $66 price target was reached within one day.3 Stocks to Sell Before They're Crushed by EarningsHowever
column24: this area then acted as technical resistance â€¦ until Friday
column25: April 21
column26: anyway.On the multiyear weekly chart
column27: we see that MSFT stock continues to grind higher and trade well above its 50-
column28: 100- and 200-week simple moving averages (yellow
column29: blue and red lines
column30: respectively).Click to EnlargeWe also see that according to the MACD oscillator at the bottom of the chart
column31: momentum thus far in 2017 is making a lower high versus the 2016 momentum highs.I personally won't assign too much credibility to this indicator alone. However
column32: it is worth noting that MSFT stock is once again trading at the very upper end of the diagonal resistance line (upper purple-dotted line).On the daily chart
column33: we see that on Friday
column34: April 21
column35: Microsoft stock finally managed to break past the $66 area and thus also past horizontal resistance. Over the past five trading days
column36: this has now amounted to about a 5% rally
column37: which is taking place just as Microsoft is set to report earnings on Thursday.Click to EnlargeWhile anything is possible
column38: it's my experience that such rallies into earnings tend not to lead to sustainable rallies - even if the stock were to gap and rally higher following the earnings report.3 Stocks to Watch on Wednesday: Twitter Inc (TWTR)
column39: Chipotle Mexican Grill
column40: Inc. (CMG) and United States Steel Corporation (X)From a trading perspective
column41: any post-earnings rally followed by a daily close well off the intraday highs would provide an opportunity to either short MSFT stock outright or sell out-of-the-money call spreads for income. The 50-day simple moving average (yellow) would become a first downside target. That line currently hovers around the $65 mark.Should MSFT stock gap and trade lower after earnings
column42: you could assume a similar posture - as long as the stock closes near its daily low this Friday. But this situation would warrant a more cautious stance.Like what you see? column1: Microsoft Stock: 3 Different Bear Cases You Haven't Thought Of;4/25/2017;"The shift to the cloud has treatedMicrosoft(NASDAQ: MSFT) well
column2: and though the ubiquity of its software   means it is still a force to be reckoned with in personal   computers
column3: there's now so much more to this tech giant
column4: and   arguably
column5: it's a lot more important.Yet as much of a tear as Microsoft has been on -- and not just   the past year
column6: but the past five years
column7: really -- there's good   reason to be mindful that there's always downside risk to a   stock. So
column8: while there are some very well-worn cautions out there   about the company and its shares
column9: we asked three Motley Fool   contributors to each share a bear case for Microsoft you might   not have thought about.Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();The cloud may not be as profitable as you thinkTim Green(Commoditization of cloud infrastructure):Microsoft
column10: along withAmazon(NASDAQ: AMZN)
column11: Alphabet's Google
column12: and others
column13: are pouring money into building massive   cloud data centers.Gartnerexpects the infrastructure-as-a-service market
column14: currently led by   Amazon
column15: to grow by nearly 37% this year
column16: to $34.6 billion.Cloud computing is more complicated than just IaaS
column17: where   virtual servers and storage are rented. Platform-as-a-service   provides an environment to develop applications without having to   manage the underlying infrastructure
column18: and the various cloud   platforms offer differentiated sets of tools and features. But   IaaS is essentially a commodity. A virtual server from Amazon is   essentially the same as a virtual server from Microsoft. 100GB of   cloud storage from Amazon is the same as 100GB of cloud storage   from Microsoft.Demand for IaaS is growing so quickly that the major providers   are capable of producing some impressive profits. Amazon's AWS   managed a segment operating margin of 25% during 2016
column19: for   example. But as the market matures
column20: competition will get fiercer
column21: and that means even more aggressive price-cutting than we've   already seen. This market will ultimately be governed by supply   and demand
column22: and once demand is no longer outpacing supply
column23: it's   hard to imagine those lofty profit margins holding up.For Microsoft
column24: this means that at least some of the billions   it is pouring into its cloud business may ultimately earn   lackluster returns -- far lower than its traditional software   business. Investors may not be taking that risk into account.Image source: Getty Images.A disruptive new gaming modelSteve Symington(The rise of ""console-free"" gaming):It's tempting to callSony's PlayStation 4 the biggest threat to Microsoft's gaming   business. After all
column25: Sony grew the number of PS4 units sold by   15.5% year over year last quarter
column26: to 9.7 million. Meanwhile
column27: Microsoft's gaming revenue declined 3% (down 1% at constant   currency)
column28: as lower Xbox console sales were only partially offset   by Xbox software and services revenue growth.However
column29: I think an even larger threat to both systems looms   with the impending rise of console-free gaming. TakeNVIDIA's(NASDAQ: NVDA) on-demand GRID Gaming as a Service (GaaS)   solution
column30: for example
column31: which NVIDIA boasts can afford gamers   ""freedom from the console"" with high-quality
column32: low-latency gaming   on any PC
column33: Mac
column34: smartphone
column35: tablet
column36: or TV. All you'll need is a   broadband internet connection. And because GRID renders the games   on NVIDIA's cloud servers
column37: then encodes each frame and streams it   to the device
column38: gamers won't be required to upgrade their local   hardware
column39: don't need physical discs
column40: and don't even need to   download or install the games they wish to play.To be fair
column41: Microsoft is certainly capable of launching a   streaming game service like this through its Azure cloud   computing platform. In fact
column42: some gamers have alreadyconfigured Azure instancesto stream their favorite AAA game titles
column43: ironically taking   advantage of Azure's access to NVIDIA's powerful M60 GPUs in the   process. If Microsoft went down this path
column44: though
column45: it would lose   the lucrative revenue stream it currently enjoys by selling Xbox   gaming console hardware.At the same time
column46: if it insists on sticking to its current   console-centric model -- something that seems likely given its   development of the next-generation Project Scorpio console --   Microsoft may be put in the difficult position of playing   catch-up as console-free gaming takes off in the coming   years.Image source: Getty Images.Pay nowandpay laterRich Duprey(More declining value assets):In the grand scheme of things
column47: Microsoft's acquisition of   LinkedIn for $26 billion last year
column48: while not chump change
column49: won't   break the tech giant's bank
column50: but it does serve to underscore what   it's getting right and what it's doing wrong -- and therein lies   some risk for the future.As a positive development
column51: it does confirm Microsoft's   commitment to the business sector and the potential nexus between   the social media platform
column52: its Office suite of products
column53: its CRM   Dynamics software application
column54: and the machine learning   capabilities of Azure. CEO Satya Nadella said as much a year ago
column55: when the deal was announced
column56: when he described a ""rich   information graph"" that would form by connecting the dots between   LinkedIn's 433 million users
column57: the 1.2 billion people using Office   products
column58: and the 300 million devices running Windows 10.   Hopefully
column59: all of the number-crunching will turn out something   useful.However
column60: Microsoft doesn't have an enviable track record when   it comes to making acquisitions. For example
column61: it ended up writing   off more in impairments and restructuring costs than the $9.4   billion it paid for Nokia. It also wrote off much of the $6.3   billion purchase price related to its acquisition of aQuantive in   2007
column62: and it's hard to say what it gained from the $8.5 billion   it spent on Skype
column63: or the $1.2 billion paid out for its other   foray into business social networking
column64: Yammer.LinkedIn's user growth was slowing before the purchase
column65: and   now that it's been rolled into Microsoft
column66: we don't get those   numbers anymore. But the idea that yet another asset with   declining value has been added to the portfolio is hard to   shake.In the first full quarter that the platform has been a part of   Microsoft
column67: it added $228 million in revenue
column68: but experienced a   loss of $100 million in net income. Time will tell whether it was   a smart move
column69: and most investors seem willing to be patient to   see how it works out
column70: but the tech leader's willingness to spend   a lot of money on ventures that don't pan out
column71: and often cost it   more in the end
column72: is a risk investors need to consider.10 stocks we like better than MicrosoftWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column73: it can pay to listen. After all
column74: the newsletter they have run for   over a decade
column75: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column76: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now...and Microsoft wasn't one of   them! That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even better   buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of April 3
column77: 2017.Suzanne Frey
column78: an executive at Alphabet
column79: is a member of The     Motley Fool's board of directors. Teresa Kersten is an employee     of LinkedIn and is a member of The Motley Fool's board of     directors. LinkedIn is owned by Microsoft.Rich Dupreyhas no position in any stocks mentioned.Steve Symingtonowns shares of Nvidia.Timothy Greenhas no position in any stocks mentioned. The Motley Fool owns     shares of and recommends Alphabet (A and C shares)
column80: Amazon
column81: Gartner
column82: and Nvidia. The Motley Fool has adisclosure policy."

column1: 3 Tech Stocks Leading the Charge Past Nasdaq 6
column2: 000;4/25/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsTheNasdaq Compositesurged past the 6
column4: 000 mark for the first time ever on Tuesday - hitting new highs for the first time since March - capping an epic gapped move higher. By gapped
column5: I mean that stocks jumped above the prior day's range at the open and then extended its rise during trading. And for ""chartists""
column6: that's a sign of serious
column7: intense buying pressure.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockThe surge puts a dramatic end to a quiet two-month downtrend as investors burned off some of their post-election ebullience in calm
column8: controlled fashion.Concerns focused on a lack of legislative progress from the Trump administration
column9: weakness in ""hard"" economic data points like retail sales
column10: a renewed decline in crude oil prices and geopolitical tension.While most of these remain in play - although President Trump is pushing hard on tax reform efforts this week - stocks had drifted enough that the situation was primed for a relief rally on any positive surprise catalyst. That was delivered on Sunday night after the first round of the French president election went as expected.10 Dividend Stocks That Will Deliver Double-Digit Returns Every YearWith that in mind
column11: here are three big tech stocks driving the charge higher:Tech Stocks to Buy: Microsoft Corporation(MSFT)Microsoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) shares are rising up and out of a four-month consolidation range near the $66-level
column12: popping to new highs. New leadership and a fresh focus on the cloud and changing to a software-as-a-service business model has helped MSFT nearly triple its share price from its 2013 lows.The company will next report results on April 27 after the close. Analysts are looking for earnings of 72 cents per share on revenues of $23.4 billion. RBC analysts are positive on MSFT shares as they see an improving server product cycle
column13: good commercial cloud margins and modestly better PC demand.Tech Stocks to Buy: Alphabet Inc(GOOGL)Alphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column14: NASDAQ:GOOGL) shares have pushed up and over its March high near $855 to push above $873.50 in trading Tuesday. This represents a near 70% rise form its summer 2015 high - an impressive run for a mature tech giant with diversified interests in everything from smartphone hardware and software to self-driving vehicle technology and virtual reality products.GOOGL has also successfully braved some advertiser losses from alleged ""hate channels"" on its YouTube platform.7 Healthcare Stocks With A-Rated ProspectsThe company will next report results on April 27 after the close. Analysts are looking for earnings of $7.57 per share of GOOGL on revenues of $19.7 billion.Tech Stocks to Buy: Facebook Inc(FB)Facebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) shares have ended a two-month sideways crawl with a big move to the upside
column15: pushing the stock up nearly 30% from its late December low. The company was in the news recently for launching its Camera Effects Platform
column16: which looks to make every smartphone camera enabled for augmented reality uses. FB stock was recently upgraded by analysts at Aegis Capital in anticipation of two big catalysts: New technology areas like VR/AR and messaging and the expectation of solid Q1 earnings.The company will next report results on May 3 after the close. Analysts are looking for earnings of $1.12 per share of FB on revenues of $7.8 billion.Anthony Mirhaydari is founder of theEdgeandEdge Proinvestment advisory newsletters. A two-week and four-week free trial offer has been extended to InvestorPlace readers.The post3 Tech Stocks Leading the Charge Past Nasdaq 6
column17: 000appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Nasdaq Crosses 6000 For The First Time Ever: What This Means For Investors;4/25/2017;"NasdaqThe Nasdaq Composite Index
column2: home to some of the world's largest technology and biotech companies
column3: reached a milestone Tuesday
column4: breaking for the 6
column5: 000 mark for the first time since its inception 46 years ago.What does 6
column6: 000 mean? Is it that different from
column7: say
column9: 780? Not really. But it presents an important moment of reflection. First and foremost is the obvious: We're in a bull market
column10: which has now lasted about eight years since the market bottomed in the first quarter of 2009 amid the Great Recession of 2008. Investors' confidence stems from the fact that corporate earnings are on the rise
column11: unemployment continues to fall
column12: the housing market is still booming
column13: and consumers (for the most part) are feeling somewhat better about their financial situation.makeArticleAd();All told
column14: Nasdaq 6
column15: 000 -- as with when the index reached its last milestone of 5
column16: 000 in March 2000 -- says investors are in full-fledged ""risk-on"" mode. But the ""risk"" this time is founded on sound fundamentals and conservative investment principals. The fact that Warren Buffett recently double-downed on his Apple (AAPL) position near 52-week highs and bought shares of Sirius XM (SIRI) at under $5 bucks underscores how far along the market has come since Nasdaq first reached 5
column17: 000 seventeen years ago.A lot has changed since then. In 2017
column18: compared to 2000
column19: corporate balance sheets are scrutinized more closely and
column20: unless your name is Amazon (AMZN) or Netflix (NFLX)
column21: P/E ratios matter more now than they did when XYZ.com and EIEIO.com were selling paper earnings. These days
column22: we can see strong revenue and profit growth from companies like Google (GOOGL) or with Facebook (FB) leading the charge.Investors have also learned a lot in seventeen years. That's the optimist side in me talking
column23: at least. I want to think we've learned since then. Besides Apple
column24: Amazon
column25: and Netflix
column26: this time the Nasdaq is also being driven by the resurgence of software giant Microsoft (MSFT)
column27: which -- thanks to its cloud transformation -- is operating on all cylinders.Ultimately
column28: Nasdaq 6
column29: 000 was reached thanks to products like social networking
column30: the iPhone
column31: the cloud
column32: online advertising
column33: breakthrough biotech innovation
column34: among other technologies. As with each milestone
column35: there's the obligatory question of: ""What's next?""Nasdaq 7
column36: 000 is a matter of ""when"" not ""if."" My crystal ball says it won't take seventeen years to gain 1
column37: 000 points. The milestone will likely be reached thanks to
column38: at least in part
column39: autonomous cars. And this puts names like Tesla (TSLA) in the drivers seat. In that vein
column40: another name investors should keep an eye on is Intel (INTC)
column41: which recently picked off Israeli self-driving technology company Mobileye (MBLY) for$15.3 billion.With innovative tech companies steering Nasdaq into the 21st century
column42: Tuesday's milestone is merely a checkpoint on the quest to help companies create
column43: or maximize
column44: their value."

column1: Google and PayPal Join Forces on Digital Payments;4/25/2017;"As smartphones rose to prominence
column2: one of the expected side   effects was increasing adoption of the digital wallet -- apps on   a smartphone designed to store credit card information and used   to facilitate mobile payments. Turns out that consumers are   creatures of habit and the rate of adoption has been slower than   expected. Consumers have become accustomed to swiping credit or   debit cards and aren't ready to switch just yet.A recent report byStatistarevealed that just 14% of U.S. consumers had used a mobile   payment to make a purchase in 2016
column3: though that number is   expected to grow to 18% in 2017 and to 37% by 2021. The   transaction value of these payments totaled $24 billion in the   U.S. last year.PayPal joins forces with Google in the digital wallet. Image     source: PayPal.makeArticleAd();Rivals become partnersSeeking to get their share of this nascent opportunity
column4: PayPal Holdings
column5: Inc.(NASDAQ: PYPL) andAlphabet Inc.'s(NASDAQ: GOOGL) (NASDAQ: GOOG)  Google are joining forces.   The partnership will allow users to link their PayPal account to   Android Pay
column6: Google's mobile payments platform. The companies are   expanding on a collaboration that started nearly three years ago
column7: with PayPal being added as a payment option for Google Play
column8: the   company's online app store.Consumers upload their credit card information into a digital   wallet app in their phone
column9: which allows users to pass their   smartphone over a terminal equipped with near-field   communications technology rather than swiping or inserting their   credit card. These mobile payment systems use one-time-only   codes
column10: rather than the card number
column11: making them a more secure   form of payment. Ironically
column12: worries about personal data and fear   of fraud are the most cited reasons among consumers who have not   yet used mobile payments
column13: according to Statista.Image source: Google.Expanding its footprintPayPal
column14: whose service got its start as a secure payment option   on websites
column15: has been partnering with a growing number of   companies to expand its footprint. Over the past year
column16: PayPal has   announced deals with major credit card processorsVisa Inc.
column17: Mastercard Incorporated
column18: and most recentlyDiscover Financial Services
column19: along with a host of other providers. PayPal believes that by   partnering with other companies it will provide more choices to   consumers.Google is hoping to increase adoption of its mobile-payment   service
column20: which has been lagging competitorApple
column21: Inc.(NASDAQ: AAPL) in the digital-wallet space. Statista reports that   while 12% of consumers have used Apple Pay for a transaction
column22: only 9% have used Android pay
column23: and 6% have usedSamsung(NASDAQOTH: SSNLF) Pay
column24: the other major smartphone-based mobile   wallet. The principal reason for its lead is availability. Apple   Pay is accepted at 36% of U.S. merchants
column25: followed by Android Pay   at 24%
column26: and Samsung Pay at third with 18%.Coffee to goStarbucks Corporation(NASDAQ: SBUX) boasts one of the most popular store-only mobile   payments. The company launched its app in 2011
column27: one of the first   such hybrid programs joining a mobile-payment app with a   customer-loyalty program. Statista reports that mobile payments   accounted for 25% of all Starbucks' transactions in the United   States. The coffee purveyor has taken things a step further with   its Mobile Order & Pay program
column28: by allowing customers to   order and pay in advance and pick up their purchase without   waiting in a register line. Starbucks recently announced the   opening of a location at the company's Seattle headquarters that   will only accept ordering and payments via mobile.Beginning of a trendWe are still early in the adoption cycle
column29: and as digital   wallet technology becomes more pervasive
column30: companies are vying for   their share of the proceeds. These transactions are expected to   grow at a rate of 52% annually to $866 billion by 2021. The   digital payment space is highly fragmented
column31: with a host of   options available to consumers. These partnerships and innovative   solutions are only the beginning of a trend that will be years in   the making.10 stocks we like better than Alphabet (A   shares)When investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column32: it can pay to listen. After all
column33: the newsletter they have run for   over a decade
column34: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column35: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Alphabet (A shares) wasn't   one of them! That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even   better buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of April 3

column1: Will Alphabet (GOOGL) Surprise Investors in Q1 Earnings?;4/25/2017;"Alphabet Inc.GOOGLwill report first-quarter 2017 earnings on Jan 27 after the bell.The surprise history has been decent in Alphabet's case. The company missed estimates twice in the last four quarters but has an average four-quarter positive surprise of 2.71%.Coming to the price performance
column2: over the past one year
column3: shares of Alphabet steadily treaded higher. The stock returned 18.4% compared with the Zacks categorizedInternet Servicesindustry's gain of 11.3%.What Happened in the Last Reported Quarter?Alphabet's fourth-quarter earnings missed the Zacks Consensus Estimate due to higher taxes. However
column4: revenues grew year over year
column5: driven primarily by the boom in Mobile Search
column6: with the ongoing strength in YouTube. Also
column7: strength in programmatic advertising and Play aided revenue growth.Factors at Play in Q1The main drivers of the Google business haven't changed. Pricing remains under pressure
column8: both on account of the ongoing FX concerns as well as continued strength in mobile and TrueView. Volumes are however encouraging as total paid click grew a reassuring 36% last quarter.Google has gained strength in the mobile platform. Management is focused on driving mobile experiences and the company is well positioned to pick up strong intent-to-buy signals as a result of studying mobile searches from its huge database. As a result
column9: revenue from mobile platform is expected to increase in the to-be-reported quarter.YouTube remains a strong contributor benefiting from the increase in online video consumption. More than a thousand creators are currently engaged with the platform
column10: bringing in a thousand subscribers every day.Also
column11: Google has turned more aggressive in the commercialization of its self-driving cars. It aims to expand its revenues from this segment in the to-be-reported quarter. However
column12: the current regulatory environment doesn't support fully automated cars
column13: so there could be some hurdles on the way.Google's cloud business trails Amazon's AWS
column14: Microsoft's Azure and IBM. The company's cloud business is expected to do well in the to-be reported quarter. And finally
column15: Google platforms like Android
column16: Chrome and Daydream continue to help it draw more users and sell more ads.On a cautionary note
column17: Google's troubles in the EU are mounting. Despite its attempts to appease authorities by investing in the region
column18: EU may prove much more expensive for the company. Google is not providing for this outflow
column19: which could mean that it still has a reasonable chance of coming out victorious. But the developments are worth keeping an eye on as these are the main reasons for the overhang on the company's shares.Earnings WhispersOur proven model does not show that Alphabet will beat on earnings this third quarter. This is because a stock needs to have both a positiveEarnings ESPand a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy)

column1: Amazon's Alexa Just Took Another Step Toward World Domination;4/25/2017;"As the science of artificial intelligence (AI) becomes more   advanced and deeply ingrained in our daily lives
column2: society gets   closer to some of the iconic examples of AI from science fiction.Star Trekfans will remember the captain using a voice command to   engage the ship's mainframe on the StarshipEnterprisesimply by saying ""Computer.""Amazon.com
column3: Inc.(NASDAQ: AMZN) recently added a new wake word to its   Alexa-enabled Echo and Echo Dot smart speaker system
column4: which   amused and delighted fans of the pop-culture phenomenon. Now all   thoseStar Trekfans will be able to engage with the digital assistant by saying   ""Computer."" It's a fitting tribute
column5: as theStar Trekcomputer was the inspiration for the development of Amazon's   voice-controlled digital assistant. While this Easter egg may   have thrilled sci fi fans
column6: developers were elated to find that   Amazon is once again opening up Echo's technology to third-party   developers.Echo far-field voice recognition technology will be     available to outside developers. Image source: Amazon.com
column7: Inc.makeArticleAd();Far-field voice recognitionOne of the innovations that has made the Echo so successful is   the far-field voice-recognition capabilities of the smart   speaker. The seven-microphone circular array combines a number of   technologies
column8: including beamforming
column9: noise reduction
column10: echo   cancellation
column11: and voice processing
column12: which allows the Echo to hear   commands across a crowded room.As part of Amazon's vision for Alexa to be everywhere
column13: the   company is providing exclusive
column14: invitation-only access to the   technology behind its microphone array and voice processing and   will allow third-party device makers to incorporate Echo's   know-how into their own products. Through the Alexa Voice Service   Program
column15: Amazon is offering a hardware reference package that   bundles the technology for use by partners and not charging for   the privilege.Amazon's advantageIf you think altruism is behind this gesture
column16: think again.   Consumers are able to access Amazon's music streaming service and   make purchases on the e-commerce website using Alexa voice   commands. Amazon also benefits by having the technology accessed   by as many consumers as possible
column17: as its AI-based voice   recognition technology improves the more it is used.This isn't the first time Amazon has permitted the embedding   of Alexa technology into other manufacturers' products. The   company worked with a number of hardware developers beginning in   June 2015 and has more than 40 partners
column18: with products from   speakers to smartwatches
column19: and from cars to refrigerators.Alexa in the cloudAmazon is also pursuing other avenues to make its voice   service ubiquitous. The company just announced that it will make   this technology available to its cloud-computing customers.   Amazon Web Services (AWS) the company's cloud-computing service
column20: will provide access to Amazon Lex
column21: Alexa's AWS alter-ego
column22: to   create their own chat bots. These artificially intelligent   software programs provide verbal or text interactions with   consumers in a way that is designed to emulate a human being and   are seen quite often in a messaging context.Google Home directly competes with Echo. Image source:     Google.No phone to call her ownAmazon has been at a disadvantage in the virtual-assistant   market
column23: having missed out on the opportunity in mobile
column24: as Alexa   doesn't have a phone to call her own
column25: likeApple
column26: Inc.'s(NASDAQ: AAPL) Siri andAlphabet Inc.'s(NASDAQ: GOOGL) (NASDAQ: GOOG) Google Assistant. This is the   latest in a number of moves designed to establish a beachhead in   the area of voice control. The company hopes to achieve an   insurmountable installed base of devices to fend off competition   from these other virtual assistants.Google's release of the Home smart speaker is the first direct   competitor to the Echo
column27: and Google has the advantage of its   massive search capabilities and a foundation of millions of   Android-based smartphones. While Apple hasn't announced its   intention to produce a smart speaker
column28: there have been unconfirmed   reports that one is in development. Apple is known for coming   late to market with a superior product and stealing market share
column29: so it could take the same approach here.Meanwhile
column30: the company has been hard at work integrating Siri   across the breadth of Apple's devices. Not only can Siri be   accessed on Apple's flagship iPhones
column31: but it has also been   enabled on the iMac
column32: MacBook Pro
column33: and MacBook Air. In another   moved designed to make Siri omnipresent
column34: users can access her by   giving two taps on one of Apple's branded AirPods.Amazon has the edge -- for nowAmazon's advantage rests not only in being first to market   with its device
column35: but also in the multitude of Alexa commands or   skills
column36: numbering over 10
column37: 000. RBC Capital Market's Mark Mahaney   and Jim Shaughnessy estimate that 17% of consumers have ordered   products from Amazon's website using their Alexa-based device
column38: which could result in an additional $10 billion in sales annually   by 2020. Add to that an ever-increasing installed base of   Alexa-enabled devices
column39: and Amazon is one step closer to world   domination.10 stocks we like better than AmazonWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column40: it can pay to listen. After all
column41: the newsletter they have run for   over a decade

column43: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Amazon wasn't one of them!   That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even better   buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of April 3

column1: America's 12 Most Charitable Companies;4/25/2017;"Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();Whether through cash donations or through providing their   products and services free of charge to people and nonprofits in   need
column2: corporations across America are making billions of dollars'   worth of charitable donations each year. Here's the list of the   nation's 12 most charitable companies
column3: according toThe Chronicle of Philanthropy'smid-2016 report(registration required)
column4: along with some of the causes   these companies are giving to.Image source: ExxonMobil.12. ExxonMobilFirst up is the oil and gas behemothExxonMobil(NYSE: XOM)
column5: which gave more than a quarter of a billion dollars   in 2015 alone (the most recent year for which data is available).   The company has spread its donation efforts across various areas
column6: from education to global health initiatives to malaria   prevention. ExxonMobil also has a program to donate $500 on   behalf of an employee for every 20 hours the employee   volunteers.Goldman Sachs employees volunteering in Bangalore in 2016.     Image source: Goldman Sachs.11. Goldman SachsInvestments banks are driven solely by greed
column7: and they only   care about lining executives' pockets -- right? That's the image   of big banks that's often played up in the media

column9: a donor-advised fund
column10: has given more than $1 billion in   grants to thousands of nonprofits in 80 countries worldwide.A community knowledge center in Kenya. Image source: Cisco     Systems.10. Cisco SystemsCisco Systems(NASDAQ: CSCO) is already using its data and cloud computing   technology to help develop ""smart cities"" around the world in   places like Copenhagen
column11: Denmark. But the company also uses its   funding and technology to build ""Community Knowledge Centers"" in   areas that lack internet access
column12: such as in Kenya
column13: as shown in   the image above. These centers allow local residents to connect   to online resources such as skills training. Cisco's management   believes investments like these are critical to ending the cycle   of poverty in these areas.Image source: Wells Fargo.9. Wells FargoWhileWells Fargo(NYSE: WFC) has certainly come under public scrutiny over its   problematic account-selling tactics in the last few months
column14: the   company has long been regarded as one of the most charitable   for-profit organizations in the U.S. Wells Fargo supports   hundreds of local nonprofits in the cities where it operates
column15: as   well as large national nonprofits that are involved in financial   education and much more. Wells Fargo management announced its   2020 economic goals last year
column16: and they include $500 million in   philanthropic spending by 2020.Image source: Eli Lilly.8. Eli Lilly and CompanyEli Lilly(NYSE: LLY) is the maker of important pharmaceutical products   like Prozac and insulin. It's also the parent of the Eli Lilly   Foundation
column17: which awards grants for philanthropic   initiatives in the areas of quality healthcare in low- and   middle-income countries
column18: as well as public education in the   United States
column19: with an emphasis on science and math. The   foundation also matches millions of dollars' worth of employee   donations each year.Image source: Bristol-Myers Squibb.7. Bristol-Myers SquibbHealthcare companyBristol-Myers Squibb(NYSE: BMY) says on its website that it seeks ""to improve   the health outcomes of populations disproportionately affected by   serious diseases"" through increasing healthcare worker capacity   and integrated medical care. The company recently announced a $50   million donation (matched with another $50 million from other   donors) in a new public-private partnership with the   government of Botswana to treat children with cancer and blood   disorders.Microsoft employee Prashant Gupta in India. Image source:     Microsoft.6. MicrosoftMicrosoft(NASDAQ: MSFT) founder Bill Gates is not only one of the   wealthiest people in the world
column20: but also one of the most   charitable -- he's the co-founder of the Bill and Melinda Gates   Foundation
column21: which has donated tens of billions toward the cause   of improving healthcare and relieving poverty around the world.   Microsoft seems to hold similar values
column22: as the company notes that   it donates nearly $2 million per day in cash and equipment. Its   philosophy is that technology can help humankind overcome some of   the greatest challenges it faces. In the image above
column23: a Microsoft   employee helps farmers in India use technology to better time   their crops during a drought.Google Cardboard headset being used to help veterans     virtually attend a Veterans Day Parade. Image source:     Google.org.5. AlphabetAlphabet's(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL)  philanthropic efforts   include donating its own services -- for example
column24: it gives   nonprofits free access to Google Adwords for advertising
column25: and   trains military veterans to learn new technologies as they   transition to civilian jobs. The company also launches bold   technological ventures that are meant to take dramatic steps   toward solving the world's problems. For instance
column26: the company   provides funding and expertise to groups that can use the Google   Earth tool to fight global deforestation.Image source: Wal-mart.4. WalmartWal-Mart(NYSE: WMT) is the world's largest retailer by sales
column27: and it also   holds the spot as the largest donor in the retail industry. The   company gives cash and product donations to nonprofits working on   labor benefits
column28: food for those in need
column29: and much more. The   company also sends aid to communities in the U.S. that are   affected by natural disasters. In December it gave $250
column30: 000   toward relief and recovery efforts in areas of Tennessee that   were being ravaged by wildfires.Image source: Merck & Company.3. Merck & CompanyMerck & Co.

column33: particularly within the communities   where the company operates. It also aids in global initiatives to   take on cancer
column34: diabetes
column35: hepatitis C
column36: and HIV/AIDS. The   company notes on its website that it donated $1.7 billion worth   of products in 2015 alone.Image source: Getty Images.2. Gilead SciencesThe second-largest corporate donor as of 2016 isGilead Sciences(NASDAQ: GILD) . Gilead is one of the leaders in HIV/AIDS   pharmaceuticals. Its products include a medication called   Truvada
column37: a form of pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) that blocks   the virus from spreading between individuals. The company's top   philanthropic priority is ending the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and   making life-saving healthcare accessible in areas of need.Image source: Pfizer.1. column1: These 3 Tech Giants Are More Involved in Gaming Than You Think;4/24/2017;"Video games don't get the headlines for technology giants likeFacebook(NASDAQ: FB)
column2: Alphabet(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL)
column3: andAmazon.com(NASDAQ: AMZN)
column4: but make no mistake -- these companies are   aggressively competing to control a meaningful share of the $100   billion video game industry.The video game industry is growing about 6% per year
column5: with   mobile gaming serving as one of the key drivers of that growth.   In addition to mobile gaming
column6: two new markets -- e-sports and   virtual reality (VR) -- are small but growing fast.IMAGE SOURCE: PIXABAY.makeArticleAd();Game developers need the cloudPeople are beginning to spend as much time playing games as   they do on social media or on streaming services likeNetflix. One reason is that technology advancements on smartphones and   tablets are gradually making mobile games more complex
column7: like   console or PC games. But
column8: this growth in mobile gaming is placing   a burden on game developers without the expertise to provide   online infrastructure that can support the huge spikes in usage   when new updates or content are released for a particular   game.Developers are turning to cloud solutions to split the   processing burden of a game between cloud servers and the mobile   device. The results: a much smoother gaming experience for the   player
column9: and more demand for cloud providers such as Alphabet's   Google Cloud Platform andAmazon Web Services.The mobile gaming market generated nearly 40% of the total   video game industry's revenue in 2016
column10: and revenue from mobile   gaming increased 18% in 2016
column11: to about $40 billion. Mobile is   expected to be a key driver of the industry's growth for the   foreseeable future.E-sportsThe concept of someone paying to go to a venue to watch others   compete in a video game might seem strange to most
column12: but this is a   $1 billion market that isgrowing fast.The global e-sports audience is estimated to be 385 million   and could grow to 500 million by 2020
column13: according to Newzoo.   Because the great majority of e-sports fans watch competitions   online
column14: the e-sports opportunity plays right into the hands of   companies like Alphabet and Facebook that already have social   platforms in place to connect people with content.Amazon
column15: however
column16: took a big step ahead when it acquired   Twitch.tv for $970 million in 2014. Twitch is a platform where   users can live-stream their PC games to other gaming enthusiasts
column17: and it has a staggering 100 million monthly viewers. The   game streaming site also broadcasts e-sports tournaments around   the world. Competition between Twitch and Alphabet's YouTube has   become tense lately. Through 2016
column18: Twitch had an important   partnership with ESL -- the world's largest e-sports company --   to broadcast e-sports events. However
column19: ESL recently moved   exclusively to YouTube
column20: a sign that YouTube is gaining ground on   Twitch.And then there's Facebook
column21: with its network of 1.2 billion   daily users. There's no doubt Facebook could be a sleeping giant   in e-sports viewing
column22: but it has a ways to go to catch up to its   competitors. Unlike Twitch and YouTube
column23: Facebook has no dedicated   streaming page for gaming.The social-media giant is making progress with its recent   release of the Facebook Live video feature for computers
column24: after   only being available on its mobile app. This will allow gamers to   stream live gameplay to followers
column25: but it lacks the monetization   features provided by Twitch and YouTube for popular game   streamers.Virtual RealityWhile Facebook is trailing YouTube and Twitch in e-sports
column26: Facebook is investing heavily in VR
column27: which is expected to become   a $45 billion market by 2025
column28: according to Grand View Research.   The social-media giant purchased Oculus -- the maker of the Rift   headset -- for $2 billion in 2014.Oculus
column29: Alphabet
column30: Sony
column31: Samsung Electronics
column32: andHTCall shipped VR headsets in 2016
column33: and the combined results appear   to have fallen below expectations
column34: but that really depends on who   you talk to.Company executives likeNVIDIACEO Jensen Huang and Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg expressed   satisfaction with the first year of the VR market. NVIDIA   develops the powerful graphics processors that help gamers play   the more graphically intense VR games. Jensen Huang recently told   analysts on a conference call:The first year of VR has sold several hundred thousand     units.The early VR is really targeted at early adopters. And I     think the focus of ensuring an excellent experience that     surprises people ... has really been a good focus ... I think     the first year was absolutely a great success.Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg
column35: on a recent conference call
column36: made it clear that Oculus would probably not be profitable for   quite some time
column37: as the company continues to invest in VR   development:I don't think that there is really a strategy to pull this     in from ten years to five ... I would ask for the patience of     the investor community in doing that
column38: because we're going to     invest a lot in this
column39: and it's not going to return or be really     profitable for us for quite a while.The technology promises not only to deliver a new immersive   gaming experiences
column40: but also to change the way people communicate   with each other. However
column41: it's not likely to catch for a while
column42: at least until headsets get cheaper.The video game industry has a solid ecosystemThe video game industry isdoing wellon its own
column43: with the investment put into it by game publishers   likeActivision BlizzardandElectronic Arts. But social-media giants and Amazon committing resources to the   industry is a great sign for the future of gaming.10 stocks we like better than Alphabet (A     shares)When investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: Nasdaq Hits Record High on French Election Results;4/24/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsU.S. equities bounded higher on Monday in response to the ""as expected"" French election result on Sunday night. The result was the largest one-day gain since March 1 - breaking stocks out of their recent funk.makeArticleAd();In the end
column3: theDow Jones Industrial Averagegained 1.1%
column4: theS&P 500gained 1.1%
column5: theNasdaq Compositegained 1.2% and theRussell 2000gained 1.3%. Treasury bonds finished lower
column6: the dollar was down
column7: gold lost 0.9% and crude oil fell 0.8% despite increases expectations of an extension of the OPEC supply freeze agreement from late last year.Financials led the way with a 2.2% gain while yield-sensitives including REITs and telecoms finished lower. Real estate names lost 0.9%. Breadth was solidly positive
column8: with 2.5 advancers for every decliner. NYSE volume totaled 907 million shares
column9: 112% of the 30-day average.AK Steel Holding Corporation(NYSE:AKS) gained 6% on an upgrade to overweight from analysts at Macquarie on expected improvements in earnings on improving steel market demand.Hasbro
column10: Inc.(NASDAQ:HAS) gained 5.9% on a Q1 earnings and revenue beat. AndWhole Foods Market
column11: Inc.(NASDAQ:WFM) gained 2.1% after the FT reported Albertson's could be exploring a takeover.7 Blue-Chip Stocks Every Investor Should OwnWayfair Inc(NYSE:W) lost 5.4% afterAmazon.com
column12: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) representatives reportedly told members of the Furniture Marketing Group of plans to a launch a new furniture sellers program.Turning to the French election
column13: the victory of centrist Macron and anti-globalist Le Pen in the first round of the presidential election diminished concerns of a ""Frexit"" and increased confidence in Europe's economic recovery. The runoff vote will be held on May 7.Here at home
column14: the ""Trumpflation"" trade is getting another lift on reports President Trump is refocusing on tax cut efforts reportedly telling advisors to prioritize rate reductions over deficit concerns. A plan will reportedly be unveiled on Wednesday. The specter of a government shutdown on April 28 also appears to be fading somewhat
column15: with the consensus view that a short-term bill covering one to two weeks is likely to be passed to facilitate long-term negotiations between Democrats and Republicans.Anthony Mirhaydari is founder of theEdgeandEdge Proinvestment advisory newsletters. It Always Does.The postNasdaq Hits Record High on French Election Resultsappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: 3 IPOs to Watch For This Week;4/24/2017;"The last week of April is scheduled to seeeightdifferent companies go public
column2: and Zacks has you covered with three unique IPO offerings to watch out for.The wide-ranging list of companies set to go public this week will help contribute to an already booming 2017 for the IPO world. Since Jan. 1
column3: 36 IPOs have been priced in the U.S.-not including this week's offerings-which is up around177% year-over-year.These three IPOs cover finance
column4: big data
column5: and biopharmaceuticals. Check them out:China Rapid FinanceThe Shanghai
column6: China-based online credit company
column7: China Rapid Finance Ltd.
column8: is China's largest online consumer lending marketplace. China Rapid Finance has tapped into the company's massive and growing middle class
column9: which is estimated to be over 500 million people. Many of these people normally don't have access to bank credit.China Rapid Finance targets individuals online and through mobile devices who have quality employment records but no credit history. The company refers to these people as ""Emerging Middle class Mobile Active."" China Rapid Finance is a massive online consumer credit marketplace that makes its money from recurring transaction and service fees from both borrowers and investors. According to the company
column10: China is the world's largest untapped consumer credit market
column11: and it is expected to grow into an $870 billion market by 2020.The company uses algorithms and metrics in its mostly-automated system of finding credit-worthy individuals online. China Rapid Finance's typical consumption-based loans are normally worth less than $865 for 3-month terms. However
column12: the company does offer up to $14
column13: 400 ""Lifestyle"" loans
column14: which require greater screening.Before starting China Rapid Finance
column15: its founder
column16: chairman
column17: and CEO Dr. Zane Wang served as the head of analytics for Sears Holdings Corp.'sSHLDcredit cards services and advised the People's Bank of China on the creation of a national credit bureau.China Rapid Finance is set to offer 10 million shares at an expected price range of $9.50 to $11.50 per share
column18: raising $105 million in the process. The company is scheduled to officially price on Wednesday in order to start trading on the New York Stock Exchange on Thursday. column21: built on Apache Hadoop and latest open source technologies.""The big data company works with companies to integrate both structured and unstructured data by utilizing CDH
column22: its 100% open source distribution. CDH includes Apache Hadoop
column23: which is used to help distribute

column25: and process massive amounts of data by breaking it up into more manageable pieces. Cloudera's offerings are aimed to be large and scalable across huge organizations.The company's current client list includes the likes of FacebookFBand Alphabet Inc.'sGOOGL. Google.Former Google
column26: Yahoo! Inc.YHOO
column27: Oracle CorporationORCL

The company was a winner of the 2017 Cybersecurity Excellence Awards.Cloudera is set to offer 15 million shares at an expected price range of $12 to $14 in order to raise $195 million. The company's shares are set to officially price on Thursday with trading starting on the New York Stock Exchange on Friday. Cloudera will trade under the ticker symbol CLDR.Zymeworks Inc.Vancouver
column29: British Columbia-based Zymeworks Inc. is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company that develops protein therapeutics that help treat cancer

column33: development

column35: Zymeworks developed a proprietary protein modeling and structure-guided protein engineering system called ZymeCAD.ZymeCAD helps develop high-quality models of protein therapeutics' structure. It also tries to understand the effect of amino acid mutations on native protein
column36: as well as other important functions in an effort to help develop more successful treatments for cancer

column1: 7 Blue-Chip Stocks Every Investor Should Own;4/24/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsMy concept of blue-chip stocks is very different from that of most investors.makeArticleAd();Source:Poker Photos via Flickr (Modified)I think when most investors' minds wander to blue-chip stocks
column3: the old fogies come to mind - legacy Big Pharma and telecom companies
column4: beverage behemoths and consumer staples giants. I also think calling these stocks ""blue chips"" does a disservice to investors
column5: though.Most of these companies are well past their heyday. Most are low- to no-growth companies that pay out meager dividends. While you shouldn't necessarily expect breakneck growth from extremely large companies
column6: you also shouldn't settle for kibble.I typically view blue-chip stocks as companies that continue to grow earnings at 8% annually at more
column7: have tons of free cash flow
column8: lots of cash on hand
column9: and still are future-looking - not backward-looking.10 Dividend Stocks That Will Deliver Double-Digit Returns Every YearWith that in mind
column10: here are seven blue-chip stocks that deserve a spot in every long-term diversified portfolio.Blue-Chip Stocks Every Investor Should Own: Cardinal Health (CAH)Source:Via WikimediaI want to start out with a stock that doesn't get much play in lists of blue-chip stocks:Cardinal Health
column11: Inc.(NYSE:CAH). It's not small by any means
column12: at $22 billion in market cap - it's just not a first-to-mind name when it comes to big
column13: no-doubt stocks.That doesn't mean thishealthcare stockdoesn't belong.I like Cardinal Health because it deals in distribution
column14: not manufacturing. Distribution is where the money is. Corporations similar to CAH have both footprint and infrastructure
column15: and therefore can get their healthcare supplies to where they need to go for maximum profitability.Hence the reason I love distribution. Quality control isn't an issue. It's just about using an established network to get items where they need to go when they need to be there. And with a 24
column16: 000-pharmacy network to distribute to
column17: CAH has plenty of customers. Besides all forms of drugs
column18: it also takes care of logistics
column19: managing inventory and so on.Cardinal Health has been growing at 10% annually on average
column20: and is expected to do the same over the next five years. I also love that CAH generated more than $2.4 billion in free cash flow last year
column21: and only uses 20% of operating cash flow to pay its 2.5%-yielding dividend.Blue-Chip Stocks Every Investor Should Own: Apple (AAPL)Source:Beni Krausz via UnsplashNow
column22: let's move on to a blue-chip stock that typically makeseverylist of blue-chip stocks to buy:Apple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL).Apple is the premiere name in blue-chip stocks. The company has almost $250 billion in cash and investments. You can grouse about most of it being parked overseas
column23: but even ifApple never gets a big repatriation holiday courtesy of President Donald Trump
column24: that's still plenty of ammunition once taxes are taken out.Although Apple still generates the majority (60%-plus) of its revenues from its iPhone
column25: and that is a concern
column26: I get the feeling that shareholders are content with what Tim Cook is doing as a game manager. Maybe it's the fact that AAPL is up nearly 25% year-to-date. Maybe it's the fact that Apple is near all-time highs.8 Retail Stocks That Can Win Despite AmazonI'd like to see more vision
column27: but Apple stock has so much margin of safety that if you plan to own it for a long time
column28: you'll do fine - and you'll do even better ifCongress lowers the corporate tax rate to 15%.Blue-Chip Stocks Every Investor Should Own: Chevron (CVX)Source:swong95765 via Flickr (Modified)There are certain brands and companies - and even entire sectors - that are so intrinsic to human life that it's foolish not to invest in that arena.In this case
column29: oil still is a slam dunk.Yes
column30: alternative energy continues to creep forward
column31: but oil remains king
column32: and will for decades to come. And yes
column33: the oil market is always going to be volatile
column34: but that's exactly why big producers likeChevron Corporation(NYSE:CVX) are the place to be. They have the scale and cash flow to maintain flexibility and survive even the worst of times.Frankly
column35: any of thebig energy stocksare fine
column36: but for now
column37: I like Chevron's upside better than the others. It's loaded with cash
column38: it has been wise with its capex spending
column39: and it survived the oil downturn without having to touch its dividend (which
column40: by the way
column41: yields more than 4% right now).The past couple years haven't exactly been fun
column42: but CVX has survived. Now
column43: it's poised to recover anytime oil prices do.Blue-Chip Stocks Every Investor Should Own: Microsoft (MSFT)Source: ShutterstockMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) is another mainstay of blue-chip stock lists
column44: and it truly does belong there.That's because it offers safety - Microsoft sits on a cash hoard of some $130 billion
column45: and has insanely consistent free cash flow of $25 billion annually. It can even afford to pay out half of that as a dividend.And under Satya Nadella

column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsSamsung Electronics(OTCMKTS:SSNLF) faced a make-or-break moment with the release of its new flagship smartphone

column6: a very competitive Android flagship smartphone. Arch rivalApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL)
column7: too

column9: with a 10th anniversary iPhone 8 on the horizon.TheSamsung Galaxy S8is one of the biggest
column10: most anticipated smartphone releases of 2017. The question is
column11: does it live up to the hype?Galaxy S8 Review: Beating Apple to the PunchSamsung has traditionally launched its flagship Galaxy smartphones in the spring
column12: while Apple waits until fall for new iPhone releases. This year
column13: that order is going to have a very big impact.7 Healthcare Stocks With A-Rated ProspectsSamsung is springing an all-new
column14: futuristic design on the smartphone world. The Galaxy S8 is virtually bezel-free. It's Amoled display stretches from side to side
column15: and the Home button is banished to the back of the device
column16: minimizing the top and bottom bezels.This lets Samsung squeeze a 5.8-inch Infinity display in the Galaxy S8. The Galaxy S8+ features a whopping 6.2-inch display in a form factor roughly the size of Apple's 5.5-inch iPhone 7 Plus.The Galaxy s8 also features a glass back design and ups the biometric security ante by adding an iris scanner.All of this puts Samsung in the position of raining on Apple's parade this fall. 2017 is the 10th anniversary of the iPhone and Apple is expected to make a big splash withan iPhone 8 with an all-new designfeaturing a near bezel-free Amoled display
column17: glass back
column18: iris scanner and no physical Home button. Sound familiar?While Apple is rumored to be plotting a$1
column19: 000-plus price tag for the iPhone 8
column20: Samsung also took the risk of pricing the Galaxy S8 at a premium. At $749 (and $849 for the galaxy S8+)
column21: the Galaxy S8 costs $100 more than last year's Galaxy S7.Galaxy S8 Review: Two Flaws
column22: But One Will Get Better With TimeThe Galaxy S8 is big -without feeling too large- speedy
column23: and its display absolutely pops. The camera is the same as the Galaxy S7's and remains one of the best in the business. Unlike the iPhone 7
column24: the Samsung Galaxy S8 retains a headphone jack and it doesn't just come with a pair of disposable buds
column25: Samsung is offering $99 custom tuned pack-ins.But Samsung didn't get everything quite right.The fingerprint sensor is banished from the front. Unable to incorporate a scanner beneath the display
column26: Samsung banished it to the back. But in an unfortunate design choice
column27: the scanner is located right beside the camera lens. This has led to numerous complaints about smudgy photos.The second problem is Bixby
column28: Samsung's new AI-powered virtual assistant. The Galaxy S8 comes with a dedicated Bixby button
column29: but for the moment
column30: voice functionality is disabled. That puts Bixby at a huge disadvantage compared to Siri or Google Assistant. However
column31: in this case
column32: the flaw will get better with time. Samsung is aiming to offer Bixby voice support later this spring.Galaxy S8 Review: Specifications5.8-inch quad-HD Super Amoled Infinity Display (5.8-inches on Galaxy S8+)Qualcomm Inc.(NASDAQ:QCOM) Snapdragon 835 CPU with 4GB RAM64GB storage (expandable to with microSD cards up to 256GB capacity)12 MP f/1.7 rear camera with Dual Pixel sensor and optical image stabilizationIris and fingerprint scanners3000mAh or 3500mAh battery with fast charging and support for wireless charging802.11ac Dual band MU-MIMO Wi-Fi
column33: Bluetooth 5.0
column34: USB-C
column35: NFC
column36: ANT+Includes Bixby personal assistant with dedicated Bixby buttonIP 68 water and dust resistantSamsung Pay supportRuns Android 7 Nougat0.31 or 0.32-inches thick
column37: weighs 5.47 ounces or 6.10 ouncesMSRP $649 and $749Galaxy S8 Review: ConclusionWith the Samsung Galaxy S8 to deal with
column38: Apple and Google have their work cut out when they release their own new flagship smartphones this fall.Samsung has beaten them to the punch with a new design statement that's expected to become the industry standard much the way the iPhone 6 inspired several years worth of aluminum-backed
column39: rounded-corner clones. The 10th anniversary iPhone 8 in particular
column40: appears to have lost some bragging rights.More importantly for Samsung
column41: the Galaxy S8 gets a big monkey off its back. The new flagships shows that it can still build a beautiful
column42: powerful smartphone. And the flood of positive Galaxy S8 reviews are a good sign that it's finally been able to put the Galaxy Note 7 fiasco in the rear view mirror.Snap Inc (SNAP) Stock Is Finally Falling ApartAt the moment
column43: there's no real question about which smartphone is the best in the world. The next big question for Samsung is one we should know the answer for as launch sales numbers come in: are customers willing to pay a $100 premium over last year's Galaxy S7?As of this writing
