column1: Apple Inc. Wants to Make Recycled iPhones;4/20/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsApple(NASDAQ:AAPL) isn't just the world's most valuable company - it's well on its way to being the greenest as well.makeArticleAd();In the lead-up to Earth Day 2017
column3: Apple released its 2017 Environmental Sustainability progress report. The company continues to make progress in its goals
column4: including the use of renewable power for its own facilities as well as by its suppliers. And it added a lofty new pledge to the list: Apple says it is pursuing a ""closed-loop supply chain"" that would see it cease mining and instead build all of its products entirely from recycled materials.But it's still not big on having an iPhone last more than three years of practical life
column5: or having you fix it yourself.Apple Continues to Lead Green Technology CompaniesApple has built a reputation as a green technology company. In 2012
column6: it committed to transitioning to 100% renewable energy and has increasingly emphasized environmental sustainability in its products and packaging. In 2017
column7: Greenpeace named Applethe most environmentally friendly major technology company- a title it has held for three years straight.Other major tech players likeAlphabet Inc.(NASDAQ:GOOGL) andFacebookInc(NASDAQ:FB) score well in many areas
column8: but AAPL continues to lead the pack. The company released the 2017 update to its annual Environmental Sustainability report
column9: showing just how much progress it has made.Source: AppleApple wants to keep up its role as one of the planet's greenest tech companies.2017 Environmental Sustainability Progress ReportWith Earth Day coming this weekend
column10: Apple's progress report release was timely. It shows a company that continues to push green technology and environmental sustainability at a massive scale.The 10 Best Stocks to Buy for the Next DecadeTwo primary areas - transitioning partners onto renewable energy and the new goal of implementing a closed-loop supply chain - remain a work in progress. But otherwise
column11: the report shows the company continues to make great strides.Among the milestones achieved in the past year:100% of electricity used by Apple's data centers and 96% of power used by its facilities worldwide comes from renewable energy (primarily solar
column12: wind and hydro)Working with suppliers to bring 4 gigawatts of renewable energy online by 2020 (with around 750 megawatts currently operational and 2 gigawatts committed)99% of Apple packaging is recycled or responsibly sourced from sustainable forests (iPhone 7 boxes made from a mix of responsibly sourced paper
column13: bamboo and waste sugarcane)Use of laser-induced breakdown spectrometers to ensure materials used in products are safeMoving to a Closed-Loop Supply ChainRight now
column14: the biggest knock against technology companies like Apple is the massive mining operations needed to supply raw materials - aluminum
column15: copper
column16: lithium and other elements. Mines are an environmental nightmare
column17: they're dangerous for workers and they're often located in conflict regions.To solve this part of the equation
column18: Apple is now committing to a closed-loop supply chain. This means using high-quality recycled materials - and even harvesting components from old AAPL products - instead of mining.A recycled iPhone
column19: in other words.Source:Yanki01 via Flickr (Modified)Can Apple make a recycled iPhone?This goal is further in the future
column20: but it's something Apple says it is moving toward.What the companywon'tdo in the name of green technology is build an iPhone with an extended useful life
column21: or one that users can repair themselves instead of having to take it to an Apple Store.Apple's VP of Environment
column22: Policy and Social Initiatives gave an interviewwithViceto discuss the company's environmental sustainability initiatives. She talked up the closed-loop supply chain commitment
column23: noting that it would also let AAPL certify its products as being ""conflict-free.""Apple Inc. (AAPL) iPhone 8 Facing a Resurgent Samsung (SSNLF)However
column24: she stopped short at the idea of an iPhone having a useful life of beyond three years and deflected the proposal of designing smartphones so customers could undertake basic repairs (like replacing adead iPhone battery) by themselves.""I think trying to pretend that we can sort of make it easy to repair the product
column25: and that you get the product that you think you're buying - that you want - isn't the answer.""Son't expect iPhone owners to be able to swap out that cracked screen themselves any time soon. However
column26: Apple fans can take heart in the fact that they're buying from the world's most environmentally friendly tech company.And someday
column27: they will be able to buy a recycled iPhone
column28: thanks to Apple's new commitment to pursuing a closed-loop supply chain.As of this writing
column29: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceCommit to Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock With Zero Money DownApple Inc. Stock (AAPL) Price Target Upped...AgainApple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Is Officially Off the Investment PedestalThe postApple Inc. Wants to Make Recycled iPhonesappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Should You Buy Facebook Inc (FB) Stock? 3 Pros
column2: 3 Cons;4/20/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsInvestors that purchasedFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) stock at the post-IPO lows could be forgiven for thinking they are in Oculus' virtual reality universe. After all
column4: you don't get many chances to buy stocks that go up 7x in under five years. Anyone who believed in Zuckerberg's entrepreneurial skills has earned a great reward.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockBut
column5: as always
column6: Wall Street is a forward-looking mechanism. Is expensive FB stock still worth purchasing today
column7: or has its explosive growth phase run its course?According to the analysts
column8: Facebook has at least another five great years ahead. But don't overlook the potential pitfalls that could sink FB stock before then.FB Stock ConsExpensive Stock: Facebook stock is particularly expensive
column9: trading at more than 40 times earnings. There are plenty of reasons to be optimistic about FB's future. However
column10: valuation still matters
column11: regardless of how good the company's fundamentals may be.When you compare Facebook toAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column12: NASDAQ:GOOGL)
column13: it is hard to justify the stock's price. Alphabet is trading at 30 times earnings and has an equally compelling growth story
column14: at least in my view.7 Top Emerging Markets Stocks to Buy NowAging Userbase: A recentarticlecompiled evidence of FB's aging userbase. It's worth remembering that even teens who signed up with FB at the time of the initial iPhone launch are now in their mid-20s. A 2014 study found that more than half of 65-and-up aged persons had a Facebook account. That number has surely risen since then - and the majority of new users are older folks who already have many contacts using the company's online platform.Younger users
column15: by contrast
column16: are more likely to sign up for Instagram
column17: Snapchat
column18: Tumblr or other such alternatives. This isn't all bad news. FB obviously controls one of those. And younger users aren't nearly as valuable to advertisers as older ones; the advertising value of Facebook's core audience grows as users mature and obtain higher incomes. However
column19: to the extent that FB stock is valued as a way to play a younger audience
column20: it needs to have success with Instagram and other platforms aimed at teens as its core product is seen as increasingly stale.Virtual Reality Disappointment: Virtual reality is expected to be a huge market
column21: with some experts suggesting it will be a $30 billion opportunity by 2020. Much of the excitement around FB stock comes from its early mover role there. However
column22: recent signs out of Oculus Rift suggest reasons to be cautious.Facebook recently closed nearly half the Oculus pop-up stores withinBest Buy Co Inc(NYSE:BBY) stores due to poor customer demand. Oculus cut prices for both the Rift and the touch controller by $100 each.This could just be a bleeding-edge tech problem. The VR ecosystem simply isn't that big yet; once more products are introduced except customer demand to pick up. A few high-profile games could turn virtual reality's fortunes around. However
column23: to the extent VR is already baked into FB stock
column24: there is real risk of disappointment.FB Stock ProsNeutralizing Threats: Facebook stock faces a key threat. If people leave their platform
column25: the stock would collapse. Unlike say Alphabet
column26: which has many ways to reach customers with ads
column27: the social media company is more platform-dependent. One of the big bear points with Facebook is that younger people aren't nearly as excited about Facebook as older folks. FB stock bears will inevitably break out the MySpace analogy sooner or later.However
column28: Facebook has now shown that it is capable of deflecting threats from insurgent platforms. For a few years
column29: Twitter Inc(NYSE:TWTR) appeared to be a real threat. Hardly anyone thinks that anymore. Google Plus came and went with little effect. What it can't beat
column30: it can buy. FB's acquisitions of WhatsApp and Instagram
column31: both decried as expensive at the time
column32: have paid off in spades.Down Goes Snap: Expanding on that previous point
column33: Facebook has taken seemingly decisive steps to neutralize its latest rival. Shares ofSnap Inc(NYSE:SNAP) went public earlier this year with great fanfare. However
column34: SNAP stock hasn't performed well. From its opening print around $24
column35: it briefly traded higher but has sold off and now is struggling to hold the $20-mark. Why have investors turned on SNAP stock?In large part
column36: it's because FB is moving to crush Snap. The company recently decided to clone many of Snap's features within its Instagram Stories platform. That decision is paying off in spades. Instagram Moments has now passed the200 million usermark
column37: up 50 million already for the year. More importantly
column38: it makes Instagram Moments more popular than Snapchat
column39: which tallies only 161 million daily users. Remember
column40: Instagram Moments only launched last August and it has already overtaken Snapchat. While bears are right about Facebook's namesake platform showing its age
column41: don't underestimate the company's ability to compete for younger users with other services.Twenty-First Century Fox Inc (FOXA) Isn't a Factor Without Bill O'ReillyBig EPS Growth Ahead: Analysts have set high marks for FB stock. The consensus Street price target is $160.72. Even after the big run in Facebook stock
column42: $161 would represent a solid win from today's price.More impressively
column43: analysts expect earnings to grow 28% this year. Given the company's track record for smashing earnings estimates
column44: that represents a really good base level of growth
column45: which FB could well beat. Over the next five years
column46: analysts forecast earnings to grow at a 23% per year rate compounded. At that clip
column47: earnings double every three years. FB would be far more profitable and have a low price-to-earnings ratio by 2022 based on today's price if that earnings growth plays out.Bottom Line on Facebook StockFB stock has become increasingly attractive over the last two years. The company shook off the first big bearish point
column48: solving the mobile monetization problem. Now it has created successful secondary platforms to attract younger users. Unfortunately
column49: Facebook stock fully reflects these developments. It has soared in recent years. You can make the argument to buy a great company
column50: even at merely a fair price. However
column51: for my money
column52: I'd rather wait for a stock market correction that causes a big shake-out in FB stock before purchasing.At this time of this writing
column53: Ian Bezek held no positions in any of the aforementioned stocks. You can reach him on Twitter at@irbezek.More From InvestorPlaceThe 10 Best Stocks to Buy for the Next Decade10 Stocks That Won't Exist in a DecadeThe 11 Best Dividend Stocks to BuyThe postShould You Buy Facebook Inc (FB) Stock? 3 Pros
column54: 3 Consappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Forget IBM
column2: Buy These Tech Stocks for Growth Instead;4/19/2017;"International Business Machines CorpIBMhas been a disappointment for growth savvy investors' due to its sluggish results in the last five years. We note that since 2011
column3: the company's top-line has declined annually
column4: which has affected earnings growth rate despite sizeable share buybacks and cost saving initiatives over the period.makeArticleAd();IBM has been moving away from its traditional businesses to newer (read lucrative) business avenues like cloud and data analytics. Though IBM's ""Strategic Imperatives"" (cloud
column5: analytics
column6: mobility and security) are performing well
column7: the recently announced first-quarter 2017 results exhibited that these are not enough to suffice the weakness in traditional businesses yet.We note that the overall weakness has hurt IBM's returns in the last five years. The company has lost 18.3% against S&P 500's gain of 73.1%.Intensifying Competition Hurting ProfitabilityWe believe that intensifying competition in most of the ""Strategic Imperatives"" is hurting IBM's profitability. This is primarily due to continuing investment
column8: which is necessary in order to remain competitive.The cloud computing market is currently dominated by AmazonAMZNthrough its Amazon Web Services. We note that the fight for the #2 place is intensifying owing to the growing presence of MicrosoftMSFT
column9: AlphabetGOOGL
column10: salesforce.com and Oracle. This has affected IBM's gross margin in the last couple of years.We note that gross margin in 2016 contracted 190 basis points (bps) over 2015. In the recently concluded quarter
column11: non-GAAP gross margin contracted a massive 300 basis points (bps) from the year-ago quarter.Newer Techs Still in Nascent StageAlthough IBM has been expanding product portfolio into newer technologies like Blockchain
column12: Quantum computing and Containers through frequent acquisitions
column13: we believe that these are still in nascent stage and will take some time to contribute meaningfully towards top-line growth.Moreover
column14: sluggish IT spending is a concern for IBM. Gartner in its latest report projects IT spending to increase 1.4% over 2016 to $3.5 trillion in 2017. The figure is much lower than earlier projection of 2.7% growth.Although estimated improvement in data center spending is good for IBM
column15: slowing spending on enterprise software and IT services are huge concerns.Alternative PicksCurrently

column1: 5 Must-See New Quotes From Netflix
column2: Inc. Management;4/19/2017;"WhileNetflix's(NASDAQ: NFLX) slower-than-expected subscriber growth in its   first quarter has received lots of attention since the results   were posted earlier this week
column3: investors shouldn't overlook the   valuable insights in the streaming-TV company's earnings call.   Key topics during the call included a look at Netflix's   international potential
column4: why management envies YouTube
column5: what to   expect from the U.S. market

column1: F8 Conference: Facebook Inc (FB) Bets Big on AR;4/19/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) is on the second day of its F8Developer Conference. Yesterday was the keynote by CEO Mark Zuckerberg
column3: and it painted a picture of a company that's doubling down on augmented reality. It also laid out the groundwork for a Facebook that's planning to take on everything fromSnap Inc(NYSE:SNAP) to consumer electronics giants to smartphones.makeArticleAd();Source: FacebookF8 and the Rise of ARFor a while there
column4: Facebook was all about virtual reality. It hasn't given up on the idea of social VR - after all
column5: it spent $2 billion to buyOculus VRin 2014 - and at F8 the company was showing off the Facebook Spaces VR app.But it's doubling down onaugmented reality.New developer tools in the form of the Facebook Camera Effects platform will let developers release AR apps that can run using the existing Facebook mobile app's camera functionality. This technology will let these apps overlay virtual objects onto the real world view. It's an approach thatPokemon Goproved could be a smash hit
column6: helping to push it as the next big thing.AR is something thatMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) is pursuing with its HoloLens
column7: andApple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is expected to make akey feature of its 10th anniversary iPhone 8.5 Tech Stocks to Buy for Growth AND DividendsHowever
column8: Facebook has a different vision. At F8
column9: the version of AR it was showing off starts with apps piggybacking on the Facebook app
column10: so the nextPokemon Gomight actually be played on Facebook instead of being downloaded from the App Store.And FB is pursuing a future where advanced eyeglasses - very similar in appearance to Snapchat Spectacles - take the place of screens and clumsy VR headsets. The AR glasses would let the wearer view virtual objects overlaid on top of a real world view
column11: without the need to look at a smartphone screen.Apple's Targets: Smartphones
column12: Tablets
column13: TVsThe F8 keynote showed that Facebook's ambitions for VR go far beyond the smartphone. In fact
column14: if the company has its way
column15: AR glasses could eventually replace not only the smartphone
column16: but also other screened devices like tablets and televisions.As Zuckerberg said during the keynote: ""We don't need a physical TV. We can buy a $1 app TV and put it on the wall and watch it.""If the 10-year roadmap Facebook laid out at F8 pans out
column17: FB will first use AR to begin rivalling Apple andAlphabet Inc's(NASDAQ:GOOG
column18: NASDAQ:GOOGL) app ecosystems by boosting third-party offerings that run within its own app.Eventually
column19: it plans to make augmented reality more than a killer app. AR glasses combined with ubiquitous high-speed internet and artificial intelligence could usurp the iPhone and Android smartphones altogether as the must-have devices at the center of our lives.Or asBusiness Insiderputs it
column20: Mark Zuckerberg just signed the death warrant for the smartphone.""Other F8 NewsAugmented reality was a huge part of the F8 keynote
column21: but Facebook has a lot more going on in the near term. Besides the Facebook Spaces VR app
column22: the company also showed off game and music integration in its Messenger app. Facebook is offeringSpotifyintegration
column23: and promises Apple Music within Messenger is coming soon.Rite Aid Corporation (RAD) Stock Must DieAlso coming to Messenger are more powerful bots
column24: capable of running with predictive assistance for tasks like suggesting movie showtimes based on conversations. And Facebook is also continuing to improve M
column25: its own AI-powered virtual assistant. Taking on Snapchat
column26: Facebook's Camera Effects platform also supports 2D overlays and 3D 'masks"" similar to Snapchat features.For now
column27: Facebook is focused on turning the camera into the most important piece of smartphone technology. But in ""five to seven years
column28: Facebook plans to have AR glasses like the ones it envisioned at the F8 conference. And if all goes according to plan
column29: those will not only seal FB's position at the top of social media
column30: it will catapult the company to the forefront of consumer electronics as well
column31: taking on Apple and other smartphone makers and potentially disrupting just about anything that currently uses a screen for interaction.As of this writing
column32: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace7 High-Yield Stocks That Could Wreck Your Retirement7 Energy Stocks That Will Turn 2017 on Its HeadAlphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Calls Upon a ""Hire"" Power to Reach $1

column1: How to Invest in the "Internet of Things";4/19/2017;"All around us
column2: the world grows more intertwined every day. Thanks in part to our global web connections
column3: we have the ability to interact with people and things on an incredible level. This online experience can be life-saving and important
column4: or it can be as arbitrary as simplifying monotonous tasks.There are many industries and companies that aim to advance this experience. One growing market
column5: known as the Internet of Things (IoT)
column6: connects our household or commercial items to a wireless network by embedding them with electronic
column7: software
column8: or sensor technology. This network of devices allows us to take the next step into a wireless world that relies less and less on direct human-to-computer interaction.You might actually be using products in the IoT without knowing it. Some common examples include the remote operation of a house's security system
column9: wearable motion and activity tacking products
column10: and even public trash bins that automatically alert a municipality when it is full.The Internet of Things is definitely present in our everyday lives right now
column11: but it also has a lot more room to grow. According to research firm IDC
column12: via theWall Street Journal
column13: the IoT market could nearly triple in the coming years. In 2014
column14: the global IoT market was worth $655.8 billion
column15: but it could reach up to $1.7 trillion by the year 2020.With the industry showing that much room for growth
column16: investors need to start thinking about investing in the IoT now
column17: and we've highlighted a few companies and strategies for those who would like get the IoT into their portfolios.ETF SuccessPerhaps the easiest way for investors to make a play on the Internet of Things is with a themed ETF. If that interests you
column18: check out Global X Internet of Things Thematic ETFSNSR
column19: the first IoT-related ETF on the market.Big Name Patent HoldersOne of the most important steps a company needs to take to capitalize on emerging technology is locking down patents at the earliest possible point. In regards to the Internet of Things market
column20: we've seen a lot of companies filing for patents that put them in a good position to grow as the IoT grows.One such company is technology behemoth AppleAAPL. Apple holds a patent named ""Local Device Awareness""
column21: which describes an automated relationship between multiple close-range devices. The technology could be used for position tracking
column22: such as finding a lost remote control
column23: or even proximity-based virtual reality
column24: like a video game that depends on one's actual position in a room.Another major IoT patent holder is IBMIBM. Primarily an information technology-focused company
column25: IBM figures to be a major player in the IoT. Currently
column26: IBM holds a patent regarding data filtering in Internet of Things devices
column27: which describes a process in which devices receive and interpret information. This patent puts IBM amongst the frontrunners in technology that allows devices to communicate without human interaction.Furthermore
column28: IBM just announced an Internet of Things partnership with Cisco SystemsCSCO. IBM will implement its Watson technology into Cisco's wide network of edge devices and end points in an effort to provide real-time feedback and data for the oil & gas
column29: manufacturing
column30: shipping
column31: and mining industries.Today's Leading ProductsWhile patents are important for future growth and development
column32: we also have to look at the already-available IoT devices. Again
column33: we are looking at some of the world's biggest tech companies here.One of the more obvious industry leaders is Alphabet Inc.GOOGLand its line of Nest home monitoring products. Alphabet
column34: under the Google name at the time
column35: acquired Nest for $3.2 billion in early 2014
column36: and since then the brand has become one of the biggest names in home automation with its smart thermostats
column37: smoke detectors
column38: and safety cameras.Another leader in the IoT market right now is AmazonAMZN. Amazon's Dash Buttons
column39: which allow users to re-order specific products with the click of an actual physical button that can be placed anywhere in the home
column40: could be considered an entry-level IoT device. Additionally
column41: the company's Echo smart speakers
column42: which utilize its Alexa home connectivity technology
column43: are probably the most popular consumer IoT product on the market right nowGoogle actually recently responded to Amazon's Echo speaker with a home automation device of its own
column44: the Google Home. The Home runs on Google's new voice assistant
column45: which also powers its new Pixel phone and represents Google's new era of hardware/software interaction.(Also read:Google's New ""Home"" Internet of Things Device   Challenges Amazon Echo)Finally
column46: SamsungSSNLFis another major player with its SmartThings brand. Samsung SmartThings are a series of in-home products
column47: ranging from electric outlets to motion sensors
column48: which allow for easier control of a users' entire home.Unsung HeroesThe technology giants will certainly be leaders in the IoT market
column49: but investors should also look into the smaller companies that will be the manufacturers of the actual hardware. For every product IoT product sold by Apple
column50: the supplier who built one of the components within the device also stands to benefit.One of Apple's key suppliers is Skyworks SolutionsSWKS. Skyworks is the industry leader in semiconductor manufacturing and currently produces a chip that is a vital part of the iPhone. Similar technology will be the backbone of the IoT movement
column51: as semiconductors and sensors move beyond their usual homes in phones and computers and into our other household items. Skyworks is currently a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).Investors should also focus on some smaller cap stocks that have potential to grow in correlation with the IoT market. One such company would be Sierra WirelessSWIR
column52: a wireless communications expert with a product line that should fit perfectly in the IoT market.Another company to consider is Iridium CommunicationsIRDM
column53: a low-Earth orbit satellite company that has recently partnered with IoT platform providers as the industry has discovered a use for LEOs in connecting the world.5G RevolutionIt's also important to pay attention to the rise of 5G data networks. The term ""5G"" is short for ""5th generation mobile networks
column54: and it refers to the proposed telecommunications standards that will replace the current 4G standards.While previous standards have focused on human-to-human communication
column55: 5G will need to power the growing Internet of Things and other technologies that seek to bring people closer to the world around them.Telecom giants like AT&TTand VerizonVZhave been building up their portfolios of 5G-compatible wireless spectrum
column56: while chipmakers like QualcommQCOMare focused on building the needed hardware (also read:Here's How To Invest In The 5G Data Revolution).Bottom LineThe Internet of Things has the potential to change the consumer electronics industry as we know it. The growth of the market will be another indication of humanity's expansion into an autonomous world
column57: and investors need to start taking note of the IoT now.Whether you want to focus on the major technology players or the small companies at the heart of the IoT movement
column58: the time is now to add this industry to your portfolio.Also
column59: investors interested in the Internet of Things should check out this episode of theZacks Friday Finish Linepodcast:Zacks' Top 10 Stocks for 2017In addition to the stocks discussed above
column60: would you like to know about our 10 finest buy-and-hold tickers for the entirety of 2017?Who wouldn't? Last year's market-beating Top 10 portfolio produced 5 double-digit winners. For example
column61: oil and natural gas giant Pioneer Natural Resources and First Republic Bank racked up stellar gains of +44.9% and +44.3% respectively. Now a brand-new list for 2017 has been hand-picked from 4

column1: IBM's Cloud Computing Holds Major Potential: Should You Buy?;4/19/2017;"International Business Machines Corp.'sIBMinvestor briefing last month reflected its continuing focus on being a cloud-first company. In 2016
column2: cloud revenues grew 35% to $13.7 billion
column3: while the annual exit run rate for cloud-as-a-service revenue increased 53% on a year-over-year basis to $8.6 billion.In itslatest quarterly earnings report
column4: the tech giant reported cloud segmental revenue growth of 45% from the prior-year period. Additionally
column5: IBM has over 50 cloud centers globally
column6: and its Bluemix platform was one of the largest open public cloud deployments worldwide at the end of 2016.IBM's Watson on Cloud is also a key growth driver for the company. The company expects Watson to reach over 1 billion people by the end of 2017
column7: and IBM estimates the market for Watson on Cloud as a decision-making support system to be worth nearly $2 trillion by 2025.Cloud Computing: Robust Growth ExpectationsIBM's growth expectations from cloud computing remain positive in the long haul. Management anticipates market opportunity in enterprise cloud to be greater than $800 billion by 2020. Moreover
column8: the company expects more than 85% of enterprises to commit to multi-cloud architectures by 2018
column9: which is positive for its hybrid cloud offerings.The overall growth expectation for the public cloud computing services market is very bullish. According to Gartner
column10: the worldwide public cloud services market was projected to grow 18% through 2016 to $246.8 billion in 2017. This figure will increase to $383.3 billion by 2020.makeArticleAd();Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) is projected to be the highest growth service driven by improvement in platform-as-a-service (PaaS) and massive adoption of artificial intelligence (AI)
column11: analytics and the Internet of Things (IoT). IaaS is projected to grow from $25.29 billion in 2016 to $71.55 billion in 2020.IBM Lags Behind in the CloudDespite impressive growth figures and bullish sentiments
column12: IBM lags behind the likes of AmazonAMZNand MicrosoftMSFTin the public PaaS and IaaS cloud computing markets. According to Synergy Research's latest report
column13: Amazon Web Services (AWS) maintained its dominant position in the market followed by Microsoft's Azure
column14: Alphabet'sGOOGLGoogle
column15: and IBM at the end of fourth-quarter 2016.The research firm noted that these three have gained market share in the last one year at the expense of smaller players
column16: as well as strong growth from both Microsoft and Google. However
column17: their combined market share of 23% lags compared with Amazon's 40%.We believe that IBM's hybrid approach has yet to find many takers in both the public and private cloud markets. Despite significant investments - first on acquiring SoftLayer for $2 billion and then spending more than $1 billion on data centers - its client list is not as impressive as Amazon's or Microsoft's.China: IBM's Savior?Per Gartner
column18: China has become a significant IaaS cloud market. The research firm noted that ""While China's cloud service market is nascent and several years behind the U.S. and European markets
column19: it is expected to maintain high levels of growth as digital transformation becomes more mainstream over the next five years.""IBM is now planning to tap into China's fast-growing cloud computing market through a new company formed in collaboration with Wanda Internet Technology Group. The new company will offer IaaS and PaaS to Chinese businesses. Reportedly
column20: IBM will have a share in revenues.Moreover
column21: as a part of the deal
column22: the company will launch Watson services to China. IBM is expected to offer Watson Conversation services
column23: which will allow developers to add natural language interactions between clients and applications.Bottom LineIn its Q1 earnings report
column24: IBM reported a bigger-than-expected drop in revenue
column25: marking the 20thconsecutive quarterly sales decline. Demand for its legacy hardware and software businesses is stagnating
column26: but IBM has been slowly shifting towards cloud-based areas over the years.Despite lagging behind in comparison to its competition
column27: IBM is developing a niche for its hybrid cloud services
column28: along with ""Strategic Imperatives"" like cognitive computing
column29: artificial intelligence
column30: and machine learning. And with Watson
column31: IBM is advancing in vital areas like Internet of Things
column32: healthcare
column33: and financial services end-markets that will support growth in the long run.5 Trades That Could Profit ""Big-League"" from Trump   PoliciesIf the stocks above spark your interest
column34: wait until you look into companies primed to make substantial gains from Washington's changing course.Today

column1: Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Calls Upon a â€œHireâ€ Power to Reach $1
column2: 000;4/19/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL) closed April 18 at $853.99
column4: up 7.8% on the year. That's a good showing when compared to the S&P 500
column5: but GOOGL stock is a long way from hitting $1
column7: the holy grail of stock prices.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockWord has gotten out in recent days that Google is working on a new recruitment tool that will help companies find quality recruits while managing the application and hiring process.Dubbed Google Hire
column8: it's currently in limited testing
column9: and could be a threat both to job boards likeLinkedInand job application tracking software such as Greenhouse and Lever.Huge Boost to AlphabetI've never understood why Google wasn'tdirectly involved in the HRbusiness given its understanding of information and its paying customers use it.Privacy concerns aside
column10: if this product is remotely helpful in improving the hiring process for both employers and potential employees
column11: it could be a huge boost to GOOGL stock. Here's why:Almost everyone who pays Google to advertise on its various platforms -InvestorPlacecontributor Dana Blankenhorn recently reminded readers here that Alphabet is stillgrowing ad revenues by 20%year-over-year on a quarterly basis - has some need for growing their businesses; one of the most important aspects is hiring the right people.10 Stocks That Won't Exist in a DecadeThe HR software market is said to be worth $14 billion annually in the U.S. alone. According to Aptos
column12: Calif.-based research firm HRmarketer
column13: companies spend $785 billion annually on employee benefits products and services
column14: just one segment of the human resources pie.It's an industry that employs more than1.6 millionpeople in the U.S. whose job it is to manage their employer's talent.Potential Category KillerHRmarketer divides the HR marketplace into seven separate categories: Recruitment and staffing
column15: compensation/payroll
column16: employee benefits
column17: talent management/employee relations
column18: training and development
column19: workforce planning and analytics
column20: and legal and compliance.Google Hire is focusing on one segment of the HR marketplace
column21: but there's no reason why it couldn't broaden its scope to cover some of these other areas.For example
column22: if you've ever done any work with Google Analytics
column23: you know how deep you can dive. Google has absolutely the right technology and people to compete in HR analytics. And that's just a second category.Now
column24: I'm not saying thatMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) and all the other software behemoths out there can't do the same
column25: because they can
column26: but Google sits in a particularly convenient position to take advantage of this marketplace
column27: one that is still very fragmented despite its size.""Forward-looking organizations are also beginning to employ simulations and gaming to connect with talent
column28: particularly Millennials
column29: and analyze whether candidates are primed to succeed in a given role
column30: suggested Deloitte authorsMichael Stephen
column31: David Brown and Robin Erickson in a February 28
column33: article about talent management.Some 71% of the global business leaders surveyed for the article rate their company as weak at using gaming and simulations to attract and assess potential candidates.GOOGL Stock Would Be Less Dependent on Ad RevenueThere's no reason Alphabet can't use its $36 billion in annual cash flow to roll up businesses currently competing in the various categories of the HR marketplace.Facebook Inc (FB) Stock Is Headed to $150 on EarningsIn December
column34: I warned investorsthat GOOGL stock was a must-own in 2017
column35: in part because of the revenue growth of its cloud business. Google Hire could become another tool in Alphabet's kit to generate more revenue from initiatives other than advertising which accounts for 89% of its overall sales.If you can book a flight through Google Flights or manage your communications and other business activities through Google Gmail and Google Drive
column36: why not use Google to manage your hiring process and other HR-related activities?Soon
column37: you'll be able to. And that's a great thing for GOOGL stock.As of this writing

column1: Baidu (BIDU) Stock Pops as Company Open Sources its Self-Driving Car Tech;4/19/2017;"Shares of Baidu

column6: and it will focus on utilizing the company's strengths in artificial intelligence to build a collaborative driverless car ecosystem.""AI has great potential to drive social development

column4: several other announcements
column5: related to virtual reality (VR) and Messenger
column6: were made.Facebook also announced a new program called Developer Circles
column7: aimed at forging a strong developer community to enable better dissemination of knowledge about technologies as well as better collaboration. Next
column8: there is the Places Graph to help users get data (names
column9: photos
column10: Facebook consumer ratings etc) on 140 million places across the world-like parks
column11: public places and restaurants-to create ""location-aware experiences"". By creating such experiences
column12: it will ""help people learn more about where they are so they can make informed decisions about where to go and what to do""
column13: adds Facebook.However
column14: over the last few days
column15: Facebook has been in the limelight because of the live streaming of a murder on its platform. A septuagenarian in Cleveland
column16: Robert Godwin Sr
column17: was shot dead by Steven Stephens
column18: who posted the video of the crime on Facebook Live. A massive manhunt was carried out by the police. However
column19: the alleged killer reportedly shot himself dead two days later outside a Mc Donald's car park following a brief police chase. The news came in around the time of the CEO's keynote. Zuckerberg condemned the killing and stated
column20: ""Our hearts go out to the family and friends of Robert Godwin Sr. We have a lot of work and we will keep doing all we can to prevent tragedies like this from happening.""Major HighlightsCamera Effects Platform:Facebook launched Camera Effects Platform that will enable users to add masks
column21: frames and interactive filters to their photos. For the time being
column22: the platform has two features. Frames Studio will help to create designs that can be used as profile picture frames. Meanwhile
column23: AR studio will help in creating masks
column24: animated frames and scripted effects and other AR technologies ""that react to movement
column25: the environment or interactions during Live videos.""Facebook has been eyeing the AR/VR market for long. Zuckerberg said AR and VR go ""hand in hand."" The company is working on a technology called SLAM (simultaneous localization and mapping) that can convert a 2D image into 3D.Facebook

column1: Tech Roundup: QCOM Answers Apple
column2: GOOGL Answers DoL
column3: WDC Objects;4/18/2017;"Last week saw QualcommQCOMfiling counterclaims against AppleAAPLin their ongoing patent-related lawsuit
column4: AlphabetGOOGLdefending itself against gender inequality allegations by the Labor Department
column5: Western DigitalWDCobjecting to Toshiba's chip unit sale to BroadcomAVGOand much more.So let's jump to the details-Qualcomm Replies to AppleIn counterclaims filed in a California Federal court
column6: Qualcomm has indicated that Apple is playing needlessly dirty in an attempt to keep costs down. The point of contention
column7: as has often been in the past
column8: is standard essential patents (SEPs)
column9: on the basis of which much of modern day telecommunications takes place.The companies that contributed technology to form the standard are required to license the technology to others on fair
column10: reasonable
column11: and non-discriminatory (FRAND) terms. But what constitutes FRAND has been debated about a lot because companies offering this technology obviously want to be paid more
column12: especially from companies like Apple that make super normal profits. While on the other hand
column13: the companies that license want to point to all their other innovations built on top of the standards and argue that the standards are just a very small part of the end product and so don't deserve a good price.Qualcomm's complaints are mainly about Apple failing to engage in good faith negotiations over its 3G and 4G patents while also seeking to use both these and its 5G technology at a fraction of the cost that other smartphone vendors are apparently willing to pay. ""Now
column14: after a decade of historic growth
column15: Apple refuses to acknowledge the well-established and continuing value of those technologies. It has launched a global attack on Qualcomm and is attempting to use its enormous market power to coerce unfair and unreasonable license terms from Qualcomm"" reads the complaint.It also says that Apple made ""false statements"" to the Korean FTC and encouraged Samsung to go after it to force Qualcomm to change its licensing model. The KFTC investigation ultimately led to an $865 million fine on Qualcomm. Note that Apple doesn't use Qualcomm technology directly but through its manufacturing partners
column16: which have licensing deals with Qualcomm
column17: some going back to before Apple started using its technology.If Apple withholds payments to its partners they might hold out on payments to Qualcomm. Qualcomm may be able to get its agreements enforced in court but it leads to unnecessary and wasteful litigation on multiple levels. This is exactly what Apple is doing according to Qualcomm.Qualcomm further says that Apple ""acted to prevent Qualcomm from revealing to consumers the extent to which iPhones with Qualcomm's chipsets outperformed iPhones with Intel's chipsets"" and later falsely claimed that there was ""no discernible difference.""Google's Fight with the Labor DepartmentThe U.S. Department of Labor (DoL) has made a sweeping statement that it had ""found systemic compensation disparities against women pretty much across the entire workforce"" and DOL Regional Director Janette Wipper said the agency had received ""compelling evidence of very significant discrimination against women in the most common positions at Google headquarters.""In a detailed response to the allegation
column18: Google's VP of people operations
column19: Eileen Naughton said that the claims had been made ""without any supporting data or methodology."" She also explained the salary analysis system Google currently employs:""Each year
column20: we suggest an amount for every employee's new compensation (consisting of base salary
column21: bonus and equity) based on role
column22: job level
column23: job location as well as current and recent performance ratingsâ€¦The analysts who calculate the suggested amounts do not have access to employees' gender data. An employee's manager has limited discretion to adjust the suggested amount
column24: providing they cite a legitimate adjustment rationale.""The model then measures individual salary calculations against those received by their peers which is done to eliminate ""statistically significant differences between men's and women's compensation"". Naughton also said that Google's methodology is available to other businesses if they want to test their own compensation practices for equal pay.This has been going on since Sep 2016
column25: after which a case was filed in January
column26: asking for its compensation data. Things came to a head after Google failed to comply with a routine audit.Western Digital ObjectsToshiba is under pressure to sell its memory chip business after accounting irregularities related to its Westinghouse nuclear project put it into financial trouble. But Western Digital
column27: which recently acquired SanDisk
column28: is in a JV with Toshiba and has also invested billions of dollars in that business.WDC says that Toshiba didn't have the legal right to split the chip business and it also deserves prior and confidential negotiating rights in case of its sale as a result of this agreement. It also objects to a sale to Broadcom
column29: despite it being the highest bidder because of unsavory dealings with that company. Read more:Why Suitors Are Flocking To Toshiba's Chip BusinessPC Shipment Declines Continue to ModerateAccording to research firms IDC and Gartner
column30: PC shipments showed signs of improvement in the first quarter of 2017
column31: with declines continuing to moderate. This was the 10thstraight quarter of PC shipment declines. Business PCs did better than consumer PCs as expected. The spoilers remain largely the same: shift to mobile devices and emerging markets
column32: and a longer replacement cycle. Read more:Strong PC Shipments Witnessed in Q1: Gartner

column34: Wistron Certified in India: Apple' smanufacturing partner Wistron has received Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) certification for manufacture/assembly of a phone (Model A1723
column35: brand number R-62000612
column36: certified under IS 13252) in India that according to media reports
column37: is the iPhone SE. The BIS reportedly says that this phone will be different from international versions. Apple recently discounted the 4-inch phone to Rs. 19
column39: which is expected to help it gain share in the mid-range market. Wistron-owned ICT Service Management Solutions
column40: based in Yeshwantpur
column41: Benguluru has been commissioned for the manufacturing.MKM Optimistic on Alibaba Cloud Growth: MKM analysts have issued a highly optimistic report about Alibaba'sBABAcloud business. They estimate that the business could be worth $20 billion today with the potential to grow to a $65-70 billion valuation over the next 4-5 years.The optimism is driven by data supplied by the analysts: 60K developers are working on the platform
column42: AliCloud has 765K paying customers (up 100% year over year)
column43: it has 2.8 million total customers; after large enterprises
column44: which use state-owned infrastructure
column45: AliCloud is the largest private player with 70 of the largest 100 startups using its services. Also
column46: Alibaba has been investing in the business for the past eight years
column47: which is reportedly three years short of Amazon and four years longer than Alphabet's Google.New Technology/ProductsAMD Ryzen 5 Release: AMD started selling its Zen-based Ryzen 5 processors (four core/eight thread and six core/twelve thread) into the channel some time back and now
column48: these products are available to consumers. The processors reportedly compare well with Intel's Kaby Lake-based i5 chips (four core/four thread) going by the considerable number of reviews comparing the two.As may be expected
column49: Intel's chip is more expensive when you consider the fact that it has fewer threads and cores
column50: but single-core performance is better. On a net basis
column51: while AMD still lags Intel slightly on performance
column52: it's packing in more compute power at lower costs that is likely to go down well with consumers. Gamers are the biggest drivers of consumer PC sales right now so both Intel and AMD have their work cut out.Microsoft Tools for Hybrid Cloud Migration: MicrosoftMSFThas come out with three new tools that in very broad terms
column53: will help enterprises evaluate the savings generated from moving corporate workloads to Azure
column54: the Azure Hybrid Use Benefit in the Azure Management Portal that can save them up to 40% on their Windows server licenses and Azure Site Recovery to facilitate the process of migrating virtual machines to Azure. Microsoft is en route to delivering annualized commercial cloud revenue of $20 billion by 2018 and its pace of growth indicates that the once unreal target is now within reach.Microsoft Launching Minecraft Marketplace: The Minecraft development team apparently can't keep up with the demand for customizations and levels and so it's getting on board independent developers that will supply these and other customizations through the in-game store. The good thing for developers is that Minecraft maker Mojang
column55: now owned by Microsoft is willing to pay out 50% of what the creation generates
column56: with 30% going to Apple
column57: Google
column58: or Microsoft's app stores and itself retaining the rest.Minecraft is an insanely popular title
column59: having sold 121 million copies worldwide
column60: with 55 million unique monthly players (figures from Microsoft). As of now
column61: nine businesses have been approved for selling feature packs with prices ranging from $1-10 per creation. Microsoft will sell Minecraft Coins that can be used to buy items.  Microsoft intends to eventually make the purchases sync across devices and platforms.Microsoft Ends Support for Vista: Microsoft has officially withdrawn support to its unsuccessful Windows Vista launched in 2009. While some people did buy systems based on the OS
column62: most were dissatisfied and what's more
column63: Vista was the reason that most XP users simply refused to move on. All that is well behind us and both Windows 7 and Windows 10 have been received well. Microsoft says
column64: Windows Vista users ""will no longer receive new security updates
column65: non-security hotfixes
column66: free or paid assisted support options
column67: or online technical content updates from Microsoft."" So that ends the matter.Google Home Services
column68: Food Delivery App for India: Google has launched an app called Aero in Bengaluru and Mumbai
column69: India that will allow people to connect with home service providers like plumbers
column70: electricians and the like. It will also allow users to search for nearby restaurants and schedule food delivery.M&A and CollaborationsMicrosoft
column71: eBay
column72: Tencent Invest in India's Flipkart: Microsoft
column73: eBay and China's Tencent joined earlier investors Naspers Group
column74: Tiger Global Management
column75: Accel Partners and DST Global for a share in Flipkart
column76: India's largest ecommerce company. The three companies together invested $1.4 billion. Ebay sold its Indian operations to Flipkart and added $500 million for its share in the company. The company is now valued at $11.6 billion.Microsoft Buys Deis: Microsoft spent an undisclosed amount of money to buy San Francisco-based software startup Deis that was reportedly acquired by Engine Yard back in 2015. The startup has developed an open source tool based on the Kubernetes container management system that Google developed and then open sourced.Microsoft initially agreed to work with Google on Kubernetes back in 2014 but also backed competing platforms Mesos and Docker Swarm. But Kubernetes has gained ground so in February
column77: Kubernetes became available on the Azure Container service as well. The reason this is all so significant is because containerization is extremely important for information stored in the cloud since it creates a virtual box of code that can be shared and moved between applications and across clouds as needed.""At Microsoft
column78: we've seen explosive growth in both interest and deployment of containerized workloads on Azure
column79: and we're committed to ensuring Azure is the best place to run them
column80: Scott Guthrie
column81: EVP cloud and enterprise group at Microsoft wrote in a blog post.Google to Invest In LG Display: South Korea's Electronic Times has reported that Google has offered to pay LG Display up to $880 million (one trillion KRW) as its contribution toward a production line for flexible OLED panels for use in second-generation Pixel phones. LG is considering the offer. Google's Pixel
column82: which has the appearance and features of a premium device and has been marketed as such
column83: will fall back in the race with Samsung and Apple on features if it doesn't get some OLED screens of its own.So Google's needs are clear: it also doesn't need to get into a deal with Samsung
column84: which uses OLED in its own phones and is also in an agreement to supply to Apple. So it's trying to find another supplier.Some NumbersFacebook Announces Monthly Advertisers: FacebookFBhas announced that the number of advertisers on its platform has grown from 4 million to 5 million between September and now. Businesses with mobile pages now total 65 million while businesses with Instagram profiles are up to 8 million. Among the 5 million advertisers

column1: Facebook Inc (FB) Stock Is a Long-Term Powerhouse;4/18/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThe markets are an awfully confusing place
column3: congested with a litany of diverging arguments. Especially for a beginner investor
column4: deciding where to go is a potentially perilous experiment. But within the madhouse
column5: a few names pop up that are seemingly above the fray. You can depend on them through good times and bad.Facebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) is easily a top contender in this category. So
column6: what makes FB stock so special?makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockThe obvious answer is the enormous success that it has enjoyed. Since closing at $38.23 after its initial public offering
column7: Facebook stock is now trading above $140.In fact
column8: shares set an all time closing record on Mar. 29
column9: at $142.65. The only time that FB stock floundered was during its maiden year of 2012
column10: when initial investors lost 30%.That setback is of course well back in the rear-view mirror. Early concerns about FB being unable to monetize its business quickly faded due to its sheer dominance of its industry. WhatAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column11: NASDAQ:GOOGL) aka Google is to the internet
column12: Facebook is to social media and networking. Using the success of GOOG as a model
column13: it's not a stretch to imagine the same thing occurring to FB stock.The measure of a company's reach is obviously determined by how well it is known to the general public. For FB
column14: they've changed our lexicon. Not only is Facebook a verb
column15: its ancillary terms
column16: such as ""friending
column17: are used seamlessly inpopular culture.Facebook Stock Is the Investment of TomorrowAs great as this is
column18: the markets are ""here today
column19: gone today."" After rising so much over the past six years
column20: it's natural to assume that the growth potential is gone. While it's difficult to say whether Facebook stock will crank out a few triple-digit returns likeNetflix
column21: Inc. (NASDAQ:NFLX) orAmazon.com
column22: Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN)
column23: shares offer plenty of long-term positives.The 11 Best Dividend Stocks to BuyThe future of FB stock was essentially secured back in the summer of 2015. That was when CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced that the company launched its solar-powered plane Aquila. More than just a cool science experiment
column24: Aquila providedinternet accessto remote regions of the world.It's not so much the technology that went into this project
column25: but rather
column26: its implications. The social media giant has over 1.7 billion users that log onto their site on a monthly basis. That by itself is an impressive number for the company
column27: and is more than enough reason to consider buying Facebook stock. Clearly
column28: a majority of the subscription base comes from tech-savvy nations.Management could just be content with what they have
column29: which is an enormous global brand. Instead
column30: they realize that the often hegemonic influence of the west is waning. In terms of true growth potential
column31: the key markets are Africa and Asia. Despite being the most populous continents
column32: they rankat the bottomof internet penetration. By launching projects such as Aquila
column33: Facebook is asserting itself as the brand of tomorrow
column34: not just of today.That kind of smarts doesn't come around too often. If I had to pick one reason why FB stock is a long-term no-brainer
column35: this would be it.FB Stock: A Discount Is Coming
column36: But Don't Over-Think It!Having said that
column37: I agree withInvestorPlace'sSerge Berger
column38: who struck abalanced tonewith Facebook stock. In his words
column39: we should embrace the company
column40: not chase it.Click to EnlargeFor those that want to get the best deal
column41: Mr. Berger's advice is quite timely.FB stock is on a roll but typically in the markets
column42: momentum isn't a one-way street. For January
column43: shares returned 11.5%
column44: while the benchmarkSPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust(NYSEARCA:SPY) was flat. Beyond that
column45: February picked up nearly 2%
column46: while March ended up with over 3% returns.United Continental Holdings Inc (UAL) Stock Is Good ... For Dividends?Essentially
column47: Facebook stock hasn't had a genuine correction since November of last year. You'd figure at some point
column48: things will slow down a bit. We're already seeing the first possible signs of that
column49: with FB stock going nowhere so far this month. Don't be surprised to see further modest downside before things start picking back up.And pick up it will. While everybody aspires to get the best price
column50: there's a risk in over-thinking the opportunity in Facebook stock. I'd hate to see someone save nickels to lose dollars.The bottom line for FB is that its leadership is one of the most innovative
column51: forward-thinking teams ever assembled. They still have their focus on the day-to-day
column52: which is why the stock is where it is right now. But they're making sure that they're relevant for future generations. As a steady rock in your portfolio
column53: you couldn't ask for more.As of this writing
column54: Josh Enomoto did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace10 Hopeless Stocks to Wash From Your Portfolio Forever7 Top Emerging Markets Stocks to Buy NowBank of America Corp (BAC) Stock Is a Screaming Buy After Q1 EarningsThe postFacebook Inc (FB) Stock Is a Long-Term Powerhouseappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: After Netflix's Mixed Q1 Earnings
column2: Should You Sell Your FANG Stocks?;4/18/2017;"After a mixed first-quarter earnings release Monday
column3: shares of Netflix fell more than 1.85% in early morning trading on Tuesday. Despite solid revenue growth
column4: investors were unimpressed with several other key figures from the report
column5: which has cast a cloud of uncertainty over the tech sector-especially the notorious ""FANG"" stocks-and left many wondering what exactly the market wants this earnings season.FANG
column6: an acronym coined by CNBC's Jim Cramer several years ago
column7: refers to FacebookFB
column8: AmazonAMZN
column9: NetflixNFLX
column10: and GoogleGOOGL. Each of these companies are primarily focused on tech or internet services
column11: and they all own a solid share of the market in their respective industries.These stocks have traditionally been appealing because of their promises to deliver aggressive growth in their own key areas
column12: but Netflix's latest earnings report underscores the recent shift in focus throughout the FANG group
column13: calling each individual stock into question this earnings season.What Netflix's Q1 Earnings Shows UsFor the first quarter
column14: Netflix reported earnings of 40 cents per share
column15: which beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate of 38 cents per share and marked year-over-year growth of over 560%. Netflix's quarterly revenue of $2.637 billion narrowly missed our consensus estimate of $2.641 billion
column16: but it also displayed aggressive growth
column17: gaining about 35% from the year-ago quarter (also read:Netflix Posts Earnings Beat
column18: Stock Dips on Weak Guidance).The investors that are selling Netflix in the wake of its report seem to be focused on the company's slightly disappointing subscriber growth figures. The streaming service reached 98.75 million total members in the quarter
column19: with 94.36 of those being paid
column20: non-trial memberships. This fell just short of the 99 million members that the company guided for in its previous report.For years
column21: Netflix has traded on this subscriber growth figure
column22: but with its international expansion completed over a year ago
column23: a focus on membership adds seems a bit outdated. Netflix thinks this too.""For the last several years we've had flat operating margins due to established markets funding international expansion with every spare dollar we hadâ€¦ the major indicators of our progress were member and revenue growth and US contribution margins
column24: the company said in its shareholderletter. ""Starting this year
column25: we can be primarily measured by revenue growth and (global) operating margins as our primary metrics.""Netflix's key metric is no longer what it used to be
column26: and this idea becomes a pattern when we look at the other FANG stocks.Take Facebook
column27: for example. In February
column28: shares of Facebook dipped slightly after its fourth-quarter report
column29: despite the fact that the company beat our consensus earnings and revenue estimates. Why? Because investors wanted more of the aggressive-growth Facebook that they had grown accustom to (also read:Why Facebook Stock Slumped Despite Solid Earnings Report).In reality
column30: Facebook warned investors that this year would be one of heavy investments into its future and significantly slowed year-over-year growth. While this could mean a short-term hit to earnings
column31: Facebook longs should be rejoicing that the company has realized it needs to work on the next big growth opportunity right now. That may take years to pay off
column32: but Mark Zuckerberg and company have a history of being right.For Amazon
column33: the story is similar. We once focused on the growth of its e-commerce business and questioned its ability to dominate traditional retailers. Now Amazon has all but killed old-school retail
column34: and investors are more concerned with the growth of Amazon Web Services and Amazon's media investments.Google has a similar story. Heck
column35: Google isn't even Google anymore. Alphabet Inc.
column36: the new-ish parent company of Google
column37: has its hands in just about every emerging tech market. Why? Because Google's traditional advertising business is slowly fading. The company is focusing on new growth opportunities.Bottom LineAs we look ahead to the upcoming earnings announcements from Facebook
column38: Amazon
column39: and Alphabet
column40: don't make the same mistake that some Netflix investors have today. These aren't your daddy's FANG stocks
column41: and that means you shouldn't be focused be on all the old key metrics.With that said
column42: remember to look at these stocks individually
column43: and study the latest trends in earnings estimates and estimate revisions before making a play on any of them.Sell These Stocks. Now.Just released: today's 220 Zacks Rank #5 Strong Sells demand urgent attention. If any are lurking in your portfolio or Watch List

column1: Here's How Apple Can Reach a $1 Trillion Valuation;4/18/2017;"""I sold my stock in Apple back in 1995. If I would have held it longer
column2: I would have been a millionaire!
column3: exclaims that one guy that we all totally know.While that guy tends to talk about ""what could have been"" a little too frequently to be taken seriously
column4: he does have a point here. After decades of consistent growth
column5: interrupted by just a few down periods
column6: AppleAAPLis the world's most-valuable publicly-traded company with a market capitalization of nearly $750 million.Perhaps no company has burned its imagery into the minds of the public better than this technology behemoth. The Cupertino
column7: California-based firm is more than just a brand-it's an influencer of culture. As Apple goes
column8: so do the masses. Its logo is iconic; its products are timeless.And investors still want more.So how can Apple
column9: with its well-established product lines and billions of existing customers
column10: break into uncharted territory? How does the one on top climb higher? How does the biggest get even bigger?The short answer: by trying something new.Old Dog
column11: New TricksOut of the many new options that Apple has to test out
column12: it seems like the company is taking self-driving cars the most seriously. Last Friday
column13: the iPhone maker received a permit to begin testing self-driving cars in California
column14: and it looks like Apple's formerly top-secret autonomous vehicle project is finally ready to take the next step (also read:Apple Gets Self-Driving Car Permit: What's at Stake for the Industry?).However
column15: we are still-at the very least-several years away from an ""iCar
column16: and Apple is likely to meet stiff competition from its industry competitors in this field.On top of the big-name automakers like TeslaTSLA
column17: General MotorsGM
column18: FordF
column19: and many others working on self-driving cars
column20: tech companies like Alphabet Inc.GOOGLand IntelINTCare also working on their own autonomous vehicle projects (also read:Intel Buys Mobileye: Are More Driverless Car Deals in the Future?).The self-driving car space is sure to be crowded
column21: but a brand like Apple won't have to worry about name recognition
column22: and if the company's previous products are any evidence
column23: Apple's car project will likely result in a sleek
column24: user-friendly
column25: and high-performing vehicle.Becoming a major player in what could be a world-changing industry
column26: especially one that is still at its infancy like this one
column27: would certainly help Apple gain even more value. Of course
column28: that's far from the only thing the Tim Cook-led company can do to bring its market cap over $1 trillion.If the internet-and its vast array of unfounded rumors-were left to decide how Apple can grow
column29: it would want the tech giant to enter the world of media productionâ€¦ by buying DisneyDIS.Yes
column30: the age-old ""Apple should buy Disney"" conjecture is alive and well
column31: despite no real evidence pointing towards any merger talks between the two companies.And while it may be pure fiction
column32: an Apple-Disney merger does speak to something that is currently missing from Apple's portfolio of products and projects. For all of the snazzy devices that the company makes
column33: it owns very little of what its customers access on those devices.Sure
column34: Apple Music has growninsanely fast
column35: but Apple has notably not yet entered the world of video streaming or original programming. The Apple TV device is a strong candidate for any cord-cutter
column36: and an Apple-owned over-the-top streaming service has been rumored for years
column37: but buying a media company would immediately bolster Apple's arsenal if it does want to seriously contend in this space at some point.Bottom LineThe goal of a publicly-traded company is not to reach new market-cap milestones
column38: break records
column39: or make headlines. In fact
column40: it is quite a bit simpler than that. All public companies
column41: big or small
column42: need to provide value to their shareholders.This means that reaching a $1 trillion valuation is likely not an explicit goal for Apple right now. Instead
column43: Tim Cook and company are probably plotting on how to effectively deliver the next must-have product
column44: while also continuing to pump out the Apple products we all know and love.These goals are
column45: of course
column46: intended to help the company grow and provide that desired value for its shareholders.But an Apple that's worth $1 trillion is not that far away
column47: and the company has several obvious new routes it can take if it wants to add the nearly $250 million in market cap needed to reach the milestone.Only time will reveal how Apple intends on continuing its ridiculous growth
column48: but in the meantime
column49: we can continue to speculate. Will Apple become a self-driving car giant
column50: or will it purchase a media company and take the entertainment business by storm? I can't wait to find out.Sell These Stocks. Now.Just released: today's 220 Zacks Rank #5 Strong Sells demand urgent attention. If any are lurking in your portfolio or Watch List

column1: 3 Reasons That Tesla (TSLA) Will Be the Most Valuable Automaker Again;4/18/2017;"Last week
column2: Tesla Inc.TSLAbrieflybecame America's most valuable car company by market cap. While General Motors (GM) regained its throne shortly after
column3: the Silicon Valley-based automaker is not looking to back down from the fight.Here's why Tesla is going to be the country's most valuable car company again:Price IncentivesElectrekreported that Tesla hasdiscontinuedthe cheapest version of its Model S sedan and lowered the price of the following variant the 75 kWh Model S
column4: by $7
column6: 500.The price slashes ""makes sense
column7: according toThe Motley Fool.As Tesla's Model 3
column8: the cost-efficient electric car
column9: is set to launch in July
column10: it could compete in sales with the Model S. By lowering the price
column11: the owners who prefer an upgrade or a more spacious car might have a greater incentive to purchase a Model S.ChinaThe price drop is not only good for electric car buyers here in America but also to customers in Asia. As many countries in Asia continue to shift their focus to greener policies
column12: citizens and corporations are looking at the electric car for alternative transportation to avoid air pollution.Not only is China theworld's largest auto market
column13: with 23.6 million cars sold in 2016
column14: it is also thelargest market for electric cars. According toEv-Volumes
column15: China saw 85% growth in electric car sales from 2015 to 2016.China has demonstrated its commitment to reducing CO2 emissions and building a market for electric vehicles. The country looks to create a $1.3 billion market
column16: as it announced in February that Beijing's taxi fleet of 70
column17: 000 vehicles will be switched over to an all-electric fleet
column18: according to a report byNational Business Daily.Before shaking up the taxi fleet
column19: Chinese citizens have been buying electric cars. Tesla reported that its sales in China tripled in 2016 compared to 2015
column20: bringing in over $1 billion in revenues.Self-Driving CarsAlphabet'sGOOGLGoogle or Uber aren't the only tech companies building an autonomous car.China's tech giant
column21: TencentTCEHYis also one of the leaders in developing self-driving car technology.Reutersreported back in July 2016 that Tencent backed a Chinese automotive venture
column22: Future Mobility
column23: which aims to launch an electric self-driving car before 2020.Furthermore
column24: Elon Musk
column25: Tesla's CEO
column26: pledgedto make a car that can drive from Los Angeles to New York City with no human control by the end of 2017. Teslareleased a videoof its Model X SUV driving itself around Palo Alto last year.Though it is plausible that Musk will not meet his own deadline
column27: Tencent seems to have faith.  The Chinese Internet leader recently purchased $1.8 billion worth of Tesla shares.These investments by Tencent not only show the company's belief in the market for the self-driving car
column28: but it also hints at Tesla's possible foothold in the Chinese auto market. With market cap of over $280 billion
column29: Tencent offers more than just financial backing
column30: but also strong political connections.Bottom LineTesla's recent decision to lower prices might just be a short-term strategy to keep investors confident while it works to explore China's market and develop a self-driving car. Either way
column31: these choices are smart. It's clear that Tesla still has several key markets to break into
column32: and that means it will surely regain the top spot eventually.makeArticleAd();Sell These Stocks. Now.Just released
