column1: Netflix (NFLX) Stock Isnâ€™t Feeling Heat From YouTubeâ€™s Free Service;4/13/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsWhile news that YouTube is now available on 53% of set-up boxes may haveAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL) fans excited
column3: Netflix
column4: Inc.(NASDAQ:NFLX) doesn't seem fazed by it. You can see it in the price action: since the data points hit the market early Monday morning
column5: NFLX stock is up 0.9% while GOOGL is down 0.2%.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockJust about every firm on Wall Street covers both of these companies with microscopic precision
column6: so if these numbers budged the competitive map
column7: we would have seen a bigger reaction.That said
column8: the logic behind Wall Street's yawn does tell us important things abouthow post-cable TV is evolving.For one
column9: a network-driven alternative to what's on cable has grown beyond niche to normal
column10: with 53% of U.S. households now pushing network video straight to their screen. That's a great inflection point in terms of market penetration: big enough to qualify as a lot more than a fad but with almost enough room left to double its audience one more time.TV is big business
column11: limited only by the amount of time we spend viewing it. With 96% of the population still watching the conventional cable box
column12: companies selling alternative programming can capture plenty of viewer minutes and starve their rivals. NFLX reaches 75% of the streaming audience
column13: so 56% of the overall TV audience remains wide open to expansion.I suspect the company will keep nibbling at that market or even discount the service to take bigger bites if management decides scale is more important than profitability. Either way
column14: every one of those viewers pays NFLX the same monthly fee no matter how many hours they stream - even if they don't use the service at all.NFLX Subscribers Want to PayThe YouTube model is very different. Simply being available on the big household screen doesn't automatically generate a lot of free cash flow and it doesn't really compete with NFLX or other pay-TV channels. YouTube original programming - the ""Red"" Lineup of shows - hasn't exactly made a big impact at $9.99 a month.Beyond that thin slice
column15: the site's content is still overwhelmingly user-generated and available for free. GOOGL gets ad revenue when those videos play via set-top boxes
column16: but NFLX signs subscribers who want to pay.10 Hopeless Stocks to Wash From Your Portfolio ForeverAlmost every one of those 58 million NFLX households pays. Only 1.5 million of the 34 million YouTube households have upgraded to Red. The rest may drain a few minutes from Netflix and rack up a little ad revenue
column17: but a show more or less isn't really going to change the dynamics much at all.As it is
column18: NFLX is chewing up about an hour a day of a subscriber's viewing time
column19: locking those blocks off from competitors who need the eyeballs.The Real CompetitorsI believe the real competitors here areAmazon.com
column20: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) and other monthly subscription models like Sling and Hulu
column21: not to mention traditional TV like TimeWarner Cable Inc's(NYSE:TWC) HBO.AMZN is coming up fast
column22: and it's easy to imagine scenarios where subscribers looking to trim their budgets will have to choose one service or the other. I don't think that's happening yet - Amazon Prime plus NFLX streaming is $19 a month compared to an average cable TV bill above $100
column23: so cable cutters can keep both options open
column24: watch all day and it's the cable companies that suffer.This is perhaps another golden age of television - or maybe we call it video. People will chase whatever they like at price points they can afford.Right now
column25: the ""free"" option YouTube supports hasn't cut all that deeply into pay-for-play
column26: which means NFLX stock is a long way from feeling any heat.Hilary Kramer is the editor ofGameChangers

column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsEarnings season hits the financial sector today and investors don't seem awfully impressed as banking stocks are trading about a half percent lower while the remainder of the market trades flat. column8: this represents two key technical items.First
column9: the stock's lower Bollinger Band is trading just below this level. A break of this band on a closing basis will cause a volatility sell-off for JP Morgan that would likely target $82 with haste.The 11 Best Dividend Stocks to BuySecond
column10: $85 marks the March lows when technical traders defended JPM stock after its last break of the bottom Bollinger Band. The market doesn't like to see round-numbered levels that had previously been defended broken

(AAPL)Apple made the headlines this morning with a note circulating that the stock could potentially targetWalt Disney Co(NYSE:DIS) as an acquisition to increase their content business. column14: who haven't bid the price higher or lower on the news.After topping out around $145

column16: except if things lead to a price that is just slightly lower than $140.According to the charts
column17: $140 has been a significant level for the bulls when it comes to ""buying the dip"" as each touch of that price has seen an increase in buying volume since early March.Additionally
column18: AAPL stock's 50-day moving average is creeping higher and will soon intersect with the $140 price point
column19: building what we refer to as ""double barreled"" support.The bottom line is that we usually see Apple shares rise ahead of their earnings announcement. The company is slated to release their next earnings on May 4. Putting that together with the support we see building at $140

column1: Why Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Is STILL Easy Money;4/13/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThe decision by managers atYahoo! Inc.(NASDAQ:YHOO)
column4: to listen to Wall Street and become ""more than a search engine"" will go down in history as the biggest mistake in the history of American business. Bigger than the Red Sox selling Babe Ruth. Bigger than Western Union ignoring the telephone. Today
column5: 20 years later
column6: the company that focused on what computers do rather than people has more opportunity than it knows what to do with.Alphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG

column8: the artists formerly known as Google
column9: will report first-quarter earnings on April 27 andanalysts are expecting a hiccup.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockThe consensus on GOOGL stock is for net income of $7.24 per share on revenues of $19.31 billion.The top line for Alphabet will fall almost $1 billion short of last year's figure
column10: but the bottom line will be almost 20% richer
column11: with more than $1 in every $4 coming down to the net income line. Yet that's a down quarter.GOOGL Stock: The Downside of Self ServiceThe key to Alphabet's success is self-service. You don't talk to GOOGL before buying their search service

column13: you just buy it online. Clouds scale to infinity and beyond
column14: and with its niche secure
column15: the company is a money-making machine you can't turn off.Like a trust fund baby

column17: chief financial officer Ruth Porat
column18: who cut off the company's allowance for things like the self-driving car
column19: and demanded such ""side bets"" be revealed to shareholders so they might pay their own way. I like Wall Street's evil stepmother
column20: very much.The 11 Best Dividend Stocks to BuyThere is a downside to all this. Alphabet treats its algorithms like an oil well that can't run dry. Gender discrimination can creep into the companywithout its even knowing it.Ads may appearwhere they shouldn't.I warned about thislast monthbut until an algorithm is written to address it effectively

column30: and just byputting someone with a clue in charge of it

column1: Facebook's Messenger App Crosses 1.2B Monthly Active Users;4/13/2017;"With each passing day
column2: Facebook Inc.FBis achieving a new milestone. The global social networking giant yesterday revealed that its home grown chat platform - Messenger - has crossed the 1.2 billion monthly active users (MAU) mark
column3: roughly the same as WhatsApp which achieved this milestone two months ago.The 1.2 billion mark represents over 100% growth from approximately 600 MAU base in Mar 2015. Earlier in July last year
column4: the company had announced that its MAU have doubled from Nov 2014 and touched the 1 billion milestone.Messenger is Facebook's third platform
column5: with over 1.2 billion MAU. Facebook's fast growing MAUs reflect the popularity of all its apps including WhatsApp
column6: Messenger and Instagram.  We note that these are far more popular than rival social media apps like TwitterTWTRand SNAP Inc.'sSNAPSnapchat.The Messenger platform has been witnessing tremendous surge in its active user base after Facebook split it off and created a standalone company in 2014. Since the split
column7: the platform has added various useful features like voice calling
column8: individual and group video calling
column9: stickers
column10: frames
column11: etc. which helped in expanding its user base.Most recently
column12: Facebook introduced artificial intelligence (AI) powered voice assistant
column13: M for Messenger
column14: which will help users with suggestions to improve their communication experience on the app. For the time being
column15: Suggestions from M will be available to users across the U.S.
column16: with global launch in the near term.Furthermore
column17: the company in February this year
column18: partnered with TransferWise Ltd.
column19: an international money transfer service
column20: that will enable users to make international transactions over the Messenger app. Notably
column21: in Sep 2016
column22: Messenger provided tools to developers
column23: enabling 'bots' to accept and make payments within the U.S.
column24: thereby eliminating the need to redirect to an external website.Messenger's consistent growth in user base has heated the debate that Facebook should now make efforts to monetize the platform. The social media platform too is aggressively working on monetizing the opportunities presented by its subsidiaries. Chatbots and ""conversational commerce"" are likely to be the strategies for Messenger.Various analysts believe that it will be wise for Facebook to ramp up the monetizing experiment on Messenger rather than trying on the WhatsApp platform. This is so because Facebook's balance sheet carries a hefty amount of goodwill related to the WhatsApp acquisition and if the experiment fails it will impact the company's financials badly. However
column25: attempting the same on Messenger will not carry such risks for the company as it is Facebook's in-house developed chat platform.Therefore
column26: in our opinion
column27: the company should look for options to generate ad revenues from Messenger as the competition for ad dollars from the likes of Alphabet'sGOOGLYouTube
column28: Twitter and Snapchat has been intensifying rapidly.Notably
column29: ad revenues contribute over 95% to Facebook's total revenue. Continuous rise in advertising revenues as well as the company's strategic efforts to sustain the growth momentum has put Facebook on investors' favorite stock pick list. Notably
column30: in the past one year
column31: Facebook's shares generated a return of 26% compared with the ZacksInternet Servicesindustry's return of just 5%.At present

column1: Report: Apple Inc. Is Making an Apple Watch for Diabetics (AAPL);4/13/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsApple(NASDAQ:AAPL) is reportedly working on a top secret project that would incorporate blood glucose monitoring technology for the Apple Watch. The ability to check and monitor blood sugar levels without the need to use a needle to physically draw blood would be a medical game changer.makeArticleAd();Source: AppleAn Apple Watch for diabetics would also make AAPL's wearable a must-have for hundreds of millions of people.Diabetes: A Big Problem That's Getting BiggerDiabetes is a chronic disease that's on the upswing. According to the World Health Organization (WHO)
column3: modern lifestyles with relatively little activity and increasing body weight is to blame for the majority of cases of Type 2 Diabetes - the most common version. The number of people affected is rapidly growing
column4: with WHO reporting the108 million cases globally rose to 422 million by 2014.Managing diabetes requires regular monitoring of blood glucose levels throughout the day
column5: which means using a needle to prick a finger for blood needed for testing. That also means buying a blood testing monitor and ongoing purchases of testing strips.Few people like being pricked with a needle multiple times every day.10 Hopeless Stocks to Wash From Your Portfolio ForeverAn Apple Watch for Diabetics would upend the entire blood glucose monitoring process
column6: making it easier
column7: far less invasive and eliminating the ongoing cost of supplies.The Team Working on an Apple Watch for DiabeticsCNBCbroke the news thatAAPL has a secret teamworking to develop sensors that can continuously monitor blood sugar levels -without having to draw blood. The project is focused on optical sensors that would shine through the skin to measure blood glucose levels. This sensor would be integrated into the bottom of the Apple Watch - in a similar fashion to the current model's optical heart rate sensor.The resulting Apple Watch for diabetics would have the potential to be a game-changer in how the disease is managed.According toCNBC's sources
column8: this project isn't pie in the sky. In the past year
column9: AAPL has reportedly been adding biomedical experts from medical corporations to the initial team of 30 engineers. It is conducting trials at clinical sites in the San Francisco area
column10: and has hired consultants to work on the regulatory requirements.What This Could Mean for Apple Watch SalesThe impact of integrated blood glucose monitoring on Apple Watch sales would be huge. The Centers for Disease Control says that in 2016
column11: 29 million Americans had diabetesand 86 million were pre-diabetic.No one enjoys needles
column12: and while an Apple Watch for diabetics wouldn't eliminate the need for insulin shots
column13: itwouldeliminate the finger pricking to draw blood for testing multiple times per day. It also would eliminate the need to carry around the blood glucose testing kit and the ongoing purchase of testing strips.Constant blood glucose monitoring could also help those 86 million Americans realize they are pre-diabetic and help them to manage their lifestyle to prevent the onset of full-blown diabetes.There Are HurdlesThe biggest issue facing Apple - aside from actually developing a reliable blood glucose sensor- is regulatory. Apple has been able to get away with the Apple Watch heart rate sensor because it does not market its wearable as a medical device. But this move would bring the Apple Watch under U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulation.That in turn could disrupt release cycles
column14: as AAPL would likely need FDA approval before making any changes.3 Reasons Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Is Still a Top BuyNaturally
column15: there is competition. After all
column16: diabetes management is a hugely profitable target.Alphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL) has been working on asmart contact lens project since 2014. This involves embedded glucose sensors
column17: but has yet to result in a commercial product.Apple Watch sales have been fine
column18: but not spectacular. The company remains firmly in the lead for smartwatch sales
column19: and has made concerted effort to steer its wearable more into health and fitness territory
column20: with a resulting sales bump - in Q4 2016 it sold a record 4.6 million units.But add constant blood glucose monitoring making it an Apple Watch for diabetics and for the tens of millions of Americans who are concerned about monitoring their health for signs of diabetes onset?Thatcould be the feature that finally turns Apple Watch into a ""must-have"" device
column21: with hundreds of millions of people globally who would suddenly have a real reason to want to buy one.As of this writing
column22: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceApple Inc. column1: Hereâ€™s How to Capitalize on Facebook Inc (FB) Ahead of Earnings;4/13/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThere are plenty of options strategies for traders to consider holding through an earnings announcement
column3: and we will talk about some of those in future posts. But there is also a strategy to consider that is meant to be closed out prior to earnings that most options traders are probably familiar with - buying a straddle or strangle ahead of earnings.makeArticleAd();Source:Via Stock SnapLet's take a look below what a straddle and strangle is
column4: in case you are not familiar with them.Keeping it fairly simple
column5: both a straddle and strangle consist of buying both a call and put with the same expiration date and on the same security. A straddle is buying a call and put at the same strike price
column6: and a strangle is buying them for two different strike prices. For the most part
column7: one is chosen over the other based on how close the underlying stock is trading to a particular strike price.There are different ways in which to profit - either from delta (changes in option premium based on direction)
column8: vega (changes in option premium based on volatility) or both.Since both a call and put are purchased
column9: it is beneficial for the stock to move distinctly in one direction. Then you will have either positive or negative delta and the trade will benefit from a continued move in the direction of the delta.10 Hopeless Stocks to Wash From Your Portfolio ForeverUp and down action is not beneficial usually.Vega effects option premium based on the implied volatility. Options increase in price when IV rises and vice versa. Since the position is long a call and put
column10: it is beneficial for IV to increase.There are several companies that are expected to announce next week
column11: includingNetflix
column12: Inc.(NASDAQ:NFLX). But this strategy can work best when there are a couple of weeks left until the expected announcement. EnterFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB). The company is expected to announce quarterly earnings on May 3.Lawrence Meyersjust recently wrote about Facebook stock and how he now considers it to be investment-worthy and he notes how digital advertising is being dominated by FB andAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column13: NASDAQ:GOOGL). Will the stock rise ahead of earnings because of a perceived value or will this uncertain market pull the stock lower after a months-long run higher?An Option Straddle Idea to Consider on FB StockThe Rationale:The plan for buying a straddle or strangle based on earnings is to put the position on ahead of earnings and exit the position (hopefully for a profit) before the actual announcement. Of course
column14: the position can be held over the announcement
column15: but a big move is probably needed to profit because the IV will drop - and so will the option premiums - after the announcement.Although past performance is not indicative of future behavior
column16: it might be beneficial to look at a stock's previous earnings to gauge if it may be a good candidate. Take a look at a one-year chart of FB stock below. The stock has moved fairly well prior to the announcement several times in the past.Click to EnlargeThe goal is for the stock to move decisively before the actual announcement. Consider buying the position anywhere from about a month to about a week prior to the announcement. Remember time decay (theta) is a concern
column17: so be sure to allow enough time and maybe not just pick the expiration that takes place right after the expected announcement.What usually benefits this pre-earnings position is vega. Since implied volatility (IV) generally rises as the earnings date nears
column18: option premiums should rise as well minus any time decay. If the stock moves decidedly higher or lower after the position is put on and IV increases
column19: it is a win-win for the position. Consider managing the position for profit based on an expected return goal like a certain percentage. Consider managing the position on the stop-loss side of things based on two criteria: an exit at a certain point (like before the announcement) and/or a certain percentage of risk
column20: just like you may for profit.Should You Buy Netflix
column21: Inc. (NFLX) Stock Ahead of Earnings?The Trade:Buy the May $140 call and the May $140 put for $9 or less.The Strategy:The maximum profit on a straddle is theoretically unlimited because the stock can continue to rise up until expiration and pretty much fall to zero. The maximum loss is $9
column22: or whatever was paid for the straddle
column23: if FB stock finishes right at $140 at May expiration. Both options would expire worthless. There are two breakeven points at expiration; $131 to the downside and $149 to the upside based on a cost of $9.John Kmiecik is the head options instructor for Market Taker Mentoring
column24: and co-author of the eBook 3 Secrets to Making Money in Any Market. Get your complimentary copy of his option tradingeBookhere. He can be reached atjohn@markettaker.com. At the time of this writing
column25: he did not own a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace10 Blue-Chip Stocks That Will Bleed for the Rest of 2017The 11 Best Dividend Stocks to BuyJPMorgan Chase & Co. Crushes Q1 Earnings. Buy JPM Stock at Will.The postHere's How to Capitalize on Facebook Inc (FB) Ahead of Earningsappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: TiVo Inc (TIVO) Enters into Licensing Agreement with Roku;4/13/2017;"makeZacksArticleAd();Digital home entertainment services and solutions provider
column2: TiVo Inc.TIVO
column3: recently entered into a licensing and multi-year intellectual property agreement with Roku
column4: Inc. However
column5: the financial terms of the deal were not disclosed.Per the deal
column6: Roku now has a license to TiVo and Rovi Corporation patent portfolios for over-the-top (OTT) offerings. Additionally
column7: the contract entitles customers of Roku to directly access TiVo's high-quality entertainment metadata and other products to carry on search and navigating user interface.California-based Roku is a privately held consumer electronics company
column8: primarily dealing in consumer digital media products. Its digital media receivers allow customers to stream video or audio via Internet on televisions. It offers both fee-based and free services to its customers.According to Samir Armaly
column9: executive vice president of TiVo

column12: TiVo's strategy of including Roku makes its service more ambitious. It is expected that this inclusion will bring more users to TiVo and drive the sales of TiVo's other digital goods. Therefore
column13: the deal could help the company gain larger market share.Bottom LineWe believe that recent deals with leading companies coupled with new customer wins
column14: product launches and international expansion will drive top-line growth.It should be noted that TiVo was formerly known as Rovi Corporation. Upon successfully completing the acquisition of TiVo Inc. early this September

column1: Why Apple Is Beating (and Will Keep Beating) Google in Mobile Payments;4/13/2017;"The smartphone market has historically been dominated by   Google's Android.In the most recent quarter
column2: theAlphabet
column3: Inc(NASDAQ: GOOGL) (NASDAQ: GOOG)  property controlled more   than 80% of the global mobile operating system market. You might   be tempted to believe that the company would be able to leverage   its massive installed base of devices into a commanding lead in   the area of mobile payments. While that would be an easy   conclusion to draw
column4: it's not actually the case.WhenApple Inc.(NASDAQ: AAPL) launched Apple Pay in 2014
column5: it announced that the   payment service was supported byVisa
column6: Mastercard
column7: andAmerican Express(which represented 83% of credit card purchases in the   U.S.) and was accepted at 220
column8: 000 merchant locations. One of the   criticisms at the time was that the seemingly large number only   represented about 2.4% of the approximately 8 million merchants   in the U.S. that accepted credit cards. Apple touted its NFC   antenna technology as groundbreaking
column9: but the vast majority of   merchants didn't possess the point-of-sale systems the would work   with this technology. But from these humble beginnings and early   criticisms
column10: Apple has emerged as the leader in the mobile   payments space.makeArticleAd();Image source: Getty Images.Apple Pay transaction volume up 500%During its most recent conference call
column11: Apple revealed   that the number of Apple Pay users had more than tripled over the   last year and that transaction volume was up 500% year over year.   The service has been rolled out in four new countries
column12: for a   total of 13. Apple admitted that while adoption has been slow
column13: 4   million locations that cover about 35% of all retail stores in   the U.S. now accept Apple Pay. Since Apple collects a piece of   each transaction
column14: this could eventually generate a significant   ongoing revenue stream for the company.A recent report by Statista revealed similar findings
column15: with   about 36% of U.S. retailers accepting Apple Pay. Google takes up   the second spot with Android Pay
column16: which is accepted at 24% of   merchants
column17: andSamsung(NASDAQOTH: SSNLF) offering Samsung Pay comes in third with 18%.   Apple Pay's acceptance at a significantly greater number of   merchants appears to be paying off
column18: and is likely the reason   for Apple's lead in the category.Monthly Apple Pay transactions grew 50%While one-off payments help growth
column19: regular use will be a key   driving factor. Consumer analytics firm TXN Solutionsreviewedthe transactions from over 3 million payments and reported that   the number of monthly Apple Pay transactions grew by 50% between   December 2015 and December 2016.How does this translate to overall consumer usage? Market   research firm eMarketerrevealedthat fewer than 20% of smartphone users have paid using a mobile   device in the preceding six months. That is expected to grow to   33% by 2020. Statista found that Apple Pay leads among consumers
column20: with 12% using the service
column21: while only 9% use Android Pay and 6%   use Samsung Pay.Apple leads in the growing mobile payments segment. Image     source: Pixabay.Mobile payments slowly gaining popularityWith the wide adoption of smartphones
column22: many expected that   mobile payments would gain fast acceptance
column23: but thus far it has   been slow to materialize. Numerous factors including concerns   regarding personal data security and the potential for fraud have   contributed to the slow rate of adoption by consumers. Still
column24: Statistaexpectsmobile payment transactions to grow at a rate of 52% annually to   $866 billion by 2021.The2016 North America Consumer Digital Payments   Survey(link opens PDF) byAccentureConsulting indicates that while consumers still default to   traditional payments now
column25: many report that they expect to making   more digital payments by 2020. Several key trends are at play   that will drive further mobile payment adoption. Fifty-six   percent of consumers are aware of the technology and plan to use   it in coming years. Millennials (those the report defines as   being between the ages of 18 and 34) and mass affluents (those   consumers with annual income of $100
column26: 000 or more after taxes) are   pioneering the change to digital payments
column27: with 35% of these   groups regularly using their mobile phone to make online   payments. This bodes well for Apple
column28: as market research firmMBLMin its Brand Intimacy Report found that Apple is one of themost beloved brands among millennials. Finally
column29: 73% of consumers trust their traditional credit card   providers the most when considering mobile payments
column30: which again   bodes well for Apple Pay as it pairs with existing credit   cards.Part of a growing trendApple doesn't break out the revenue generated by Apple Pay
column31: though its services segment
column32: where it is located
column33: reached a   record $7.17 billion in the first quarter of 2017
column34: up 18% over   the prior-year quarter. Apple revealed in its most recent   conference call that more than 2 million small businesses now   accept invoice payments using Apple Pay and thatComcastwould soon as well. CEO Tim Cook said the company's goal is to   double revenue from the services segment by the end of 2020.The acceptance of Apple Pay by a larger segment of retailers   appears to have resulted in greater popularity for its service.   That doesn't mean the company can rest on its laurels. Last   month
column35: Samsung launched Samsung Pay in India
column36: the world's second   most populous country
column37: ahead of both Apple Pay and Android Pay
column38: and LG announced that it would debut its own mobile payments   service in June.The field is becoming more crowded
column39: but Apple is clearly the   top dog in mobile payments
column40: and it has plenty of tailwinds to   help it maintain that spot.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column41: it can pay to listen. After all
column42: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade

column1: Should You Buy Netflix
column2: Inc. (NFLX) Stock Ahead of Earnings?;4/13/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsShares ofNetflix
column4: Inc.(NASDAQ:NFLX) have been on fire this year
column5: although some investors wouldn't touch NFLX stock with a ten-foot pole. It's volatile and it's valuation is high. But
column6: you can't ignore the global dominance Netflix has when it comes to streaming video.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockTake it from me - someone who hasn't owned Netflix stock - this one's success was hard to miss. With shares currently trading near $145
column7: investors everywhere - again
column8: including me - are kicking themselves for missing out. After all
column9: less than six months ago
column10: NFLX stock was trading below $100. Since then
column11: it's up a casual 45%.That's great for those who have been long. But
column12: are they now staring down a barrel loaded with risk?Why Netflix Ain't Your Average FlickLike we talked about withTesla Inc(NASDAQ:TSLA) just the other day
column13: Netflix stock doesn't trade based on valuation. Without a connection to valuation
column14: evaluating NFLX becomes very difficult.When weevaluated the ""FANG"" stocks
column15: two were easy -Facebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) andAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL
column16: NASDAQ:GOOG). That's because the valuations justify their stock price. The other two
column17: despite being regular components to our everyday life
column18: weren't so easy. Those two stocks were NFLX andAmazon.com
column19: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN).The 10 Best Stocks to Buy for 2017: Still the Best?Instead of trying to buy Amazon
column20: Netflix or Tesla based on valuation
column21: investors have to focus on other catalysts. Put simply
column22: these are story stocks. When the narratives are positive
column23: the stocks do well. When the narratives worsen
column24: they tank.In Netflix's case
column25: strong subscription growth and impressive content gets bulls excited. However
column26: poor global expansion execution and a miss on subscriber estimates gets the bears going.A Closer Look at NFLX StockSo
column27: if you can't value Netflix
column28: how do you trade it? How do you justify owning it? It's simple really. If you believe in the streaming trend
column29: then it makes sense to bet on the leader. Netflix isn't for everybody
column30: but for those who can stomach the volatility
column31: big gains can be had.Let's look at two charts
column32: the short-term and the long-term
column33: starting with the latter.Source: StockCharts.com2-year chartAs you can see
column34: NFLX stock went through a bit of a struggle in 2016. However
column35: it had little trouble exploding higher near the end of the year. Since it rose above $140 in January 2017
column36: though
column37: it has had trouble pushing higher (blue semi-circle). Previous resistance of $130 (blue line) could act as support for Netflix.Source: StockCharts.com7-Month ChartLooking at the short-term chart
column38: it's easier to see the consolidation near $140
column39: while support at $130 isn't so obvious. However
column40: NFLX is sitting right on its 50-day moving average. This same level was tested just a few weeks ago. Generally
column41: the more times a stock tests support or resistance
column42: the more likely it is to break.With earnings coming up
column43: though
column44: that makes this a tougher trade. Support could completely give way
column45: or it could propel NFLX stock higher.The Bottom Line for NetflixAn investor who has owned NFLX stock for many months or years is different than an investor making a move now. For active investors
column46: taking some chips off the table is rarely frowned upon. But
column47: should a correction materialize
column48: they have gains to protect against some of those losses.For new investors
column49: though
column50: buying now could mean trouble. While Netflix seems likely to report another great
column51: exciting earnings report
column52: a disappointment would cause shares to tumble. Given that NFLX stock is already up more than 40% over the last six months
column53: I'd be hesitant to initiate a new position in Netflix.7 Tech Stocks That Are a Sneeze Away From CollapsingI know for some this news won't matter. But
column54: I find it at least a little interesting that its Chief Product Officer
column55: Neil Hunt
column56: and Chief Talent Officer
column57: Tawny Cranz
column58: areleaving the company to pursue other interests. Again
column59: it may mean nothing. But
column60: two departing execs
column61: a stock that's up 45% in six months and earnings on Monday make me want to take the ""wait and see"" approach.NFLX stock could explode to new highs post-earnings. But
column62: it could also have a reasonable pullback even on good results
column63: simply because the stock's up so much. A pullback to $130 would represent a 10% decline and give investors a defined entry and exit in NFLX.The 100-day moving average currently sits at $135 and could also act as support should a pullback materialize.Bret Kenwell is the manager and author ofFuture Blue Chips. column1: PayPal vs. Visa: Which Mobile Payment Stock Should You Buy?;4/12/2017;"Over the last several years
column2: mobile payment methods have pushed their way into the transaction scene and onto the national stage with the likes of Apple Inc.'sAAPLApple Pay
column3: Alphabet Inc.'sGOOGLAndroid Pay
column4: and Samsung Pay grabbing headlines.It seems clear that the long-term transition to a more cashless
column5: mobile payment-based society is underway. But it is still very much just getting out of the starting blocks.Checks and cash still account for nearly 85% of payment transactions around the world
column6: but mobile payment has gained traction. Areported39% of U.S. mobile phone users made a mobile payment in 2015
column7: and the number could climb to nearly 70% by 2017.Still
column8: a recentWall Street Journalreport suggeststhat only 13% of the estimated 680 million iPhone users have used Apple Pay.This leaves room for payment giants PayPal Holdings
column9: Inc.PYPLand. Visa Inc.Vto grow exponentially. PayPal helped revolutionize e-commerce

The credit card giant expects the service to be available at all Visa POS terminals in Europe by 2020.In Australia

column1: Strong PC Shipments Witnessed in Q1: Gartner
column2: IDC;4/12/2017;"The two independent research firms - Gartner Inc.ITand International Data Corporation (""IDC"") - yesterday reported their worldwide PC shipment data. Although the numbers of both firms are different
column3: they have one similar opinion that the worldwide PC shipment has shown concrete signs of improvement in the very first quarter of 2017.According to Gartner
column4: although PC shipment declined year over year
column5: it is rather modest compared with several previous quarters. On the other hand
column6: as per IDC
column7: PC shipment recorded its first growth in the last five quarter.Decline Moderated - Per GartnerThe preliminary data released by Gartner showed that PC shipments in the quarter were down 2.4% year over year to 62.2 million units. The decline marked the 10th straight quarter of year-over-year fall
column8: which is the longest duration of decline in the history of the PC industry.During the quarter
column9: the industry witnessed modest growth in business PCs for the first time
column10: after several quarters of decline. However
column11: demand for consumer PCs continued to decline as various customers refrained from replacing their older PCs
column12: while some consumers stopped using PCs as they can do their work on other mobile devices.Gartner stated that among the top six vendors
column13: Asus and Acer witnessed declines in PC sales
column14: while the likes of Lenovo
column15: HP Inc.HPQ
column16: Dell and AppleAAPLrecorded growth during the first quarter. However
column17: companies under the Others category witnessed a 12% drop in PC shipments.Lenovo managed to retain its leading position with 19.9% market share. Most importantly
column18: the company registered a year-over-year increase in PC sales for the second time in a row
column19: after witnessing a decline for several quarters. Lenovo saw 1.2% growth in PC sales during the first quarter.HP Inc. and Dell were the other gainers during the quarter
column20: and recorded the fourth consecutive quarter of year-over-year growth. Holding the second spot among worldwide PC vendors
column21: HP Inc. registered 6.5% growth in PC shipments and raised its market share to 19.5% from 17.9% in the year-ago quarter. Dell
column22: which occupied the third position
column23: witnessed 3.4% growth and raised its market share to 15% from 14.2% in first-quarter 2016.After making a comeback in fourth-quarter 2016
column24: Apple continued to witness year-over-year growth in the first quarter as well. During the quarter
column25: the company's Mac sales climbed 4.5%
column26: which helped it to improve its market share to 6.8% from 6.3%. It holds the fifth spot among the top six PC vendors.Asus and Acer held the fourth and sixth spots respectively
column27: witnessing a year-over-year decline in PC shipments of 14% and 1.8%.First Growth After Five Years - Per IDCIDC stated that after witnessing decline for consecutive five years
column28: worldwide PC shipments registered its first growth in this quarter. During the first quarter
column29: PC shipments grew 0.6% year over year to about 60.3 million units. According to
column30: Jay Chou
column31: research manager
column32: IDC PCD Tracker ""The traditional PC market has been through a tough phase
column33: with competition from tablets and smartphones as well as lengthening lifecycles pushing PC shipments down roughly 30% from a peak in 2011.""The difference in data is mainly due to different techniques used for tracking PC sales as well as the inclusion and/or exclusion of certain products. For example
column34: unlike Gartner
column35: IDC includes Chromebooks
column36: which run on Alphabet Inc.'sGOOGLChrome operating system. Gartner
column37: on the other hand
column38: takes into account Microsoft Corp.MSFTtablets and ""detachables"" such as the iPad Pro and the Asus Transformer
column39: which are not taken into account by IDC.In the top vendors list too
column40: the firm has a different opinion. According to IDC
column41: HP is the leading PC vendor
column42: with 21.8% market share followed by Lenovo
column43: Dell
column44: Apple and Acer with respective market share of 20.4%
column46: 7% and 6.8%.Talking about the geographical performance
column47: IDC revealed that PC shipment in the U.S. and Asia/Pacific (excluding Japan) (APeJ) slightly declined year over year
column48: while that in Europe
column49: the Middle East and Africa (EMEA) and Japan grew marginally. Notably
column50: sales in Japan witnessed year-over-year growth for the third consecutive quarter.What's AheadAlthough
column51: both firms reported encouraging first-quarter PC shipment data
column52: their forward looking statements makes us slightly cautious about the prospects of the PC industry. Both firms agreed that the recent surge in DRAM prices and short supply of SSD will lead to an increase in PC prices.Mikako Kitagawa
column53: principal analyst at Gartner said that
column54: ""The price hike will suppress PC demand even further in the consumer market
column55: discouraging buyers away from PC purchases unless it is absolutely necessary. The price hike started affecting the market in 1Q17. This issue will grow into a much bigger problem in 2Q17
column56: and we expect it to continue throughout 2017."" IDC also predicted that consumer demand will remain under pressure.Computer - Peripheral Equipment Industry 5YR %     ReturnComputer - Peripheral Equipment Industry 5YR %     ReturnBottom LineIn the emerging markets
column57: consumers are increasingly opting for relatively inexpensive mobile computing devices
column58: such as smartphones. The increase in functionality and larger screen sizes (5 inches and above) are boosting the demand for such devices. Additionally
column59: the ongoing transformation in the way people communicate has led to the proliferation of mobile devices.Therefore
column60: we believe that PC manufacturers have to deal with cost of device to ensure long-term growth. Furthermore
column61: in our opinion
column62: PC vendors' focus on innovative products such as 2-in-1s
column63: and thin and light notebooks
column64: as well as technology enhancements can make customers opt for a new PC.According to Ms. Kitagawa
column65: principal analyst at Gartner
column66: ""While the consumer market will continue to shrink
column67: maintaining a strong position in the business market will be critical to keep sustainable growth in the PC market. Winners in the business segment will ultimately be the survivors in this shrinking market."" He further cautioned
column68: ""Vendors who do not have a strong presence in the business market will encounter major problems
column69: and they will be forced to exit the PC market in the next five years. However
column70: there will also be specialized niche players with purpose-built PCs
column71: such as gaming PCs and ruggedized laptops.""From the long-term perspective
column72: PCs have to compete with mobile computing devices. The decline will hurt the business prospects of companies like HP Inc.
column73: Intel Corp.INTC

column1: Top Executives Keep Fleeing Uber
column2: Is the Ride-Hailing Giant Doomed?;4/12/2017;"Uber Technologies Inc. has taken another hit to its public image
column3: and this time there might be no one left to clean up the mess. Rachel Whetstone
column4: Uber's communications chief
column5: announced Tuesday she would be leaving the ride-hailing giant while the company faces an onslaught of public relations nightmares.Whetstone
column6: a former executive at Alphabet Inc.'sGOOGLGoogle who joined Uber in 2015
column7: resigned without giving reason. It is still unclear what prompted Whetstone to leave in the midst of a pivotal time for Uber
column8: but the timing seems a little odd given that PR disasters have piled up recently.Her second in command
column9: Jill Hazelbaker
column10: is set to take over the position
column11: which has become more important than ever.Whetstone's departure marks theseventh high-rankingUber employee to depart from the company in 2017 alone. Not all of them left on bad terms
column12: but Ed Baker
column13: head of product and growth
column14: resigned after the company's internal workplace culture investigation ramped up.Many of the top Uber employees supposedly left on good terms
column15: but it seems hard to think the massive amount of recent public
column16: political
column17: and legal backlash had nothing to do with it.But does the mass executive-level exodus signal Uber is doomed to fail? Or is the company that is currently valued at almost $70 billion just experiencing growing pains?Potential Long Term ProblemsAmong other things
column18: Uber is looking intoclaims of rampant sexual harassmentat the company's corporate offices. The company is alsofighting a lawsuitfrom Google's self-driving leg Waymo
column19: which claims Uber stole a ton of its proprietary self-driving car technology.More recently
column20: Pittsburgh Mayor Bill Peduto voiced his concern that Uber wasnot pulling its weight financiallyin the agreement to test its self-driving car technology in the city. Pittsburgh one of the only places in the U.S. willing to let Uber test its new technology.Travis Kalanick recently apologized for a video that went viral of the Uber CEO berating and demeaning an Uber driver while he was a passenger. In wake of the incident
column21: Kalanick
column23: also recently admitted that he needed management guidance.It is a positive sign that Uber's CEO admitted to needing some guidance in order to help drive his company forward during rocky times. The only problem is that no one with the proper experience has stepped up to the plate yet.Scandal is not a good thing for any company
column24: and it could prove to very bad for Uber as it looks into the possibility of going public in the next couple of years. Still
column25: despite the controversies and a need to bolster leadership
column26: things are not all bad for Uber.It's Not All BadIn today's mile-a-minute world
column27: people simply forget things. It seems like ages since the""Delete Uber"" hashtagfirst popped up. Even though the company and its controversial CEO are still taking deserved heat almost daily
column28: the rider numbers speak to a different narrative.The head of Uber North America's operations
column29: Rachel Holt
column30: spoke with reporters in late March about the ride-hailing company's eye-popping rider numbers. ""In fact
column31: in our most mature country
column32: we've grown faster in the first 10 weeks of 2017 than in the first 10 weeks of 2016
column33: Holt said. ""Looking at less-mature regions
column34: trips were up 600% in February
column35: year on year.""Holt did not go into any further details about the privately held company's most recent numbers
column36: but it seems that even as Uber tries to navigate a tumultuous and sometimes toxic road
column37: many riders cannot resist the convenience and ubiquity of the ride-hailing company's service.Head herefor a more in-depth look at Uber's competition
column38: controversy
column39: and the possibility of a 2017 IPO.Looking for Ideas with Even Greater   Upside?Most of Zacks' investment ideas are short-term

column1: Dow Loses Support for First Time Since Election Day;4/12/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsU.S. equities finished lower in relatively quiet trading on Wednesday. Big picture: Stocks continue in their listless
column3: ultra-tight
column4: two-month consolidation range. But on a purely technical basis
column5: something major did occur: TheDow Jones Industrial Averageclosed below its 50-day moving average
column6: a key technical support level for the first time since November.makeArticleAd();The catalyst for the decline were lingering concerns about the geopolitical outlook (amid hotpots in Syria and North Korea concerning both Russia and China) as well as ongoing reports pooh-poohing the likelihood of action on tax reform before the end of the year.In the end
column7: the Dow lost 0.3%
column8: theS&P 500lost 0.4%
column9: theNasdaq Compositegave back 0.5% and theRussell 2000was 1.3% lower. Treasury bonds were stronger
column10: the dollar was weaker
column11: gold gained 0.3% and oil broke a string of gains to decline 0.5%.Defensive utility and telecom stocks led the way with gains of 0.6% while industrial were the laggards
column12: down 1.3%. Breadth was heavily negative
column13: with decliners outpacing advancers on the NYSE by a ratio of 2.2 to 1. NYSE volume was 86% of the 30-day average.10 Hopeless Stocks to Wash From Your Portfolio ForeverBlackberry Ltd(NASDAQ:BBRY) gained 16% after being awarded some $814 million in an arbitration settlement withQualcomm

column1: Facebook Inc (FB): Itâ€™s Not Too Late to Buy FB Stock;4/12/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsI confess thatFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) never appealed to me as an investment. I avoid momentum stocks anyway
column3: and I didn't really believe that meaningful revenue would be generated by Mark Zuckerberg & Co. I was dead wrong.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockFacebook has become a digital billboard
column4: generating a massive 98% of its revenue from ads
column5: which can be a terrific business. Now
column6: more than 5 million businesses advertise on Facebook.com.As technology improved and the ability to ascertain return on investment became more and more efficient
column7: finding which sources for eyeballs would pay the best became easier. I never thought FB stock would be such a place
column8: but here we are.Not only that
column9: but FB has gotten even better at figuring out how to leverage its users into generating more revenue
column10: and a lot of that is happening via mobile. It makes sense
column11: of course
column12: because the entire world is mobile at this point and emerging markets are moving out of 2G into higher speeds.Thus
column13: FB stock has soared because it really owns the display side of generating digital ad revenue
column14: whileAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column15: NASDAQ:GOOGL) owns the search side of the business.10 Blue-Chip Stocks That Will Bleed for the Rest of 2017I'm going to do some number-crunching here. I don't want to overwhelm
column16: but you'll see how FB stock price is going up on the backs of some impressive growth as shown in Q4:Daily Active Users (or DAUs): 1.23 billion
column17: geographically well-diversified with the U.S. & Canada at 15%
column18: Europe at 21%
column19: Asia-Pacific coming in at 32%
column20: and the rest of the globe also at 32%.Mobile DAUs: 1.15 billionMonthly Active Users (also known as MAUs): 1.86 billionMobile MAUs: 1.74 billionGrowth in ad revenue for Q4
column21: year-over-year was an astonishing 53% to $8.63 billion.Not only are users growing
column22: but the average revenue per monthly active user (or ARPU) is off the charts for North America
column23: climbing from $9 in Q4 of 2014 to $13.70 in 2015 (more than 50%!) and $19.81 last year
column24: up nearly 50%.Going back to this idea that mobile revenue growth is exploding on the backs of improving mobile technology
column25: mobile revenue in Q4 of 2014 was $2.5 billion. It nearly tripled to $7.2 billion last year.When you look at the entire digital ad spend these days
column26: it is dominated by Facebook and Google.I hate the idea that 98% of a company's revenues comes from one thing. Diversification means everything to me. However
column27: I cannot argue with the fact that FB is the 800-pound gorilla in the space.There are only three things that can upset the apple cart for FB stock
column28: and neither seem like they could ever be permanently damaging. First
column29: it is possible that something else appears that makes Facebook decline in popularity. This seems extremely unlikely at this point in time. Barring some kind of horrendous PR disaster that causes Facebook to implode
column30: I don't take this threat seriously.Second
column31: it is possible that the number of users is being misreported. How FB actually determines the number of users and how active they are is what matters here
column32: and if advertisers ever lose confidence in that data
column33: they could run for the hills. I'm not suggesting that this is the case
column34: but if it were
column35: then there would be trouble.Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Won't Hit $1000 Like ThisFinally
column36: a severe recession could cripple advertising spending. The thing about this is that it would be temporary. The financial crisis took a toll on companies that relied on ad revenue
column37: but it came back. Facebook's balance sheet is a fortress
column38: so little would be impacted.FB stock trades at 40 times its earnings. And now
column39: I can't say it's unreasonable considering its growth rate.Lawrence Meyers is the CEO of PDL Capital
column40: and manager of the forthcomingLiberty Portfolio stock newsletter. As of this writing
column41: he has no position in any stock mentioned. He has 22 years' experience in the stock market
column42: and has written more than 1

column1: Tech Roundup: TWTR Sues
column2: Surface Tops iPad
column3: MSFT Scorpio;4/12/2017;"Last week
column4: the big technology companies saw limited movement in share prices amidst news that TwitterTWTRsued the government
column5: Microsoft'sMSFTSurface beat Apple'sAAPLiPad in customer satisfaction
column6: the Xbox Project Scorpio reveal and Intel'sINTCMcAfee spinoff (announced last year).Here are the details-Twitter Sues Then Withdraws Suit Against U.S.   GovernmentThe government sent an order to Twitter to reveal the IP addresses and phone numbers of an account called @ALT_uscis that had been trolling President Donald Trump about his immigration policies mostly with respect to Mexico. The account was created in January with its 9
column7: 000 tweets garnering it 120
column8: 000 followers.Twitter sued the Department of Homeland Security and US Customs and Border Protection to block the order
column9: claiming that it was ""unlawfully abusing a limited-purpose investigatory tool"" (related to import of counterfeit goods)
column10: especially since the person behind the account was merely criticizing Trump and there was no evidence to suggest that it was engaged in criminal activity.The following day
column11: Twitter lawyer Mark Flanagan said that the summons had been withdrawn and that the demand ""no longer has any force or effect."" Further details weren't available.Surface Beats iPadMicrosoft may finally have achieved what it set out to do when it introduced the first Surface several years ago. Despite its less-than-satisfactory features
column12: Microsoft continued to pitch the product against Apple's popular iPad while quickly learning from its mistakes to make better and better iterations. Microsoft needed in on the BYOD market
column13: which was rapidly eating into its share of PCs.Fast forward to today and J.D. Power's 2017 U.S. Tablet Satisfaction Study reveals that Microsoft's Surface brings greater satisfaction to customers than Apple's iPad and tablets from Samsung
column14: LG
column15: Amazon
column16: Acer and Asus
column17: beating all the devices on three counts: Internet connectivity
column18: availability of official accessories and the variety of pre-installed applications.Its attractiveness
column19: materials quality and size were also considered better than the iPad. Moreover
column20: according to the study
column21: people who want the latest technology
column22: or want something as capable as a laptop are opting for the Surface more often than the iPad.Apple still sells more tablets than anyone else.Microsoft Project Scorpio RevealMicrosoft has developed a brand new gaming console in an initiative it calls Project Scorpio. The primary goal appears to be to handle 4K video at 60 frames per second
column23: but according to Eurogamer's Digital Foundry
column24: which did an independent check
column25: there will be power to spare for additional visual improvements.There were probably a  couple of reasons why Microsoft's XB One wasn't very successful
column26: the first being its aspiration to capture every kind of gamer from the casual to the most serious and the second being its uncompetitive price. With this console Microsoft has made its choice: it's going full throttle for the hard core gamer.This looks like a better strategy since casual gamers will be slower to adopt a console anyway because they might satisfy their needs with a mobile device or make do with cheaper alternatives.  But a hard core gamer needs a console because nothing else will do. So this is a better segment to target your console at.The pricing issue is trickier although the current market guesstimate is between $400 and $600. Some say it could go higher because the BOM cost is higher for this device and because hard-core gamers don't mind spending. Others say that it will lose out to Sony's PS4 Pro despite being more powerful if the pricing isn't right.Intel Spins Off McAfeeIntel has completed the deal to spin off Intel Security as it refocuses its efforts on the cloud.McAfee for its part gets increased agility to better address security concerns that are changing rapidly given the advent of the Internet of Things (IoT) as well as the increased connectivity of emerging markets
column27: both of which are creating new opportunities. Tech Crunch says that currently
column28: McAfee secures two-thirds of the world's 2
column29: 000 largest companies and grew its revenue 11% in the first half of 2016.Intel spent $7.8 billion to buy McAfee seven years ago and TPG is now getting a 51% stake in a deal worth $4.2 billion. Intel initially killed the brand and regrouped the business under Intel Security
column30: but with the spin-off
column31: McAfee is back in the game.TickerPrice Change Last WeekPrice Change Last 6 MonthsAAPL-0.22%+25.67%FB-0.89%+9.39%GOOGL-0.67%+3.87%MSFT-0.27%+13.33%CSCO-2.49%+4.70%AMZN+0.94%+9.65%Other storiesCorporateApple Moving Beyond Imagination: Apple GPU supplier Imagination Technologies has issued a press release saying that Apple will stop using its technology in new products within the next 15-24 months. There's a lot of speculation about why Apple is doing this
column32: despite the fact that the press release says that Apple will be sing independently developed GPU designs.Imagination says that Apple is unlikely to be able to do it without infringing on its patents
column33: so it expects that licensing revenue will be down but not out. But it's also true that the iPhone maker has been recruiting a large number of GPU engineers and history says that it can do it (as in the case of its CPU design).GPU technology is very important not only for its flagship line of iPhones
column34: but also for emerging new markets like AR/VR and auto
column35: so it's very unlikely that Apple is bluffing about its technology. Unless it's working to pressure Imagination prices and then buy out the company
column36: something that it could do very easily given its cash hoard.Apple India News: The Indian daily Economic Times has reported that given the institution of goods and services tax (GST)
column37: it will become hard for Apple to obtain specific customs duty exemptions and freight subsidies for the products it is getting ready to assemble at the Bangalore plant.  Meanwhile
column38: the App Accelerator center in Bangalore kicked off last week with minimum fanfare.Apple's goal here is to collaborate with local developers to make suitable apps for the Apple ecosystem. Which may be just what Apple needs as Counterpoint Research estimates that there will be a billion netizens in India by 2020. A Google and BCG study says that Indian smartphone users in 2020 will be 520 million. That is huge potential and Apple is getting in at the right time.Facebook News Literacy Project: FacebookFB
column39: along with organizations like Craig Newmark Philanthropic Fund
column40: Ford Foundation
column41: Democracy Fund
column42: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation
column43: Tow Foundation
column44: AppNexus
column45: Mozilla and Betaworks is forming a group to which they will contribute $14 million to tailor how consumers read news. The initiative is being called The News Integrity Initiative and is Facebook's way of making mends with the ""fake news"" attack on its platform. Urban Dictionary describes ""fake news"" really well: A term formerly useful for describing websites consisting entirely of intentionally fabricated news stories
column46: but now used to describe virtually anything that does not mesh with one's own views.YouTube Go in India: Alphabet'sGOOGLYouTube Go
column47: supporting English and the Indian languages Hindi
column48: Bengali
column49: Tamil
column50: Marathi
column51: Telugu
column52: Kannada
column53: Gujarati and Malayalam
column54: launched its beta version last week. This is basically a data-light app offering recommendations and trending videos from your area when you open the app
column55: with an option to watch the preview of any video before you decide to play it or download for offline viewing.As may be expected
column56: the video won't be too great because 640p resolution is the best that it can do. But it does allow you to decide how much data you want to use on each video and also lets you share video with friends near you without using any data (through Wi-Fi direct and Bluetooth).Amazon Creating Jobs: AmazonAMZNis creating 5
column57: 000 new part time Virtual Customer Service positions as part of its initiative to add 30
column58: 000 part-time positions in the U.S. over the next year. This is in addition to the 100
column59: 000 full-time full-benefit jobs it has promised to create over the next 18 months. Part timers spending more than 20 hours a week will be considered for other benefits including Amazon's Career Choice program that pre-pays 95% of tuition for courses related to in-demand fields.Legal/RegulatoryACCC Takes Apple to Court: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) has sued Apple for alleged false
column60: misleading
column61: or deceptive representations about consumers' rights under the Australian Consumer Law. The ACCC has found upon investigation that Apple generally avoided looking at or servicing a customer's device if he had earlier taken it to a third party
column62: even if the third party's fix wasn't related to the defect before Apple. ACCC Chairman Rod Sims said
column63: ""Consumer guarantee rights under the Australian Consumer Law exist independently of any manufacturer's warranty and are not extinguished simply because a consumer has goods repaired by a third party.""Germany Law on Fake News: Germany has created legislation that says that social networks will be fined as much as 50 million euros ($53 million) if they fail to give users the option to complain about hate speech and fake news or refuse to remove illegal content. Two categories were added to another bill that makes corporate officials responsible for noncompliance with fines up to $5 million. The first requires the compulsory removal of content that has been flagged as child porn. The second is really ridiculous but mentions content inciting terrorism. While Merkel's party backed these two inclusions
column64: this bill hasn't been passed yet.Facebook Loses New York Case:  The New York Court of Appeals
column65: while recognizing the privacy concerns
column66: has upheld the decision of a lower court that Facebook didn't have the legal right to appeal a search warrants order in a criminal case. The case involves search warrants on 381 Facebook account holders who were allegedly involved in a disability benefits fraud case against New York City police and fire retirees. Five of the six judges were in favor of the ruling while the only dissenting judge said that Facebook was denied ""any meaningful recourse"" against the ""en masse"" data seizure. Facebook may take the matter to the federal courts.New Technology/ProductsFacebook Testing Workplace: Facebook is testing a free version of Workplace
column67: the walled-off social networking service for office workers that it's referring to as the ""Standard"" edition. The paid version
column68: called ""Premium"" is more secure
column69: but offering the same basic services like chatting and collaboration
column70: and including specialized versions of Facebook Live and News Feed. This is a crowded market including Microsoft's Teams
column71: Slack and Google's Hangouts Chat (part of G Suite) although the others are yet to offer a free version.M&A and CollaborationsFacebook Collaboration in Korea: Facebook is planning on sprucing up its AR/VR tech by tapping into the Korean market. So it is working in collaboration with Korea Innovation Center (KIC) and the Institute for Information & Communications Technology Promotion (IITP)
column72: both managed by the Ministry of Science
column73: ICT and Future Planning. As part of the ministry's Technology Revolution Together initiative
column74: in which it seeks to help startups go global
column75: it has identified 138 prospects eligible to work with Oculus
column76: Facebook's VR arm
column77: of which 30 have indicated interest.Amazon Deal with NFL: The National Football League has now given Amazon the rights to live stream 10 Thursday night football games for the 2017 season. Amazon is paying $50 million
column78: which is 5x the 10 million Twitter paid last year. But then
column79: Twitter is totally dependent on advertising
column80: while for Amazon
column81: advertising is more of an experiment (although on track to fetch a billion dollars this year). Amazon will be streaming to Prime members
column82: so it must expect Prime member additions. This will of course help it sell much more than a football game (products
column83: video
column84: music
column85: sports)
column86: which allows it to offer the higher price.Some NumbersApple Places Huge OLED Order: According to a report in the Nikkei Asian Review
column87: which was based on a supply chain source

column89: which is often the case. Apple is expected to launch three new iPhones this year.iPhone 8 Price Cut Likely: It had been rumored that Apple's new iPhone would cost somewhere around $1000
column90: but it now appears that only the high-end model could reach that high. A research report from UBS analyst Steven Milunovich reportedly says that Apple usually prices its low-end model at the mid-range market. So since Samsung's new Galaxy S8 and S8 Plus phones with their 5.8-inch and 6.2-inch displays cost $720 and $840
column91: respectively

column93: this means Apple will make a lower profit
column94: so its gross margins will be something to watch.Android Is Most Popular OS: Mainly because of the smartphone becoming the primary device to access the Internet
column95: the secular decline in traditional PC sales and the emergence of Asia as the biggest market for connected devices

column97: Android garnered a 37.93% share of Internet usage compared to Windows' 37.91%.While Microsoft still dominates the desktop

Google's Android and Chrome strategies remain hazy and with these stats there are now renewed speculations about their merger.HPE Lowers Outlook: After the spin out and merger of its enterprise services group with Computer Sciences Corp

column1: Trade Goldman Sachs Group Inc (GS) Stock and Win No Matter What;4/12/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsSince the 2016 U.S. elections
column3: banks have been on a tear. In particular
column4: Goldman Sachs Group Inc(NYSE:GS) finally recovered the highs from 2007. They have since given back about $25 per share
column5: but the fundamental outlook for GS stock still is promising.makeArticleAd();Source:Erik DrostAs long as President Trump is committed to loosening the regulatory strings
column6: banks should have a shallow bottom. Furthermore
column7: the U.S. Fed is in a tightening cycle and that also should provide support to GS stock.I am not one to chase target prices
column8: so I am not calling for a buy signal here. In fact
column9: I see a technical threat where GS could lose another $15 if it fails to rebound from here. If  that happens then the $200 area should provide some support since it has been pivotal and GS bulls are likely to fight for it once again.Regardless

column14: I am committed to owning it at $160. Anything below $157 per share would accrue losses. Essentially

column16: however. That said

column20: such asCitigroup Inc(NYSE:C)
column21: so we could get a preview of how traders will react to GS earnings.Learn options as easy as 1-2-3here. Nicolas Chahine is the managing director ofSellSpreads.com. As of this writing

You can follow him on Twitter at@racernicand stocktwits at@racernic.More From InvestorPlaceAlphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Won't Hit $1000 Like ThisThe 11 Best Dividend Stocks to Buy7 Tech Stocks That Are a Sneeze Away From CollapsingThe postTrade Goldman Sachs Group Inc (GS) Stock and Win No Matter Whatappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Do Millennials Care About Stocks?;4/12/2017;"Welcome to Episode #77 of the Zacks Market Edge Podcast.Every week

column8: and Parth Panchal
column9: a Zacks intern and finance major at Loyola of Chicago
column10: to discuss Millennials and investing.There's a myth that Millennials are all broke

column12: and have so much college debt it prohibits them from doing things

column17: yes

column21: even the history major

column14: to express concern about Alphabet's core advertising business. Concerns about cost-per-click (CPC) rates did pressure GOOGL stock a few years back

column16: despite 4 points of currency headwinds.Google-owned properties saw growth accelerate to 22% from 16% the year before. The AdSense business (which Google refers to as Google Network Members) is seeing smaller sales increases
column17: but still grew more than 3% in each of the past two years. Meanwhile
column18: ""other"" Google revenue jumped up 41%
column19: which the 10-K attributed to app sales through Google Play.Looking forward
column20: however
column21: there are legitimate concerns. Competition is only going to increase
column22: in particular from social media giantsFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) andSnap Inc(NYSE:SNAP). Both companies - along withTwitter Inc(NYSE:TWTR)
column23: although I'm highly skeptical of TWTR's chances - can offer more direct
column24: more personally tailored advertising options. And
column25: of course
column26: Amazon represents a real threat to Alphabet. That company hasa strong ad opportunity of its own
column27: and at least one analyst believes the Amazon Echo couldpressure the entire search modellonger-term.Even in recent numbers
column28: there are concerns. The most notable is that cost-per-click continues to decline
column29: largely a result of the continuing shift to mobile. The AdSense business is rather stagnant at this point. Growth in Android usage and increasing share for the Chrome browser and Google Docs have helped
column30: but those tailwinds will fade
column31: if only due to the already-large proportion Google owns in both markets.There's a real
column32: ""okay
column33: then what?"" concern about what happens to GOOGL stock once ""click growth"" slows.Alphabet Isn't WinningWith GOOGL stock still pricing in a reasonable amount of growth
column34: Alphabet must succeed beyond advertising. Its early efforts haven't been promising
column35: asNest simply hasn't grownthe way Google expected. What's more
column36: two key executives on theGoogle Fiber project were reassigned last week
column37: implying a retreat from that initiative; Google Home is behind the Echo; and Google's cloud hosting similarly trails both Amazon and Microsoft's Azure.Waymo's role in self-driving cars is yet to be determined
column38: admittedly. The Pixel smartphone is an opportunity (although many companies have failed in that space
column39: including Amazon and Microsoft). And investors do need to remember that the company is spending lavishly outside of Search.The ""Other Bets"" category lost about $3 billion last year
column40: a significant headwind to earnings (almost $4 per share after-tax). Even if Alphabet has to pull back on some of these initiatives - as appears to be the case with Google Fiber - earnings will benefit. But if ad growth slows to single-digit growth
column41: there's probably not enough to support the current price of GOOGL stock.GOOGL Stock Looks FamiliarAll told
column42: GOOGL stock is more dangerous than it looks. Alphabet's current situation reminds me quite a bit of what Microsoft looked like at the end of the past decade. Microsoft's dominant PC platforms - Windows and Office - were still growing
column43: but it was clear that pressure was on the way. For the most part
column44: Microsoft's efforts to diversify did not work.Buy These 3 Airline Stocks Instead of United Continental Holdings Inc Stock (UAL)MSFT stock subsequently traded at a low-teen multiple to earnings
column45: barely moving for several years until optimism surrounding ""the cloud"" provided a tailwind.It's not hard to imagine a similar fate for GOOGL stock over the next few years. If advertising slows
column46: as seems likely
column47: and Alphabet can't find a secondary driver
column48: which seems possible
column49: then GOOGL isn't going to hit $1
column50: 000 or anywhere close. That's one possible scenario investors need to keep in mind.As of this writing

column1: How Chesapeake Energy Corporation (CHK) Stock Could Double;4/11/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsChesapeake Energy Corporation(NYSE:CHK) analysts expect CHK to turn a profit of 75 cents per share this year. Next year
column3: that could easily rise to above $1 per share. Its sales growth should average 15% a year in the next couple of years and total sales could reach $11 billion by the end of 2018. Even with depressed oil prices
column4: Chesapeake Energy is well on the way to doubling.makeArticleAd();Source:Philadelphia 76ers Via FlickrAccording to an article inthe Economistmagazine last year
column5: more than 90% of producers can turn a buck even if oil prices fall to $30 per barrel.That's because oil-rich countries
column6: such as Iran and Saudi Arabia
column7: operate national oil giants that can extract a barrel of oil (or an equivalent
column8: such as natural gas) out of the ground for less than $10 per barrel. U.S.-based shale producers have production costs closer to $15 per barrel.The above helps explain why OPEC
column9: the giant oil cartel
column10: hasn't had much luck with cutting production to try and boost oil prices. Even at $50 per barrel
column11: which is still half what it sold for a couple of years ago
column12: most producers can still make a profit by producing at their existing wells.The Appeal of Chesapeake EnergyChesapeake Energy shares currently trade at just over $6 per share
column13: so at first glance the single digit price-earnings ratio looks quite compelling. Unfortunately
column14: the company is being punished for its past when it spent billions of dollars buying oil and gas fields back when energy was booming and oil prices were around $100 per barrel.That buying binge resulted in a rather large write-down of many properties in its portfolio. In 2015
column15: itwrote off $18.2 billionof those investments and lost $22.43 per share. It also pushed shareholders' equity (or book value) into negative territory
column16: meaning the company has lost money for shareholders since it was founded.Yet
column17: the company has stayed in business
column18: and conditions are improving. Last year's loss was only $6.45 per share (compared to $22.43 previously) and debt is being whittled down by asset sales. Total long-term debt ended last year below $10 billion. Its gas properties are valued on the books at $66.5 billion
column19: and its total portfolio qualifies it as one of the largest natural gas producers in the United States.Shale gas producers
column20: or those that rely on fracking to extract oil and gas from the ground
column21: have proven frustratingly resilient to OPEC. They continuously innovate to lower production costs and stay afloat
column22: even though energy costs remain depressed.Despite its past overinvestment at the peak of the market
column23: Chesapeake Energy is still a major player in the industry. Yet the market still has concerns about its survival.CHK plans to reduce debt by $2 billion to $3 billion""over the next few years through additional asset sales.""It has a net-debt-to-Ebitda (one of the most common ways to analyze how large a firm's debt load is) goal of 2x
column24: which would make its overall debt load quite manageable.As with most companies
column25: future cash flow is key for CHK stock. But in Chesapeake's case
column26: it is especially important. Its stated goal is to ""achieve cash flow neutrality in 2018.""Bottom Line on Chesapeake EnergyDebt-rating firm Moody's hasa positive outlookon much of Chesapeake's outstanding debt. It has noted that the company is reducing debt and plans to generate positive cash flow as soon as is reasonably possibly. It sees plenty of available liquidity
column27: meaning the firm should be able to continue to raise debt as needed.Moody's would likely downgrade Chesapeake's debt if production growth slows again
column28: cash flow goals aren't met or liquidity dries up. These situations seem unlikely
column29: and the fact the company is expected to report a profit while oil prices are low
column30: is encouraging.As with most energy producers
column31: Chesapeake Energy would breathe a huge sigh of relief if oil prices increased from current levels. A jump to $60 a share or more in oil prices could cause CHK stock to rally rather significantly
column32: as earnings would increase further and liquidity concerns would be further allayed.But as it stands currently
column33: even with $50 oil
column34: CHK should be able to work to improve its balance sheet and boost cash flow. If it can keep its operations stable
column35: shares could easily double from current levels
column36: and that would represent an earnings multiple in the low-teens
column37: based off analyst profit expectations from next year.Chesapeake's low P/E also compares favorably to rivals.Range Resources Corp.(NYSE:RRC) trades at more than 30 times earnings expectations for 2018.Antero Resources Corp(NYSE:AR) is more reasonable at 17x for the same period
column38: but this is still well below Chesapeake's multiple.Amazon.com
column39: Inc. (AMZN) Stock: $1 Trillion Doesn't MatterInvesting in CHK stock represents a higher risk/higher potential reward play in the industry. Trouble could appear if oil happens to slide back toward $30 per barrel. In this respect
column40: safer and more diversified players
column41: includingExxon Mobil Corporation(NYSE:XOM) orBp plc (ADR)(NYSE:BP)
column42: make more sense.As of this writing
