column72: edit documents
column73: browse the web
column74: watch videos and reply to messages directly from the smartphone on a larger display.An Android desktop experience is also possible by attaching a mouse and keyboard. The phone should be lapped up by consumers but may also have enterprise appeal. Samsung has announced that Citrix and VMware are partners enabling virtualization technologies to work with the phone.Intel Talks 10nm Tech: At its first Technology and Manufacturing Day
column75: Intel has said that it will have 14nm++ technology out this year
column76: offering a 26% performance bump over its 14nm iteration and 12.5% over its 14nm+ tech released last year. It will also offer 20% better transistor performance over competing 14nm and 16nm technology. Intel is making this possible through what it calls hyper scaling technologies that have enabled it to offer superior PPA (Performance
column77: Power
column78: Area) than competitors. It's also using a lithography technology called Self Aligned Dual Patterning for its 14nm
column79: which will be followed up with Self Aligned Quad Patterning for 10nm.Intel thinks that these technologies will enable it to maintain its PPA lead over competing technologies. But the danger remains given that competitors will be moving to 10nm this year and Intel probably won't do that until 2019
column80: at which time they will be serving up 7nm chips. Intel chips may lose their edge around that time
column81: unless there's more in store.Cisco to Separate Networking Software: CiscoCSCOappears to be caving in under the increased competitive pressure in the switching business. The company is now planning to separately sell the networking software that it previously sold along with its switches. This will allow its existing and new customers to use the software along with cheaper switches from competitors such as Broadcom. There should be a resultant negative impact on its switching revenue as some hardware sales will be lost.Cortana to Access Android Lock Screen: Microsoft has signaled its entry into the personal assistant space with the announcement that Cortana will have access to Android's locked screen

column1: Google AI Just Beat Human Pathologists at Detecting Cancer;4/4/2017;"The science of deep learning
column2: a sub-discipline ofartificial intelligence(AI)
column3: is only a recent development in the grand scheme of   things
column4: but during its short existence
column5: it has been producing   some impressive technological achievements. Advances in image   recognition
column6: language understanding
column7: and translation have led to   the development ofvirtual assistants
column8: smart home speakers
column9: gainsincybersecurity
column10: and are leading the charge towardautonomous driving. Now
column11: companies have found a way to use those AI smarts to fight   cancer.Deep learninginvolves the construction of artificial neural networks
column12: using   software and complex algorithms to recreate the capacity of the   human brain to learn. These learning computers have a particular   knack for sifting through vast amounts of data and recognizing   patterns
column13: getting smarter as they go. The first breakthrough   involved feeding a system thousands of pictures of cats
column14: until   the program was able to recognize a cat on its own.GoogLeNet AI provides groundbreaking cancer research! Image     source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();Recognizing breast cancer tumorsThis ability to identify patterns has led to a significant   breakthrough in the area of breast cancer research. Last month
column15: in a paper titledDetecting Cancer Metastases on Gigapixel Pathology     Images
column16: Alphabet Inc.(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) division Google announced that it   had created a neural network that could analyze medical images   and identify tumors with a greater degree of accuracy than human   pathologists. The study revealed that the company
column17: using   its GoogLeNet AI
column18: reviewed thousands of medical images   supplied by a Dutch university and was able to identify malignant   tumors in breast cancer images with an 89% accuracy rate
column19: compared to 73% for its human counterparts. In ablog
column20: Google researchers explained:Pathologists are responsible for reviewing all the     biological tissues visible on a slide. However
column21: there can be     many slides per patient
column22: each of which is 10+ gigapixels when     digitized at 40X magnification. Imagine having to go through a     thousand 10 megapixel (MP) photos
column23: and having to be responsible     for every pixel. Needless to say
column24: this is a lot of data to     cover
column25: and often time is limited.This technology has the potential to provide initial   screenings
column26: allowing doctors to review only those images that   have been flagged as potentially cancerous. The system still   requires improvement
column27: as it generated a number of false positives   -- identifying cancerous cells where none were present. So
column28: while   AI won't be replacing pathologists anytime soon
column29: these algorithms   could be used to pre-screen images and not only reduce the   workload on doctors
column30: but also serve parts of the world where   pathologists are in short supply.IBM enhances Watson's ability to ""see"" medical images. Image     source: IBM.Watson reads medical imagesGoogle isn't the only one testing AI for this purpose. Nearly   a year ago
column31: International Business Machines Corporation(NYSE: IBM) partnered with numerous health systems
column32: imaging   technology companies
column33: and academic medical centers to trainWatson AI
column34: its cognitive computer
column35: to read medical images. This more   broadly based collaboration is focusing on cancer
column36: cardiovascular   disease
column37: eye health
column38: and diabetes. The company announced last   month that it had expanded that initiative to 24 organizations   worldwide
column39: which will provide the vital input necessary to train   the system. IBM also announced the first fruits of this endeavor
column40: an application for the detection of one type of cardiovascular   disease involving a narrowing of the heart's aortic valve. It   plans to expand Watson's efforts to a variety of additional   cardiovascular conditions in the near future.Watson is already seeing success in a number ofmedical applications. In its most impressive results in the field to date
column41: Watsonreviewedthe medical records of 1
column42: 000 cancer patients and was able to   develop a treatment plan that concurred with oncologists'   recommendations with 99% accuracy. The AI was also able to   provide additional recommendations in about 30% of cases that had   been missed by doctors
column43: thanks to its ability to review   even the most recent medical research.The future of medicineNeither company provides specific information regarding how   these AI-related medical breakthroughs would contribute to the   overall business
column44: and any contribution would represent only a   minuscule part of each company's total revenue at this juncture.   These are still extremely early developments
column45: but they illustrate   the vast potential of AI in the not-too-distant future.These AI algorithms won't be replacing your doctor
column46: but they   might just make them more efficient. AI and its applications to   medicine are still in early days
column47: but I wouldn't be surprised to   hear more groundbreaking announcements in the near future.10 stocks we like better than Alphabet (A       shares)When investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock       tip
column48: it can pay to listen. After all
column49: the newsletter they       have run for over a decade

column51: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now...and Alphabet (A shares)       wasn't one of them! That's right -- they think these 10       stocks are even better buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of February 6

column4: with the intention of attracting outside companies and initiating what amounts to
column5: essentially
column6: an auction of its most valuable asset.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockIn early February
column7: Barron'sreported that Toshiba execs were apparently consideringthe sale of the NAND businessto offset the company's debt. At the time
column8: "" Toshiba's equity [had] dropped to negative $1.7 billion
column9: so it needs to come up with at least that much cash to stay afloat.""That negative equity was the result of a $6.3 billion write-down
column10: which apparently stemmed from""accounting regularities""and ""overstated profits"" of more than $1.2 billion and ultimately led to the resignation of the company's chairman.Initially

column12: but nothing came of that

column15: with more than two-thirds of shareholders approving the proposal.International Ramifications of Toshiba's NAND Flash MemoryToshiba's NAND flash memory business has been described as the company's crown jewel
column16: and rightly so. In 1984
column17: Toshibainvented flash memoryand in1989 released NAND flash memory chips. Simply put
column18: NAND flash memory is""non-volatile storage technology that does not require power to retain data.""This technology has become the international standard for temporary data storage (i.e.
column19: USB thumb drives
column20: MP3 players and other devices where files are frequently overwritten).The 5 Best Stocks to Buy for AprilSince offering a 20% stake in the business didn't yield any viable bids
column21: the company seemingly has no choice but to sell the entire unit. With flash memory being one of the largest pieces of technology found in everything from smartphones to automobiles to modern kitchen appliances
column22: the owner of that business will have immediate influence on the global flash memory market. This thesis is supported by estimates from Nomura
column23: which indicate that""global NAND sales could increase 51.2% year over year to $51 billion in 2017.""The List of Bidders Is HugeAs you can imagine

GOOGL and AMZN would be able to""reduce their dependence on external chip makers and ensure supply for their own data servers through in-house manufacturing.""Existing chipmakers such as MU would gain ""an immediate impact on pricing

column1: 2 Top Stocks to Buy in Virtual Reality;4/4/2017;"Virtual reality (VR) may be off to a slow start with   consumers
column2: but investors only need to scratch beneath the surface   to see how many technology companies arealready pushing ahead on VR.The combined augmented reality and virtual reality market is   expected to be worth $13.9 billion this year -- but in just three   years
column3: it's forecast to grow by an order of magnitude reaching   $143.3 billion in 2020
column4: according toIDC. And while much of the focus is on headsets and controllers   right now
column5: it's likely to be software makers and platform   creators that benefit the most.Image source: Oculus.makeArticleAd();""AR and VR headsets get most of the media attention right now
column6: but the hardware is only as good as the software and services   running on it
column7: Tom Mainelli
column8: IDC's program vice president   for devices and AR/VR
column9: said recently.That's why investors would be wise to considerAlphabet(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) andFacebook(NASDAQ: FB) for their VR potential. Forget that these are among   the biggest players in the broader tech space for a moment
column10: and   focus instead that they are pursuing VR from a different angle   than most of their competitors.Why Alphabet is a top virtual reality stockIgnore Google Cardboard. You can even set aside Google's   latest headset
column11: Daydream View
column12: if you'd like. Instead
column13: think   about hundreds of millions of smartphone users going to a   Google-created platform for nearly all of their VR content.Google launched its VR hub
column14: Daydream
column15: last year
column16: and   while it hasn't taken the smartphone market by storm yet
column17: it   doesn't have to -- at least not yet. This first iteration of   Daydream was just the opening gambit in its long-term strategy to   becometheVR content hub for mobile users.Remember that Alphabet built out its dominance in the   smartphone space not with hardware
column18: but with a platform   (Android); Daydream could ultimately work in the same way.   Already
column19: there are over 100 Daydream VR apps available to   customers
column20: offering everything from gaming to movies
column21: from the   NBA and NFL toThe New York Times
column22: and more.The big opportunity here is that no one else has the same   reach that Alphabet does in the smartphone space. Daydream   could become the gateway that brings more users into VR
column23: and Alphabet could monetize this advantage in the same way   it does with Android -- through ads and paid apps (about   one-third of the Daydream apps cost money right now).Alphabet is keenly aware of the capacity for software and   services to generate massive revenues
column24: and I think the company's   early focus on mobile VR -- through Daydream -- is an attempt to   get out ahead of all of its competitors.Why Facebook is a top virtual reality stockJust as we did with Alphabet
column25: let's set aside the case for   Facebook's VR hardware --- through the Oculus Rift -- for now.   Instead
column26: focus on the company's long-term view for VR:""This is a good candidate to be the next major computing   platform. It's worthy of a lot of investment over a long   period
column27: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg said in   a Bloomberginterviewlast year.Zuckerberg admits that VR could take 10 years or longer to   take off
column28: but  his company didn't spend $2 billion on Oculus   solely to sell cool headsets -- Facebook's also using the   hardware to accelerate the development of software and   services.While it's easy to get caught up in the Rift hardware
column29: its   weak sales numbers
column30: and therecent departureof Oculus' founder Palmer Luckey from Facebook
column31: remember that the   social media powerhouse is still at the beginning stages of its   VR push. It first wanted to enter the hardware market to help   spur demand for software. As Zuckerberg noted last year
column32: ""The   next phase is building the next great software experiences.""Long-term investors looking for the top stocks in VR would be   wise to focus on these software plays -- and remember that it's   likely to take awhile for this market to truly come into its   own.10 stocks we like better than FacebookWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: Facebook Inc (FB) Is About to Eat Alphabet Incâ€™s (GOOGL) Lunch;4/4/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsI've argued in the past thatFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB)is too cheap
column3: but I can understand why some investors might be cautious
column4: if not bearish
column5: toward Facebook stock.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockFB stock has risen about 700% from all-time lows reached in 2012. And the company now is worth almost as much as Warren Buffett'sBerkshire Hathaway Inc.(NYSE:BRK.A
column6: NYSE:BRK.B) and more thanExxon Mobil Corporation(NYSE:XOM)
column7: among many others.But Facebook itself already haswarned that its blistering growth rate should slowin the coming years.At less-than-20-times 2018 consensus per-share earnings plus cash
column8: Facebook stock still looks cheap. Meanwhile
column9: the scandal this weekatAlphabet Inc's(NASDAQ:GOOGL
column10: NASDAQ:GOOG) YouTube is another example of what a mess the online advertising industry is. The more the rest of the business struggles
column11: the more obvious the value of the Facebook platform becomes. And that should lead to further upside for FB stock.YouTube
column12: Twitter and Facebook StockGoogle has a problem on its hands with YouTube. Major advertisers - such as the U.K. operations ofMcDonald's Corporation(NYSE:MCD)
column13: Starbucks Corporation(NASDAQ:SBUX) andJohnson & Johnson(NYSE:JNJ) - havepulledall non-search advertising.The boycott is estimated to cost Alphabet$750 million to $1 billion in revenue. It seems highly likely that some - if not most - of that spend will make its way to Facebook. Those brands still want to advertise online - and Facebook will be the best option left standing.The 5 Best Stocks to Buy for AprilAfter all
column14: Twitter Inc(NYSE:TWTR) has its own well-documented problems with ""hate speech
column15: one reason why ad growth on that platform has stalled out. Facebook content can be controversial from time to time
column16: but FB's controls look stronger.To be sure
column17: Facebook has had some advertiser issues of its own. Late last year
column18: the company disclosed a series of measurement errors
column19: including an overstatement of the so-called ""reach"" of advertising campaigns. But Facebook at least has been on top of its problems - and is fixing them. Twitter and YouTube are playing from behind at the moment.The Online Advertising Ecosystem Is BrokenThe problems at YouTube are just a single example of an online advertising ecosystem that looks increasingly troubled. Twitter by its own admission has had trouble keeping major advertisers and providing consistent ROI. And the Leslie Jones debacle last year
column20: along with consistent efforts to remove bots and battle hate speech
column21: has hurt that platform's reputation.For its part
column22: Google has repeatedly had to change its terms to combat fraud
column23: adware and malware. And beyond the major platforms
column24: there's further worry for advertisers.Criteo SA (ADR)(NASDAQ:CRTO) and privately held SteelHouse hada nasty lawsuitlast year
column25: with each company accusing the other of click fraud and other malfeasance. One estimate suggests that fraud takesabout one-thirdof online ad spending.For major advertisers
column26: in particular
column27: online advertising is becoming a minefield. The content next to which ads are placed can't be trusted. Measurement of campaign ROI is susceptible to error and fraud. Advertisers clearly are paying for bogus traffic - even on mobile.In that context
column28: Facebook - if it can convince advertisers it's conquered its measurement errors - presents a compelling alternative to traditional online advertising spend. And if more issues like the YouTube ad boycott arise - and they will - ad demand should only increase
column29: and that should push Facebook stock higher.Bottom Line on Facebook StockThere are two core risks to Facebook stock. The first is that traffic to the platform will decline
column30: particularly if consumers find new social media outlets. So far
column31: neither Twitter norSnap Inc(NYSE:SNAP) has proven able to peel away much traffic.The second risk is whether advertisers will keep their dollars on the site or take them elsewhere. That risk has been highlighted of late by Facebook's own guidance and by last year's measurement errors.All Hope Is Fading for Sprint Corp (S) StockBut that risk is diminished by the struggles at Facebook's peers
column32: which make FB advertising look more attractive - and more secure - by comparison. And with both risks rather low on a near-term basis
column33: it's hard not to see more upside for FB stock. There's no debt
column34: still-impressive earnings growth
column35: and a multiple not far from that of the broad market as a whole.Indeed
column36: Facebook stock is attractive enough on its own. And if its competitors are going to send more business its way
column37: it's more attractive still.As of this writing

column1: Before You Dismiss Snap Inc (SNAP) Stock
column2: Remember Facebook Inc (FB);4/4/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsAdmittedly
column4: Snap Inc(NYSE:SNAP) stock hasn't had a great start to its life as a public company. From a business standpoint
column5: nothing has actually happened yet. There's been no earnings news so far: First-quarter results for Snap stock likely will be reported in late April or early May. The company did add a ""search"" feature to Snapchat
column6: but that's not big news relative to the $27 billion valuation currently assigned to SNAP.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockBut the narrative surrounding Snap stock has been persistently and consistently negative.Analyst downgradesmet the stock almost immediately
column7: leading SNAP to tumble after early post-IPO gains.Complaints about the lack of voting rights afforded Snap stock holders have led to calls that the company's own IPO was the sign of a bubble in thebroad market.Then when analysts from firms that underwrote the SNAP IPO
column8: including Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley
column9: giving Buy-equivalent ratings to the stock
column10: there were thepredictable howlsthat major investment firms were unfairly supporting the stock price. Little over a month after the SNAP IPO
column11: it seems downright contrarian - if not unethical - to issue positive commentary on Snap stock.I certainly understand some of the skepticism; with Snap stock trading at ~60x revenue
column12: valuation risk is obvious.FB Opened Much
column13: Much Worse Than SNAPBut investors jumping on the ""bash Snap"" bandwagon
column14: or thinking SNAP is a slam-dunk short
column15: should bear in mind theearly tradingof social media giantFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB):""Facebook Inc shares slid below $29 to a new low on Tuesday as nervous investors fled the company's shares
column16: concerned about the social network's long-term business prospects and an initial offering price that proved too rich â€¦Wall Street has harbored concerns that Facebook
column17: while boasting nearly a billion users worldwide and dominating Internet social-networking
column18: would have difficulty translating its growing presence on smartphones and other mobile devices into revenue.""That quote comes from a Reuters article written May 29
column19: 2012 - just eleven days after the FB IPO. The IPO itself was a mess
column20: too
column21: and widely referred to as something close to a disaster. Indeed
column22: Nasdaq Inc(NASDAQ:NDAQ) wasfined $10 millionfor system failures during FB's first day of trading.7 'Best of the Best' Stocks to Buy for the Second QuarterIt only got worse from there. By September
column23: FB traded below $18
column24: down more than 50% from its IPO price. And it's difficult not to hear echoes of the Snap IPO in Facebook's own coverage at the time. An ""initial offering price that proved too rich"". Snap stock's lack of voting rights compares to the disclosure that FB CEO Mark Zuckerberg would control the companyeven when he died.And FB stock in its first six months of trading had the same feel Snap stock does now. It was ""muppet bait"": a stock that would burn retail investors. The valuation was crazy. There were even calls that the Facebook IPO was the sign of a ""new tech bubble"" - the same as those made now. Of course
column25: FB investors now are singing a very different tune.Facebook Growth Doesn't Make Snap Stock a BuyThat's not to say
column26: at all
column27: that SNAP is a buy simply because Facebook stock is up ~700% from those all-time lows in September 2012. Snap stock is expensive anda long way from profitability
column28: as my colleague James Brumley has pointed out.But there are two lessons investors interested in SNAP should glean from Facebook's first few months as a public company. The first is that it might be OK to show some patience. Early post-IPO trading is volatile; it's better suited to equity and options traders
column29: not investors. The market is still figuring out fair value for Snap stock
column30: and that takes some time
column31: and a lot of arguments. Lock-up expirations
column32: which allow pre-IPO investors to cash out at designated times
column33: still loom
column34: and could further pressure SNAP.The second lesson
column35: however
column36: is to tune out the noise. The armchair analysts questioning the valuation of Facebook stock
column37: or claiming some sort of bubble
column38: were flat wrong. There was no tech bubble; not only has FB stock soared
column39: but the NASDAQ 100 has better than doubled. Investors who listened to dire
column40: media-baiting
column41: predictions missed out on a lot of value - and not just that created by Facebook stock.Give Snap Stock A ChanceSnap stock might turn out to be a worthwhile investment. It might not. Either way
column42: it is not a sign of the financial apocalypse. The lack of voting rights only makes official what investors in Facebook andAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column43: NASDAQ:GOOGL) already have through their permanent minority voting rights: No control.Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Won't Escape This Storm Anytime SoonThere's little effective difference between Snap stock and Alphabet stock from a governance standpoint. (The same is true among the classes ofUnder Armour Inc(NYSE:UAA
column44: NYSE:UA) stock
column45: which presentsan intriguing arbitrage opportunity.)And yes
column46: Snap stock is expensive
column47: but expensive stocks can stay expensive for a very long time - or grow into their valuations. Just look atAmazon.com
column48: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN). The next time you hear a snap judgment (pun intended) short case for SNAP
column49: remember what theWashington Postwrote about the Google IPOin 2004:""This price is insane. And anyone buying Google as a long-term investment at $109.40 will lose money â€¦ This has nothing to do with Google as a company â€¦ It has to do with math and with limiting factors - fancy language for the old truism that no trees grow to the sky.""Those voices are always out there. Don't listen to them alone. Do your own research
column50: and give Snap stock a chance.As of this writing

column1: Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Wonâ€™t Escape This Storm Anytime Soon;4/4/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsSince the early days ofAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column3: NASDAQ:GOOGL)
column4: there has been plenty of controversy. Often it has been about content
column5: such as with copyright infringements. Yet GOOGL stock has usually found ways to deal with the issues.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockBut recently
column6: Alphabet has found itself in another scrape
column7: and this one may prove fairly damaging.It all started in early February
column8: when theTimes of Londonreported that YouTube ads from major brands were associated with videos that involved hate speech
column9: terrorism and violence.What Kind of Trouble Is Alphabet In?The backlash was quick - and GOOGL stock has already taken a hit. Over 250 brands have suspended their ad campaigns on YouTube
column10: including some of the world's largest likeVerizon Communications Inc.(NYSE:VZ)
column11: AT&T Inc.(NYSE:T)
column12: Wal-Mart Stores Inc(NYSE:WMT) andStarbucks Corporation(NASDAQ:SBUX).While Alphabet has responded with tough talk about taking swift actions
column13: the fact is that the problems continue. On Mar. 24
column14: TheWall Street Journalreported that YouTube was still running ads with major brands that had offensive content.Yet all this is not a one-off. It seems quite likely that GOOGL has been running these kinds of ads for some time.10 Stocks You'd Be Foolish to Buy Right NowWhat's more
column15: the company has recently been involved in other mishaps
column16: such as:GOOGL made certainLGBTQ content""restricted
column17: which has caused an uproar in the community.The company terminated one of its most popular YouTube shows
column18: called PewDiePie
column19: because ofallegedanti-Semitic jokes.Googlepulled an advertisingagreement with a YouTube channel called ""Real Women
column20: Real Stories
column21: which had interviews with women who talked about sexual harassment and abuse.Now it's certainly understandable that advertisers should be very concerned. They understand that their brands are quite delicate and can easily be tarnished. Also
column22: by paying for the ads
column23: the companies are essentially subsidizing this content!So what does all this mean for GOOGL stock? Well
column24: some analysts have been crunching the numbers. For example
column25: analysts at Nomura Instinet estimate that YouTube will suffer about$750 million in lost revenues.It's true that this is a relatively small amount when compared to Alphabet's annual revenues of $90 billion. Yet the analysis may ultimately be too narrow. Let's face it
column26: brands may get concerned about other ad programs from GOOGL.Besides
column27: rivals likeFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) andSnap Inc(NYSE:SNAP) will certainly act quickly to capitalize on the situation. In fact
column28: even traditional cable networks
column29: such as the Hallmark Channel
column30: can tout their brand-safe content as more attractive alternatives. Keep in mind that the ""upfront"" season has already started
column31: which is when advertisers make decisions for their budgets.Bottom Line on GOOGL StockIn an interview withRecode
column32: Alphabet executive Philipp Schindler noted that the content issues have been blown out of proportion
column33: saying that it involves ""very very very small numbers."" Yet
column34: he is still focused on dealing with it
column35: such as by using third-party audits and AI software.Overall
column36: this kind of corporate-speak is probably not winning points with advertisers - and it could mean further problems with GOOGL stock. Whenever there is a major controversy
column37: it is critical for a company to react quickly and not get into the statistics of the problem. Customers want action.Wells Fargo: Should You Buy WFC Stock? 3 Pros
column38: 3 ConsA notable example of this is what happened to Airbnb a few years ago
column39: when a customer's home got trashed. The company swiftly made major changes
column40: such as providing an insurance guarantee. As a result
column41: the controversy quickly faded away. If anything
column42: it helped to engender much more customer loyalty and confidence.But so far
column43: GOOGL has not taken this kind of proactive stance. Instead
column44: the company has been more defensive - and somehow thinks technology will be the cure.Now
column45: this strategy may still work for Alphabet
column46: but it will probably take time for things to simmer down. And in the meantime
column47: this could mean that there will be a cloud over GOOGL stock
column48: which could result in sluggish returns.Tom Taulli runs the InvestorPlace blogIPO Playbookand is the author of various books
column49: includingTaxes 2017: Saving A Bundle.Follow him on Twitter at@ttaulli. As of this writing
column50: he did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace10 Small-Cap Stocks That Could Double in the Next 3 MonthsThe 7 WORST Stocks to Buy Right Now7 'Best of the Best' Stocks to Buy for the Second QuarterThe postAlphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Won't Escape This Storm Anytime Soonappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column13: Part 1Link:https://www.zacks.com/commentary/108625/us-telecommunications-industry-outlook---april-2017The U.S. telecommunications industry is currently balanced with almost equal proportions of positive and negative influences. Ever since Donald Trump's presidential victory
column14: the stock prices of most of the major telecom stocks have enjoyed a bullish run in the market through the end of the first quarter of 2017.In a nutshell
column15: the primary reasons behind this bull run were
column16: firstly
column17: the new-look U.S. telecom regulatory body - Federal Communications Commission (FCC) - has given enough indications that It will be less stringent compared with the Obama administration and is likely to roll back several stringent regulations of the previous regime. Secondly
column18: the less restrictive nature of the FCC will aid mergers and acquisitions which will likely spur growth in 2017. Thirdly
column19: expected corporate tax reform will benefit telecom operators.However
column20: several near-term headwinds continue to persist in the telecom industry. The chief ones include growing price competition for wireless services are likely to reduce carriers' revenue growth in 2017. Leading cable MSOs (multi-service operators) have decided to enter the wireless field in 2017 which is likely to intensify competition in an already saturated market.Further
column21: capital spending by the U.S. telecom carriers may be muted in 2017. The 4G LTE wireless penetration is currently 83% in North America. This can primarily be attributed to most carriers' intention to upgrade to 5G wireless network standard which requires massive investment. However
column22: a full-phased 5G network deployment is unlikely before 2020.FCC Under TrumpPresident Trump already has had quite an impact on telecom policy parameters. On Jan 2017
column23: Trump elected existing Republican commissioner Ajit Pai as the new Chairman of the FCC. Ajit Pai is a staunch opponent of several laws and rules adopted by the FCC under former Chairman Tom Wheeler's regime
column24: including Net Neutrality laws
column25: rules to reform business data market and set-top box reform proposals. Notably
column26: all three reform rules were going to hit the telecom operators and ISPs (Internet service providers) the most.Recently
column27: the U.S. Senate and House of Representative voted against a set of privacy rules for broadband service providers
column28: proposed previously by the FCC under the Obama administration. On Oct 2016
column29: the then FCC chairman Tom Wheeler had proposed these rules. However
column30: the new FCC -- reconstructed by Trump with Ajit Pai at its helm -- voted to stay the rules of the previous regime on Mar 1
column31: 2017.What Are Broadband Privacy Rules?The broadband privacy rules proposed by former FCC Chairman Wheeler required ISPs to get consumers' explicit consent before selling or sharing Web browsing data and other private information with advertisers and other companies.Since ISPs have direct access to user database
column32: they used to sell the data to digital marketing firms for targeted advertising. This was a major source of revenues for the ISPs.It is important to note that ISPs likeVerizon Communications Inc.(NYSE:VZ-Free Report) andAT&T Inc.(NYSE:T-Free Report) are governed by FCC rules. On the other hand
column33: Internet firms such asAlphabet Inc.(NASDAQ:GOOGL-Free Report) come under the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) regulations. At present
column34: there are no rules governing data disclosure by Internet firms.As a result
column35: the 'Opt In' ruling will be an advantage. However
column36: the FCC had assured the ISPs that it will try to harmonize the regulations with the FTC. Notably
column37: all the stocks mentioned above currently carry a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). You can seethe complete list of today's Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy)   stocks here.ISPs to Cheer NowThe digital advertisement market space is growing exponentially and ISPs have been increasingly investing resources to cash in on the bountiful opportunities. However
column38: the FCC's previous directive stipulated that the ISP should notify customers before sharing any user data for advertising. This was certainly going to mar ISPs prospects in the business. Consequently
column39: a new FCC body exercising lesser restrictions certainly augurs well for the ISP industry.Key Attributes for 2017(1) The telecommunications industry is essentially characterized by high barriers to entry. The deployment of network infrastructure requires significant capital expenditure
column40: which very few entities can afford. Furthermore
column41: it is not easy for a new telecom carrier to establish itself in the market as it requires government approval to transmit voice
column42: data
column43: and video. Such barriers protect the profits of incumbents.(2) A major characteristic of the telecommunications industry is that it is immune to international geo-political disturbances
column44: even when these lead to economic fluctuations. This is because the need to remain connected stems from our primal instinct to communicate with fellow human beings. Volatility in the global economy due to political and economic disturbance in the Eurozone
column45: Asia-Pacific or the Middle-East has had little impact on the sector.(3) Wireless network strength is the key to future growth of the overall telecom industry. As wireless networks run on radio frequency
column46: spectrums (airwaves) are naturally the most sought after assets in the industry. Spectrum auctions conducted by the FCC from time to time will significantly boost network capacity.(4) Telecom companies offer one of the highest dividend yields in the U.S. economy. Unlike other industries
column47: U.S. telecom operators generate revenues predominantly in the country. This makes these stocks less susceptible to volatility in the foreign exchange rate as well as macro-economic fluctuations plaguing rest of the world. We believe the strong dividend yield momentum will continue as the U.S. economy slowly returns to stability.(5) Mergers and acquisitions (M&A) are not uncommon in the U.S. telecom industry. Telecom and pay-TV operators often join forces to provide better and attractive bundled products to customers. In order to stay ahead of competition
column48: existing players need to be constantly on their toes to introduce innovative products or merge with other companies. In the near future
column49: the U.S. telecom industry is likely to witness further mergers and acquisitions along with product diversifications.Upcoming 5G Wireless TechnologyAccording to a study commissioned by Qualcomm
column50: fifth-generation (5G) wireless technology could result in real global economic growth by $3 trillion cumulatively from 2020 to 2035. Several industry researchers hold that 5G network will provide a download speed of 1 Gbps (gigabit per second)
column51: which is 200 times the throughput of the currently available standard 4G LTE network. Latency period of data delivery will be in single milliseconds. Further
column52: 5G technology is designed to be more power efficient than any other standard wireless network available at the moment. Naturally
column53: 5G-enabled mobile devices are likely to last much longer than their 3G or 4G counterparts.In July 2016
column54: in a landmark voting
column55: the FCC unanimously decided to make available high-frequency radio spectrums (above 24 GHz) for the use of the upcoming 5G wireless network. With this
column56: the U.S. becomes the first country in the world to identify and open up a significant amount of spectrum suitable for the ultra-fast 5G mobile standard. At present
column57: all four major national wireless operators
column58: namely
column59: Verizon
column60: AT&T
column61: Sprint Corp.(NYSE:S-Free Report) andT-Mobile US Inc.(NASDAQ:TMUS-Free Report) are conducting trial runs for 5G wireless standards.Valuation Calls for StabilizationGoing by the P/E (price to earnings per share) valuation metrics
column62: which is often used to value telecom sector stocks
column63: the industry looks a bit expensive at this stage. The industry currently has a trailing 12-month P/E ratio of 22.13x
column64: which is higher than the median value of 20.73x in the past year.Additionally
column65: the reading compares unfavorably with the market at large
column66: as the current P/E for the S&P 500 is pegged at 20.31x and the median level is 19.26x. At present
column67: the telecom sector looks overvalued compared to the overall market. This indicates a near-term stabilization for the companies.Another commonly used valuation metrics for this sector is P/S (price to sales) which depicts a similar picture. The industry's current P/S of 3.12x compares unfavorably with the market at large
column68: as the current P/S for the S&P 500 is at 3.08x and the median level is 2.89x.Strong Stocks that Should Be in the NewsMany are little publicized and fly under the Wall Street radar. They're virtually unknown to the general public. Yet today's 220 Zacks Rank #1 ""Strong Buys"" were generated by the stock-picking system that has nearly tripled the market from 1988 through 2015. column1: Alphabet's Android Topples Windows as Most Preferred OS;4/4/2017;"Per Techcrunch
column2: Alphabet Inc.'sGOOGLAndroid operating system (OS) has dethroned Microsoft'sMSFTWindows as the most popular OS in the world with respect to Internet usage.TechCrunch quoted data provided by StatCounter (a web analytics company) per which Android had a 37.93% market share in the Internet usage space in Mar 2017. This was followed by Microsoft with 37.91% share
column3: Apple'sAAPLiOS at 13.1% and Mac OS at 5.17%.Shares of Alphabet were up 1.06% on Monday. We note that the technology giant outperformed the ZacksInternet - Servicesindustry over the last one year. While the industry gained only 7.6%
column4: Alphabet's shares returned 13%.StatCounter noted that Android's growth was driven by growing demand for smartphones as a means to access the Internet
column5: declining PC shipments and rising demand in Asian countries.We note that Microsoft has dominated the global OS landscape since the 1980s. Given the fact that Android entered the space just five years ago
column6: with a market share of 2.4%
column7: this is a phenomenal achievement. It marks an end to Microsoft's dominance in the OS space.However
column8: as per StatCounter
column9: the Windows OS still commands the lion's share when it comes to desktops and laptops.Our TakeAs per a CiscoCSCOreport
column10: it is estimated that more than half of the world's population will be connected to the Internet by 2020. With PC shipments on a decline
column11: much of this demand will be met by smartphones that enable users to access the Internet on the go.As per an IDC report
column12: the worldwide shipment of smartphones is estimated to reach a whopping 1.9 billion by 2020 at a CAGR of 6%. Given the growth opportunity in smartphones
column13: it is expected that the demand for OS will go up significantly. We believe that Android's dominance is a positive for Alphabet.Moreover
column14: in emerging economies such as India where more than 90% of the smartphones have Android
column15: there is ample scope for the company.On the other hand
column16: although Microsoft is losing ground in the OS space in terms of Internet usage
column17: its in-built search feature
column18: Bing
column19: is proving to be a strong competitor for Alphabet's search engine Google.Zacks RankAt present
column20: Alphabet carries a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) while Microsoft carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). You can seethe complete list of today's Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy) stocks here.Zacks' Best Private Investment IdeasIn addition to the recommendations that are available to the public on our website

column1: Will Verizon (VZ) Bind AOL & Yahoo Assets by an 'Oath'?;4/4/2017;"U.S. telecom behemothVerizon Communications Inc.VZis planning to unite AOL Inc. with Yahoo Inc.'sYHOOcore internet assets under one umbrella - Oath. This was recently reported byBloomberg.Oath is expected to be Verizon's new company overseeing Yahoo and AOL
column2: including more than 20 brands. The company is reluctant to provide any further details on Oath before summer. Reports
column3: however
column4: state that Verizon is pre-estimated to have 1.3 billion users and $7 billion in sales from the combined AOL and Yahoo.AOL Inc. - a major player in the digital content and online advertising space - was acquired by Verizon in Jun 2015. The Verizon-Yahoo deal for $4.83 billion is expected to be completed by the end of the current quarter of this year (by Jun 30). Following the two major irreversible data breaches in the latter half of 2016
column5: this deal underwent a discount revision of $350 million. Under the terms of the deal
column6: Verizon will take control of Yahoo's core assets including its search products
column7: digital content brands
column8: and advertising and analytics assets. The core businesses of Yahoo perfectly complement Verizon's core areas of digital platform.Bottom LineFor quite some time
column9: Verizon is geared up to acquire some major companies in the digital media space. Notably
column10: the company is systematically diversifying its business model into the digital media platform
column11: targeting the lucrative segments of digital media
column12: advertising and content creation as well as distribution.Last September
column13: Verizon teamed up with private media group Hearst Corp. on a number of digital ventures. The company's also launched a segment - ComplexNetworks.com - in a bid to strengthen its digital-video networks. With this service
column14: Verizon is set to pose a formidable challenge to giants like Alphabet Inc.GOOGLand Facebook Inc.FBin the mobile video advertising space.Meanwhile
column15: Verizon Communications is likely to start an online TV streaming service this summer
column16: according to a recent Bloomberg report. The company has decided to come up with dozens of channels nationwide for the new service. Management is currently negotiating with several TV network owners to secure online streaming rights.We believe that the combination of Yahoo and AOL should help Verizon sell more digital advertisements and create a major player in the mobile media and advertising space.Price PerformanceDespite such profitable and booming business prospects
column17: the price performance of Verizon is depressing. Over the past three months
column18: the stock lost 10.01% compared with the Zacks categorizedWireless Nationalindustry's decline of 4.67%.We believe continued operation in the saturated and competitive wireless market
column19: expenses related to promotions and discounts
column20: an intensely competitive video market and persistent losses in access lines (in its wireline segment) might have caused the company's below-par performance.Verizon currently carries a Zacks Rank #4 (Sell).You can seethe complete list of today's Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy)   stocks here.Zacks' Best Private Investment IdeasIn addition to the recommendations that are available to the public on our website

column1: This Catalyst Can Take NVIDIA to the Cloud;4/3/2017;"The boom in data traffic is creating the need for stronger   cloud infrastructure
column2: forcing cloud service providers (CSPs) to   upgrade their data centers to process the increasing volume and   complexity of data. Gartner estimates that public cloud   infrastructure investments will grow almost 37% this year
column3: to   $34.6 billion
column4: thanks to investments fromAmazon
column5: Microsoft(NASDAQ: MSFT)
column6: andAlphabet's(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) Google to bring their data   centers up to speed.One way to tap this multibillion-dollar market is throughNVIDIA(NASDAQ: NVDA)
column7: as its Tesla graphics processing units (GPUs)   are helping the CSPs bring raw computing power to their data   centers. As it turns out
column8: the chipmaker's data center business   has taken off remarkably in recent quarters
column9: outpacing the growth   in other key segments.Data Source: NVIDIA. Chart by author.makeArticleAd();In fact
column10: the data center business is now NVIDIA's   second-largest revenue source
column11: and it is likely that it will   continue to get bigger given the company's recent moves in this   space.NVIDIA is gaining from GPU adoption in the cloudA huge amount of data is being generated thanks to connected   cars and other Internet of Things devices.IntelCEO Brian Krzanich believes that a single autonomous car could   generate 4
column12: 000 gigabytes of data daily if driven for just one   hour
column13: thanks to all the sensors and cameras installed.Machina Research
column14: on the other hand
column15: forecasts that the number of connected   devices will grow over fourfold
column16: to 27 billion
column17: by 2025.This is going to create a big challenge for CSPs in   transferring the data from the cloud to the data center
column18: with   Gartner forecasting that 25% of the data generated will go to   waste even before it is analyzed. NVIDIA
column19: however
column20: has a solution   for the CSPs with its Tesla GPUs that are specifically aimed at   this market.Image source: NVIDIA.The Tesla GPUs accelerate a data center's computing power
column21: enabling service providers to process huge data sets at a   fraction of the cost required to build a new facility
column22: which   would previously have been required to analyze the same amount of   data. NVIDIA does this by allowing service providers to replace   central processing units with its high-performance GPUs that can   deliver a fivefold boost in computational power and slash costs   by 60%.Not surprisingly
column23: Alphabet has decided to use the chipmaker's   Tesla K80 GPUs on the Google Cloud Platform to offer   deep-learning capabilities to its users. Google Cloud users can   now use up to eight GPUs to perform intensive tasks such as   high-performance data analysis
column24: seismic analysis
column25: and video   transcoding.Google is going to charge $0.70 per hour for each K80 GPU in   the U.S. and $0.77 per hour in Asia and Europe
column26: allowing users to   carry out deep-learning operations without any significant   capital investment. What's more
column27: Tencenthas also decided to use NVIDIA's Tesla P100 and P40 GPU   accelerators to give artificial intelligence (AI) computing   capabilities to its enterprise customers
column28: giving the chipmaker   access to China's booming public cloud-infrastructure market.NVIDIA is targeting AI cloud computingAI cloud computing is fast gaining traction thanks to the   advent of the Internet of Things and connected cars that require   autonomous decision making based on data generated
column29: and NVIDIA   does not want to miss the gravy train. The chipmaker recently   partnered with Microsoft to bring to market a hyperscale GPU   accelerator aimed at AI cloud computing applications.NVIDIA and Microsoft expect their framework -- the HGX-1 -- to   be used in healthcare
column30: self-driving cars
column31: and voice recognition
column32: among others
column33: as it is positioned as the standard architecture   for AI cloud computing. The HGX-1 is based on an open-source
column34: modular design
column35: indicating that it is scalable in nature since it   comes with eight Tesla GPUs that can connect to the central   processing unit depending on the workload.NVIDIA has made a smart move by tying up with Microsoft to   develop an AI cloud computing solution as the latter's Azure   cloud service is growing at a faster pace than the market leader.   Amazon Web Services -- the e-commerce giant's cloud computing   services subsidiary -- is currently the market leader in this   space
column36: but Microsoft's Azure cloud could overtake it in a couple   of years according to aMorgan Stanleysurvey.In all
column37: NVIDIA's data center business has a lot of room for   growth as the company's GPUs will play a mission-critical role in   cloud computing thanks to the chipmaker's deep-learning and AI   capabilities. More important
column38: the company is partnering with the   key players to sustain its rapid growth in this space.Find out why Nvidiais one of the 10 best stocks to buy nowMotley Fool co-founders Tom and David Gardner have spent       more than a decade beating the market. (In fact

column1: Pittsburgh Mayor Slams Uber: Will This Affect Its Driverless Car Efforts?;4/3/2017;"Uber hit another bump on the road to driverless car domination as Pittsburgh's mayor pushed back on the ride-sharing startup's autonomy in the city.Pittsburgh Mayor Bill Peduto recently stated his concern that Uber is not pulling its fair share in the agreement to test its self-driving car technology in the city. Peduto believes that Uber should be doing more to give back to Pittsburgh since the city is allowing Uber to conduct driverless car tests that other cities have fought successfully against.""If they are going to be involved in economic disruption
column2: they have a moral obligation to society
column3: Mayor Pedutotold theWall Street Journal. ""In a partnership
column4: it's not just what we can do for them.""Uber planted its self-driving seeds in Pittsburghalmost two years agowhen it set up an ""Advanced Technologies Center."" In September 2016
column5: Pittsburgh became the first city in the world to allow self-driving Uber passenger trials. The seven-year-old ride-hailing company is currently testing its driverless car technology in Pittsburgh with human monitors behind the wheel.It is unclear at the moment exactly what Mayor Peduto hopes Uber will do for the city. Nevertheless
column6: a drastic change from Uber seems necessary as the mayor's stance has shifted quickly since the initial September announcement.""It's not our role to throw up regulations or limit companies like Uber
column7: Peduto told theNew York Timesin September. ""You can either put up red tape or roll out the red carpet. If you want to be a 21st-century laboratory for technology
column8: you put out the carpet.""Uber recently reached a settlement with the Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission to end the court battle related to its $11.4 million fine for operating without proper permission. The lawsuit dates back to Uber's early days in the state in 2014
column9: when the company blatantly operated without the proper permits for months. The ride-sharing giant agreed to pay roughly $3.5 million in fines

column1: Apple Inc. (AAPL) Will Develop Its Own iPhone Graphics Chip;4/3/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) already designs its own CPUs for the iPhone
column3: iPad and iPod Touch. AAPL licenses the iPhone's PowerVR GPU - graphics processing unit - from British chipmakerImagination Technologies(OTCMKTS:IGNMF).makeArticleAd();Source: AppleDespite the long-term relationship (and Apple owning a stake in the company)
column4: AAPL has decided to go it alone on the iPhone graphics chip. Imagination Technologies confirmed the bad news this morning
column5: triggering a panic sell-off that saw the company's shares plummet by over 60%.AAPL's Long Relationship with Imagination TechnologiesApple has been licensing the iPhone GPU from Imagination Technologies since 2008. Its dependence on the company to provide the iPhone graphics chip led Apple to boost its investment in its graphics partner to a 10% stake in 2009.In 2014
column6: it was announced thatApple had signed an extended deal with Imagination Technologies
column7: agreeing to continue using its PowerVR GPUs in iPhones for a multiyear period. As the British chipmaker's largest client
column8: this was a big deal.However
column9: despite the new licensing deal
column10: the relationship between the two companies began to deteriorate. Last year
column11: MacRumorsreported Apple confirmed it hadbeen in talks to acquire Imagination Technologiesoutright
column12: but decided to pass. From there
column13: AAPL began hiring talent from the chipmaker
column14: and was rumored to be establishing a UK office to develop its own iPhone graphics chip.Apple to Design Its Own iPhone Graphics ChipThose rumors became fact this morning when Imagination Technologiesposted a statementon its website confirming Apple's move:""Imagination Technologies Group â€¦ has been notified by Apple Inc. (""Apple"")
column15: its largest customer
column16: that Apple is of a view that it will no longer use the Group's intellectual property in its new products in 15 months to two years time
column17: and as such will not be eligible for royalty payments under the current license and royalty agreement.""The fallout was immediate
column18: with Imagination Technologies stock dropping over 68% within hours.Designing a new iPhone GPU from scratch will be a challenge - especially without running into IP issues and while using a team with members from AAPL's former long-term partner. Imagination Technologies notes this on its statement
column19: saying: ""Imagination believes that it would be extremely challenging to design a brand new GPU architecture from basics without infringing its intellectual property rights.""However
column20: Apple designs its own A-series CPUs for iOS devices
column21: usingARM Holdingstechnology. Its success on this front shows that AAPL engineers can build customized chips that compete with the best. Ditching PowerVR for its own in-house iPhone graphics chip could give Apple a significant edge over the Android competition using off-the-shelf GPUs.The Apple Effect Can Turn Around and Bite Youâ€¦As Imagination Technologies is discovering
column22: working with AAPL can be risky. There is potential for huge rewards. But there is also the danger that Apple will decide technology is too important to be left with a third party and bring it in-house. Countless app developers have found this out the hard waywhen iOS gains new features that effectively replaces them.GT Advanced Technologies(OTCMKTS:GTATQ) has seen the dark side of the Apple Effect. That company was tapped by AAPL to manufacture sapphire crystals for future iPhone use. The Apple deal meant a huge ramp-up for mass production. Unable to meet AAPL's demands
column23: rather than celebrate a big payday
column24: the company was forced todeclare bankruptcy in 2014.Trade Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Before Its Major RallyThe worst-case scenario here for Imagination Technologies is that Apple does go it alone and develops its own in-house iPhone graphics chip. Half of the company's revenue disappears within two years. The most positive read is one that was spiked out on today's statement:""Apple's notification has led Imagination to discuss with Apple potential alternative commercial arrangements for the current license and royalty agreement.""In other words
column25: for Imagination Technologies the best case scenario is renegotiating its deal
column26: convincing Apple to stay be offering more favorable terms.Squeezing its suppliersis another move AAPL is well known for and this movecouldbe just a bargaining tactic. Either way -designing its own iPhone GPU or continuing to use the PowerVR chip for less money- Apple comes out ahead. It always doesâ€¦As of this writing

(AAPL) Will Develop Its Own iPhone Graphics Chipappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: 5 Best Growth Stocks to Own as Core Holdings in Your Portfolio;4/3/2017;"It can be hard for growth investors to decide what stocks to   buy because innovation means that today's winners might not   be tomorrow's winners. Instead of gambling by focusing on the   latest fad

However
column7: those predictions   haven't panned out -- especially after Samsung's reputation took   a big blow when it was forced to recall its Note last year   because of defective batteries.IMAGE SOURCE: GETTY IMAGES.makeArticleAd();Apple's iPhones

column16: but the numbers suggest that there's enough   running room for this company to get much
column17: much bigger.In 2016
column18: Amazon generated $136 billion in sales
column19: up 27% from   2015. While that's a big number

column24: and its   Prime service has made it a big source for consumer   entertainment
column25: too. Also
column26: its recent push into virtual assistants   means that its devices are sitting in living rooms nationwide
column27: and that gives Amazon even more chances to connect with (and   profit from) consumers. The company'sAmazon Go
column28: a checkout-less store prototype
column29: and its AmazonFresh show it's   hoping to shake up the $631 billion grocery retail market soon
column30: too.Expanding its marketsIt's hard to find a company that's better at innovation than   the biotech giant Celgene. It already markets a slate of   billion-dollar blockbuster drugs
column31: and it's enjoying a steady   stream of revenue and profit growth thanks to R&D   investments
column32: acquisitions
column33: and collaborations.Its Revlimid is the most widely used first- and second-line   therapy in multiple myeloma
column34: and although Revlimid's sales are   already $7 billion per year
column35: R&D programs are expanding its   use
column36: and that has management targeting $8 billion in sales this   year. It also markets the billion-dollar third-line multiple   myeloma drug Pomalyst and the pancreatic cancer drug Abraxane
column37: which brought in $967 million in sales last year.In 2014
column38: management launched the psoriasis drug Otezla
column39: and   although it's only been on the market a short time
column40: it's already   selling at a $1.2 billion clip. Otezla sales could increase to   $1.7 billion or more this year. The company may also launch its   first multiple sclerosis drug soon. It acquired ozanimod in 2015   when it bought Receptos for $7 billion
column41: and following late-stage   trial results that arguably position it as a best-in-class   therapy

column1: Himax Technologies History: Everything Investors Need to Know;4/2/2017;"Himax Technologies(NASDAQ: HIMX) has been publicly traded since 2006
column2: and since   then thefabless semiconductor companyhas experienced a few massive stock price run-ups and a few   substantial drops as well. Investors who bought Himax right   when the company went public have seen their investment gain just   over 4%.To find out how the company might perform in the near future   let's take a quick look at what's caused Himax's stock to pop --   and dip -- and if the company is likely to experience more of the   same going forward.Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();Himax's share price historyAs you can see from the chart below
column3: Himax's share price   history has been on a wild ride since mid-2013
column4: after   experiencing a slow decline following its IPO.Himax's stock price began skyrocketing in 2013 on news thatAlphabet's(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) Google was implementing some of   Himax's technology into its ill-fated Google Glass device. Google   even took a 6.3% stake in the company at the time
column5: with the   option of grabbing 14.8% of Himax if wanted it -- which Google   eventually decided against .Image source:YCharts.During that time the company's stock hit an all-time high
column6: only to plummet after things with Google and its Glass device   didn't pan out.Then
column7: near the beginning of 2016
column8: investors started getting   excited about Himax's prospects in the AR space again
column9: this time   on hopes thatMicrosoft's(NASDAQ: MSFT) Hololens would bring Himax's share price huge   gains. Unfortunately
column10: the company faced a similar situation as in   the past when the Hololens failed to bring huge gains for Himax.   Investors began dumping the stock after a few analysts cut their   buy ratings on news that Hololens shipments were lower than   expected.Looking aheadMuch of Himax's prospects are being built around the company's   ability to supply technology for its AR customers. On Himax's   recent earning call
column11: CEO Jordan Wu said that
column12: Having invested in related technologies for over 15 years
column13: we are uniquely positioned as the provider of choice for micro     display and related optics
column14: both of which [are] critical     enablers to AR devices.The company is ramping up for more sales of its liquid   crystals on silicon (LCOS) and wafer-level optics (WLO)   products for AR devices after ramping up production for both   later this year and into 2018.Himax says that the ramp-up is because its AR customers are   looking to their next generation devices
column15: and that Himax's tech   will benefit from that. While this certainly could be true
column16: it   also feels a little like 2013 all over again. Betting on AR --   which is still an unproven market -- could take a long time to   pay off for the company.Northland Capital Markets' Tom Sepenzis wrote in a recent   investor note (republishedon Barron's):Augmented reality remains the largest potential for HIMX     with its LCOS and WLO products
column17: but the market has hit another     stumbling block as prices remain prohibitive for consumers. We     believe that this will limit the number of new AR devices for     the next 12-24 months....AR is expected to be worth $117 billion by 2022
column18: according to   Markets and Markets research. Investors can look to Himax's past   share price volatility and see that betting on this stock's AR   future can turn out badly. A better approach may be to wait a   little while longer and see if Himax's technology investments   bare some fruit later this year and next
column19: and then see how well   that positions the company in the AR space.Right now
column20: investing in Himax looks like a bet on both its   unproven prospects in ARandthat the augmented reality market will grow quickly. Himax's   history has shown that investors can easily get caught up in the   stock's future potential
column21: while disregarding the hurdles the   company faces.10 stocks we like better than Himax     TechnologiesWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column2: Will Amazon Ever Be Profitable Abroad?;4/2/2017;"Amazon.com(NASDAQ: AMZN) dove into the Middle Eastern market for the first   time ever this week.The e-commerce giant said it would acquire Souq.com
column3: the   largest online platform in the Arab world with 8.4 million unique   products for sale and operations in Saudi Arabia
column4: the United Arab   Emirates
column5: and Egypt.Terms of the deal were not disclosed
column6: thoughTechCrunchreported the price tag at $650 million
column7: below the $1 billion   Souq.com was valued at in its last funding round. Amazon   said it expected the deal to close by the end of the year.makeArticleAd();Souq.com CEO Ronaldo Mouchawar. Image source: Souq.comSouq is the latest in a long history of mostly successful   acquisitions for Amazon. Among the other online retailers Amazon   has taken over are the popular shoe seller Zappos and   Diapers.com-parent Quidsi
column8: where Amazon just announced it was   laying off hundreds of employees. Another notable move was the   company's purchase of Kiva Systems
column9: which makes robots that move   shelves and has helped boost efficiency in its warehouses.While Amazon's acquisition strategy has helped consolidate its   lead in e-commerce and drive growth in other areas like cloud   computing
column10: video streaming
column11: and audio books
column12: the company's   results in international markets have been less impressive.In 2016
column13: Amazon post an operating loss of nearly $1.3 billion   outside North America
column14: and that loss nearly doubled from the year   before. At $44 billion in revenue
column15: Amazon's international   segment is about half the size of its North American division.   Over the last three years
column16: international growth has also   significantly lagged growth in its home market
column17: even when the   effects of a stronger dollar are stripped out. During those   three years
column18: Amazon has also suffered a total operating loss   abroad of more than $2.6 billion.Amazon has been operating outside North America for nearly 20   years
column19: but even for a company whose mantra is ""long-term
column20: investors would be remiss if they didn't question whether the   company's international segment will ever generate profits.A tough nut to crackWhile plenty of American companies have found success and   billions in profits abroad
column21: including tech giants likeAppleandAlphabet
column22: it's been tougher going for retailers.Targetrecently abandoned its Canadian operations; several retailers
column23: includingHome Depot
column24: have pulled out of China
column25: and evenWal-Mart(NYSE: WMT)
column26: with subsidiaries in major international markets   like the UK
column27: China
column28: Brazil
column29: and Mexico
column30: has struggled at times to   replicate its success at home as operating margins are thinner   outside the US. About a quarter of Wal-Mart's revenue comes from   abroad.For retailers
column31: entering foreign markets means massive   investments in real estate and supply chain infrastructure. Even   an e-commerce company like Amazon still needs a network of   fulfillment centers to serve its overseas customers. It has over   100 such warehouses in the US
column32: which have allowed it to offer   services like Prime Now and Amazon Fresh
column33: but matching that   density abroad won't be easy. The company's competitive advantage   often lies in the fast delivery that its Prime membership program   offers
column34: which helps explain why it's profitable in North America   but not internationally.Amazon has stepped up its focus on foreign markets. After   losing out toAlibabain China
column35: the company has pledged $5 billion in investments in   India
column36: challenging local companies like Flipkart and Snapdeal
column37: as   well as Alibaba. It also recently made Prime Video global
column38: offering rock-bottom prices in markets like India and   undercuttingNetflixin the process. However
column39: in the vast majority of those countries   where its video streaming service is now offered
column40: the two-day   delivery that Americans associate with Prime is not available.Will the Souq deal pay off?Buying the biggest e-commerce company in the Middle East seems   like a smart move
column41: and will certainly accelerate Amazon's growth   in that corner of the world. But investors need to be mindful   that Amazon is in a much earlier stage of development abroad than   it is in the US. The company is still making investments to drive   growth
column42: and seems less concerned with profits. While Prime has   reached a penetration rate of about 50% of US households
column43: that   rate is much lower overseas.It's unclear at this point if Amazon will ever be consistently   profitable in the international segment. A weaker dollar would   help
column44: but the company also faces a number of challenges unique to   the international market including infrastructure
column45: different   cultures and regulations
column46: and local competition.With Souq joining its portfolio
column47: expect Amazon's international   revenue growth to continue
column48: but profits will likely remain absent   for the foreseeable future
column49: as the company's scale overseas is   still far from what it is at home.10 stocks we like better than AmazonWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: In Your 40s? 3 Stocks You Might Want to Buy;4/1/2017;"What will the world look like 20 to 25 years from now?That's the question that investors in their forties should   think about when considering which stocks to buy now. While even   the best prognosticators can't know for sure what the future   holds
column2: three stocks seem to be pretty good bets to survive and   thrive in the decades ahead. If you're in your forties
column3: here's   why Google's parentAlphabet(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL)
column4: Illumina(NASDAQ: ILMN)
column5: andTeladoc(NYSE: TDOC) could be stocks to consider.Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();Alphabet: Artificial intelligence
column6: robots
column7: virtual reality
column8: and moreAlphabet is about a lot more than just its enormously   successful Google search engine. The company claims a leadership   role in many of the most important technologies for the future
column9: including artificial intelligence
column10: robotics
column11: and virtual   reality.Artificial intelligence (AI) could change how we drive
column12: work
column13: and nearly every other aspect of our lives over the next 25   years. AI has been a top priority for Alphabet for quite a while.   However
column14: the technology giant has beefed up its capabilities   significantly in recent years through acquisitions. Alphabet   bought 11 AI companies over the last five years
column15: according to   market-intelligence provider CB Insights. Most notably
column16: Alphabet   scooped up hot British AI pioneer DeepMind in 2014.On a related note
column17: there have been quite a few news stories   lately about how robots could replace human workers in the near   future. Alphabet is a leader in the robotics field also. The   company owns Boston Dynamics
column18: which in 2016 announced the   development of its Atlas robot. Atlas was so impressive that it   prompted internet entrepreneur and angel investor Jason Calacanis   to state that the robot ""is really the end of manual labor.""Virtual reality is another technology poised to radically   change how we live in the next few decades. Alphabet is a major   player in this area
column19: also. It markets the Daydream View virtual   reality headset made with soft
column20: breathable fabric that is   comfortable to wear.The bottom line is that Alphabet appears to be in great   position to be a leader in multiple technologies that could shape   the future. And with a huge cash stockpile
column21: the company will   likely continue making strategic acquisitions that improve its   leadership position.Illumina: Making the DNA revolution possibleA different kind of technology has already begun   revolutionizing medicine and seems highly likely to continue   doing so. Analyzing DNA and mapping the human genome has led to   significant medical breakthroughs and the development of powerful   drugs. One company largely responsible for making this DNA   revolution possible is Illumina.Illumina is the global leader in sequencing and   array-based solutions for genetic analysis. The company's   HiSeq X genomic sequencing system technology announced in 2010   paved the way for mapping human genomes for roughly $1
column23: a   milestone in the DNA revolution.Another major milestone could be just around the corner. In   January
column24: Illumina announced its newest system
column25: NovaSeq. Illumina   believes that the NovaSeq architecture will enable a human genome   to be mapped for $100. Such a dramatic reduction in cost should   fuel the growth of precision medicine
column26: an approach for treating   disease that matches drugs with individuals' genetic   profiles.The impact of what Illumina's technology could usher in isn't   easy to fully grasp. Diseases for which no treatment is currently   available could be treated and potentially even cured. Others   will find the ""gold""
column27: but Illumina will likely continue to be the   leading provider of genetic ""shovels.""Teladoc: Bringing healthcare to your homeDo you hate going to the doctor? Teladoc is a leader in   bringing the doctor to you -- virtually.The company provides on-demand healthcare services   remotely to patients through mobile devices
column28: internet
column29: and phone.   Teladoc commands an impressive 75% market share in the telehealth   industry. That's three times larger than its nearest   competitor.Teladoc estimates a total U.S. market opportunity for   telehealth of more than $29 billion. Too optimistic? Not if you   consider that around one-third of all outpatient medical care is   treatable through telehealth and four-fifths of behavioral health   visits could be done remotely.Although the majority of Americans still haven't used   telehealth
column30: the numbers are growing.A recent survey showsthat most of those who haven't received healthcare virtually are   interested in doing so.While several companies have jumped into the telehealth space
column31: Teladoc is leading the way. The company has over 7
column32: 500 customers
column33: including more than 220 of theFortune1000 companies.10 stocks we like better than Alphabet (A     shares)When investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
