column1: Is Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) the Best FANG Stock to Buy?;3/29/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsA few weeks ago
column3: I touched on the so-called ""FANG"" stocks. The acronym covers popular stocks likeFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB)
column4: Amazon.com
column5: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN)
column6: Netflix
column7: Inc.(NASDAQ:NFLX) andAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL) - formerly Google
column8: making up the ""G."" But after delving into that from 10
column9: 000 feet
column10: I wanted to jump specifically into GOOGL stock.makeArticleAd();I was very upbeat about Alphabet in the assessment. Despite the optimism
column11: though
column12: we suggested waiting for a pullback. In fact
column13: our very words were:""At just a hair under all-time highs
column14: now may not be the best time to buy. A retest of its 50-day moving average near $840 and a further decline to its 200-day moving average near $800 would offer better entry opportunities.""So with GOOGL stock stumbling of late
column15: where does it leave us?According to the charts
column16: right where we wanted.Alphabet's IssuesAlphabet's YouTube ran some controversial ads. Running alongside them
column17: though
column18: included ads fromMcDonald's Corporation(NYSE:MCD)
column19: AT&T Inc.(NYSE:T)
column20: Johnson & Johnson(NYSE:JNJ) and others.  As a result
column21: many of these brands havepulled or suspendedtheir advertisements with the search and video giant. That sounds like bad news
column22: and at least temporarily
column23: it is.10 Clobbered Stocks to Buy That Are About to Get Red-HotThe news pushed Alphabet stock below its 50-day moving average for the first time since late-December. However
column24: my first thought was immediately that if one didn't want to buy the stock immediately after the breach of the 50-day MA
column25: they could wait until it hit the 100- or 200-day moving averages
column26: or safer still
column27: wait for a bounce.That's just what we've gotten.GOOGL stock has since rebounded off the 100-day and is now challenging its 50-day moving average. A breakthrough here would mean enormous things for the stock
column28: including a push toward all-time highs.We took a look at Alphabet's technical aspects
column29: but what about its fundamentals?What Makes GOOGL Stock Look So Good?When we sorted through the FANG stocks
column30: Alphabet was our favorite in regards to fundamentals.First
column31: consider its brand. There is no question who is the undisputed leader in search. There's a reason people don't say
column32: ""I don't know
column33: Bing it."" Or ""who knows
column34: just Ask Jeeves."" Google is the king of search and until the internet dies
column35: it's unlikely GOOGL will either.In fact
column36: Alphabet's Google site is themost visited websitein the world. Interestingly enough
column37: its YouTube property is ranked second. Even Google.co.in - the Google used in India - is ranked seventh in the world.Alphabet has a grip so strong it's unlikely it will ever be broken. For a long-term shareholder in GOOGL
column38: that's money in the bank.As the quarters and years go by
column39: Alphabet's core businesses will continue to line investors' pockets. Its consistency is attractive
column40: but other bets look promising too.For better or for worse
column41: Alphabet takes some chances known as ""moonshots."" Take for instance
column42: the company's self-driving car business. Alphabet's been at this one for a long time. Renamed Waymo
column43: the unit has been making breakthroughs
column44: which is very promising in this suddenly strong growth market. Without moonshots
column45: Waymowould have never been created. It's what makes Google
column46: Google.However
column47: these moonshots can be bad news when they don't pan out and cost too much money. The minds that started Google changed the internet forever. And while they're excellent product people
column48: they didn't make for the best financial overseers.Bring in CFO Ruth Porat
column49: and that changes. Porat leftMorgan Stanley(NYSE:MS) and joined Alphabet in May 2015. The stock
column50: stagnant for a year
column51: boomed 50% in the 18 months following her hire.Streaky earnings results were replaced with consistent beats. She tightened budgets in a way that curbed careless spending yet still gave teams the flexibility they needed. Alphabet now has better transparency with the Street as well as a share buyback.The Bottom Line for AlphabetPerhaps the best part of GOOGL stock is the valuation. While not cheap necessarily
column52: the valuation is reasonable. Trading with a forward price-to-earnings ratio of 21
column53: Alphabet is forecast to grow earnings 19.3% annually for the next five years.Apple Inc. Stock Hits Another Record High: How Much Further Can AAPL Run?Throw in expectations for ~18% and ~15.5% respective sales growth for this year and next
column54: and Alphabet becomes even more attractive.With a stellar brand
column55: reasonable current valuation
column56: long-term growth and strong management
column57: GOOGL is poised for success well into the future.Luckily
column58: investors now have a chance to buy.Bret Kenwell is the manager and author ofFuture Blue Chips. He can be contacted on Twitter via @BretKenwell. As of this writing
column59: Bret Kenwell held no positions in any security mentioned.More From InvestorPlace9 Cheap Stocks to Buy Now Under $9 a ShareThe 7 Best Dividend Stocks to Buy for the Second QuarterThe 10 Best ETFs to Buy for the Rest of 2017The postIs Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) the Best FANG Stock to Buy?appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Why Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) Stock Will Keep Jumping Higher;3/29/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsEarlier this month

column4: which is the latest iteration of the TX1
column5: which NVDA describes as""the world's first supercomputer on a module.""The company designed the Jetson module as a tool to assist developers in advancing and creating new technology. Additionally
column6: in partnership withMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT)
column7: Nvidia announced development of theHGX-1 Hyperscale GPU Accelerator
column8: which promises improved performance and standardization for cloud-computing servers.makeArticleAd();Source: NvidiaThese tools will also serve NVDA stock investors (indirectly

column10: as they further the company's rise to the top of the AI industry ladder.Android Centraldescribed the Jetson TX2 best
column11: saying:""The people who will build this technology of the future will need the tools to do so. In 2017
column12: NVIDIA is doing its part
column13: and the Jetson TX2 is the embodiment of this idea.""Simply put
column14: the Jetson TX2 is a mini supercomputer that can process massive amounts of data on the spot
column15: which can be a huge advantage for technology developers who would otherwise have had to upload all that data to an online server for cloud computing.10 Small-Cap Stocks That Could Double in the Next 3 MonthsWhat's more
column16: NVDA's Jetson TX2 is capable of ""edge"" machine learning
column17: a term that refers to the ability of the module to process
column18: interpret and analyze data without the need to first upload it to the cloud
column19: then download the resulting information and details. The TX2 has served its purpose quite successfully and it has helped Nvidia achieve its goal of simplifying developers' processes by reducing the number of steps required to garner important data.As far as the HGX-1
column20: NVDAbelievesthat:The HGX-1 hyperscale GPU accelerator will do for AI cloud computing what the ATX standard did to make PCs pervasive today. It will enable cloud-service providers to easily adopt NVIDIA GPUs to meet surging demand for AI computing.More Iconic Brands Rely on NVDA Than You Might RealizeHistorically
column21: Nvidia has been known for its industry-leading graphics cards. But
column22: NVDA stock is much more than a computer GPU maker. Sure
column23: the company still produces some of the most advanced GPUs that make hardcore gamers drool
column24: but graphics processors are actually capable of much more.While high-end GPUs will
column25: obviously
column26: improve PC video quality and reduce or eliminate that annoying screen lag when you're playing a first-person shooter game
column27: they're also used for a surprising number of non-visual applications.For instance
column28: Alphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column29: NASDAQ:GOOGL) andTesla Inc(NASDAQ:TSLA) use Nvidia GPU technology in the development of their respective driverless cars.Volkswagen AG (ADR)(OTCMKTS:VLKAY) andDaimler AG's(OTCMKTS:DDAIF) Audi brand have also been using Nvidia GPU units in their own driverless vehicle development projects. These companiesuse the NVDA Drive PX2- which
column30: according toForbes
column31: shares the renowned Tegra Parker silicon as the Jetson TX2.Beyond just autonomous vehicles
column32: though
column33: Nvidia GPU devices have been used by medical scientists and pharmaceutical companies to investigate and better understand the effects of aging. Using GPUs made by NVDA
column34: biotech companies such asInSilicoemploy AI to analyze large data sets and""emulate human brain function""in an attempt to combat diseases related to old age and reduce the cost of healthcare.Why the Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Comeback Is Just BeginningSimilarly
column35: at its annual Open Compute Project summit earlier this month
column36: Facebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) announced a cutting-edge AI server dubbed Big Basin
column37: which features""no less than eight Nvidia Tesla P100 GPU accelerators.""Bottom Line on NVDA StockAll things considered
column38: Nvidia stock's meteoric rise in the field of artificial intelligence shows no signs of slowing. With the release of the Jetson TX2 module
column39: coupled with the upcoming HGX-1 accelerator
column40: NVDA stock has addressed - seemingly quite successfully - mobile/field R&D as well as the cloud computing needs of AI developers.For Nvidia stock
column41: this is a solid sign that the past year's 213% gains will continue.As of this writing
column42: Greg Gambone did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace10 Clobbered Stocks to Buy That Are About to Get Red-HotThe 7 WORST Stocks to Buy Right NowThe postWhy Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) Stock Will Keep Jumping Higherappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Snap Stock: A Gimmick for Insiders to Cash In;3/28/2017;"Snap Inc.SNAP
column2: the parent company of picture messaging app Snapchat
column3: was known to be the most exciting IPO of 2017. Since last October
column4: when chat of a Snap IPO began
column5: Wall Street created incredible buzz in anticipation of one of the largest tech IPOs in history.Co-founders Evan Spiegel and Bobby Murphy have grown Snap to be the social media giant it is today. When boldly declining buy-out offers from FacebookFBand GoogleGOOGL
column6: Mr. Spiegel and Mr. Murphy knew they could grow their company to be worth a lot more than they were being offered. So they worked to expand and Snap now trades on the New York Stock Exchange at a $25 billion valuation.You might be thinking $25 billion is a tremendous value. Well
column7: insiders of Snap might be cashing in more than you think.When digging into Snap's stock issuance
column8: it seems that the affair has the ultimate and underlying value of making their insiders rich. Due to a deviance from a primary focus on shareholders
column9: I call Snap's stock a gimmick.Peculiar Lock-Up Periods & Insider SellingLet's begin with the curious contingencies in Snap's lock-up periods: lock-up periods restrict shareholders from selling their positions for a certain amount of time. This allows newly public companies to manage volatility in their first days of trading. With a lock-up period
column10: shareholders are forced to contemplate if they would like to hold their shares or cash in.Also
column11: lock-up periods create a sentiment of confidence to the market. Large investors holding shares of a new publicly traded company shows the broader market that there is reason to buy and keep the stock.So
column12: why are Snap's lock-up periods peculiar? Snap has expected some institutional investors to hold shares for an entire year. While lock-up periods are common
column13: a year is quite the demand to fill. Snap has also reduced the lock-up period for its employees from the usual 180 days to 150 days.So what's happening here? Snap increased the amount of time institutions have to hold their stock and decreased the amount of time until their internal employees
column14: the ones who know the company the best
column15: can sell.But wait
column16: it gets even more outlandish. Within days of Snap stock trading
column17: upper management of Snap began releasing their shares to the open market. Mr. Spiegel and Mr. Murphy both sold 16 million of their shares for $17 apiece
column18: cashing in for over a quarter billion dollars
column19: each. On top of that
column20: additional directors and officers of Snap sold millions of their shares to make an immediate profit off the market's sentiment of their company.If Snap really was doing incredibly well and has the potential that the market thinks
column21: why wouldn't Snap's most influential faces hold the stock? Why wouldn't they show the market how confident they are in their company? Is the market more bullish than Snap's insiders?Zero Shareholder SayNo one in this world knows Snap better than the people who decided to immediately sell shares
column22: and this should really open your eyes. What's happening is Snap's insiders are taking advantage of what the market has to say about them. After a dry year of IPOs in 2016
column23: Snap was the next big thing after AlibabaBABAand Facebook. With that
column24: insiders chose to exploit the opportunity and run to the bank.But let's try and look on the bright side. As insiders sell shares
column25: they're giving away ownership of the company
column26: right? This makes their votes have less weight when deciding on corporate activity? Wrong. Class A shareholders get absolutely zero votes. So not only are Snap's insiders able to take advantage
column27: they are able to take advantage and not lose any control of the company.How is Snap able to get away with this? Let's put our feet in their shoes.You're an insider and just sold a heavy portion of shares within days of trading
column28: to buy yourself another vacation home. How do you keep your company's stock from tanking? Require large investors to hold it for longer
column29: as discussed above.  Also
column30: work with the underwriting banks that took you public to issue great ratings for your stock.Biased Snap RatingsYesterday
column31: banks which took Snap public
column32: such as Goldman SachsGMand Morgan StanleyMS
column33: released their ratings for the company as theirwaiting periods to release research ended. And what do you know? Most released a ""Buy"" or ""Hold"" recommendation.Although the first ""Buy"" ratings came before Snap's underwriters released their research
column34: the majority sentiment leaned towards the sell side on Wall Street. After the release of Snap's underwriters' recommendations
column35: the majority of analysts have now swung to the buy side.Again
column36: let's take a step back to see what's happening here. The banks which took Snap public are issuing great ratings
column37: which is an entire step away from the what most of Wall Street felt prior to their release.Did these brokerages really have any other choice? If they mostly issued ""Sell"" ratings
column38: as the majority of Wall Street had
column39: then the stock would immediately sell off and that would hurt their firm. And to kill two birds with one stone
column40: issuing bullish ratings keeps the stock lifted as Snap's insiders sell.Closing ThoughtsSnap's stock issuance is rich in confusion. Activity seems to be backwards from what a traditional company would do to keep their shareholders in mind.When looking under the hood it seems Snap is overvalued in the market. Also
column41: outlook seems shaky as Snap's professionals can't even hold their shares.I realize my above ideas may sound conspiracy like
column42: but those were not my intentions. I hope to spark your ideas and thoughts in what may be happening behind the scenes of Wall Street
column43: concerning Snap's stock. Regardless
column44: it's a matter of time until we see Snap's true intentions of going public rise to the surface.More Stock News: This Is Bigger than the iPhone!makeArticleAd();It could become the mother of all technological revolutions. Apple sold a mere1 billion iPhones in 10 years but a new breakthrough is expected to generate morethan 27 billion devices in just 3 years
column45: creating a $1.7 trillion market.Zacks has just released a Special Report that spotlights this fast-emergingphenomenon and 6 tickers for taking advantage of it. If you don't buy now
column46: you maykick yourself in 2020.Click here for the 6 trades >>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today

column1: Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Might Have a Chink in Its Armor;3/28/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsOne of the key reasonsAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column3: NASDAQ:GOOGL) - while it was still called Google - grew from nothing to an advertising behemoth in just a few years lies in the fact that much of what it offered was automated. Without the need for human intervention
column4: it could cost-effectively offer ad space to advertisers with the click of a button (and payment
column5: of course). This did wonders for GOOGL stock.makeArticleAd();Source:Brionv via Wikimedia (Modified)There does come a time
column6: however
column7: when a ""hands off"" approach to â€¦ well
column8: pretty much everything can cause problems.Alphabet stock holders were made well aware of that reality just last week when a couple of advertisers suspended their ad spending at YouTube when it was realized their advertisements prefaced some distasteful hate speech that surfaced at the popular online video venue.In its defense
column9: the company didn't know. As was noted
column10: ad placements are essentially automated. On the other hand
column11: it's arguable to say GOOGL should have known something like that could happen
column12: and prevention measures should have been put in place. The debacle may force Alphabet to operate its advertising service with at least a little more human involvement.A Big Mistake for GOOGL Stock?Although several companies pulled the plug on their YouTube ads
column13: AT&T Inc.(NYSE:T) andVerizon Communications Inc.(NYSE:VZ) were acouple of the bigger names that called it quitsâ€¦ at least for the time being.10 Clobbered Stocks to Buy That Are About to Get Red-HotThere was no specific event that prompted the boycotts
column14: nor is it a brand new realization. But
column15: the matter had been boiling over for a couple of weeks now
column16: withan anti-Semitic clip video called ""Jewish World Order""serving as the poster child of how vile the digital video venue can be
column17: and how damning the power of association can be to a brand.It's theoretically not supposed to happen. Aside from the fact that ads are intended to be targeted to a plausible potential customer
column18: but knowing that automated filters aren't perfect
column19: human judgment can also play a role in determining the appropriateness of an ad placement. Still
column20: that's clearly not working either.Alphabet responded:""We don't comment on individual customers but as announced
column21: we've begun an extensive review of our advertising policies and have made a public commitment to put in place changes that give brands more control over where their ads appear. We're also raising the bar for our ads policies to further safeguard our advertisers' brands.""It's the right thing to do
column22: but a little too late.Impact on Alphabet StockAnd it's not just an embarrassing gaffe that will blow over
column23: as most do. Nomura Instinet believes the advertiser boycott willshave $750 million off of the company's top line over the course of the remainder of 2017.That
column24: however
column25: isn't much in the grand scheme of things.YouTube wasprojected to drive $7.7 billion in revenuefor that three-quarter stretch. Alphabet has done $90.3 billion in revenue for the last four quarters. Of course
column26: inasmuch as YouTube isn't profitable
column27: the impact on the per-share profits of GOOGL stock may be nil.Not all analysts are convinced the high-profile flub is going to do any lasting damage
column28: however. Morgan Stanley calculates that the affected part of the company's ad businessonly makes up 10% of the organization's revenue machine
column29: and boasts millions of advertisers. RBC Capital's math follows up on Nomura's calculation
column30: pointing out that even in the event of a 10% lull in that arm's revenue
column31: it would still only translate into a 1.7% lull in total revenue.Bottom Line for GOOGL StockIt's still not clear what
column32: if anything
column33: Alphabet specifically intends to do about the miscue and the subsequent fallout. And the plausible fiscal impact of the damage done is little more than guesswork at this point. Those matters
column34: however
column35: may be secondary.Should You Buy T-Mobile US
column36: Inc. (TMUS) Stock? 3 Pros
column37: 3 ConsWhile Google may still be the king of search and display ads and GOOGL stock is still one of the top picks in the industry
column38: this is another dent in the company's reputation - and its operation. The automated approach of pairing up ads and publishers was clever when it was the only option
column39: but the whole business of internet advertising has changed. Alphabet stock didn't change enough with it.Case in point: Last year
column40: an internet advertising arrangement called Header Bidding became all the rage.Facebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB)took that ball and ran with it â€¦ and customers love it. Rather than adapt on the future of digital display ads
column41: GOOGL doubled down on its version of the ad-selling approach that distinctly lacks the transparency so many Header Bidding users love. Most observers expect Alphabet stock to lose market share as long as it refuses to face Facebook head-on.None of this means GOOGL stock is doomed
column42: but between being lapped by Facebook and now clearly being unable to guarantee appropriate ad placements to its biggest customers
column43: investors should start to ask some tough questions about Alphabet's sales and delivery model.As of this writing
column44: James Brumley did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace10 Small-Cap Stocks That Could Double in the Next 3 MonthsThe 7 WORST Stocks to Buy Right NowThe postAlphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Might Have a Chink in Its Armorappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Snap Inc Stock (SNAP) and The Running Of The Bulls;3/28/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsMost of the analyst commentary onSnap Inc(NYSE:SNAP) stock since the initial public offering had been bearish
column3: as only two of the initiation reports in the early weeks of trading came withBuy ratings
column4: but now the blackout period for the underwriters is over.makeArticleAd();Thus
column5: it comes as no surprise that the bulls are running along the top of that so-called ""Chinese wall
column6: carrying a flood of positive analysis for Snap stock on their shoulders.Investors in Snap stock appear to be eating it up.Snap Stock a ""Venture Stage Investment""Goldman Sachs Group Inc(NYSE:GS) analyst Heath Terry initiated coverage of Snap stock with a Buy rating and $27 price target. He describes the Snapchat parent company as ""venture stage investing in premium creative platform."" He explained that the recent trend among Internet companies over the last few years is to wait for ""later stages of growth and profitability"" before filing for their IPO.While he admits that buying into a firm that's in the venture capital stage comes with more risk than buying into one that's in later stages of growth
column7: in Snap's case
column8: he feels that the potential reward is greater than the risk.The company has 158 million daily active users who visit the site 18 times every day for a total of 30 minutes. While the initial reviewers of Snap expressed concern about the deceleration in daily active user growth
column9: Terry said comScore data suggests that this metric reaccelerated in the fourth quarter when monthly active users grew 18 million compared to 12 million in the third quarter.This is a particularly interesting point as other analysts noted that the timing of Snap's deceleration in user growth was in line withFacebook Inc's (NASDAQ:FB) launch of products like Instagram Stories
column10: which looks like a clone of Snapchat.Snap's Growth Will ContinueJefferies Group LLC(NYSE:JEFF) analyst Brian Fitzgerald initiate coverage of Snap stock with a Buy rating and $30 price target and said he doesn't feel the company's growth will disappear like the photos posted on Snapchat do. He feels that advertisers will ""clamor to serve ads to its large audience of deeply-engaged users
column11: many of whom are in the attractive millennial demographic and are located in high-value ad markets.""He notes that the average revenue per user for the company's much bigger competitor Facebook is about nine times higher ($23.77 versus Snap's $2.70)
column12: but he expects Snap's average revenue per user to grow sharply and narrow that large gap. He feels that ARPU is Snap's main growth lever and its most likely source of upside to estimates.Fitzgerald also points out that the company's strategy is an asset-light one because it outsources its infrastructure costs toAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL) andAmazon.com
column13: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN).9 Stocks to Buy That Are Growing Faster Than AmazonAs a result
column14: it should be able to scale its platform without any big capital expenditures
column15: a recent area of contention between Facebook and investors.Snap is a Top ""Innovation Machine""RBC Capital Marketsanalyst Mark Mahaney initiated coverage of Snap stock with an 'outperform' rating and $31 price target. He bills the Snapchat parent as ""an innovation leader"" in mobile for both advertisers and consumers. He even goes so far as to describe Snap as ""one of the best innovation machines on the 'net today.""Indeed
column16: the company does deserve some credit for innovation
column17: as some of its ideas have been so good that Facebook decided to clone them
column18: adding its own small spin on products that otherwise look like Snapchatcopies.Mahaney describes Snap's innovation as ""extremely impressive"" and sees ""substantial growth opportunities"" in its current daily active user base and low ARPU. He also offered up Facebook and Twitter as examples of how Snap should be able to scale its profitability.William Blair analyst Ralp Schackart initiated coverage of Snap stock with an Outperform rating
column19: also highlighting the young age of Snapchat's user base as a huge strength because advertisers struggle to reach this age cohort. More than half of Snapchat's users are between the ages of 13 and 24.Other Initiations of Snap StockNot every new analyst report on Snap stock this morning was fullybullish
column20: as Stifel analyst Scott Devitt initiated coverage of Snap stock with a Hold rating and $24 price target. He sees a long monetization runway
column21: but he feels that the current share price already reflects his level of optimism in the company's long-term growth opportunities.The Core of Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Is at RiskHe would become more constructive on the stock if it were to fall closer to $20 per share
column22: although it doesn't look like that will happen any time soon
column23: as investors are boosting shares thanks to this morning's flood of positive analyst coverage. Devitt would also see a better risk/ reward profile for Snap stock if the company ""materially"" beats consensus estimates in its first quarter earnings report.The postSnap Inc Stock And The Running Of The Bullsappeared first onValueWalk.Many academics claim investing is a ""random walk."" We believe this to be only partially true. It is our core belief that value investing can outperform the market

column1: China is Helping Baidu's AI Efforts
column2: and it Couldn't Come at a Better Time;3/27/2017;"Chinese internet search leaderBaidu
column3: Inc.(NASDAQ: BIDU) has made a name for itself as one of the leaders   in artificial intelligence (AI) in the world's most populous   country. It has made no secret about its excitement regarding the   prospects for the technology and has hired some of theforemost expertsin the field for high level positions within the company. Now
column4: it   is getting the Chinese government seal of approval for its   trouble.The government agency in China responsible for planning   economic and social strategies will providean undisclosed amount of fundingto Baidu to develop a national laboratory committed to deep   learning
column5: a specific discipline of AI. The ""lab"" will not be a   physical structure
column6: but an online network of interconnected   researchers sharing data. Baidu will be joined by Tsinghua and   Beihang Universities and other academics from the Chinese Academy   of Sciences. The lab's initial focus will be in the areas of   computer vision

column8: and human-computer   interaction.AI will transform industry after industry. Image source:     Pixabay.makeArticleAd();AI is the new electricityBaidu's CEO

column11: and soon will we say goodbye to the era of mobile   internet...We believe that coming is the era of artificial   intelligence

Baidu's   chief scientist Andrew Ng was a founding member of the team that   developed the Google Brain prior to his tenure at Baidu. He is   also an adjunct professor at Stanford University
column13: where he taught   AI and has made similar statements concerning his belief that AI   will be transformational:I think that AI is a new superpower. AI is the new     electricity. Two hundred years ago there was no such thing as     electricity. You couldn't talk on phones

We think     that AI will similarly transform industry to industry. column1: The 3 Stocks With the Best Businesses We've Ever Seen;3/27/2017;"A great business is extremely difficult to disrupt.   Competition has the tendency to drive down profits
column2: but a great   business can buck this trend. A competitive advantage isn't   enough; the best businesses havedurablecompetitive advantages
column3: what Warren Buffett calls an economic   moat. Trying to beat a company with a moat isn't impossible
column4: but   it's often not worth the cost.We asked three of our contributors to each discuss a company   that fits the above description. Here's whyMastercard(NYSE: MA)
column5: Alphabet(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL)
column6: andWaste Management(NYSE: WM) are three of the best businesses
column7: and the best stocks
column8: we've ever seen.A toll bridge on global commerceBrian Feroldi(Mastercard):While there are a lot of great business models in existence
column9: I   must admit that Mastercard's is the one I most admire. Mastercard   plays a crucial role in connecting merchants
column10: customers
column11: and   financial institutions together to enable digital commerce. In   exchange for its services
column12: Mastercard takes a small swipe off of   each transaction. With trillions of dollars flowing through its   network each year -- yes
column13: trillions-- those small fees add up to the tune of more than $10 billion   in annual revenue.makeArticleAd();All that revenue is wonderful
column14: but what I really love about   Mastercard's business is its operating leverage. In essence
column15: this   means that Mastercard's costs are largely fixed
column16: so processing   one more transaction costs the company next to nothing. Thus
column17: every additional transaction that the company can incentivize on   its network almost turns into pure profit. Since consumers have   been ditching cash and checks in favor of credit and debit cards   for years
column18: Mastercard's profit margin has skyrocketed.MA Profit Margin (TTM)data byYCharts.Looking ahead
column19: I see no reason for this trend to change. While   credit and debit cards are ubiquitous in developed markets
column20: they   only represent 15% of global transactions. That suggests that   this company has decades of room left for revenue and profit   growth. If true
column21: then Mastercard's stock stands a good chance at   continuing to thump the market from here. That's why I've made   this company one of my biggest personal holdings and have no   intention to sell my shares anytime soon.An incredible technology companyTim Green(Alphabet):The amount of cash that Alphabet's Google throws off is made even   more impressive by the fact that the company is still growing at   a double-digit rate. Revenue from Google grew by 20% in 2016 to   $89.5 billion
column22: with the business producing operating income of   $27.9 billion. While Google does face threats
column23: ranging from   social media companies likeFacebookto e-commerce giantAmazon
column24: the company's products are so deeply embedded in people's lives   that upending its business model would be a herculean task.Google dominates search
column25: leaving its competitors fighting over   the scraps. Products like Gmail
column26: Maps
column27: and the Chrome browser   have become the standards
column28: giving Google a massive base of users.   Google's Android mobile operating system powers more than 85% of   all smartphones sold
column29: and its Chromebooks now account for more   than half of all U.S. classroom devices sold. All of this feeds   into it advertising business and its cloud computing   business.Image source: Alphabet.The success of Google allows Alphabet to subsidize its moon   shots. From self-driving cars to internet access delivered via   balloons
column30: Alphabet is betting billions that one of these   long-shot ideas will take off. Many will lead nowhere
column31: but the   potential of each idea is enormous.Alphabet is one of the most successful companies in history
column32: and that success has been sustained by significant competitive   advantages. Even if none of Alphabet's moonshots pay off
column33: the   company should continue to thrive well into the future.The best kind of business: The ones you use daily but     never even considerTyler Crowe(Waste Management):I think of some of the best businesses to be in are the   ones that we don't consider on a daily basis. Those   day-to-day tasks we take for granted and think nothing of paying   for the service. Is there anything that fits that description   better than handling our refuse? Companies that collect and   properly dispose of our trash are incredibly valuable services   that we barely notice. Behind the scenes
column34: though
column35: it is a   business that has more competitive advantages than one can count.   That's what makes Waste Management the kind of company that   leaves me in awe of its business model.The most obvious advantage a waste handling industry has is   geography and regulations. The ability to open up a new landfill   for proper waste disposal faces mountains of regulatory scrutiny   as well as the ""not in my backyard"" mentality of local   communities. So those companies that can get a landfill up and   running have near-monopolistic reign over a particular region. If   that weren't enough
column36: it's extremely capital intense to build and   maintain a fleet of collection vehicles. These types of strategic   benefits keep competition low in specific regions and give   those operating in a particular community incredible pricing   power.For investors in Waste Management
column37: it has translated this   economic moat into a value-generating machine. While no one will   ever be blown away with the company's growth rates
column38: it continues   to generate gobs of free cash flow that is used to buy back stock   and increase dividend payments. These sorts of   shareholder-friendly initiatives have made Waste Management an   incredible stock to hold for decades at a time.WM Dividenddata byYCharts.It's hard to disrupt a well-entrenched business in the   waste-handling industry
column39: and that makes Waste Management a stock   that should tug at the heartstrings of long-term investors.10 stocks we like better than MastercardWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: U.S. Senate Votes to Eliminate FCC's Broadband Privacy Rules;3/27/2017;"Recently
column2: the U.S. Senate voted against a set of privacy rules for broadband service providers
column3: previously proposed by the telecom regulator FCC (Federal Communications Commission) under the democratic administration of President Obama. On Oct 2016
column4: the then FCC chairman Tom Wheeler had proposed these rules. However
column5: the new FCC -- reconstructed by President Trump with Ajit Pai at its helm -- voted to stay the rules of the previous regime on Mar 1
column6: 2017.The U.S. Senate voted 50-48 to repeal the rules. The vote also prohibits the FCC from reintroducing the rules in the future. The matter will now move to the U.S. House of Representatives.What Are Broadband Privacy Rules?The broadband privacy rules proposed by former FCC Chairman Tom Wheeler required ISPs to get consumers' explicit consent before selling or sharing Web browsing data and other private information with advertisers and other companies. Since ISPs (Internet Service Providers) have direct access to user database
column7: they used to sell the data to digital marketing firms for targeted advertising. This was a major source of revenues for the ISPs.It is important to note that ISPs like Verizon Communications Inc.VZ
column8: AT&T Inc.Tand Comcast Corp.CMCSAare governed by FCC rules. On the other hand
column9: Internet firms such as Facebook Inc.FB
column10: Twitter Inc.TWTRand Alphabet Inc.GOOGLcome under the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) regulations. At present
column11: there are no rules governing data disclosure by Internet firms.  As a result
column12: the 'Opt In' ruling will be an advantage. However
column13: the FCC had assured the ISPs that it will try to harmonize the regulations with the FTC.Notably
column14: all the stocks mentioned above currently carry a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). You can seethe complete list of today's Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy)   stocks here.FCC in the Trump EraDonald Trump already has had quite an impact on telecom policy parameters. On Jan 2017
column15: Trump elected Republican commissioner Ajit Pai as the new Chairman of the FCC. Ajit Pai is a staunch opponent of several laws and rules adopted by the FCC under former Chairman Tom Wheeler's regime
column16: including Net Neutrality laws
column17: rules to reform the business data market and set top box reform proposals. Importantly
column18: all three major reform rules were going to hit the telecom operators and ISPs the most.ISPs to Cheer NowThe digital advertisement market is an exponentially growing space
column19: and ISPs have been increasingly investing resources to cash in on the bountiful opportunities in this space. However
column20: the FCC's previous directive stipulated that the ISP should notify its customers before sharing any user data for advertising. This was certainly going to mar ISPs prospects in this business. Therefore
column21: a new FCC body with less regulatory intention will certainly bode well for the ISP industry.Zacks' Top 10 Stocks for 2017makeArticleAd();In addition to the stocks discussed above
column22: would you like to know about our 10 finest buy-and-hold tickers for the entirety of 2017?Who wouldn't? Last year's market-beating Top 10 portfolio produced 5 double-digit winners. For example

column1: Better Than Cash: 8% Payouts â€œHedgedâ€ Against a Market Pullback (QYLD
column2: EOS);3/27/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsIf you're worried about a pullback
column4: I don't blame you. But don't sit in cash and earn nothing when you can hedge your portfolio AND collect yields up to 8%.makeArticleAd();Let's talk about a couple of funds that use a well-worn options tactic - writing ""covered calls"" - that can generate generous yields typically between 7% and 9%. Conveniently
column5: you never have to deal with the complications of options contracts - these funds do all the work for you!But
column6: why covered calls
column7: and why now?Covered calls are an options strategy in which you sell call option contracts against stocks you hold. Selling the call options generates income
column8: called a ""premium."" From there
column9: a couple things can happen. If your stock reaches the strike price of the call option
column10: you're obligated to sell your shares to the call buyer (but you still keep the premium). If your stock stays below the strike price
column11: you still keep the premium
column12: and you can keep your shares - and from there
column13: if you'd like
column14: you can keep selling covered calls against them for more income.Ziegler Capital Management
column15: a specialty investment bank out of Chicago
column16: extols the virtues of covered calls (emphasis mine):""Investors often consider the income from the sale of the call option as a form of downside protection. As a result of this income
column17: covered call strategies have historically generated impressive results compared to the S&P 500 Index in terms of risk mitigation and volatility reduction. â€¦ Over a market cycle
column18: covered call strategies have tended to produce equity-like returns with lower beta and lower volatility.""10 Mutual Funds You Can Buy and Hold ForeverThis strategy does limit your upside during raging bull markets
column19: but whether we're about to fly into some market turbulence
column20: or on the slim chance that a significant downturn is nigh

column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsLast week
column4: chipmaker - and graphics processing specialist -Nvidia Corporation(NASDAQ:NVDA) unveiled some encouraging but perhaps unusual news. That is
column5: Chinese internet powerhouseTencent Holdings Ltd(OTCMKTS:TCTZF) hasselected Nvidia as the providerof its core hardware needed to make Tencent's artificial intelligence ambitions a reality.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockIt was odd
column6: simply because that's not what Nvidia does. A more conventional computer processor and chipset name likeAdvanced Micro Devices
column7: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMD) orIntel Corporation(NASDAQ:INTC) would make more sense serving as the backbone for a new AI system.Thing is
column8: this isn't the first time owners of NVDA stock have heard of the company's hardware being selected as the centerpiece of an artificial intelligence system. Just two weeks ago
column9: Nvidia was tapped byMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) topower the next generationof its AI offering.What gives?As it turns out
column10: traditional computer processors like Intel's Core and Pentium CPUs or AMD'sRyzenaren't necessarily best-suited for the ultra-high-speed processing needs the rise of AI has created. Investors - and not just NVDA stock holders - would be wise to note the nuance
column11: as AI is expected to become a$16 billion marketby 2022
column12: andgrow to $36 billionby 2025.GPU Technology vs. CPU TechnologyHistorically
column13: while the hardware and firmware supporting a computer's (or laptop's) display screen was a key part of its performance
column14: a device's heart and soul was its processor
column15: or CPU. It operatesâ€¦ well
column16: everything at blazing fast speed
column17: with more RAM (memory) helping out.7 Consumer Stocks That Will Lead Your PortfolioThe graphics processing unit
column18: or GPU
column19: wasn't a dealmaker or a dealbreaker.As computers have become faster and more powerful
column20: though
column21: and performance expectations have swelled
column22: GPUs have become very
column23: very impressive
column24: in many cases fully taking on the display-management role that was otherwise taken on by the CPU. Indeed
column25: a GPU is some4thing of a mini-computer in itselfâ€¦â€¦ and they're very
column26: very fast. That makes them perfect for high-speed artificial intelligence applications
column27: where the quantity of computations is more important than the depth or complexity of those computations.An entry posted at the Nvidia corporate blog in the middle of last year not only served as something of an omen to the tech world
column28: but to savvy owners of Nvidia stock as well.It explains:""Computer programs contain commands that are largely executed sequentially. Deep learning is a fundamentally new software model where billions of software-neurons and trillions of connections are trained
column29: in parallel. Running DNN algorithms and learning from examples
column30: the computer is essentially writing its own software. This radically different software model needs a new computer platform to run efficiently. dlboost-3-webAccelerated computing is an ideal approach and the GPU is the ideal processor. As Nature recently noted
column31: early progress in deep learning was ""made possible by the advent of fast graphics processing units (GPUs) that were convenient to program and allowed researchers to train networks 10 or 20 times faster.""That's what Microsoft knew a couple of weeks ago when it asked Nvidia to provide the computing power for its HGX-1 hyperscale GPU accelerator
column32: specifically for cloud-based artificial intelligence applications.Nvidia CEO Jen-Hsun Huangadded of the new Microsoft/Nvidia venture:""AI is a new computing model that requires a new architecture. The HGX-1 hyperscale GPU accelerator will do for AI cloud computing what the ATX standard did to make PCs pervasive today. It will enable cloud-service providers to easily adopt NVIDIA GPUs to meet surging demand for AI computing.""ATX
column33: short forAdvanced Technology-eXtended
column34: is motherboard configuration that paved the way for the proliferation of PCs thereafter by standardizing how they would be assembled and what sort of hardware could be connected to them.The biggest leap forward since ATX was unveiled would be a game-changer indeed. With Tencent and Nvidia now taking another step down that road
column35: Nvidia is emerging as a key player in a market few expected it to be in.The Core of Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Is at RiskNvidia's deep-learning technology is also part of its autonomous driving platform
column36: though it remains to be seen exactly what its future looks like on that front.Bottom Line for Nvidia StockFor all intents and purposes
column37: Nvidia stock is still mostly an investment in tech company that makes computer displays work. That's not apt to change anytime in the immediate future. Given time though
column38: artificial intelligence is positioned to be a big piece of the company's revenue pie. Current and would-be shareholders need to add the subject of AI to the company's future report cards.As of this writing

column1: Facebook Is Partnering With Amazon.com to Take on Google;3/27/2017;"Facebook(NASDAQ: FB) is already a dominant force in digital display   advertising. eMarkter expects the social network giant's share of   the U.S. market to climb to 39.1% this year
column2: as it sells more   than three times as much display advertising as its next closest   competitor
column3: Google. TheAlphabet(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) company is expected to generate   $5.2 billion in U.S. display advertising this year.But Facebook's ad revenue is largely confined to its own   properties
column4: such as Facebook and Instagram. The Facebook Audience   Network (FAN) -- its ad network -- generates only a few hundred   million in annual net ad revenue for the company. That number   could get a significant boost in the near term
column5: as Facebook just   announced it's rolling out header bidding to all mobile web   publishers. That represents not only a significant opportunity   for Facebook to increase its network ad revenue
column6: but a threat to   Google's display ad business as well.Image source: FacebookmakeArticleAd();Publishers love header biddingHeader bidding is a system that levels the playing field when   it comes to selling ads online. Previously
column7: whenever you loaded a   web page
column8: that publisher would check ad networks one by one until   it found an advertiser willing to pay a reasonable price to   populate the ads on the site. Since Google is such a dominant   force in advertising
column9: publishers' searches usually started and   ended with Google.Header bidding allows publishers to collect bids from multiple   ad networks at the same time and receive the highest bid for its   ad inventory. As a result
column10: publishers receive more revenue for   their ads
column11: and smaller ad networks stand a fighting chance   against Google. The more ad networks supporting header bidding
column12: the better it is for publishers. Facebook says publishers in its   tests saw a revenue increase of 10% to 30%.Image source: FacebookAmazon.com(NASDAQ: AMZN) notably developed a header bidding solution last   year in an effort to potentially growits advertising business. Given Amazon's prowess in cloud computing -- supporting   hundreds of major websites -- its integrated cloud-based solution   could prove extremely popular with publishers. Now
column13: Facebook is   partnering with Amazon and several other header-bidding system   developers to bring its ad network to more publishers.Growing the ad networkFacebook's audience network still represents a small part of   Facebook's revenue. It reached a $1 billion run rate at the   beginning of 2016
column14: but that's gross revenue. Facebook only keeps   a small percentage of that figure as net revenue.During Facebook's second-quarter earnings call last year
column15: CFO   Dave Wehner told analysts: ""The overall growth is still being   driven predominantly by Facebook. Instagram is clearly making a   contribution
column16: as is the Audience Network.""That may change later this year
column17: however
column18: as Facebook faces ad   load saturation. But with the social network's steady user growth   and continued increases in engagement
column19: Facebook's enormousness   will still be tough to overshadow.Nonetheless
column20: the growth of FAN will certainly help Facebook   offset some of the slowdown at its flagship app. In fact
column21: since   the audience network uses the same targeting data as Facebook's   in-house ads
column22: Facebook advertisers may be inclined to start   buying more ads on Facebook
column23: especially if header bidding   increases its ability to win bids on publishers' websites.FAN represents an opportunity for marketers to reach   Facebook's audience outside Facebook and even expand beyond   Facebook. Management says FAN offers 16% greater reach than   Facebook alone and now reaches 1 billion people monthly.The impact on GoogleThe value of FAN to publishers is that Facebook requires   marketers to bid the same on FAN ads as on its own ads.   Therefore
column24: third-party publishers get the same (presumably high)   rates as Facebook. If Facebook's average bid is higher than   Google's
column25: it could force Google to lower its take rate from   publishers.Last year
column26: Google generated $15.6 billion in gross revenue   from its network partners. It also paid out $10.9 billion in   revenue sharing to those publishers
column27: about 70%. In fact
column28: publishers' revenue share from Google has increased two   percentage points since 2014
column29: when header bidding started   becoming popular.Google said that ""the increase in Network Members' TAC   [traffic acquisition cost] rate was primarily driven by the shift   in advertising buying from our traditional network business to   programmatic advertising buying."" As more ad sales shift to   header bidding and more ad networks like Facebook join the fray
column30: Google stands to see that number continue climbing
column31: unless it   wants to lose out on some of that $15.6 billion in gross revenue   it generated last year.10 stocks we like better than FacebookWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column32: it can pay to listen. After all
column33: the newsletter they have run for   over a decade
column34: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column35: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Facebook wasn't one of   them! That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even better   buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of February 6

column1: How Much Will Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Fall If the iPhone 8 Flops?;3/24/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsCalling a spade a spade
column3: Apple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) is the most recognizable names in the world. By extension
column4: AAPL stock remains one of the market's most sought-after picks.makeArticleAd();Source:iphonedigital via FlickrBoth platitudes are well deserved. The company has earned its way to the top
column5: making a piece of hardware - the iPhone - not only a technical marvel
column6: but a status symbol and lifestyle centerpiece like no other. The device keeps millions of consumers ranging from tweens to geriatrics with their noses buried in their smartphones in all four corners of the earth.Nevertheless â€¦While Apple has been largely deserving of its spot on so many investors' pedestals
column7: that sort of collective homage is always dangerous. Nothing lasts forever
column8: and as unpopular as the premise may be
column9: it would be wise to at least entertain the possibility that the next-generation iPhone (referred to the iPhone 8 so far) could the unveiling that starts exposing Apple's cracks.iPhone 8 Flop? Never!Before you pull out your pitchfork
column10: start heating up the tar and gather your feathers
column11: dial it back just a bit. This isn't to say that even a mediocre Apple still isn't better than most any other stock on the planet.10 Safe Dividend Stocks to Own During the Next Market CrashStill
column12: there are three key reasons the iPhone 8 could end up not beingthe panaceait has been made out to be. Yes
column13: they're rather obvious
column14: but concerns all the same:1. People Really Are Growing Tired of the Constant ConnectivityIt was fun for a few years
column15: but some smartphone owners - an increasing number of them - are starting to realize their unhealthy addiction to their devices. A survey performed last year indicated that42% of Americansconstantly check their phones for new messages. It's a statistic being noticed by impartial observes like CTV technology analyst Carmi Levy.Levy commentedlast year:""The promise of technology is that it'll improve our lives
column16: but sometimes we become enslaved to the technology because there's so much going on. A certain part of our brain is always looking for something that is perhaps simpler â€¦ and delivers as promised with fewer frustrations.""Enough consumers are starting to move the notion out of their subconscious into their conscious.2. $1
column17: 000 for a Phone? Really?Yep
column18: somebody out there won't think twice about paying it. A lot of people won't think twice about paying it. For a wide swath of iPhone fans who will sooner or later realize that's more than one month's rent or mortgage payment
column19: though
column20: they're due a ""get real"" moment.3. Strong CompetitionFor the longest time
column21: Apple had little to no competition. That's changing though. Yes
column22: the exploding battery debacleSamsung Electronics(OTCMKTS:SSNLF) faced with its Galaxy 7 phones was damning
column23: and it's not like the Google Pixel fromAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column24: NASDAQ:GOOGL)was a smashing successthat threatened Apple either.Both companies are still overhauling their hardware and improving their designs though
column25: and consumers are taking notice
column26: for about a third to half the cost of an iPhone.Potential Impact on AAPL StockAs for the impact a lackluster iPhone 8 response might have on AAPL stock
column27: one can only guess. But
column28: one can still make an educated guess.For its most recently completed quarter
column29: Applesold 78.29 million iPhones
column30: generating $54.38 billion worth of revenue. That's not necessarily a full picture of the then-new iPhone 7's success
column31: however. The device was actually unveiled a few days prior to the beginning of the quarter
column32: and saw tremendous sales immediately after its launch. For the iPhone 7's inaugural quarter
column33: the company producediPhone revenue of $28.16 billion
column34: selling 45.51 million units. Between both quarters
column35: the bulk of the iPhones sold were the 7 model.It was record-breaking success
column36: by the way
column37: with the78.29 million iPhones sold last quarteredging out sales of the second edition of the iPhone 6 in the comparable quarter a year earlier. The average selling price for the most recent quarter comes out to $695 apiece.That price tag does present something of a quandary for any estimates regarding the impending success of the iPhone 8. It could sell 30% fewer phones
column38: but inasmuch as the cost of the 8 is more than 40% greater than the 7
column39: Apple could conceivably do just as well (and possibly post wider margins).This is where putting AAPL stock on a pedestal becomes a bit of a problem though.Bottom Line for AppleFor better or worse
column40: Apple shareholders have largely been trained to expect beats not just of revenue and earnings estimates
column41: but also beats of sales as measured by units. Any weakness on any front poses a risk to a usually frothy AAPL valuation.My prediction? I firmly believe the iPhone 8 will be an unexpected disappointment
column42: though that's distinctly different than a flop. Some - though not all - will balk at a four-figure sticker price
column43: forcing people to finally ask themselves ""What are we doing
column44: paying a thousand bucks to keep in touch onFacebookand to play mobile video games on a five inch screen?""Again
column45: don't misunderstand. I fully acknowledge there are some utilitarian features on the iPhone 8 that will be viewed as a must-have for some consumers.Wireless chargingis convenient
column46: and the built-in touch ID is going to be critical to some business users concerned about security.By and large though
column47: I have to believe the average consumer just wants a phone they can use to stay connected
column48: via the web and voice. An edge-to-edge screen or a lack of a home button isn't the game-changer it's being made it to be
column49: especially at $1
column50: 000 a pop â€¦ even for people who only own the iPhone as a status symbol.Kroger Co (KR) Stock Looks Very Attractive Right NowTo quantify my pessimism
column51: I'm guessing Apple sells 70 million units of the iPhone 8 in its first full quarter starting in October. That translates into more year-over-year revenue
column52: but is still a letdown for what's supposed to be ""the best iPhone ever."" Such a result could easily send AAPL sock careening
column53: though odds are good the market would figure it out before the official numbers were released by the company. AAPL stock could lose as much as 20% of its value on that kind of worry.Perhaps worse than the numbers themselves would be the sudden realization that Apple is indeed fallible. A bad quarter is forgivable. A flawed business model isn't as easily forgotten.As of this writing

column6: reportsEngadget.Google Hangouts users that are worried about losing their old messages are fretting over nothing. When choosing a new default messaging app
column7: their old text messageswill be transferred overfrom Hangouts to that one. column1: Amazon Is About to End the Competition's Only Advantage Over Alexa;3/23/2017;"E-commerce giantAmazon.com
column2: Inc.(NASDAQ: AMZN) has a hit on its hands with itsartificial intelligence-based Alexa virtual assistant and the products powered by the   digital darling. The Echo smart home speaker

column6: which also includes the Fire TV stick   and Fire tablet

This new   communication functionality would extend to other Alexa devices
column11: working in much the same way as an intercom. If true
column12: this   capability would partially address the disadvantage compared to   other digital assistants
column13: which are primarily   smartphone-based.Amazon is taking other steps to counter its virtual   assistant's marked deficiency. Amazon reveled this week that   Alexa would soon be found in Amazon's official iPhone app

column15: which essentially brings its myriad of   skills to the iPhone. And it won't be the only phone sporting   Alexa. Earlier this year

column17: it probably won't be   long before Alexa is available on Google's Android phones.Alexa gets an upgrade. Image source: Amazon.In my houseEstimates for sales of the Alexa family of products vary.   Consumer Intelligence Research Partners (CIRP)estimatesthat 8.2 million US consumers own an Alexa-powered device.   Analysts at Morgan Stanley estimated total sales at 11 million by   early December 2016
column18: but admit that number is too low
column19: having   missed out on the high-volume Black Friday and holiday sales.   Including strong holiday sales
column20: those numbers could be in the   range of 13 to 15 million. With an estimated 125 million   U.S. households
column21: Alexa could be nearing a 10% penetration   rate.What have you done for me lately?Alexa's popularity seems to stem from more than the mere   novelty of the product. Amazon released a skills kit early on   that encouraged developers to create voice commands
column22: which   connected Alexa to their products and services. Amazon recentlyannouncedthat developers had published more than 10
column23: 000 skills for the   virtual assistant
column24: giving it the clear lead in terms of   usefulness. With that many choices
column25: you might wonder how to find   the skills most useful to you. Alexa has that covered
column26: with a   Skill Finder feature that also presents a ""skill of the day"" for   the asking. Other popular offerings include games like the   Potterhead quiz for Harry Potter fans
column27: trainer tips for fans ofPokemon Go
column28: ordering your favoriteDomino'spizza
column29: and even help deciding what to watch on TV or at the   movies.Foolish final thoughtsAddressing the key disadvantage that stood between Alexa and   consumers is an indication of how seriously the company views its   ecosystem. The family of products have even beenprominently displayedin Amazon's growing number of bookstores. Early sales won't make   a dent in Amazon's revenue
column30: a gargantuan $44 billion in the   company's most recent quarter
column31: so why the big push? A recent   analyst note may provide a clue. Mark Mahaney and Jim Shaughnessy   from RBC Capital Markets predict that it could be worth an   additional $10 billion in annual sales of devices and products by   2020. With that much riding on Alexa

column1: AT&T & Verizon Suspend Marketing Advertisements from YouTube;3/23/2017;"U.S. telecom behemothsAT&T Inc.TandVerizon Communications Inc.VZhave decided to suspend their marketing campaign on Google's YouTube site. The reason behind the decision is the appearance of their ads alongside offensive and highly controversial videos promoting adult contents
column2: terrorism and hate speeches. Notably
column3: Google is a division of Alphabet Inc.GOOGL.Yesterday
column4: the two companies announced that they are suspending all their advertising from Google's non-search platforms
column5: including YouTube as well as third-party websites that Google partners with. The withdrawal will stand until Google permanently solves the problem. So far
column6: more than 250 companies have pulled their advertisements from YouTube including Johnson & JohnsonJNJ
column7: the world's biggest health-care company.The decision of Verizon and AT&T is significant as telephone operators are among the biggest block of advertisers in corporate America. The two companies together spent $6.6 billion in advertisement in 2015. According to Kantar Media
column8: Verizon and AT&T were the third and fourth largest ad spenders in the U.S. in 2016.Importantly
column9: the two telecom giants have withdrawn their ads from Google's non-search platforms only. However
column10: Google's search service generates the majority of its advertisement revenues which was a whopping $79.4 billion in 2016. Although Google doesn't disclose how much of its ad revenues came from YouTube
column11: research firm eMarketer estimated it to be around $5.6 billion and has projected this figure to reach $7 billion in 2017.At this stage
column12: it is worth mentioning that Alphabet Inc. has been in a tussle with AT&T and Verizon during the last couple of years over several regulatory issues related to broadband and data privacy. The company has significantly stepped up investments in fiber-optic broadband and wireless technologies to increase competition.Price Performance of Alphabet

column1: The Future of Virtual Reality: 5 Things to Know;3/22/2017;"Virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR) technologies   have gotten a lot of attention over the past few years.Sony's PlayStation VR headset is shining a spotlight onthe viability of VR gaming
column2: whileAlphabet's(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL)  Google Cardboard and new   Daydream View headsets are pushing mobile VR into the mainstream.   The unexpected success of Pokemon Go last year showed that   smartphone users are ready and willing to adopt augmented   reality. AndMicrosoft's(NASDAQ: MSFT)  development of its HoloLens goggles aim to   prove that the virtual and augmented worlds will soon become a   part of our reality.Investors looking to benefit from these two intertwined   markets should keep these five things in mind:Image source: Google.makeArticleAd();1. The future of VR could be our next computing     platformMuch of the attention surrounding virtual reality right now   has to do mainly with how it will be used for gaming
column3: filmmaking
column4: or other entertainment content. ButFacebook(NASDAQ: FB) CEO Mark Zuckerberg believes that VR could surpass   all of these categories.He said in a Bloomberginterviewlast year that VR is ""a good candidate to be the next major   computing platform."" Zuckerberg thinks it'll take a while for us   to get there (more on that later)
column5: but he's optimistic that VR   could be a primary form of communication technology in the near   future:Photos are richer than text; video
column6: much richer than photos.     But that's not the end
column7: right? I mean
column8: it's like this     indefinite continuum of getting closer and closer to being able     to capture what a person's natural experience and thought is
column9: and just being able to immediately capture that and design it     however you want and share it with whomever you want.2. It will take a while for VR to gain     tractionVR is still in its very early stages
column10: and it's likely that it   will take many more years before it becomes mainstream --   Zuckerberg has put the timeframe at five to 10 years.Adding to the slow pace is the fact that some hyped   technologies
column11: like Magic Leap's AR headset
column12: have recently been   found to be behind schedule.The Informationreported(subscription required) at the end of the last year that Magic   Leap -- which has raised $1.4 billion in funding in about three   years -- pivoted away from some of its earlier fiber optic   technologies and now trails the image quality of Microsoft's   HoloLens.And even the HoloLens
column13: which currently costs $3
column14: 000 and is   mainly for developers
column15: has sold only thousands of units. Roger   Walkden
column16: Microsoft's HoloLens commercial lead
column17: recently toldThe Inquirerthat
column18: ""We're not trying to sell hundreds of thousands or millions   or anything
column19: it's expensive
column20: and it's not in huge numbers. So   we're happy with the level of sales that we've got -- I can't   tell you anything about the numbers
column21: but it's in thousands
column22: not   hundreds of thousands
column23: and that's fine. That's all we need.""While Microsoft may be pleased with those numbers
column24: it's still   a clear indicator that VR and AR have a long way go before they   become mainstream.And then there's the recent news that Facebook's Oculus is   shutting down 200 of its 500 demo sites within Best Buy   stores
column25: reportedly due to thelack of public interest. The future may be virtual
column26: but we're getting there slowly.3. It offers a new way of seeing our worldJason Pontin
column27: the editor of MIT'sTechnology Review
column28: recentlyinterviewedJessica Brillhart
column29: a filmmaker for virtual reality at   Google
column30: and talked with her about how VR is currently used and   what it might become in the near future. When asked if   people will eventually use VR to record home videos
column31: Brillhart   responded that we probably would but that it might not be a good   thing
column32: Think of everything you forget about a birthday party when     you're a kid. But now the rig would capture everything. You     could watch someone you loved respond the way she used to
column33: or     eat cake a certain way. It is going to be interesting to see     what happens when we aren't able to forget anything     anymore.The interview is a good reminder that VR is still in its early   stages and it's still unclear how this platform will be used
column34: and   whether or not we'll like exactly how it turns out.4. Virtual reality could eventually impact all of the     sensesRight now
column35: VR is limited to a user's visual and auditory   senses
column36: but in the future this will likely be enhanced.   The general manager of Dell's gaming PC manufacturer   Alienware
column37: Frank Azor
column38: said thisin an interviewwith TIME last year:Once you begin catering to the rest of the senses
column39: like what     we feel body-wise
column40: temperature-wise
column41: and smell
column42: the reality     factor of virtual reality [becomes] stronger and the virtual     piece begins to fade.Breaking the barrier between the virtual world and the   physical world with high-end touch sensors could be the next step   in virtual reality
column43: and it won't be here for a while
column44: but VR   hardware and software makers are already thinking about how this   technology can go from immersive to fully interactive.5. The market potential for both AR and VR could be     hugeThe virtual reality market was worth about $1.9 billion in   2016
column45: but that's expected to climb to $22.4 billion by 2020.   Those numbers include both software and hardware sales. And when   you factor in AR sales
column46: the market skyrockets even higher. The   combined AR and VR market will be worth $121 billion by 2021
column47: according to Digi-Capital.In that same year
column48: IDC estimates more than 99 million AR and   VR headsets will be shipped
column49: up from just 10 million last year
column50: which represents a 58% compound annual growth rate between 2016   and 2021..The good news for investors is that companies are just getting   started with AR and VR
column51: which meansthe opportunities to benefit haven't passed. There are still plenty of unknowns
column52: but as more companies rally   around these new technologies and make the necessary investments   to get them off of the ground
column53: we're likely to see the future of   AR and VR develop substantially over the next few years.10 stocks we like better than FacebookWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column54: it can pay to listen. After all
column55: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade

column57: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right nowâ€¦ and Facebook wasn't one of     them! column1: Is Alphabet Stock a Good Way to Invest in Self-Driving Cars?;3/22/2017;"Three things seem pretty clear at this point in history:Self-driving cars will begin coming to market before     long.They'll generate huge profits for some companies.Google has been a leader in developing self-driving     technology.But does it follow that Google's parent
column2: Alphabet(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL)
column3: will reap the rewards of its   technological leadership? Or put another way
column4: are the potential   profits from self-driving cars a reason to add Alphabet's stock   to your portfolio?A lot of commentators seem to think so
column5: but I'm very   skeptical. Here's why.makeArticleAd();Driverless ""panda cars"" were the public face of the Google     Self-Driving Car Project for several years. Image source:     Alphabet.Alphabet has what looks like a leadership position...Google began tinkering with self-driving cars way back in   2009
column6: long before many investors began taking the technology   seriously. The original team behind what became knows as the   Google Self-Driving Car Project included several robotics   all-stars who seemed ready to invent the future. The whole thing   appeared to be decades beyond what the established automakers   were doing.For a while
column7: it was. Of course
column8: in the last few years
column9: some   automakers and auto-industry suppliers have invested heavily in   the technology and made significant gains. But even so
column10: Alphabet's self-driving unit
column11: which was spun out of Google and   renamed Waymo late last year
column12: retains some big advantages:By at least one measure -- ""disengagements
column13: the number of     times a human driver has to take control of a self-driving test     car -- Waymo made major progress last year andappears to be aheadof most known rivals.Maps. The first self-driving cars to come to market will     rely heavily on highly detailed maps as a backup to their     sensors. Google has been mapping the world in ever-increasing     detail for years; Waymo will have access to those maps
column14: while     its competitors will have to look elsewhere.Waymo has developed its own self-driving sensor hardware
column15: including -- crucially -- LIDAR units that cost much less than     current commercially available units.Those are significant advantages. But there's a big question   that might not be obvious to investors who don't have a deep   understanding of the auto industry:How will Waymo bring all of that to market?Waymo's current test fleet was built in partnership with     FCA
column16: but the companies have disclosed no plans to collaborate     on production vehicles. Image source: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles     NV....but bringing it to market may prove complicatedWaymo's CEO
column17: John Krafcik
column18: is a respected auto-industry   veteran who was hired to lead the project in September 2015.   Krafcik brought a welcome dose of realistic transparency to the   project when he made it clear that Alphabet has no intention of   manufacturing its own vehicles. Instead
column19: he said
column20: Waymo would   seek to bring its technology to market via partnerships with   established automakers.There's just one problem: The automakers aren't exactly   beating down Krafcik's door. In fact
column21: the auto executives I've   talked with feel that they have very good reasons to steer clear   of a deal with Waymo
column22: starting with control of the data generated   by self-driving cars.It's almost an understatement to say that automakers areveryaware of the smartphone precedent. The phone makers that chose to   adopt the Android operating system ended up making hardware on   very slim margins. Alphabet ended up with most of the profits
column23: because Android provided it with the (immensely valuable) users'   data.Auto executives don't want to end up in the same boat
column24: and   they know that they'll soon have alternatives that will allow   them to keep at least some control of the data. At least one   alternative
column25: a partnership betweenDelphi Automotive(NYSE: DLPH)
column26: Intel(NASDAQ: INTC)
column27: andMobileye(NYSE: MBLY)
column28: aims to have a self-driving system available to   any automaker that wants it by the end of 2019. That partnership   will allow automakers to retain much of the data
column29: and auto   executives see it as homegrown -- created largely by   established industry suppliers
column30: not by Silicon Valley   hotshots.Given that
column31: why go with Waymo?That said
column32: a couple of big automakers have kicked the tires on   Waymo's technology:Fiat Chrysler Automobiles(NYSE: FCAU) worked with Google engineers last year to createthe latest vehicles for Waymo's test fleet
column33: based on the well-regarded Chrysler Pacifica minivan --     but there's no sign that the two will move forward on anything     that could lead to a product for sale.Honda(NYSE: HMC) issued a somewhat odd announcement in December     saying that it was ""entering into formal discussions"" with     Waymo
column34: though nothing (so far) seems to have resulted from     those discussions. (I speculated at the time that Honda's     announcement might have been aboutprodding other potential partners to take     action. But at least as of right now
column35: it's not clear exactly what was     going on there.)Waymo may well find a profitable line of business in selling   its sensors to other companies. And it's likely that some   automaker
column36: somewhere
column37: will eventually give its self-driving   system a try.But unless other research and development efforts hit   roadblocks that Waymo is somehow able to skirt
