column1: Buy the Baidu Inc (ADR) (BIDU) Stock Dip;3/22/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsChinese tech companyBaidu Inc (ADR)(NASDAQ:BIDU) has been called ""the Google of China
column3: but BIDU stock's steady decline over the past six months suggests that the company is nowhere near comparable toAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column4: NASDAQ:GOOGL).makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockIn mid-February
column5: BIDU looked to be on the upswing
column6: but the firm'sfourth-quarter earningsdealt a heavy blow to Baidu stock.With BIDU shares down nearly 10% from where they were a month ago
column7: however
column8: this dip could translate into a buying opportunity.Baidu EarningsIt's true that Baidu reported less-than-stellar earnings last month. The company's quarterly revenue came in a $2.6 billion
column9: which represents a decline of more than 2% from last year's figures.5 Big Financial Stocks That Just Got Leveled (And What to Do Next)Even more concerning was the fact that online marketing customers declined 18.6% in 2016. For investors that consider BIDU to be the Chinese Google
column10: that's a huge deal. Advertising dollars are everything to search engines like Baidu and Google.It's Not as Bad as It LooksThose figures are certainly scary
column11: but when you look at the reason behind them things start to look a little bit rosier. It's important to note that BIDU faced some major headwinds last year
column12: including a big change to China's advertising regulations. The cost to comply with the new rules was significant for Baidu
column13: whichgenerates around 96% of its revenue from advertising.Not only did the new regulations hit BIDU's revenue hard
column14: but they also hurt the firm's customers numbers. The new regulations include strict rules regarding how companies advertise and some of Baidu's current customers weren't able to meet those requirements
column15: which resulted in a loss.However
column16: there could be a silver lining in there for BIDU as the new requirements will help the firm identify who its quality customers are. If you look at per-customer spend
column17: you'll see that those who were able to meet the new guidelines actually spent about 14% more than they had in the fourth quarter of 2015.Huge Growth Potential for BIDU StockWhat's important to note here is that even if BIDU is struggling now
column18: there is a huge growth opportunity for internet companies in China. While you might think that a search engine doesn't have room to expand any further
column19: keep in mind that China is pretty far behind the U.S. when it comes to internet users.  Just over 50% of the nation's populationhas access to the internet.That's a big deal
column20: because it means that as the internet makes its way further afield
column21: advertisers are going to be willing to pay to reach even more people. Eventually
column22: online advertising will be the best way to reach the majority of Chinese residents
column23: and marketers will have to pay for that.Bottom Line on BIDU StockNot only does BIDU have a lot of growth potential in its core business
column24: but the firm has been investing heavily in hot new technology like artificial intelligence and self-driving vehicles. While advertising revenue still makes up the bulk of Baidu's bottom line
column25: we could see big-time benefits from the firm's focus on the future.The company's efforts to develop self-driving technology are particularly enticing because the cars' navigation systems will be equipped to deal with China's complicated traffic conditions. That means that once the vehicles are roadworthy
column26: tweaking their technology to make them usable on U.S. roads will be far easier than trying to do it the other way around.Baidu Inc (ADR) (BIDU) Stock Is Just Giving Away MoneyBIDU's fourth-quarter results were definitely scary on the surface
column27: but things aren't as bad as the market would have you believe. If you have ever considered buying BIDU stock
column28: now is the time to do it.As of this writing
column29: Laura Hoy did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace8 Places to Run and Hide in a Market Crash10 Safe Dividend Stocks to Own During the Next Market CrashThe postBuy the Baidu Inc (ADR) (BIDU) Stock Dipappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: FANG Stocks are Back in Focus;3/22/2017;"A while ago someone noticed that if you took the first letters of the names of the four big modern tech companies
column2: Facebook (FB)
column3: Amazon (AMZN)
column4: Netflix (NFLX) and Google (GOOG:GOOGL) they spelled out a wonderful acronym
column5: FANG. Of course
column6: since then Google has gone and spoiled it all by rebranding their holding company as alphabet
column7: but the acronym has stuck.At the risk of spoiling that alphabetic synergy I would add Apple (AAPL) to the list
column8: given that companies role as the largest of the tech stocks. In fact some people substitute Apple for Amazon and obviously if you do that you still get FANG rather than the less appealing FAANG. For argumentâ€™s sake
column9: letâ€™s assume that all five stocks are still collectively known as the fang stocks
column10: and right now they look like a good place to be.The reason
column11: though
column12: is less about tech
column13: or indeed about business at all
column14: than it is about politics. The market seems to be driven at the moment by what comes out of the White House. Since the election there has been a lot of faith placed by traders and investors in certain policies outlined by the new administration and the Republicans who dominate Congress during the campaign; a â€œbeautifulâ€ replacement for Obamacare
column15: for example
column16: as well as tax reform and infrastructure spending.makeArticleAd();Yesterdayâ€™s drop in the stock market
column17: the biggest of the year so far
column18: was reportedly triggered by worries about the healthcare bill slated to replace the Affordable Care Act. It has met with opposition from within the Republican Party
column19: particularly from the Right
column20: and needs some serious negotiation in order to just pass the House.That in itself would be a bad thing if repeal went ahead without the replacement passed
column21: as most acknowledge that something has to fill the vacuum.More worrying for the market
column22: though
column23: is that if this bill fails
column24: it will indicate that the fiscal conservatives in Congress are sticking to their principles
column25: making stimulative infrastructure spending a virtual non-starter.Some of the biggest losers yesterday were in the industrial and material sectors that have gained the most since the election and which would be hurt most by delays in infrastructure spending. The reason the fang stocks look so attractive right now is because policy delays regarding healthcare and infrastructure spending will have little effect on them in the short term
column26: but things like tax reform when it does come
column27: especially the possibility of the repatriation of overseas profits
column28: will make an enormous difference. The consensus is that tax reform is an area that unites the party and thus could be even hastened by a split over the Obamacare replacement.The fly in the ointment could be that much of the potential growth for these firms lies in overseas expansion
column29: in particular to emerging economies. That would be a worry if the White House does push for more isolationist trade relationships
column30: but again the fact that the Freedom Caucus free market types in the GOP are flexing their muscles would suggest that any eventual move would have to be negotiated
column31: and therefore moderated from the campaign rhetoric.All in all
column32: then
column33: things look good for Facebook
column34: Amazon
column35: Apple
column36: Netflix and Google. That belief seems to have taken hold today as each of the tech big five has bucked the downward trend of the broader market and gained in early trading. Of course one swallow doth not a summer make
column37: but the logic behind these stocksâ€™ contrarian behavior is hard to refute and they may prove to be a hedge against politics driven uncertainty over the next few weeks
column38: or even months."

column1: The Google Ad Controversy:  Should it Matter to Investors?;3/22/2017;"Alphabet Inc.'sGOOGLGoogle is currently in the news regarding the issue of ads emerging next to YouTube videos that display homophobic and anti-Semitic contents.The UK Government called upon Google last Thursday after ads for taxpayer-funded bodies like The Royal Air Force
column2: The Royal Navy and BBC appeared next to ""extremist"" YouTube videos.The Government has suspended all its advertising from Google until further confirmation about those ads no longer appearing against questionable contents. The stock has lost 2.4% since
column3: against the ZacksInternet-Servicesindustry's loss of 0.11%.Google has been summoned for the second time this week to provide the government an update of the efforts it has been making to ensure that ads appear in undisputed environments.Google's Initial Response Seemed a Bit WeakGoogle did give an explanation in a blog post the next day
column4: stating that the company has policies to debar ads from appearing on pages or videos with offensive or derogatory contents. But implementation is not always easy
column5: given the millions of sites in its network. Moreover
column6: 400 hours of video get uploaded to Youtube every minute
column7: which makes the implementation doubly difficult. The company
column8: however
column9: said that it had already initiated a review of the problem.Nevertheless
column10: the investor community did not seem satisfied with a ""half-hearted"" explanation. A rating downgrade came the very next working day
column11: with Pivotal Research analyst Brian Wieser downgrading Google parent Alphabet from ""Buy"" to ""Hold"".Adding to Google's troubles
column12: the issue that primarily appeared to be centered on the U.K
column13: went global in no time
column14: with over 250 brands suspending their advertising on Youtube. The list includes big names from private as well as public sectors-Transport for London
column15: The FCA
column16: HSBCHSBC
column17: ToyotaTM
column18: McDonald'sMCD
column19: Heinz
column20: The guardian
column21: Channel 4
column23: L'Oreal
column24: Marks & Spencer
column25: Hargreaves Lansdown and Sainsbury's.A Clear Policy Revamp Announcement FollowedThe severity of the issue forced Google to make some ""serious"" announcements the following day. The company posted some notable policy revamps that include a commitment to more fine-tuned advertiser controls
column26: adding safer defaults
column27: expanding video-level reporting for advertisers and increaseing investments to implement its ad policies faster.Google also mentioned its plans to add a significant number of staff and deploy latest Artificial Intelligence (AI) powered tools to assess dubious content.Should Investors be Wary?Google is embroiled in a legal battle across practically all continents and issues like this are likely to add to its woes
column28: at least in the short haul. Apart from being a huge drain on ad revenues
column29: these give it a bad name.Alphabet Inc. Revenue (TTM)Alphabet Inc. Revenue (TTM)|Alphabet Inc. QuoteNevertheless
column30: the company has had extraordinary success in the courtroom and with government officials around the world. But developments like these are worth keeping an eye on and remain an overhang on the shares
column31: at least for the time being.In the long run
column32: we don't believe the issue will pose any severe threat to the company
column33: given Google's long history of execution
column34: leading search market share and growing focus on innovation
column35: strategic acquisitions and android OS. With huge cash balance and technological prowess
column36: the company has the flexibility to pursue growth in any area that exhibits true potential.Currently

column7: Zacks Equity Research provides analysis onTwitter Inc.(NYSE:TWTR-Free Report)andGoogle(NASDAQ:GOOGL-Free Report).Here is a synopsis of all four stocks:Bull of the Day:Internap(NASDAQ:INAP-Free Report) is a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) and has an ""A"" for both Growth and Momentum. The stock has been bouncing up against 52 week highs and looks to continue to do more of the same. It is the Bull of The Day today.DescriptionInternap Corporation provides information technology infrastructure services. It operates through two business segments
column8: Data Center Services and Internet Protocol (IP) Services. The Data Center Services segment provides colocation services comprising physical space within data centers and associated services
column9: such as power
column10: interconnection
column11: environmental controls
column12: monitoring
column13: and security. Internap Corporation was founded in 1996 and is headquartered in Atlanta
column14: Georgia.Sticking With What WorksThere is little doubt that we are in a long term bull market. One of the best ways to play this market is by buying the stocks that are seeing positive developments and are hitting new highs. INAP has both of these even and the market breaks a long streak of days without a 1% drawdown.Earnings HistoryThe earnings history isn't exactly a stellar one. I see two beats and two misses in the last four outings. None of the last four reports saw the company outperform on the top line either. But something did catch my eye.The most recent report was a beat of $0.03 which translated into a positive earnings surprise of 20%. This solid beat caused the stock to jump more than 31% in the session following the release. That has a way of making the chart look great!EstimatesThe Zacks Consensus Estimate for CY2017 saw a huge boost following the most recent earnings report. The number moved from a loss of $0.57 in January to a loss of $0.52 in February and is now at a loss of just $0.34. That is a big move in the right direction.The CY18 number has also seen a dramatic move higher
column15: going from a loss of $0.50 to a loss of $0.24 and settling at a loss of $0.16 over the same time period.If the company continues to beat expectations
column16: profitability could come by the end of the year.ValuationWithout the benefit of positive earnings we don't get to lean on the PE for our look at valuation. Instead we have to look at the conservative measure of price to book which has the stock trading at a discount to the market. INAP trades at about 4x book
column17: but the industry average is trading closer to 6.5x. The more aggressive measure of price to sales show the stock trading at 0.7x compared to a 6.2x industry average. Both of these metrics show considerable room for growth.Bear of the Day:GCP Applied Technologies( NYSE:GCP-Free Report) is a Zacks Rank #5 (Strong Sell). The company has missed the Zacks Consensus Estimate in each of the last three quarters and it is the Bear of the Day today.DescriptionGCP Applied Technologies Inc. offer specialty construction chemicals and building materials as well as packaging technologies. GCP Applied Technologies Inc. is headquartered Cambridge
column18: Massachusetts.Most Recent QuarterDespite GCP missing the most recent quarter
column19: the stock jumped more than 25% in the session following the release.The company reported EPS of $0.29 when $0.30 was expected. The 1 cent miss translates into a -3.3% negative earnings surprise. Revenues came in $5M under expectations for a 1.3% negative revenue surprise.Division Being SoldAt the same time of the earnings release
column20: the company noted that they entered into an agreement to sell their Darex Packaging Technologies business to $1.05B to Henkel. The transaction is expected to close in the middle of 2017.The sale of the business likely means that estimates will be chopped. The question is will the stock see a similar move when investors realize that while GCP may be flush with cash the entire company is trading at a value of just over $2.3B at about $33 per share.Additional content:Twitter Bot Scandal Puts Further Pressure on CEO     DorseyJack Dorsey
column21: CEO of Twitter Inc.(NYSE:TWTR-Free Report)is facing another problem in convincing advertisers to return to Twitter
column22: as new research showed that up to 15% of Twitter's 319 million users can be bots rather than human.The research was conducted by University of Southern California and Indiana University. Researchers used more than 1
column23: 000 features to identify bot accounts on Twitter. It was estimated that between 9% and 15% of active Twitter accounts are bots.The estimate of 15% is almost twice of Twitter's own estimates. In Twitter's Q4 earnings
column24: the company reported up to 8.5% of accounts could be bots.Twitter is hit particularly hard by this research because the company is already struggling to persuade advertisers to come back. Dorsey
column25: one of the site's co-founders
column26: came back in 2015 as chief executive and hopes to turn around the company's fortune; however
column27: little progress has been made.The company is still far away from making its first profit and stale user growth.The loss from operation of fourth quarter was $143 million
column28: compared to $67 million during the same time last year. Twitter also reported just 4% growth to 319 million monthly active users year-over-year.The company's performance and the bot scandal puts further pressure on Dorsey to step down as Twitter's CEO.A Twitter spokesperson recognized that bot accounts often have negative connation but can be extremely beneficial
column29: like those that automatically alert people of natural disasters or from customer service points of view.While the researchers agreed on the benefits of the bot accounts
column30: they also pointed out
column31: ""there is a growing record of malicious applications of social bots. Some emulate human behavior to manufacture fake grassroots political supportâ€¦ and promote terrorist propaganda and recruitment.""This is a problem that not only Twitter is having but all social media platforms
column32: as Google's(NASDAQ:GOOGL-Free Report)YouTube is currently suffering from ads placement issues with its advertisers.Twitter closed the day at $15.09 per share

column1: Irrational Demands: Of Anchors
column2: Pearls
column3: and Procrastination;3/22/2017;"(0:20) - Dan Ariely: Predictably Irrational(4:10) - Do first impressions get imprinted on us?(6:30) - Arbitrary Coherence: Why do we accept anchors?(12:00) - Are price tags anchors?(14:30) - Dan Ariely: Payoff(16:40) - What gets scheduled
column4: gets done.Welcome back to Mind Over Money. I'm Kevin Cook
column5: your field guide and story teller for the fascinating arena of Behavioral Economics.Today we're going to focus on the work of Dan Ariely
column6: author ofPredictably Irrational. When he published the book in 2008
column7: Ariely was a professor of Behavioral Economics at MIT. Now
column8: he's Professor of Psychology and Behavioral Economics at Duke University and he also is the founder of The Center for Advanced Hindsight. Ariely's TEDtalks have been watched over 7.8 million times.We've talked before about the cognitive bias calledanchoring. Ariely has picked up where the forefathers of Behavioral Economics like Daniel Kahneman and Richard Thaler left off by doing new experiments to find out how prevalent this bias really is.In the podcast
column9: I read from Chapter 2 of Predictably Irrational
column10: titled ""The Fallacy of Supply and Demand: Why the Price of Pearls - and Everything Else - Is Up in the Air.""Ariely begins with a story about the ""pearl king"" Salvador Assael who achieved a remarkable marketing feat in the 1970s New York luxury jewelry scene by making so-called black pearls from Tahiti into a nearly precious gem.He tells this story to help explain the power ofprice anchorsin decision making
column11: especially when the initial price reference is completely arbitrary
column12: and thus
column13: irrational.Then he describes an experiment he conducted with colleagues at MIT in the first decade of the 21st century. The researchers used a class of 55 marketing MBA students to conduct a specialized auction where the participants were first asked to write down the last two digits of their social security numbers.The act of writing down those digits had a surprising overall impact on the results of the auction

column1: AMD's (AMD) Success Is Not The Death Of Intel (INTC);3/22/2017;"My article on Tuesday
column2: which highlighted (some might say â€œboastedâ€) the recent achievements of Advanced Micro Devices (AMD)
column3: was perceived by some readers as an attack on Intel (INTC). But that was the intent.While Iâ€™m admittedly an unabashed cheerleader of Intel
column4: I can still appreciate the rags-to-riches story that AMD CEO Lisa Su has successfully executed since her appointment in January 2012. AMD stock traded at $5.40 at the time. The stock recently made a 52-week high of $15.55. Save for the people at AMD headquarters
column5: no one anticipated this remarkable turnaround. But whatâ€™s good for AMD is also good for Intel since a excitement surrounding chip battles increases consumer interest.Notably
column6: this renewed battle comes even as the rate of PC revenue continues to decline. In other words
column7: both companies
column8: which struggled at the height of the mobile era
column9: have moved beyond being just PC shops. And while AMD continues to make impressive leaps
column10: Intel is still the leader. The extent to which AMD pushes Intel to innovate
column11: the better off Intel will be. And thatâ€™s exactly what Intel CEO Brian Krzanich has begun to demonstrate.makeArticleAd();Looking to avoid the another mobile-type miss
column12: Intel is pushing heavily to be future-ready. Fresh off its second mega-deal in less than two years
column13: Krzanich â€” in his fifth year at the helm â€” seems intent on putting Intelâ€™s cash to use. The companyâ€™s$15.3 billion acquisitionof Israeli self-driving technology company Mobileye (MBLY) was the most recent example. This follows $16.7 billion deal for Altera back in 2015.These two deals suggest that Intel is not worried about what AMD is doing. It can be argued that it should. But Krzanich
column14: who has found ways to get Intelâ€™s top line growing again
column15: has shown to have a good pulse on what the company needs. Not only does Intel
column16: thanks to Altera
column17: now have an inside track on the Internet of Things and data center market
column18: Mobileye now puts Intel in the driver's seat in the realm of autonomous cars
column19: allowing it to better compete with Tesla (TSLA) and Google (GOOGL).In both acquisitions
column20: however
column21: market pundits
column22: who were unable to immediately see the financial benefits
column23: criticize Intel for overpaying. But
column24: recall
column25: Google was laughed at for buying YouTube in 2006 for $1.65 billion. Today YouTube is worth anestimated $40 billiontoday. Likewise
column26: Facebook (FB) was criticized for taking out Instagram. But assuming Intel can realize the estimated $70 billion total addressable market of driverless cars by 2030
column27: Mobileye could prove to be a bargain.In short
column28: AMDâ€™s improvements donâ€™t spell the doom of Intel. The management of both companies are executing on their stated operating objectives. And both stocks should perform well in the next 12 to 18 months. As to which stock is right for you? That all depends on where your allegiance is."

column18: which it has used to build a   fortress-like balance sheet with more than $86 billion in cash   and less than $4 billion in debt. This financial strength allows   it to invest aggressively in research and development
column19: and in the   acquisition of companies that are leading the way in important   new technologies. All of this
column20: combined with Google's renowned   culture of innovation
column21: helps it remain at the forefront of   technological change.Image source: Getty Images.Other betsIt's this innovation that necessitated its reorganization into   its current ""Alphabet"" structure. The design is brilliant
column22: as it sends a clear message   about what the company has become: a collection of businesses   with investments in a far-ranging array of exciting technologies   that are poised to pay increasing returns to shareholders in the   years ahead.Alphabet's holding company structure allows disparate   businesses -- such as self-driving technology leaderWaymo
column23: life sciences companyVerily
column24: and connected home device makerNest-- to be run and scaled independently. Management believes this   will give these ""other bets"" their best chance at receiving the   resources and attention they need to succeed over the long   term.Alphabet therefore gives investors many ways to win. The   company's core Google business is as dominant as they come
column25: which   helps to lower Alphabet's overall risk profile. And the company's   other bets have in many ways become analogous to an emerging   technology fund overseen by two of the greatest minds on the   planet: co-founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin. It's the perfect   balance of market dominance and optionality; cash flow and   reinvestment opportunity; current success and future growth   potential.ValuationAt first glance
column26: Alphabet's forward price-to-earnings ratio in   the low 20's may seem a bit expensive compared to the   S&P 500's forward P/E of about 18. But if you adjust for the   more than $82 billion in net cash it has on its balance sheet --   which equates to about $119 per share -- Alphabet's ex-cash P/E   drops to less than 19. On that basis
column27: Alphabet's stock is quite a   bargain
column28: especially considering its superior growth rates   compared to the market as a whole.Moreover
column29: investors who buy shares today will be buying   alongside Alphabet itself. The company has a $7 billion share   repurchase program currently under way -- a figure that's likely   tocontinue to growalong with Alphabet's ever rising cash flows. These share   buybacks should further help to support Alphabet's stock price
column30: and they signal management's increasing willingness to return   capital to shareholders.All told
column31: Alphabet offers retirees an excellent and relatively   low-risk way to profit from emerging technologies -- a high   potential field that's often underrepresented in retirement   portfolios.10 stocks we like better than Alphabet (A     shares)When investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: Why the Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Comeback Is Just Beginning;3/21/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) has gotten some of its moxie back. Granted
column3: the growth is nowhere near the pace of the glory years of the 1980s and 1990s. But then again
column4: the shareholder returns have been impressive. During the last 5 years
column5: Microsoft stock has logged a gain of nearly 100%. By comparison
column6: International Business Machines Corp.(NYSE:IBM) has a loss of 13% andQualcomm
column7: Inc.(NASDAQ:QCOM) lost about 11%.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockBut it does seem like the opportunity may be mostly gone for Microsoft stock. Let's face it
column8: the valuation is far from cheap.Consider that the price-to-earnings ratio is about 30X and MSFT stock is near an all-time high. Yet
column9: I think there remains more upside. The fact is that Microsoft stock is a great way to play the cloud megatrend
column10: which is likely to see growth for many years.Why MSFT Stock Is a Good BetThis technology has many benefits that are just too critical to ignore
column11: such as the ability for real-time analytics
column12: better integration with other systems and seamless updates. The business model is also fairly predictable
column13: since it is based on ongoing subscriptions.According toAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column14: NASDAQ:GOOGL) Cloud Chief Diane Greene
column15: only about5% of the world's data is in the cloud. She thinks that ultimately the market could hit a stunning $1 trillion.7 Small-Cap Tech Stocks on the Cutting EdgeBut there is another important driver: In today's world
column16: just about all companies need a strong digital presence to be successful. Simply put
column17: customers have come to expect that they should go to a site or app - and quickly get what they want.So to provide this service
column18: companies will need to rely on cloud services. And for now
column19: the two main players include MSFT andAmazon.com
column20: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN).But Microsoft stock may be in the best position. The company has a trusted global brand
column21: a massive global infrastructure
column22: a network of millions of developers as well as thousands of partners and a wide assortment of enterprise software products. Oh
column23: and there is a massive customer base that uses productivity apps like Office.Such advantages are extremely tough to replicate.Bottom Line on Microsoft StockBut what's also important for MSFT stock is that the company has essentially gone all-in with its cloud efforts
column24: such as integrating features among its products and engaging in aggressive M&A.For example
column25: the company has acquired MileIQ
column26: Xamarin and SwiftKey to bolster its mobile footprint. And more recently
column27: MSFT has been acquiring companies in the Artificial Intelligence space. Some examples include Genee (AI-powered scheduling) and Maluuba (natural language processing).Chesapeake Energy Corporation (CHK) Stock Is an Absolute Steal Right NowYet the $27 billion purchase for LinkedIn will perhaps be the most significant for Microsoft stock. With the deal
column28: MSFT gets the global leader in professional online networks - there are over467 million members- that should allow for powerful synergies with existing assets. Already
column29: the company has added LinkedIn services with the Dynamics CRM platform.So yes
column30: it should be no surprise that the quarterly reports from MSFT reflect lots of momentum. In the latestquarter
column31: the company's Azure service
column32: which is similar to Amazon Web Services
column33: saw revenues spike by 93%. In fact
column34: the annual run-rate for the total cloud segment is at over $14 billion.It's true that the cloud market is getting increasingly competitive
column35: as seen with the efforts of companies like IBM
column36: Oracle Corporation(NYSE:ORCL) andHewlett Packard Enterprise Co(NYSE:HPE)
column37: but they are all really playing catchup and they do not have the breadth of services that MSFT has. In other words
column38: when it comes to playing the cloud
column39: Microsoft stock remains a great option for investors.Tom Taulli runs the InvestorPlace blogIPO Playbookand is the author of various books
column40: includingTaxes 2017: Saving A Bundle.Follow him on Twitter at@ttaulli. As of this writing
column41: he did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace10 Clobbered Stocks to Buy That Are About to Get Red-Hot7 Dividend Stocks With Yields That Grow Like WeedsThe postWhy the Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Comeback Is Just Beginningappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: New Details Emerge on Apple's Augmented Reality Ambitions;3/20/2017;"We already know thatApple(NASDAQ: AAPL) is extremely interested in augmented reality (AR)   thanks to astring of commentsmade by CEO Tim Cook over the past year or so. Given Cook's   statements
column2: it should be obvious that the company is working onsomethingin AR; what's less clear is how Apple plans to create and deliver   AR experiences. Will it be a function of future iPhones? Perhaps   a new hardware product designed specifically for AR? Probably   both.Bloomberg's Mark Gurmannow has new details on the Mac maker's AR ambitions.Tim Cook hopes augmented reality will be Apple's next big     thing. Image source: Apple.makeArticleAd();With our powers combinedUnsurprisingly
column3: Apple has already assembled a team of   experienced hardware and software engineers
column4: while also tapping   ""talented outsiders
column5: according to the report. The team includes   engineers who have worked onFacebook's(NASDAQ: FB) Oculus Rift andMicrosoft's HoloLens. Some special effects artists from the movie industry   are supposedly even in the mix. The company has also made a   handful of AR-related acquisitions to accelerate its efforts
column6: such as the 2015 purchase of AR start-up Metaio or the 2016   acquisition of spatial perception start-up Flyby
column7: among   others.Gurman believes that Apple AR glasses will launch after Apple   attempts to include AR functions into future iPhones. The   challenge will be keeping the form factor thin and light while   being able to deliver compelling experiences. For this reason
column8: AR   glasses may be tethered to the iPhone
column9: which has more processing   power and can transmit data to AR glasses wirelessly. Keeping   costs down will also be important
column10: since the inevitable price   point needs to be justifiable to mainstream consumers.Mike Rockwell

column1: Is Google or Amazon Winning the Home Assistant Market?;3/20/2017;"Of all the recent technological trends
column2: the rise of home assistant products is one of the most intriguing ones. These products are developed to control home devices like home security
column3: lighting and sprinklers
column4: to name a few. Home assistant products also make online shopping an easy task.As these products are fast becoming a part of our homes
column5: the competition too is gradually heating up as to which products can emerge the best home assistants. So far
column6: the two main competitors in this space are Amazon'sAMZNAmazon Echo and Google'sGOOGLGoogle Home.Let's see what Amazon and Google have been doing to maintain their supremacy in the Home Assistant device space and how these devices help the companies in increasing their sales.Amazon Echo DevicesAlways aiming for innovation
column7: Amazon is definitely a frontrunner in the growing Home Assistant market.Not many people could have predicted the popularity of Amazon's Alexa when the product was first announced in 2014.It is a small speaker-like home automation device that can do everything from streaming music to dimming lights or cranking up the heat on the compatible thermostat through voice commands. It is capable of interacting with smart home products
column8: such as the Philips Hue smart light bulbs and smart thermostats from Alphabet-owned Nest.Amazon has been continuously adding new features to its Echo devices. So the growing list of things its devices can do has been keeping Echo in the headlines. The list includes a formidable lineup of compatible smarthome devices that Echo can control.How Will These Echo Devices Increase Sales?It is important to understand the nature of Amazon's core business. It is primarily an online retailer that sells a wide array of products. So
column9: these Echo products play right into Amazon's core retail business. These Amazon's Echo devices help a consumer in making online purchases through voice command
column10: thus saving time and energy.  Also
column11: Alexa can play music from Amazon's paid for subscription service and thereby act as a passive block on using rival shopping sites.These new products from Amazon have the potential to increase sales and garner higher revenues.Coming to the price performance
column12: over the past one year
column13: shares of Amazon outperformed the Zacks categorized Electronic Commerce industry. While the industry gained 53.88%
column14: the stock returned 40.11%.Google's Efforts toward Fight CompetitionGoogle on the other hand

column16: Google Home
column17: also performs an array of tasks such as playing music
column18: reading books
column19: managing calendars
column20: answering queries
column21: searching places
column22: calling over cabs
column23: controlling smart home devices and so on. It runs on Google's new voice assistant.Though it is still unclear how Home will benefit Google
column24: but it will surely help create some competition with Alexa. Moreover
column25: as voice is being seen as the next big thing in computer interaction
column26: these products could help Google expand its revenue going forward.Research company
column27: Gartner
column28: said that
column29: 30% of all interactions with devices will be voice-based by 2018
column30: because people can speak up to four times faster than they can type. Also
column31: the technology behind voice interaction is continuously improving
column32: thus increasing its use in future.However
column33: if will it be accepted by the mass is yet to be seen.Coming to the price performance
column34: over the past one year
column35: shares of Alphabet have been steadily treading higher. The stock returned 14.45% compared with the Zacks categorizedInternet Servicesindustry's gain of 11.46%.Stupendous Growth Expected in This MarketPer the recent report from Gartner

column37: up from $360 million in 2015.Also

column40: an analyst at Gartner
column41: said

column43: rather than a laptop or mobile device.""The strong growth projection for the personal assistant market is a key growth catalyst for Amazon and Google. It looks like these tech companies won't stop until they have full control over everyone's home.As a booming future is being predicted for the home assistant market
column44: Amazon and Google's home assistant devices could quite well add to their top and bottom-line figures going forward.Bottom LineImportantly

column1: Uber's President Quits: Are IPO Plans Toast?;3/20/2017;"Ride-hailing giant Uber Technologies confirmed on Sunday that   its president
column2: Jeff Jones
column3: has resigned.Jones
column4: hired just six months ago
column5: was the second-highest   ranking executive at Uber after CEO and founder Travis Kalanick.   His decision to leave Uber follows the departure of two other   Uber executives in recent weeks
column6: and a growing list of scandals   and challenges that calls into question when -- or whether --   Silicon Valley's most valuable private company will be able to go   public.The challenges facing Uber include an important lawsuit over     its self-driving technology. Image source: Uber     Technologies.makeArticleAd();Two explanations for Jones's departureWhy Jones left depends on who you ask.If you ask Uber
column7: or at least Kalanick
column8: Jones' decision to   depart followed an announcement that Uber has decided to seek a   strong chief operating officer to assist Kalanick in running the   compnay. In a note to Uber staff on Sunday
column9: Kalanick said that   Jones ""came to the tough decision that he doesn't see his future   at Uber"" after the announcement
column10: according to a Recodereport.But if you ask Jones
column11: it was a little more complicated. In a   statement provided to Recode
column12: Jones said
column13: ""It is now clear
column14: however
column15: that the beliefs and approach to leadership that have   guided my career are inconsistent with what I saw and experienced   at Uber
column16: and I can no longer continue as president of the   ride-sharing business.""Why Jones might have decided to get out nowFor starters
column17: Uber's decision to seek a COO was spurred by an   embarrassing video that showed Kalanick arguing with an Uber   driver over fare reductions that the driver claimed had hurt his   income. It also followed a former Uber employee's serious
column18: credible allegationof a pattern of sexual harassment at the company.Uber has hired two outside law firms to conduct investigations   related to the former employee's claims. One will investigate her   claims specifically
column19: the other is conducting a broader   investigation into Uber's workplace practices.In what may be related developments
column20: two other executives have   departed recently:Uber's senior vice president of engineering
column21: Amit Singhal
column22: resigned after a reporter from Recodeinformed the companythat Singhal had left a prior job at Google following a     ""credible"" allegation of sexual harassment.Uber's vice president of product and growth
column23: Ed Baker
column24: also     resigned following allegations that he had been seenkissing an Uber employeeat a company event.There's more.The New York Timesreportedearlier this month that Uber has been using a software tool   called ""Greyball"" to deceive authorities in markets where its   service had been pressured by law enforcement or banned.And in perhaps the most dangerous development for the future   of Uber's business
column25: Alphabet's Waymo self-driving subsidiary has sued Uber
column26: claiming that the   head of Uber's self-driving research program
column27: Anthony   Levandowski
column28: took proprietary technology secrets with him when he   left Google in early 2016 to found self-driving truck start-up   Otto
column29: which Uberacquired last summer. Waymo is seeking to halt Uber's self-driving operations. (Uber   has called Waymo's allegations ""baseless
column30: but hasn't yet   responded in detail.)Long story short: Uber's growth story could be in serious   trouble.The latest sign that Uber could be in serious troubleTaken together
column31: the recent reports paint a picture of a   company where sexual harassment is tolerated
column32: laws are seen as   inconveniences to be circumvented
column33: and a showcase technology   effort might be based on stolen secrets.That's all bad for obvious reasons
column34: and for one reason that   might be a little less obvious: Like all tech companies
column35: Uber is   in a constant battle to hire and retain top talent. These kinds   of stories hurt.Jones
column36: who had come to Uber fromTargetjust six months ago

column1: IBM's Cloud Computing Holds Potential: Should You Buy?;3/20/2017;"International Business Machines Corp'sIBMrecent investor briefing reflected its continuing focus on being a cloud-first company. Notably
column2: cloud revenues grew 35% to $13.7 billion for this Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) stock in 2016. You can seethe complete list of today's Zacks #1 (Strong Buy) Rank   stocks here.makeArticleAd();The annual exit run rate for cloud as-a-service revenue increased 53% on a year-over-year basis to $8.6 billion. Moreover
column3: IBM had more than 50 cloud centers globally and its Bluemix platform was one of the largest open public cloud deployments worldwide at the end of 2016.We note that the impressive growth has helped IBM outperform the S&P 500 in the last one year. While the stock has gained 18.1%
column4: S&P increased 15.3% in the same period.Cloud Computing: Robust Growth ExpectationsWe note that IBM's growth expectations from cloud computing remains positive in the long haul. Management expects market opportunity in enterprise cloud to be greater than $800 billion by 2020. Moreover
column5: the company anticipates more than 85% of enterprises to commit to multi-cloud architectures by 2018
column6: which is positive for its hybrid cloud offerings.As such
column7: the overall growth expectation for the public cloud computing services market is very much bullish. According to Gartner
column8: worldwide public cloud services market is projected to grow 18% over 2016 to $246.8 billion in 2017. Further
column9: the figure will increase to $383.3 billion by 2020.Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) is projected to be the highest growth service driven by improvement in PaaS and massive adoption of artificial intelligence (AI)
column10: analytics and the Internet of Things (IoT). IaaS is projected to grow from $25.29 billion in 2016 to $71.55 billion in 2020.IBM Lags Behind in the CloudDespite the impressive growth figures and bullish sentiments
column11: we note that IBM lags behind the likes of AmazonAMZNand MicrosoftMSFTin the public PaaS and IaaS cloud computing markets.According to Synergy Research's latest report Amazon Web Services (AWS) maintained its dominant position in the market followed by Microsoft Azure
column12: Alphabet'sGOOGLGoogle and IBM at the end of fourth-quarter 2016.The research firm noted that these three have gained market share in the last one year at the expense of smaller players as well as strong performance from Microsoft and Google. However
column13: their combined market share of 23% lags a fare bit as compared with Amazon's 40%.We believe that IBM's hybrid approach is yet to find many takers in both the public and private cloud markets. Despite significant investments - first on acquiring SoftLayer for $2 billion and then spending more than $1 billion on data centers - the clientele is not as impressive as Amazon or Microsoft.China: IBM's Savior?Per Gartner

column1: What Is the Internet of Things?;3/18/2017;"Defining the Internet of Things (IoT) can be simplified down   to the connection of everyday things -- like homes
column2: industrial   equipment
column3: watches
column4: etc. -- to the internet
column5: for the purpose of   collecting data
column6: tracking usage
column7: and automating systems. While it   encompasses many technological devices
column8: it's important to   remember that the Internet of Things spans across all major   sectors. The amount of connected IoT objects will reach 50   billion by 2020 and will be worth $7.1 trillion by that same   year.Now that you know a little more about what the IoT is
column9: let's   take a look at how companies are using the IoT right now
column10: and a   few IoT examples you might not know about.Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();You've probably already seen the IoT in actionIf you've ever seen anApple(NASDAQ: AAPL) Watch or an internet-connectedFitbitfitness tracker
column11: then you're familiar with the Internet of   Things. These devices fall into the broader wearable technology   market and they're what many people think of when they think of   the IoT.Or perhaps you've heard of a Nest programmable thermostat.Alphabet(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL)  owns Nest
column12: which makes   internet-connected thermostats that you can control via a   smartphone or tablet
column13: and learns your heating and cooling   preferences the more you use it.Both Alphabet andAmazon(NASDAQ: AMZN) are also pushing the Internet of Things into homes   with their smart home hubs
column14: like Google Home and the Amazon Echo.   Both devices use virtual assistants to answer questions
column15: order   things online
column16: or connect to door locks
column17: lights
column18: and home   security systems. Connected homes are a major part of the   consumer side of the IoT
column19: and will bring in $14 billion in   revenue this year in the U.S.Smartwatches
column20: internet-connected fitness trackers
column21: and smart   home connections are just a few examples of how companies are   investing in the IoT. While there are lots of companies betting   on the Internet of Things
column22: here's a quick list of some of the   biggest players.CompanyIoT FocusMarket CapAppleSmartwatches$729 billionAlphabetSmartwatches
column23: Nest

column31: and IoT security         monitoring$257 billionVerizon Communications(NYSE: VZ)Smart city connections
column32: ThingSpace platform

column34: smart device monitoring

column36: most of the growth with come from the enterprise market.   Research from BI Intelligence shows that enterprise devices will   account for 40% of all 23.3 billion IoT devices by 2019.Agricultural-equipment makerDeere & Companyusesinternet-connected field equipment
column37: along with sensors

column39: and cloud services to   track the efficiency of seed planting. This type of agricultural   technology is transforming how food is grown and how farmers   manage their fields and equipment.Many other non-tech companies are also jumping into the IoT as   well. General Electric

column41: has   developed its own analytics software for industrial equipment. GE   uses its software to help its customers manage their equipment   more efficiently and anticipate when it needs to be fixed.Scottish and Southern Energyuses GE's Reliability Management software to track its   equipment and maintain uptime
column42: which saves the company an   estimated $3.6 million dollars every year.What the Internet of Things needs to growIn order for more devices
column43: equipment
column44: and services to be added   to the IoT

Verizon is at the forefront of this change and   said last year that its upcoming 5G network will help address the   IoT's network needs. Verizon will roll out pilot tests of   its 5G network in 11 cities across the U.S. in the first half of   this year.While there's often a lot of hype around new technologies
column46: it's clear that companies are already taking the IoT seriously   and finding ways to use connected devices and software to offer   better products and services. And if this year is any indicator

column1: This Week in Solar;3/18/2017;"The solar industry had another busy week with a number of   announcements and earnings reports from some of the largest   companies in the business. It was so eventful
column2: in fact
column3: that I   can't cover everything in this week's roundup
column4: but I can hit the   items investors most need be aware of.As the solar industry evolves into a more mature market and   players define where they think they'll have a competitive   advantage
column5: it's time for investors to start looking at where   companies fit into the market and whether they'll have a   profitable future. With that context in mind
column6: here are the   notable news items from the solar industry this week.X-Series solar panels on a residential rooftop. Image     source: SunPower.makeArticleAd();SunPower signs a P-Series supply dealSunPower(NASDAQ: SPWR) has been laying out its plans for the future
column7: and   a central piece of its strategy is based on combining the   P-Series solar panel (which uses commodity cells to create a   slightly higher efficiency ""commodity-plus"" panel) with the Oasis   power plant design. The company is essentially transitioning from   the utility-scale project-building business to supplying   pre-engineered solutions to developers
column8: like utilities. The   strategy makes sense
column9: but we had yet to see much indication that   it was taking hold in the market... until this week.SunPower signed a 125 MW supply agreement withNextEra Energy(NYSE: NEE) to provide its P-Series modules to the developer   between June and October of this year. There wasn't any   disclosure about whether the deal included the Oasis tracking   system or any design services
column10: but even if it's just a panel   supply agreement
column11: it would be a positive sign.If deals like this continue to come through in 2017 and   SunPower is able to supply panels and other services to   developers on short lead times
column12: it would be an immensely positive   development. One deal isn't a confirmation that the   P-Series/Oasis strategy is a success
column13: but it's a step in the   right direction for SunPower shareholders.Google takes Sunroof nationwideAlphabet's(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) Google subsidiary started the   Project Sunroof initiative in 2015 to try to give customers and   installers an easy view of the solar potential of homes around   the country. Initially
column14: the project covered just a few cities
column15: but the idea was to eventually roll it out nationwide. This week
column16: that happened.Project Sunroofnow allows people across the country to quickly view an outline   of their home's solar potential
column17: and get an idea of what a solar   system might cost them. Installers can be plugged into the search   to make sales easier
column18: and I would expect some will even use it as   a tool to target sales opportunities. This is one big example of   how solar is becoming a little easier for customers to understand   and see as accessible
column19: particularly outside of traditional solar   hubs such as California and Massachusetts.Trina Solar goes privateIn a deal that has been in the works for months
column20: Trina Solar   was finally taken private this week. The $11.60-per-share offer   made by a group led by the CEO looked to be on shakier ground   late last year as solar panel prices plunged and demand in the   solar market declined
column21: particularly in China.I questioned whether or not the deal would go through given   the questionable history of Chinese buyout offers and the decline   in the market overall. But Trina Solar is now private
column22: and the   fact that the deal went through may mean management sees a   brighter future than many investors currently do.Takeaways from earnings seasonEarnings season is about over for the solar industry
column23: and   afterJA Solar(NASDAQ: JASO) andVivint Solar(NYSE: VSLR)reported this week
column24: there were a few major takeaways from the end of 2016 and early   2017.Chinese solar panel manufacturers are down
column25: but not out.     Gross margins in the fourth quarter were in the low to mid     teens at most manufacturers
column26: and while profitability generally     dropped
column27: they were able to cut costs and remain near breakeven     levels.National residential solar companies are generally in     decline and having a tough time transitioning to a market where     loan and cash sales are the dominant financing option.Sunrunis the one company that has doubled down on leasing
column28: and it's     currently going well for the company. But withSolarCityand Vivint Solar seeing installations decline
column29: there's a lot of     uncertainty about what the residential solar industry will look     like in the future.Technology improvements are coming
column30: and those who stand pat     will eventually get run over. Whether it's First Solar     upgrading from Series 4 to Series 6 solar panels
column31: SunPower     discontinuing most of its mid-level E-Series production in     favor of its high-efficiency X-Series
column32: or the advance of     mono-PERC
column33: efficiency matters more than ever in the solar     industry.That's all for this week in solar. Check back to Fool.com next   week for more about the biggest events in the solar industry.10 stocks we like better than Wal-MartWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock     tip

column1: Investors Are Betting Against U.S. Concrete -- Here's Why They're Wrong;3/18/2017;"The construction industry is highly cyclical. When the general   economy is doing well
column2: or even booming
column3: the industry usually   isn't far behind. When growth slows or a recession strikes
column4: the   appetite for construction projects takes a big hit. Luckily for   investors
column5: we're currently in the midst of a broad economic   expansion.That has made construction companies
column6: and specifically those   of cement and concrete manufacturers
column7: some of the best-performing   stocks over the last three years.Vulcan MaterialsandMartin Marietta Materialshave nearly tripled the returns of the S&P 500 during that   period
column8: while the smallerU.S. Concrete(NASDAQ: USCR) has gained an incredible 181%.Although there are great fundamentals supporting the stock's   rise
column9: investors appear to be suspicious. Slightly over 28% of the   the company's shares are traded short
column10: according to numbers   compiled by Yahoo! Finance. There's no denying that shares have   outperformed most other stocks
column11: but I think investors are wrong   to bet against U.S. Concrete. Here's why.makeArticleAd();Image source: Getty Images.Why short-sellers are wrongThe stock trades at an eye-popping 125 times trailing   earnings
column12: but there's an innocent
column13: if not downright weird
column14: explanation. It may sound odd
column15: but the better the stock performs
column16: the bigger the company's GAAP net loss becomes. That's because   U.S. Concrete must account for non-cash derivative gains and   losses from fair value changes in its issued warrants when the   stock price moves down or up
column17: respectively
column18: in any given   period.The good news is that recent quarterly GAAP net losses have no   impact on the company's cash position and have not had major   impacts on the share price. The great news is that operations   have maintained a strong level of performance for several years   in a row.U.S. Concrete notched $75 million in operating income and   $1.17 billion in revenue in 2016. Those metrics grew 235% and   95%
column19: respectively
column20: from the performance achieved three years ago.   Operating cash flow reached $112 million last year
column21: which was   well above the $24 million achieved in 2013.In other words
column22: the stock has certainly earned its 181% gain   in the last three years.USCRdata byYCharts.That said
column23: there's a strong case to be made that the company's   growth isn't over. Unlike other cement and concrete   manufacturers
column24: U.S. Concrete has strategically (and almost   exclusively) focused on major metropolitan areas in Texas
column25: New   York/New Jersey
column26: and northern California. Those markets were   responsible for 38%
column28: and 25%
column29: respectively
column30: of total revenue   in 2016. There are several advantages to that strategy that   short-sellers may be overlooking.First
column31: it allows the company to strategically acquire assets   to become a major and dominant player in each region and city.   Consider that in 2016 alone
column32: U.S. Concrete acquired four smaller   ready-mix concrete operators in the Bronx
column33: Queens
column34: and Brooklyn.   The acquisitions provided the company with 10 ready-mix concrete   plants and 189 mixer trucks. In addition to swiping away   competition
column35: the acquisitions allow the company to make more   competitive bids on larger projects. And in New York City
column36: there   are some pretty big projects.In fact
column37: the company supplied the concrete that built the new   World Trade Center Complex
column38: including Freedom Tower
column39: which was   the highest height concrete has ever been pumped in North   America. Expansions at LaGuardia Airport and the Modern Museum of   Art were also aided by the company
column40: as are other major ongoing   projects in the New York
column41: Dallas-Fort Worth
column42: and San Francisco   metropolitan areas.Second
column43: extending its leadership position in each major market   allows U.S. Concrete to have a greater influence on product   pricing. The fourth quarter of 2016 marked the 23rd straight   quarter that the company achieved year-over-year ready-mix   concrete price increases. That has an obviously beneficial impact   on revenue and margins
column44: and it has played a huge role in the   company's industry-leading margins in the ready-mix concrete   segment. Whereas the average material spread margin in the   industry was 45% last year
column45: U.S. Concrete achieved 49.2%.US Industrial Production: Cementdata byYCharts.Third
column46: operating in urban environments allows the company to   benefit from environmental considerations and initiatives
column47: such   as LEED building certifications. Humans manufacture more cement   than any other material. Unfortunately
column48: cement is also one of the   most carbon-intensive materials to produce
column49: accounting for 5% oftotal global CO2 emissionseach year. While certain materials can be substituted into cement   production processes
column50: they can significantly alter the   performance of mixed concrete. In other words
column51: it's not easy   being green.Luckily

column1: 3 Companies Set to Make a Killing From Driverless Cars;3/17/2017;"Driverless car technology is still in its nascent stage but   will grow in leaps and bounds in the coming years. IHS Automotive   forecasts that autonomous vehicle sales will shoot up from   600
column2: 000 units in 2025 to almost 21 million by 2035
column3: clocking a   compound annual growth rate of 43%.The Boston Consulting Group
column4: meanwhile
column5: expects the driverless   car market to create a $42 billion revenue opportunity in 2025   itself
column6: indicating that there is a lot of money to be made in   this space. One of the ways to tap this huge opportunity is   through technology providers such asAlphabet(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL)
column7: Microsoft(NASDAQ: MSFT)
column8: andNVIDIA(NASDAQ: NVDA)
column9: as they will play mission-critical roles in   enabling autonomous cars.NVIDIA's GPUs are boosting self-driving technologyNVIDIA is best known for making gaming graphics cards
column10: but its   products are in high demand from automakers as well.Tesla
column11: for instance
column12: is using the chipmaker's artificial   intelligence-based DRIVE PX2 platform in the Model S and Model X   cars. What's more
column13: the automaker is also going to deploy NVIDIA's   supercomputer in its mass-market Model 3.makeArticleAd();The Tesla partnership is already delivering results
column14: as   NVIDIA's automotive revenue shot up over 37% year over year for   the fiscal fourth quarter. The company could sustain its   automotive momentum
column15: as it is working with German giant Audi to   bring a Level 4 autonomous car to the market by 2020. Level 4   means it can drive itself entirely on its own.The two companies showcased an Audi Q7 at CES earlier this   year
column16: claiming that the car learned to drive on its own in just   four days using NVIDIA's AI-based DRIVE PX2 supercomputer. More   importantly
column17: NVIDIA is looking to push the envelope: It's now   working on a more advanced supercomputing platform -- Xavier --   that consumes less power but packs more computing capacity.NVIDIA's graphics processing units accelerate the processing   of huge amounts of data in real time
column18: allowing the vehicle to   make quick decisions. As the company increasingly turns its   attention toward making its self-driving supercomputers better   through partnerships with big auto companies
column19: it won't be   surprising if its platform ends up powering fully autonomous cars   by 2020.NVIDIA
column20: therefore
column21: looks right on the edge of tapping the   driverless car opportunity
column22: as 80 companies are using the DRIVE   PX2 platform to develop their technology.Microsoft's big data opportunityDriverless cars
column23: or any connected car for that matter
column24: will   generate huge volumes of data from their sensors and cameras that   will need storage and processing. Microsoftwants to ingestall this data and then use its artificial intelligence (AI)   skills to analyze it to help cars drive better through its Azure   cloud-based Connected Vehicle Platform.Image source: Microsoft.The Redmond-based company has picked a sweet spot to tap the   driverless car opportunity
column25: as a connected vehicle is slated to   produce 20 gigabytes of data per day in 2017 if driven for just   two hours. In the case of autonomous cars
column26: the data generation   could be at least 10 gigabytes per second. Now
column27: all this data   can't be stored on the car itself due to limited storage   capacity
column28: creating an opportunity for Microsoft to push its cloud   product to automakers.TheRenault-Nissanalliance has already decided to use the software giant's   connected vehicle platform
column29: pledging to put 10 cars with   autonomous technology on the road by 2020. Additionally
column30: Indian   automakerTata Motorsis adopting the platform to bring connectivity   features and predictive maintenance at affordable prices to   mass-market vehicles in India.Microsoft is also finding demand for its connected car   platform beyond automakers. For instance
column31: reinsurance provider   Swiss Re will analyze driving behavior with the help of the   telematics data collected by the cloud
column32: and then create   customized insurance deals for customers.The inevitable data increase from driverless and connected   cars could power Microsoft's Azure cloud business to new highs in   the long run
column33: allowing it to sustain rapid revenue growth from   this segment.Image source: Waymo.Alphabet's Waymo moonshot could be a big businessAlphabet's Waymo division has thebest driverless cartechnology
column34: according to data from the California DMV. As it   turns out
column35: its driverless cars have the lowest incidence rates   and the highest miles logged compared to the others testing their   technology on California roads.Alphabet can use its lead in this space by becoming an   infrastructure and knowledge supplier to auto companies
column36: and this   is what it is probably planning to do. Earlier this year

column39: so it makes sense for it   to offer a packaged hardware-software bundle to potential   customers. The company has already gained a customer in the form   ofFiat Chrysler Automobilesfor its self-driving technology

The Japanese   automaker is now exploring the possibility of equipping its cars   with fully autonomous driving technology in cities instead of its   earlier ambition of just highway driving.Therefore
