column1: 4 Famous Tech Stocks That Could Lose Their Fangs;3/17/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThe so-called ""FANG stocks"" have been an incredibly-well performing group. For those who don't know
column3: FANG consists ofFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB)
column4: Amazon.com
column5: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN)
column6: Netflix
column7: Inc.(NASDAQ:NFLX) andAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column8: NASDAQ:GOOGL) - formerly Google.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockWhy has this group been so successful? Despite a few of them sporting lofty valuations
column9: they are the respective kings of their industries. Facebook dominates social media
column10: Netflix owns streaming
column11: Amazon is the king of e-commerce and Google owns the online search engine.Over the past five years
column12: Alphabet is the worst performing of the FANG stocks
column13: returning ""just"" 180%. After that
column14: it's Facebook
column15: which has generated 265%. Amazon's 360% return stands out and Netflix's 830% gain jumps off the page. Have these stocks gone too far
column16: though?7 Small-Cap Tech Stocks on the Cutting EdgeI wouldn't necessarily argue that. Some names warrant some extra caution in my view
column17: however. Let's take a further look to see which stocks are worth holding onto and which are worth taking profits in.FANG Stocks: Facebook (FB)Source:The Crunchies! via FlickrWe'll keep the FANG stocks in order
column18: so let's begin withFacebook. Facebook has impressively captivated billions of users through its platform. At last check
column19: Facebook catered to 1.23 billion daily active users
column20: an 18% increase year-over-year. Monthly active users of 1.86 billion increased 17% year-over-year.Even more impressively
column21: Facebook has found a way to grow its revenue growth. That may seem like a typo
column22: but it's not. FB has managed to not only grow sales on a year-over-year basis
column23: but also accelerate that rate of growth as well. After impressively growing sales in the 40% to 49% range through fiscal 2015
column24: FB has now managed 50%+ revenue growth for five consecutive quarters. Obviously the company hasfound a way to continually growand its users are not tiring of its various ad formats.FB stock is not egregiously priced either; with a forward price-earnings ratio of just 21
column25: Facebook shares are not that expensive with earnings per share expected to grow 28.1% this year and 23.4% next year.Throw in the fact that Facebook has topped earnings expectations over the past 13 quarters and the stock becomes even more attractive. Shares have been on a tear this year. But a pullback to its 50-day moving average near $131 could be a buying opportunity.FANG Stocks: Amazon (AMZN)Source: ShutterstockAMZN stockhas also done well in 2017
column26: up 14%. We all know about the decaying retail sector and Amazon's ability to capitalize on that weakness. But judging the future of commerce can be difficult
column27: especially with how quickly Amazon continues to move.The biggest concern for Amazon skeptics has been earnings. Despite years of 20%-plus revenue growth
column28: AMZN's bottom line has hugged the flatline. Management argues that it's investing in itself for even more growth and so far
column29: investors have been patient. They've also been rewarded. Over the past 10 years
column30: shares are up more than 2
column31: 000%. Thankfully
column32: Amazon started to pad its bottom line with its Web Services cloud business.While I personally love Amazon
column33: I would be a bit leery of AMZN stock at these prices. Just last year we found out the hard way how fast things can change with sentiment. In the beginning of 2016
column34: AMZN stock stumbled from $675 to sub-$500 in just five weeks. That 26% haircut startled plenty of investors
column35: despite the stock rebounding to north of $800 a share within a year.The lesson here is simple: Amazon shares are not invincible during pullbacks. Should we get a notable broader market correction
column36: AMZN stock will not be spared. That is the best time tobuy the stock. Now that it's through the holiday season andcontinues to invest at a heavy pace
column37: shares could struggle in the intermediate term.7 Small-Cap Tech Stocks on the Cutting EdgeA decline to its 200-day moving average would be a great place to initiate a long position. That mark is currently near $780 per share. Any further declines could be used to accumulate the stock.FANG Stocks:Netflix (NFLX)Source:Via NetflixNFLX stockis one a lot of investors are kicking themselves over. Shares languished below $100 through most of 2016. At the time
column38: some feared higher content costs and sloppy overseas execution.Those fears still exist to some point
column39: but Netflix has shown better execution as of late. As a result
column40: shares have catapulted to north of $140. The stock has been consolidating nicely around this level. With the 50-day moving average just below
column41: it appears Netflix may be setting up for amove to new all-time highs.Investors who want to buy now could use the 50-day moving average - or a price just below - as their stop-loss. They could also wait for a possible decline to its 200-day moving average
column42: currently just below $115
column43: to buy. Longer-term investors may consider initiating a position in the name
column44: with a plan to purchase more on additional declines.The problem with NFLX stock is simple: valuation. Not many investors question the shift in video content consumption. The trend is in favor of Netflix
column45: which holds a dominant position in the streaming world. I consider Netflix a very battleground-based stock. On the one hand
column46: it's trailing P/E ratio of 384 is near the top of its five-year range. On the other hand
column47: its forward P/E ratio is the lowest it's been in the same time frame.The streaming offerings from Alphabet's YouTube
column48: as well asHulucould also be a concern. For now
column49: the bulls seem to be in control of NFLX stock. Should Netflix's execution deteriorate or competition eat into its growth
column50: the narrative may change. But for now
column51: staying long Netflix seems like it will work.FANG Stocks: Alphabet (GOOGL)Source: ShutterstockLike Facebook
column52: one of the main attractions toAlphabetis actually the valuation. Trading at 21.8 times next year's earnings
column53: shares of Alphabet aren't priced too expensive. Analysts expect GOOGL to churn out earnings growth of 17.5% next year
column54: along with 19.3% annual earnings growth over the next five years.Alphabet's founders may have paved the way for internet domination. But there's a new team member to its C-suite that has given GOOGL a much-needed boost. CFO Ruth Porat joined the company in May 2015.In the year leading up to her hire
column55: shares had been stagnant
column56: returning just 5%. Since her addition
column57: though
column58: the stock is up a whopping 60%. Does it also seem like a coincidence that Alphabet missed analysts' estimates on at least six straight quarters prior to her arrival? Since then
column59: Alphabet has topped estimates in five of the past six quarters.Admittedly
column60: Alphabet's transparency has been better
column61: making it easier for analysts to form estimates. But this added clarity makes it easier on investors and helps lower volatility. For better or for worse
column62: Alphabet takes some gambles. For instance
column63: consider Alphabet's self-driving car unit
column64: Waymo. Porat has not stifled this growth. Rather
column65: she has reigned in expenses and channeled GOOGL's focus. As a result
column66: the bottom line has improved
column67: without future potential being eliminated.8 Places to Run and Hide in a Market CrashWith a consistent core business in Google and potential upsides in businesses like Waymo
column68: GOOGL stock is attractive. With its dependable growth and a reasonable valuation
column69: it's even better. At just a hair under all-time highs
column70: though
column71: now may not be the best time to buy. A retest of its 50-day moving average near $840 and a further decline to its 200-day moving average near $800 would offer better entry opportunities.As of this writing
column72: Bret Kenwell did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.The post4 Famous Tech Stocks That Could Lose Their Fangsappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: The Gmail Phishing Scam Fooling Even the Internet-Savvy;3/17/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThere's a new Gmail phishing scam that is crafty enough to fool even well-versed internet users.makeArticleAd();Source:YouTubeThe new Gmail phishing scam includes an image that looks almost exactly like theAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column3: GOOGL) company's own attachment image. However
column4: this is only a trick to gain a user's login credentials.When a person that is the target of the Gmail phishing scam clicks on the image in the email
column5: it will take them to a page that looks almost identical to Google's own login page. Once the person enters their email and password into the fake website
column6: their account can be taken over.This Gmail phishing scam has been around for a few months now
column7: but has started gaining additional attention following coverage fromLifehacker. Those with acute eyes may be able to notice the hack due to the URL being incorrect for Google's login screen.If users don't notice the URL change when being taken to the fake Google login screen
column8: then they may get caught by this Gmail phishing scam. Users of Chrome that keep it regularly updated will see a warning when visiting a site like this
column9: but other web browsers may not warn the user of the scam.The Gmail phishing scam was originally discovered byWordfenceback in January. It suggests that users with fears that their accounts may have been hit in the hack should check their login history to see where their accounts have been accessed from. The website also advises changing passwords every few months
column10: just to be safe.More From InvestorPlace7 Telecom Stocks That Are High-Yield Money Traps10 Dangerous Dividend Stocks to Dump Now7 Stocks to Buy That Are ALMOST in Buffett Buying RangeThe postThe Gmail Phishing Scam Fooling Even the Internet-Savvyappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Privacy Revamp Makes Facebook Inc (FB) Stock Even More Attractive;3/17/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsScore one for civil liberties. This week
column3: social networking giantFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) overhauled its privacy policies
column4: blocking police departments from using the siteas a means of keeping tabs on users who may also be associated with violent protesting.makeArticleAd();On the surface
column5: it may seem irrelevant to the current and future value of Facebook stock. Most members of the ad-driven platform know they're of no interest to law enforcement officials
column6: and the protestors that were making themselves known on the social media site likely didn't know they were being watched (and therefore didn't alter the way and frequency with which they used the website).In other words
column7: so what?Thing is
column8: it's more than conceivable there were enough users of the Facebook platform that had been steering clear due to privacy concerns - just on principle - to expect them to log on now that their privacy is being protected.Privacy Remains Contentious TopicIt's neither a new debate
column9: nor is it a minor one.Apple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL)battled the FBI early last yearover the bureau's request that the company unlock an iPhone as part of a terrorism investigation.Alphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL
column10: NASDAQ:GOOG) has long been deemed to be too intrusive
column11: keeping a detailed dossier on everyone who uses Google and its servicesthat facilitates more target marketing.EvenWal-Mart Stores Inc(NYSE:WMT) is getting in on the snooping act
column12: using cameras to watch what shoppers pick up in stores
column13: and then put down without purchasing.So
column14: in the grand scheme of things
column15: it's not difficult to believe that Facebook was looking the other way when it knew law enforcement officials were using its platform as a new tool in the war on crime.7 Dividend Stocks With Yields That Grow Like WeedsThe question Facebook stock holders should be asking: At what point does accommodating every policy and agency request make the website too alarming for even the average user to visit?The American Civil Liberties Union asked the question
column16: and thenanswered it in a way that put Facebook in a questionable light. The company responded with a change in its policy.New Policies Curtail PinpointingAs of Monday
column17: police and other law enforcement agenciescan no longer tap Geofeedia's data
column18: which was built to pinpoint where Facebook users are - Facebook completely cut off Geofeedia's access to the site. It's not necessarily a permanent hurdle
column19: but it is one that will remain in place indefinitely on the location-based analytics platform.Facebook's deputy chief privacy officer Rob Sherman commented: ""Our goal is to make our policy explicit.""New PageThe clarified policy does not preclude FB from assisting law enforcement officials on a case-by-case basis. Indeed
column20: the company says it still intends to assist police when appropriate. Presumably
column21: this would mean instances where a search warrant has been issued
column22: which requires a reasonable suspicion that retrieving such information would help lead to a successful prosecution.Twitter Inc(NYSE:TWTR) and Facebook unit Instagram also booted Geofeedia from using their websites to gather and sell user information following the ACLU's exposure of the organization's invasive tactics.Bottom Line for Facebook StockOn the surface it seems like a potential setback for Facebook
column23: and by extension for Facebook stock. One of the most compelling features of the social media platform to advertisers was the deep
column24: broad
column25: and well-defined data the company could collect about each and every user.If it's scaling that detail back - and presumably it's doing so to more developers than just Geofeedia - then the potential value to advertisers is crimped.Amgen
column26: Inc. (AMGN) Stock Crashed. Here's How to Trade.Don't overthink it
column27: though
column28: and don't assume there's a cut-and-dried if/then relationship between how invasive a website can be and how valuable detailed user data is to an advertiser. They say they want stratification
column29: but many advertisers are content to promote their product or service to any reasonably targeted consumer.On the other hand
column30: consumers are more apt to use caution when it comes to websites that may nefariously collect data on a consumer
column31: even without their consent or knowledge. People have a decent sixth sense when it comes to being unreasonably monitored.In other words
column32: a FB that's more interested in basic civil rights is a better investment than one that's not. The trade-off is more than palatable.As of this writing
column33: James Brumley did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace7 Blue-Chip Stocks Holding You Back10 Mutual Funds You Can Buy and Hold Forever10 Monthly Dividend Stocks to Buy to Pay the BillsThe postPrivacy Revamp Makes Facebook Inc (FB) Stock Even More Attractiveappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Google and Facebook Will Account for 74% of Digital Ad Growth in 2017;3/17/2017;"Marketers will continue to shift a larger percentage of their   ad budgets to digital in 2017. U.S. digital ad spending is   expected to reach $83 billion this year

That's up from 54% last year as the two   combine to take about 74% of all the growth in U.S. ad spend.Even with the recent introduction of ads on the extremely   popular Snapchat fromSnap(NYSE: SNAP) and continued pressure fromTwitter(NYSE:TWTR) andMicrosoft(NASDAQ: MSFT)

The   search giant will bring in about $28.6 billion from search ads   this year

Mobile accounted for 89% of Twitter's total ad revenue   in the fourth quarter.The expected to decline comes after management provided anemic   first-quarter guidance and followed it up byde-emphasizing certain ad products. Twitter is shifting its focus to its most profitable products   in order to make good on its effort to become profitable this   year.Meanwhile

column24: and just 4% of the total growth in U.S. digital advertising.Even with strong competition

column1: 5 Signs Snap Inc's High Growth Days are Over;3/17/2017;"Snap(NYSE: SNAP)
column2: the parent company of Snapchat
column3: made its public   debut on March 3
column4: and the results were underwhelming. Snap made   its public debut at $17
column5: surged to nearly $30 on the first day
column6: then tumbled back to just over $20 in less than two weeks.Why did investors seemingly snub Snap
column7: which some bulls have   hailed as the ""nextFacebook(NASDAQ: FB) ""? The answer is simple -- six red flags indicate   that the stock could slide much lower before it's considered a   bargain.Snap's Android app. Image source: Google Play.makeArticleAd();1. Slowing user growthThe decline ofTwitter's (NYSE:TWTR) stocktaught usthat social networks live and die by their active user growth.   Without active user growth
column8: advertisers start skipping the   platform in favor of faster growing ones. Snapchat's daily active   users (DAUs) rose just  3% sequentially to 158 million last   quarter
column9: compared to 7% growth in the third quarter and 17%   growth in the second quarter.That slowdown was likely caused by the launch of new   Snapchat-like features for Facebook's Instagram and Messenger   apps -- which include Instagram Stories
column10: vanishing Instagram   photos
column11: Instant Video for Messenger
column12: and a Messenger Day app   which deletes photos and videos after 24 hours. Instagram   Stories
column13: in particular
column14: grew its DAUs from 100 million to 150   million between last October and  this January.2. Its cash burn rateSnap's S-1 filing revealed that it finished fiscal 2016 with   just $150.1 million in cash and equivalents -- a 77% decline from   $640.8 million at the end of 2015. The company had a negative   operating cash flow of $188 million in the fourth quarter of   2016
column15: and it burned through $1.14 in cash for each dollar in    generated revenue.Snap will retain $2.3 billion of the $3.2 billion it    raised during its IPO. That amount will help Snap tread   water for a while
column16: but it might not last long if its cash burn   rate accelerates. Susquehanna analysts believe that Snap won't   achieve positive free cash flow until fiscal 2020. However
column17: that   estimate could be far too optimistic if rivals like Instagram   Stories continue throttling Snapchat's growth.3. Widening lossesSnap's revenue surged 590% to $404.5 million in 2016. But on   the bottom line
column18: its net losswidenedfrom $372.9 million to $514.6 million. The company's biggest   expenses include multi-billion dollar cloud contracts withAlphabet's Google andAmazon.If Snap can't narrow its losses with such massive revenue   growth
column19: things could getveryugly once its top line growth slows down. Snap has also warned in   its SEC filing that it ""may never achieve or maintain   profitability.""4. Unrealistic revenue growth targetsSnap claims that it can  generate $500 million to $1   billion in revenues in 2017. That's a very wide range
column20: but   analysts are modeling their forecasts on  the high-end
column21: with   an average estimate of $1.04 billion. However
column22: it's unclear how   Snap plans to hit that target.The three types of Snap ads. Image source: Snap.96% of Snap's revenue came from advertising in 2016. Snap's ad    products include full-screen video ads
column23: sponsored   geofilters
column24: and sponsored lenses. If Snap's user growth peaks
column25: it   could possibly boost its number of marketing partners to generate   higher ad revenues per customer. But more than doubling its 2016   revenues to $1 billion in 2017 seems like ahugestretch.Research firm eMarketer recently trimmed its 2017 ad    revenue forecast for Snapchat from $800 million to $770   million. That reduction was modest
column26: but it indicates that   analysts aren't certain that it can hit its ambitious growth   targets.5. It thinks it's a ""camera company""Co-founder and CEO Evan Spiegel has repeatedly declared that   Snap is different from other social networks because it's a   ""camera company."" Tthat statement sounded reasonable because it   produced special filters and lenses for smartphone cameras
column27: but   rivals like Instagram can easily make similar claims.Snap's Spectacles. Image source: Snap.Spiegel didn't say that Snap would sell physical cameras   anytime soon
column28: but the company launched its Spectacles   Snap-capturing glasses late last year. The devices attracted lots   of shoppers
column29: thanks to a clever marketing campaign featuring   vanishingvending machines.If Snap builds upon that idea
column30: it could start selling other   cheap image capture devices to build its brand and differentiate   itself from Instagram. However
column31: that move could cause it to burn   through its cash even faster and weigh down its bottom line with   a low-margin hardware business.Should you avoid Snap?Snap looks like a company that went public before it formed a   coherent roadmap toward positive cash flows and profitability.   Without the ability to reach those goals
column32: Snap remains an   incredibly overvalued stock at nearly 60 times sales.To put that into perspective
column33: Facebook had a P/S ratio of   about 10 at the close of its first trading day. Twitter ended its   first day with a P/S ratio of about 11. This means that Snap   could easily plummet to the single digits if investors realize   that this ephemeral emperor has no clothes.10 stocks we like better than Snap Inc.When investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: IBM Watson Health Inks Deal with MedyMatch for Healthcare AI;3/17/2017;"International Business Machines CorporationIBMowned Watson Health has recently inked a five-year agreement with MedyMatch
column2: an artificial intelligence (AI) startup based in Israel. The objective of the deal is to integrate MedyMatch's AI technology with Watson Health for enhanced detection of bleeding in the brain as a result of stroke or head trauma.Initially
column3: IBM Watson Health will launch the MedyMatch brain bleeding detection application globally. Later
column4: the two companies will proceed toward integrating and achieving interoperability between IBM Watson Health's imaging offerings and MedyMatch's AI application.Reportedly
column5: IBM will incur several millions of dollars as recurring annual licensing fees to MedyMatch over the span of the agreement.Notably
column6: shares of IBM have underperformed the ZacksComputer - Integrated Systemsindustry over the last one year. While the industry gained a modest 24.3%
column7: the stock appreciated only 20.5%.The underperformance of the stock could be due to the time consuming transition to the cloud
column8: weakness in traditional businesses and lower IT spending worldwide. However
column9: we expect the stock to rebound given such strategic deals.What Does This Mean for IBM?As per a report by the World Health Organization
column10: nearly 7.6 million people are likely to be affected by stroke by 2030. As per another report by Zion Market Research
column11: worldwide spending on global stroke diagnostics and therapeutics is estimated to reach $31 billion by 2021 at a CAGR of 7%.There is thus a huge scope for application of IBM's cognitive technology as it helps in detecting bleeding in the brain as a result of stroke or trauma.We note that Watson Health has been fast gaining traction in the recent times. Earlier this month
column12: the company launched IBM Watson Imaging Clinical Review
column13: a cognitive imaging offering
column14: at the Health IT Conference for 2017 to address various cardiovascular diseases. (Read More:IBM Watson Introduces Cognitive Imaging to Boost Healthcare).Also
column15: earlier this year
column16: IBM Watson Health partnered with the FDA to advance cancer research. (Read More :IBM Watson Health
column17: FDA Partner to Further Cancer Research).Although competition is intensifying in the cognitive healthcare solutions space with the presence of major players such as Alphabet'sGOOGLDeepmind Health and Microsoft'sMSFTHealthcare NExT
column18: strategic partnerships such as these are expected to further strengthen IBM's  position in the long run. Also
column19: Watson Health's recent partnership with FDA over cancer research augurs well for the company in the long run.International Business Machines Corporation Price and   ConsensusInternational Business Machines Corporation Price   and Consensus|International Business Machines Corporation QuoteZacks RankAt present

column1: Google Eyes Algorithm Enhancement, Flags "Offensive" Content;3/17/2017;"makeZacksArticleAd();Alphabet Inc.'sGOOGLGoogle is reportedly taking steps to spot potentially upsetting or offensive content and reduce their appearance on the search results page. This will result in more accurate
column2: realistic and truthful information for users.Guidelines Updated With a New SectionGoogle uses around 10
column3: 000 contractors across the world as quality raters of its search results. The company has added the option of flagging ""Upsetting-Offensive"" content in its guidelines to these quality raters.They now can now flag content that promotes harmful activities such as discrimination or violence against any group of people
column4: animal cruelty
column5: child abuse
column6: racial slurs or human trafficking. Basically any hurtful or displeasing content may be flagged depending upon the motive of a search.The Broader Plan of Algorithm EnhancementData from quality raters will be used to train human coders (search algorithm writers) as well as update machine learning system on how to differentiate upsetting and offensive content from factual and appropriate ones.The broader aim is to make search algorithms capable of automatically flagging such content. This can happen if the algorithms better understand the motive of a particular search and display results accordingly.However
column7: that doesn't necessarily mean that that an offensive or upsetting content will not appear on the search results page. Rather
column8: the enhanced search algorithm will display results if it finds an explicit search being made for such content.We believe that Google's near-monopoly position in the search market is likely to drive Alphabet's stock price going ahead. Its shares have appreciated 15.2% in the last one year compared with the ZacksInternet-Servicesindustry'sgain of 11.6%.Our TakeWe believe that updates of this kind will improve Google's search quality and furnish quality results. The Google search engine is advanced

column16: with leading market share in the U.K.

column1: Why This Market Researcher Lowered Its Revenue Expectations for Snap;3/16/2017;"Analysts haven't been kind toSnap(NYSE: SNAP) since it made its IPO. Not one analyst has given   Snap stock a buy rating
column2: and shares have fallen considerably from   its opening price at the beginning of the month.Most recently
column3: market researcher eMarketer lowered its   expectations for Snap's U.S. ad revenue from $800 million to $770   million. The reason behind the lower estimate is   ""higher-than-estimated revenue sharing with partners.""Snapchat offers revenue sharing as an incentive for content   publishers to use its Publisher Stories (formerly Discover)   format. Snap is also partnering with various media companies to   produce original shows
column4: which may provide even more favorable   revenue share for the content producer.makeArticleAd();Let's take a look at how revenue sharing affects Snap's   financials.Image source: Snap/Author.Revenue sharing doesn't impact Snap's top lineWhile eMarketer is lowering its expectations for Snapchat
column5: the   actual decline in net ad revenue won't show up in Snap's top   line. Snap reports gross revenue similarly to howAlphabet(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) reports Google's revenue. Google   lumps in revenue from its network partners with its search and   YouTube revenue
column6: and then accounts for revenue sharing as part of   its traffic acquisition costs.The amount of revenue Snap shares with its publisher partners   is then reported as an item in the company's cost of revenue. So
column7: eMarketer may have well said it expects Snap's cost of revenue to   come in $30 million higher than originally anticipated.Snap's Publisher Stories. Image source: Snap.Last year
column8: Snap says revenue sharing payments increased $48.2   million from 2015
column9: but it doesn't provide a specific amount it   paid to partners. That does at least provide a floor
column10: and it's   nearly 12% of Snap's $404.5 million in total revenue last   year.For comparison
column11: Google paid out $10.9 billion in revenue   sharing to its network partners (not including YouTube) in 2016.   That's almost 14% of its total ad revenue for the year.Revenue sharing may increase even fasterWhile most analysts expect Snap to grow its top line to around   $1 billion this year
column12: its path to that mark may mean less of that   revenue makes it past the second line (cost of revenue) on its   income statement. Snap has inked several high-profile deals with   media companies over the last year.It already has deals in place with NBC
column13: ABC
column14: BBC
column15: Turner
column16: New   York Time
column17: Discovery
column18: Time
column19: A+E Networks
column20: and VICE to produce   original shows for Snapchat. Snap is still actively pursuing   these high-profile deals.It's important to note that Snap says its revenue-sharing   arrangements ""generally do not contain minimum financial   commitments to our publisher partners and are generally not tied   to specific events or promotions."" That seems to indicate Snap   doesn't pay anything up front for these productions
column21: but Snap may   help out with the costs as ""content creation costs"" also show up   in management's description of cost of revenue. Content creation   costs include personnel-related costs
column22: according to Snap's   S-1.With the growth of the Publisher Stories platform
column23: investors   should expect a stark increase in cost of goods sold due to   revenue-sharing and content-creation costs.Cost of revenue is already under scrutinySnap posted a negative gross margin last year as its cost of   revenue overshadowed its revenue. The biggest factor behind it is   Snap's hosting expenses
column24: for which it primarily relies on Google   Cloud. It's already committed to spending $3 billion in total on   cloud infrastructure over the next five years
column25: which will   continue to put pressure on Snap's gross margin as it tries to   scale.Add to that the fact that one of its revenue drivers is   growing content from publisher partners
column26: which contributes to   even more cost of revenue. While a few tens of millions of   dollars is relatively small compared to the hundreds of millions   Snap is spending with its cloud partners each year
column27: Snap's   margins are so thin that every dollar counts.10 stocks we like better than Snap Inc.When investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: Better Buy: Intel Corporation vs. NVIDIA;3/16/2017;"Intel(NASDAQ: INTC) andNVIDIA(NASDAQ: NVDA) are titans of the same semiconductor industry
column2: born a generation apart. As in all human endeavors
column3: the only   constant in business is change
column4: and Intel and NVIDIA find   themselves today at different stages of their corporate life   cycles.Thanks to coming adoption of technologies such as self-driving   cars and artificial-intelligence (AI) software
column5: NVIDIA has seen   demand for its graphics chips move from a niche into the   mainstream. On the other hand
column6: Intel roared to global dominance   during the rise of PCs and mainframe servers
column7: but it has   struggled to tap into more recent growth markets such as mobile   computing
column8: deep learning
column9: and the like.So which is the better stock for you to buy today: Intel or   NVIDIA? Let's examine three different aspects for NVIDIA and   Intel to determine which companies' shares appear more attractive   today.makeArticleAd();Financial fortitudeThose same life-cycle differences reveal themselves in   assessing the financial strength of NVIDIA and Intel. Look at   these four important metrics of liquidity and solvency for both   companies.CompanyCash and InvestmentsDebtCash From OperationsCurrent RatioNVIDIA$6.8 billion$2.8 billion$1.7 billion4.7Intel$14.9 billion$25.2 billion$21.8 billion1.7Data sources: NVIDA and Intel investor relations; Yahoo!   Finance.NVIDIA easily beats Intel in terms of near-term liquidity --   as evidenced by its current ratio -- and in terms of net debt
column10: which is just a fancy accounting term for cash and equivalents   minus debt. That being said
column11: Intel's cash flow-generation   capabilities are staggering. Though $18.4 billion of its debt   will mature in 2022 or later
column12: Intel could easily erase the   majority of its leverage in a single year

column1: An Uber IPO Will Be a Down Round;3/16/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsAmong venture capitalists a ""down round"" is defined as funding in a private company that carries a lower valuation than the previous investment.makeArticleAd();It means a company's investors are taking a loss. column9: in theory

column30: drivers and government is nowa global phenomenon. Competition from new entrants is also increasing

column35: But Don't Go Contrarian Yet!The risk of venture capitalists holding companies through their period of maximum growth is always that they will hold on too long

column37: in the end

column21: bringing the install base to 128   million.Google still doesn't know how to monetize voice searchWhile Google Home sales are improving relative to Amazon Echo
column22: it's not clear device sales will follow a similar path. Google   Home lacks one of the key functionalities of Amazon's devices:   the ability to easily shop on Amazon.Seventeen percent of Echo owners use Alexa to place orders on   Amazon
column23: according to Mahaney's survey. As the number of devices   in use grows
column24: Mahaney expects the amount of shopping done via   Alexa on Amazon to grow as well. By 2020
column25: sales through the voice   assistant could reach $5 billion
column26: according to the analyst's   estimate.Google doesn't even have a business model for monetizing   Google Home beyond hardware sales. Search and display ads don't   work very well on a device with no display.Moreover
column27: Google doesn't offer a compelling differentiating   factor for consumers to pick its device over another smart   speaker. Comparatively
column28: Amazon Prime members
column29: of which there'sa rapidly growing number
column30: have lots of reasons to pick the Echo
column31: like easy access to   ordering things on Amazon or inexpensive use of Amazon Music   Unlimited.As such
column32: Amazon is poised to win the long-term competition   even if Google Home is catching up in the short term.10 stocks we like better than AlphabetWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: Twitter's (TWTR) Prominent Accounts Hacked
column2: Shares Fall;3/16/2017;"makeZacksArticleAd();Reportedly
column3: Twitter IncTWTRwas in for a rude shock after some of its high profile accounts were hacked and used to post tweets in favor of Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan. Shares went down nearly 2% to $15.03 yesterday.Per reports
column4: the accounts were not hacked from the main platform but from Twitter Counter
column5: an Amsterdam based third party statistics service for Twitter. Some of the prominent accounts hacked included pop sensation Justin Bieber's Japan account
column6: BBC North America
column7: Reuters Japan
column8: Forbes
column9: UNICEF
column10: Duke University
column11: Amnesty International and Starbucks Argentina. Tweets filled with swastika (Nazi symbol) and hashtags like ""NaziGermany"" and ""NaziHolland"" were sent from these compromised accounts.Currently
column12: it is uncertain as to who carried out this mass hacking.Turkey/Netherlands Face-offPer media reports
column13: Turkey and Netherlands are embroiled in a political spat ever since the latter barred Turkish ministers from attending a political rally in the country ahead of a referendum in Turkey. The rally was organized to gain support for Erdogan. Turkey is drawing up a new constitution that will significantly enhance the President's power and make the post of prime minister and vice president redundant. The referendum is scheduled to take place on Apr 16.Following the treatment meted out to its ministers
column14: Turkey has ""suspended high level ties"" with Netherlands as well as barred the Dutch ambassador from returning to Ankara. It has also labeled Dutch action as ""Nazi tactics"".Twitter
column15: Inc. PriceTwitter
column16: Inc. Price|Twitter
column17: Inc. QuoteTwitter's Trolling Trouble & MoreAnalysts observe that this incident is unlikely to cause much damage to Twitter but the increase in these types of occurrences (hacking
column18: fake news & hate speech) can prove detrimental.  Social media sites have come under tremendous scrutiny following the U.S presidential elections in 2016. FacebookFBand Twitter were accused of disseminating fake news resulting in surprising election results.Rising concerns have also come from Germany as the Social Democrat Party
column19: reportedly
column20: said it will fine social media companies 50 million euros ($53 million) for their inability to contain a hoax.  Since the beginning of the year
column21: German intelligence agencies have been on their toes as there are chances that fake news will alter election results. Reportedly
column22: Buzzfeed has found that there are several fake reports on Facebook about Angela Merkel
column23: who is campaigning for the fourth term as the chancellor.Twitter has been trying to contain the trolling menace that has plagued its platform for long now and possibly kept potential users as well as buyers at bay.Apart from taking down accounts of offenders
column24: Twitter also announced several measures to combat trolling. The company has improvised the ""mute"" button
column25: which will enable users to block tweets that include objectionable words
column26: phrases and conversations. Plus
column27: it has empowered users by giving them a ""more direct way of reporting"" hateful conduct. Twitter users can now report any hateful conduct that they come across on the platform. Per Twitter
column28: this ""helps reduce the burden on the person experiencing the abuse
column29: and helps to strengthen a culture of collective support on Twitter."" The company said that it is also ""retraining"" its staff to better tackle abusive behavior on the platform.Twitter cannot afford more troubles as it passes through one of the toughest phases in its corporate history. User growth is sluggish and advertising revenues are decelerating. Amid this entire fracas
column30: the exodus of high profile executives continues. In the past one year
column31: Twitter shares declined 10.18%
column32: as against 8.57% rise in the ZacksInternet Softwareindustry. Its CEO
column33: Jack Dorsey's focus on ""live"" and user friendly changes hasn't yet moved the needle for Twitter.To top it
column34: the widely expected takeover didn't materialize
column35: with interested parties like AlphabetGOOGL
column36: Salesforce and The Walt Disney CompanyDISpulling out last minute
column37: given the challenges that Twitter faces alongside trolling.At present
column38: Twitter carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).  You can seethe complete list of today's Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy) stocks here.More Stock News: 8 Companies Verge on Apple-Like RunDid you miss Apple's 9X stock explosion after they launched their iPhone in 2007? Now 2017 looks to be a pivotal year to get in on another emerging technology expected to rock the market. Demand could soar from almost nothing to $42 billion by 2025. Reports suggest it could save 10 million lives per decade which could in turn save $200 billion in U.S. healthcare costs.A bonus Zacks Special Report names this breakthrough and the 8 best stocks to exploit it. Like Apple in 2007

column1: Sound The Alarm
column2: ALRM is Headed Higher;3/15/2017;"makeZacksArticleAd();Get ready for some upward revisions to the earnings estimates ofAlarm.com( ALRM).  The stock is a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) right now but reported earnings after the close on Wednesday
column3: March 15.  The company posted revenues of $69.79M compared to the consensus of $63.95M.  EPS of $0.19 was $0.06 better than the Wall Street consensus estimate.In the release
column4: the company guided Wall Street higher.  FY2017 is now expected to produce revenue of between $322M to $325.5M and that is comfortably higher than the $300M consensus estimate.  The company expects to earn $0.73 to $0.75 for the year and that is also above the $0.65 consensus estimate.In late after hours trading
column5: I see the stock at $33.39 up $2.76 or about 9%.Estimates Likely Moving HigherWhen a company raises guidance over the consensus you can expect the analysts to adjust their models.  These models help them derive their earnings estimates which are used in the Zacks Rank.  Since there haven't been any earnings revisions over the last 60 days
column6: ALRM is a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).  In the coming days I anticipate the stock to see several upward revisions which should help boost the Zacks Rank for this stock to a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) or a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy).AcquisitionsALRM made a few recent acquisitions and they were touched on during the conference call.  During the call
column7: management talked about how the ObjectVideo acquisition will allow customers to track cars and license plates or even customers in a store.The Icontrol Networks deal closed in the quarter and the company mentioned how the Piper unit powers a portion of the ADT platform.  The industry had been viewed as ""we versus ADT"" but that has changed with the advent of customer home protection services offered by cable companies.An analyst questioned if the company was looking to a product offering around cars
column8: and while the company would not commit on a specific answer
column9: it was clear that it could be something coming down the road.  Many times during the call management noted that they were maintaining a healthy level of spending for R&D.  Having an expandable platform is key because the security business has been changing very rapidly.Follow Brian Bolan on Twitter @BBolan1OutlookAs we think about the changes in home security
column10: it is clear that people are adding devices and services thanks to the relative ease of the internet.  Management noted on the call that people want these products and services to come from one source.As an example
column11: I have a Google Cam (formerly Dropcam) and while it is accessible via its own app I would like to see it be usable via my Amazon echo.  Yes the Google Nest is controllable via the voice recognizing tool
column12: but I would like more functionality.  I often search on Amazon for devices that are compatible with Alexa since I have power out that is controlled by another company.  It too has its own app and with only a few devices having multiple apps is already a pressure point for me.With the strong revenue guidance
column13: management believes that its products and services will be well received by customers.Analysts Notes ComingAs I look at where most recommendations are
column14: I see a few potential upgrades tomorrow.  Goldman Sachs started coverage of the stock with a Neutral rating on January 31 and a $31 price target. The analyst for the firm asked about the potential for organic growth from Icontrol which allowed management to talk about how they were going to hold their cost structure constant and could expect about $66M in EBITDA which translates to better than 20% margin.  It is possible that Goldman Sachs ups the stock to ""Buy"" tomorrow.Raymond James downgraded the stock back on August 16 as the moved their rating to Market Perform from Outperform.  Imperial Capital has the stock as ""In-line"" with a $30 price target.Roth Capital started coverage on October 3 with a buy and a $33.50 price target.  Don't be surprised to see that price target moved to $37.50 range.Maxim Group initiated with a buy rating and $37 price target on December 1.  They are clearly the most bullish on the stock and for good reason.  I would look for the Maxim price target to expand to $40 or more given the recently posted results.Trading Range?The stock has a 52 week high of $34.43
column15: but don't be too surprised to see a new level reached tomorrow.  Why do I say this?  Well back on October 31
column16: 2016 some unusual call buying was spotted in ALRM.  The call was a $35 strike with a March expiration.  At the time
column17: the stock was $29 and change so it was a pretty big reach.  I see those same calls closing at $0.17 with open interest of 856 - so not anything to get too excited about.What did catch my eye on the option chain was all the puts that moved the day of earnings.  The 27.5 strike that expires on Friday saw 729 contracts vs open interest of 898.  Check that open interest level tomorrow to see if those were all premium sellers as the put was paying $0.42.I like the chances of several price target increases coming tomorrow.  There is an outside chance we get an upgrade on the stock as well.  Throw in the idea that some mildly aggressive calls were bought several months ago I and I like the chances of this stock trading over $35 on March 16 or soon thereafter.  Either way
column18: look for this stock to become a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) or a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) in a day or two.Alarm.com Holdings

column1: What Will the Q1 Earnings Season Bring?;3/15/2017;"makeZacksArticleAd();Note: The following is an excerpt from this week'sEarnings Trendsreport. You can access the full report that contains detailed historical actuals and estimates for the current and following periods

column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsFamily Link is a new way for parents and their children to be connected onAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column3: NASDAQ:GOOGL) and its online capabilities.makeArticleAd();The service essentially allows your children to have a Google account in a safe way. Here are seven things to know about itFamily Link is an app that allows you to have a joint Google account with your kid.In order to access it
column4: you will need the app
column5: an Android phone running Android KitKat 4.4 or higher (for yourself)
column6: and a newer Android phone running Nougat (for your kid).The two phones will be in sync following this move and the parent will be able to keep tabs on what the kid is doing.Kids can use the app to play games and watch movies.Family Link makes it easy for parents ages 13 and under to approve or block apps
column7: set daily screen limits
column8: see how much time they're spending weekly or monthly
column9: and lock their devices when it's time to take a break or go to bed.Parents can monitor their kids settings remotely through their own device
column10: see the location of their child's device and more.You can also set a new unlock code if your kid forgets theirs in order to make sure they can be connected whenever they want
column11: unless you don't want them to.7 Cheap Dividend Stocks to Buy NowGOOG stock and GOOGL stock grew 0.2% and 0.3% respectively.More From InvestorPlace9 Stocks to Buy That Are Growing Faster Than Amazon10 Monthly Dividend Stocks to Buy to Pay the Bills7 Blue-Chip Stocks Holding You BackThe postFamily Link: 7 Things to Know About the New Google Accounts for Kidsappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column2: Inc. Is Missing Out on This Major Catalyst;3/15/2017;"Twitter(NYSE:TWTR) has undoubtedly missed the mark recently. Last year
column3: the social   network's sequential monthly active user growth stalled and even   temporarily turned negative. Meanwhile
column4: Twitter's revenue growth   rates have decelerated rapidly and its stock price has plummeted   nearly 70% in two years.Going further
column5: there isn't a clear end in sight to Twitter's   revenue challenges. A new report by research company eMarketer   (viaRecode) forecasts Twitter's U.S. mobile ad revenue will actually   decline in 2017 compared to 2016 asFacebook(NASDAQ: FB) andAlphabet's(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) Google gobble up marketers'   rising spending on mobile advertisements.Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();Twitter's missed opportunityIn 2017
column6: Twitter's U.S. mobile advertising revenue will   decline from $1.21 billion last year to $1.15 billion
column7: eMarketer   estimates. A quick glance at Twitter's financials in the   company's most recent quarter suggests this estimate is   realistic. Twitter's $382 million in U.S. advertising revenue in   Q4 was down 7% from the year-ago period. And given that 89% of   Twitter's global ad revenue during the quarter came from mobile
column8: it's safe to say that Twitter's mobile ad revenue in the U.S.   probably isn't faring too well.What's unfortunate about Twitter's struggling mobile ad   business in the U.S. is that it's happening at a time when   marketers are spending more on mobile ads. Total mobile ad spend   in the U.S. is expected to increase 25% in 2017 compared to 2016
column9: eMarketer estimates.Unlike Twitter
column10: advertising juggernauts Google and Facebook   are well-positioned to snap-up this incremental spending. The two   companies' combined share of U.S. mobile ad spend will increase   from 54% in 2016 to 57% in 2017
column11: eMarketer estimates. But   eMarketer estimates that Twitter's share of U.S. mobile   advertising revenue will decline from 2.6% in 2016 to 2% in   2017.Twitter management likely agrees that it won't be keeping up   with Google's or Facebook's growth rate in 2017. In the company's   fourth-quarter shareholder letter
column12: management said
column13: ""escalating   competition for digital ad spending"" could present challenges for   advertising revenue growth in 2017.Image source: Twitter.Can Twitter reinvigorate growth?Looking further into the future -- perhaps toward the end of   2017 and into 2018 -- Twitter's domestic advertising revenue   could start growing again. Management believes that the company's   recentreaccelerationin user growth will drive revenue growth. But it's going to take   time as management expects ""advertising revenue growth to   continue to lag that of audience growth in 2017
column14: the company   explained in its fourth-quarter shareholder letter.But if Twitter does return to mobile ad growth in the U.S.   toward the end of the year or in 2018
column15: don't expect growth rates   to be very high. Not only may overall growth in U.S.-based mobile   ad spend be much slower by then
column16: but Twitter's anemic 3%   year-over-year growth in U.S. monthly active users during the   company's most recent quarter -- notably below Facebook's 5.5%   year-over-year growth in U.S. monthly active users in the same   period -- suggests the user growth won't be much help for Twitter   in driving domestic ad revenue growth.10 stocks we like better than TwitterWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock       tip

column1: Apple Found Guilty of Price Fixing iPhones in Russia;3/14/2017;"AppleAAPLhas beenfound guilty for price fixingiPhones in Russia by Russian anti-trust regulator FAS (the Federal Antimonopoly Service). Apple has been price fixing in Russia since the release of the iPhone 5 and through the iPhone 6s; allegations against the iPhone 7 have not been proven.The FAS's investigation shows that when retailers in Russia attempted to sell Apple's iPhones at a lower price than what Apple wished
column2: a local subsidiary of Apple would email the retailers demanding them to hike their discounts. If the retailers failed to comply then Apple threatened to terminate their contracts to sell iPhones.No comments have been made from Apple yet; however
column3: FAS head Andrey Tsarikovsky stated Apple has ""actively cooperated"" to resolve the issue. Penalties have yet to be announced; in the meantime
column4: Apple has three months to challenge the ruling if they choose to do so.In translation from a statement by the FAS
column5: their public announcement wrote
column6: ""At the same time
column7: Apple Rus monitored retail prices for Apple iPhone smartphones installed by resellers in online stores and retail outlets
column8: and
column9: in case of setting ""unsuitable"" prices
column10: the Russian subsidiary Apple sent emails to resellers with a request to change them. Also
column11: compliance with recommended retail prices by resellers could be due to the provisions of contracts between Apple Rus and resellers.""Reporters say that the worst case scenario for Apple will be a fine calculated by 15% of Russian sales; however
column12: an official penalty will take several months to figure out.Apple is not the only leading smartphone producer to be found guilty of fraudulent activity in Russia. GoogleGOOGLwas fined $6.75 million by the FAS just last year for preinstalling their apps on Android smartphones and tablets.Zacks' 2017 IPO Watch ListBefore looking into the stocks mentioned above

column1: Twitter Is Selling Ads Like It's Television;3/14/2017;"One of the strongest trends in advertising is the shift of   budgets from television to digital as people spend less time   watching conventional TV. Consumers are spending much more time   on social media sites likeFacebook(NASDAQ: FB)
column2: Twitter(NYSE:TWTR)

column4: and YouTube -- the subsidiary of Google

column17: Twitter streamed more than 600 hours of live premium video from   content partners

column19: NBA

column33: and now it's looking to prove its worth with literal   TV ads. The impending launch of YouTube TV will provide a few ad   slots per hour for YouTube to fill in its over-the-top streaming   TV service. If YouTube can prove results better than regular   television commercials

column1: Web Browsers Are Making A Comeback
column2: Just Not In The U.S.;3/14/2017;"In the U.S. where the monthly data plan and Wi-Fi are abundant
column3: the market for single-purpose apps like FacebookFBand SnapchatSNAPhas flourished. However
column4: across the world
column5: it is not apps that are racking up users but mobile web browsers.Browsers are popular again
column6: especially in developing countries
column7: where data plans are not accessible for everyone and prepaid data plans can't support data heavy single-purpose apps. Users are finding themselves turning to web browsers to stay connected.It is not a second choice either. While it may feel like apps are faster and easier to use
column8: browser developers have been working hard to compensate users. Not only have browser companies like UC Browser from AlibabaBABA
column9: Google Chrome from Alphabet Inc.GOOGLand Opera Mini by Opera Software
column10: have made their browsers data-efficient
column11: but these companies have also beenadding new featureslike voice recognition
column12: file sharing and integration with social media.In countries where it is easy to buy used or refurbished smartphones for as little as $25
column13: it is easy to see why users lean towards web browsers instead of single-purpose apps. You spend less and achieve more.The number of Internet users globally has reached around 3.5 billion and many of the people that became Internet users in the past few years are all part of the rise of the global middle class in emerging markets. And they provided the biggest user growth for browser makers. These companies also know how to keep their users occupied and monetizing them through mobile advertising.Internet giants like Google and Facebook are noticing these trends. Two thirds of Facebook's users are in emerging markets and Google's Chrome remains the dominant browser in many emerging markets. Facebook has Facebook Lite
column14: an app designed for low-bandwidth users and Google pays other search engines to direct search traffic to ad-supported Google services.It is logical that these new users in the emerging markets will likely follow in the footsteps of their richer peers and make the shift from web browsers to apps as they get wealthier and data becomes cheaper
column15: though this doesn't worry the browser developers. There will always be a new group of users joining emerging market.India is projected to increase its per-capita income by 125% by 2025 with its population of 1.3 billion people
column16: according to Morgan StanleyMS. Opera Software said Africa is growing the fastest in terms of new downloads and there are 600 million potential users in Southeast Asia
column17: which is a huge market for these browsers.Until cellular connection become more accessible and affordable
column18: web browsers will maintain its popularity.Zacks' 2017 IPO Watch ListBefore looking into the stocks mentioned above

column1: Donâ€™t Follow Warren Buffett Into Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock â€¦ Yet;3/14/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsWhen it comes to investing
column3: Warren Buffett says investors should go with index funds. But Buffett himself takes a different approach by buying individual stocks
column4: such asApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL). The question is: Should you do as Buffett says and index
column5: or do as Buffettdoes
column6: and buy AAPL stock?makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockBuffett's lack of technology exposure is well-known among Wall Street veterans. In fact
column7: many even ridiculed the Oracle of Omaha for missing out names like Apple
column8: Alphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL) andAmazon.com
column9: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN).Until Apple came along
column10: International Business Machines Corp.(NYSE:IBM) was Buffett's largest tech play. He used to say he skipped over tech stocks because he didn't understand them well enough.But it appears that Buffett's understanding of technology is growing.I n 2016
column11: Berkshire Hathaway Inc.(NYSE:BRK.B) reported a 9.8 million-share position in AAPL stock as of March 31. That position almost doubled to 15.2 million shares as of Sept. 30
column12: then almost quadrupled to a whopping 57.3 million shares by year's end.So what has Buffett done with AAPL stock in 2017?7 Blue-Chip Stocks Holding You BackThe Oracle of Omahahas more than doubled his position. The stake now stands at some 133 million shares worth about $18.1 billion. Buffett buying some 75 million shares of AAPL stock in such a short span shows confidence in Apple.While Buffett is not known for his short-term predictions
column13: he is heralded for his long-term investments. So
column14: what does he like so much about Apple stock anyway? ""Apple strikes me as having quite a sticky product
column15: and an enormously useful product to people that use it
column16: Buffett told CNBC in late-February.Perhaps the most ironic part of Buffett's discussion on Apple centered on his own device - the famed investor doesn't even own an iPhone.Positives for AAPL StockApple stock has a lot of positives. For starters
column17: the company is flush with cash. With more than $40 per share of cash
column18: Apple could go on a transformative M&A spree - even with the repatriation tax that
column19: right now
column20: it would have to pay. Add in the potential for a tax repatriation holiday from the Trump administration
column21: and Apple's in even better shape.Additionally
column22: Apple is a cash cow that continues to bring in billions of dollars each quarter
column23: which should help continue to fund dividends and stock buybacks. Plus
column24: its cash hoard should continue to grow over time.Despite rallying more than 40% over the past eight months
column25: AAPL stock still trades with a below-market valuation. Sporting a price-to-earnings ratio of around 16
column26: it's hard to consider Apple overvalued.And the valuation argument is important. Too many investors try to justify a higher Apple stock price by applying a market-average multiple. That's an inaccurate measurement
column27: as Apple tends to trade between a P/E range of 10 to 17 (more on that in a moment). So rarely will it trade in-line with the averageS&P 500stock.With that said
column28: having a low valuation is part of what makes Apple stock attractive. Shares go through pretty extreme ups and downs. But long-term investors can feel confident in buying a stock that's not egregiously priced.Finally
column29: investors can look forward to Apple releasing themuch-anticipated iPhone 8later this fall. With a higher potential selling price and plenty of fancy features
column30: the new device is likely to drive record results.Add on its quickly growing
column31: high-margin Services business
column32: and AAPL stock becomes even more attractive for long-term investors.Should You Follow Buffett Into AAPL Stock?With all these positives
column33: Apple stock may seem like a slam-dunk.However
column34: I think investors would be best off waiting for a pullback. While we just highlighted its P/E ratio as a positive
column35: itisclose to the top of its five-year range. AAPL stock is cheap compared to the average stock
column36: but getting expensive compared to its historical average.Additionally
column37: Apple stock has gone on a massive rally. While it's admittedly consolidating nicely just under $140
column38: I find it hard to be a buyer at these levels.Why General Electric Company (GE) Stock Is Way Too DangerousWith the overall market still up big
column39: I can sleep more comfortably at night waiting for a pullback to buy Apple stock. If it doesn't materialize
column40: that is something waiting investors will have to live with. I would rather miss a few points of upside in order to avoid significant points on the downside.Historically
column41: Apple's stock is volatile
column42: whichmakes a pullback likelyat some point in the next few months.A 7% to 10% correction would be needed for me to get interested.Bret Kenwell is the manager and author ofFuture Blue Chips. As of this writing
column43: Bret Kenwell held no position in any securities mentioned.More From InvestorPlaceSnap Inc Snags Apple News' Media Head (SNAP)7 High-Yield Dividend Stocks That Are Actually SafeShould Apple Inc. Cut Its Dividend? (AAPL)The postDon't Follow Warren Buffett Into Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock â€¦ Yetappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: How a Major Drugmaker Plans to Cure Disease... Without Drugs;3/14/2017;"Pharmaceutical giantGlaxoSmithKline plc(NYSE: GSK) has the resources to pursue long-term bets in   medicine that could eventually change the course of disease   treatment and yield large payoffs. Three and half years ago the   company announced its plans for an audacious goal: to literally   eavesdrop on the body's electrical system and enter into the   body's own internal conversations in order to heal disease.Not as crazy as it soundsMedicine has long focused on chemical processes to alter   biological function
column2: but every organ has a nerve connection that   regulates its function. Organs are controlled by patterns of   electrical impulses transmitted through nerve fibers
column3: but when   organs dysfunction in chronic disease
column4: the electrical patterns   are different. That fact opens up the possibility that inserting   patterns in nerves to certain organs can correct conditions that   lead to disease. Using electrical impulses to influence organ   function is nothing new -- cardiac pacemakers have been in use   for decades -- but scientists are just beginning to realize the   possibilities of using nerve signals to restore organs to normal   function and actually treat disease.Image source: GlaxoSmithKline plc.makeArticleAd();A seminal paper was published in the scientific journal Nature   in 2000 which presented evidence that stimulation of the vagus   nerve could actually trigger an anti-inflammatory response in   rats. Electrical stimulation of the nerve inhibited the   production of tumor necrosis factor (TNF)
column5: which is also the   mechanism used by some blockbuster anti-inflammatory drugs such   asAbbVie's Humira. Since then
column6: researchers have come to believe that   influencing the the body's electrical system could lead to   treatments for conditions as diverse as asthma
column7: arthritis
column8: inflammatory bowel disease
column9: hypertension
column10: diabetes
column11: infertility
column12: and even cancer. A drug gets dispersed throughout the body
column13: affecting multiple pathways and organs in the process and   potentially causing undesired side effects
column14: but targeting the   signals of a specific nerve bundle with an implanted device has   the potential for producing highly localized and specific   effects.GlaxoSmithKline announced in 2013 an effort to pour resources   into the field of bioelectronics
column15: taking a leadership role in the   industry. The company announced a $1 million innovation prize
column16: the creation and funding of a network of researchers
column17: and the   launch of a $50 million venture capital fund
column18: Action Potential   Venture Capital
column19: to invest in pioneering bioelectronic   technologies.The investment is already producing visible progress. The   first investment by the venture capital fund was in SetPoint   Medical
column20: a privately held California company that is developing a   platform to treat inflammatory diseases by modulating nerve   signals with implanted devices and was co-founded by one of the   authors of the original 2000 paper in Nature. In July 2016 the   company reported the results of a first-in-human study of vagal   nerve stimulation by an implanted device for treatment of   arthritis. The study showed that the approach inhibited TNF   production and improved symptoms
column21: including in some patients who   had not responded to conventional drug treatments. In January   2017
column22: SetPoint reported positive results of another human study   using its device to treat Crohn's disease.Googling the body's internal networkImage source: GlaxoSmithKline plc.As encouraging as the results from SetPoint are
column23: that approach   is primitive compared with the ambitions of a $715 million joint   venture that Glaxo andAlphabet(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) birthed last August called Galvani   Bioelectronics. The collaboration with Verily Life Sciences
column24: formerly known as Google Life Sciences
column25: aims to do no less than   to map the human nervous system
column26: crack the electrical codes   flowing through nerves controlling the body's organs
column27: and be able   to modify the signals to restore health using implantable   devices the size of a grain of rice.The effort has enormous potential... and enormous challenges.   Verily will contribute expertise in device miniaturization and   software. The tiny devices will need a read/write interface to   nerve fibers and a way to be powered without heating the body --   both significant technical problems yet to be solved. The   approach will also require the analysis and interpretation of   massive amounts of data taken from the signals sensed on   individual bundles of nerves controlling the targeted organs
column28: something that's right up Google's alley. Glaxo
column29: for its part
column30: has been working for several years on a ""nerve atlas"" with the   goal of identifying the specific nerve fibers whose signals will   need to be decoded and modulated.A long shot
column31: but we could get news by 2019Executives from GlaxoSmithKline and Verily are optimistic
column32: though. At the time of the announcement last August
column33: Glaxo   executive Moncef Slaoui expressed the belief that Galvani could   begin human trials within 18 months
column34: achieve proof of concept in   three years
column35: and begin commercialization in seven years. This   timeline puts the effort on the radar of long-term investors
column36: who   could be seeing news on developments in the next few years.The challenge is huge

column1: Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Carries Some Risks;3/14/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsI recently wrote anarticlesuggesting thatAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL
column3: NASDAQ:GOOG) was the perfect value play
column4: as it was a growth stock that was not unreasonably valued based on various criteria. Now I'll dive into what I think the risks of GOOGL stock are
column5: and how they may manifest.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockMy biggest concern with GOOGL stock has always been that it is effectively a one-trick pony. Alphabet is the largest digital advertising billboard in the world
column6: with about 88% of its revenues coming from advertising. Moreover
column7: GOOGL stock's growth has been driven by this spectacular seizure of internet territory from competitors.In fact
column8: during the financial crisis
column9: ad revenues still grew about 8% year-over-year in 2009 despite a worldwide ad revenuedeclineof 11% that year.GOOGL Stock and Digital AdvertisingNow
column10: digital advertising was still in its hyper-growth phase back then. Should another major crisis hit
column11: I'm not so sure that Alphabet won't see a decline. Yet what's so astonishing about GOOGL stock is just how much money it makes from advertising. It could get hit with a 20% decline in total revenues
column12: which would bring it roughly in line with fiscal year 2015 results
column13: and still generate net income of $15 billion or so
column14: and operating cash flow of $26 billion or so.This is hardly a catastrophe
column15: which shows that for now at least
column16: GOOGL has a lock on substantial growth in ad revenue. However
column17: that advertising is the result of people using Google's search engine. What if that changes? Right now
column18: Google has more than 80% search engine marketshare. It's so popular that we now use the product's name as a verb.7 Blue-Chip Stocks Holding You BackI think it will be very difficult to supplant Google as far as search engine usage goes. However
column19: there is other behavior which may result in less reliance on the search engine and
column20: therefore
column21: fewer eyeballs for ads. Mobile apps have obviously exploded in number and usage. The more adept and fully functional that apps become
column22: the less Google may be used.Social media is only going to grow
column23: and the more that these products offer in terms of either their own search engines
column24: or places for advertisers to divide their ad spend
column25: the worse it is for GOOGL.There's also some interesting competition in the form of product searches
column26: and of course
column27: that competition comes fromAmazon.com
column28: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN). According to a 2016 PowerReviewssurvey
column29: 38% of users use Amazon as a place to search for products
column30: and Google comes in second at 35%. I think about my own usage when it comes to product searched
column31: and yes
column32: I always start with Amazon. Inventory
column33: price and reviews are the reasons why people start there. The larger that Amazon grows
column34: the stickier it will become as far as product searches
column35: and that could mean fewer eyeballs for GOOGL.Obviously
column36: Alphabet Inc. has plenty of money and can ramp up competition in mobile access
column37: butApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) andFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) obviously have a corner on that market so far.What Nvidia Needs to Avoid a Breakdown (NVDA)There is some regulatory risk
column38: as well. The EU slammed Alphabet Inc. for tweaking search results to direct people to its own shopping sites. The FCC is an unknown beast - it could end up regulating the internet in ways harmful to GOOGL stock.However
column39: when it comes to buying the stock
column40: I don't see immediate dangers to GOOGL that makes its valuation less attractive. At 18x next year's earnings
column41: and five-year annualized analyst projections of 19.3% growth
column42: it's already undervalued. When I give it a 10% premium for global brand name
column43: cash flow and cash on hand
column44: it becomes a true growth and value play. Still.Lawrence Meyers is the CEO of PDL Capital
column45: and manager of the forthcomingLiberty Portfolio stock newsletter. As of this writing
column46: has no position in any stock mentioned. He has 22 years' experience in the stock market
column47: and has written more than 1
column48: 600 articles on investing. Lawrence Meyers can be reached atTheLibertyPortfolio@gmail.com.More From InvestorPlace9 Stocks to Buy That Are Growing Faster Than Amazon7 High-Yield Dividend Stocks That Are Actually SafeThe postAlphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Carries Some Risksappeared first onInvestorPlace."
